title: Great location
text: When for a few nights with my wife for our mini-hunimoon. Location was great. Starbucks is basically in the reception. You can spend a fortune staying in NYC we found this to be reasonably priced and worth the money, above what you would expect.

title: A place to remember and perfect location
text: This is a nice Jazzy hotel that brings you back in time with great lounge ambience. We stayed there for 7 days/6 nights, from March 23rd to 29th, 2024. The welcoming was smooth even speaking in French (A BONUS) forgot the name of the gentlemen, with clear explanation of the details and destination fee, but few info were missing that was clearly explain at the bar. Great Crunch gym in the basement. In their bar/restaurant (THE STAYTON ROOM) from the amazing smile and service of quality of Maria C., made us feel welcomed, to the smile of Valentina S. and Brandy the subsequent days and great convo with Kush who knows how to entertain guest, the staff was incredible. Notable mention to the manager Rachel for extending our late check out to meet our needs and finally to Nicole at check out, after an error on the destination fee that was missing a day discount, immediately corrected and add an extra day discount for the error. The hotel is old so you could hear a little but not much in the other rooms but a 95 years old hotel you could not ask for more, room are not big but very nice and clean. Location is perfect and on point. The only downside was the constant construction in the street starting around 10-11 pm through the night but can't blame the hotel for that. A little pricey but you feel the quality of it and what you pay to be in Manhattan. Thank you Lexington for the amazing stay.

title: Lexington good mix of value and comfort in Midtown Manhattan
text:
Favorable stay at this Marriott Autograph Collection property located in midtown Manhattan close to Grand Central Station. 

Checkin was smooth, no issues. Unfortunately no upgrades due to capacity issues. I used a corporate rate for this stay. Price was a little over $300 per night which is reasonable for this brand and location. They offer you bottled water at check in which is good because none in room. 

Room was on 25 “elite floor” was small but functional and clean. It took a while to heat up as the heating unit is next to window.  Bath was a single sink and standup shower. As mentioned, no water or coffee maker.

Lobby is two levels with big TV screens looping NYC scenes. Small business center on mezzanine level.  There is a Starbucks on first floor with street access, this surprisingly was open at 6A.

Had buffet breakfast in first floor restaurant.  There is no executive lounge at this location. Breakfast was buffet style and had standard fare, coffee was very good. Self service, no wait staff present at 730A.

Only comment would be that key access is not required for elevators, meaning anyone off street can access rooms.  There is a doorman and lobby security, but no one checking elevator access.  I inquired at front desk and got a “because we don’t offer that feature” explanation.  Given life in NYC, I find this to be a big security gap.

Doorman helped us get a cab and with our bags.  Friendly and efficient.  Overall, I would stay at this location on a self funded trip to NYC as this location delivers a good combination of value and comfort in a great central location.

title: Amazing front desk Nicole
text: Just arrived, unfortunately the rest of my party were delayed on account of the earthquake grounding their flight from Canada. As I had flown from the UK I arrived early and initially couldn’t check in. Nicole on the front desk was unbelievably helpful and an absolute life saver she managed to get me a temporary room to freshen up in and wait until the room for my party was available. That alone was some of the best service I’ve received at a hotel and she’s definitely a credit to the company.

title: Excellent stay, we have been very comfortable in this hotel
text: We just spent 6 nights at The Lexington Hotel and were very happy. Its location is central, you are walking to Central Park, Met, Times Square, Empires State and more relevant places. It is very comforting to arrive at the room with good heating and take a bath with good pressure of warm water, clean towels and replenishment of gel, shampoo and moisturizing cream courtesy of the hotel. Cleanliness is excellent. The varied salty/sweet breakfast with a delicious pastry and delicious coffee!! All staff very attentive and friendly. Especially at reception, we would like to highlight the attention of Philippe who provided us with information about New York. We will definitely return to the Lexington Hotel on our next visit to this wonderful city.

title: Not up to Marriott standards.
text: Very disappointed in this hotel. This was my first and last stay here. Bathtub drain didn’t work well and each day got a little worse. Finally at 9pm on day 3 called front desk to ask for plumber. I was told someone would be right there. But after 30 minutes, and no one showed up, I called again. I called three more times and every time got a voice message and no one returned my call. It’s terrible that you can’t even get a hotel operator or someone at the front desk. What if it was an emergency? Finally, someone showed up at 45 minutes and tried to fix it and said they’d have to come back the next day with a machine. I didn’t want anyone in my room so I just gave up and lived with it for the next few days until I left. When I checked in I was handed two bottles of water and was told I could get more bottles every day but on the third I went to the front desk and asked for more water and they said they were out. The breakfast was terrible. Inconsistent quality. Fruit but poor meager choices. There is a $35 destination fee, which could go towards the breakfast buffet which actually cost more than that and it wasn’t worth it. I like to eat oatmeal for breakfast. The first day I went down there they had oatmeal the second day they did not. My room was very warm despite me putting the air conditioner on when it was 35° outside. The only thing is hotel has going for it is its location. I think it must’ve been a beautiful old hotel once but the decor in the lobby was tacky and did not go with the historic ambiance-shame on you Marriott.

title: Very dirty hotel and room, overpriced continental breakfast, and we had multiple things stolen from our room.
text:
The reason for my stay was bringing my mother, who has cancer, to Manhattan for her 60th birthday. I called the hotel 7 times prior to my stay, leaving messages with the staff I was directed by reservations to contact, because I wanted to arrange a fruit basket or champagne in the room as a surprise upon arrival. I clearly expressed that I was willing to pay a premium for this service. I never received a call back, and my calls were never answered. Even after checking in and informing the front desk of this, we still were never able to arrange any type of fruit basket or champagne delivered to the room (again, we were in no way asking for this for free). I was told I would receive a phone call from the department that handles those requests and that phone call was never received.​ I tried calling the front desk from the room multiple times and was never answered.

Upon arrival at the hotel, we noticed the bathtub drain was closed and there was a clear line of film of dirt and grime around the edges and in the base of the tub. Aside from the dirt, it was obvious it hadn't been cleaned because the drain w​a​s plugged. We called the front desk to inform them of this situation, and our calls were never answered. We called repeatedly over the course of several hours and were never answered or responded to. We attempted to speak with the front desk, but the line was so incredibly long and moving so slowly due to only 1 or 2 front desk staff working we opted to just clean the tub ourselves.

After an abysmal and incredibly overpriced, ​frankly disgusting continental breakfast that consisted of only juice and bagels for $40 a person, we arrived back to our room to notice the door was locked. My key was not allowing me in. The door was completely shut and locked. After knocking and repeatedly trying my key, a member of the cleaning staff opened the door and said he needed 15 more minutes. We said no, we needed to get into the room, because my mom needed to take her cancer medication. We entered the room to find no cleaning supplies, clean towels, clean sheets, or any indication of cleaning whatsoever, and there was no cleaning cart anywhere to be seen, clearly indicating he was not actually cleaning the room. 
Shortly after he left, we noticed my mom's cannabis vape pen for her cancer pain was gone. It had been sitting right on the nightstand, we completely searched high and low (even though she never replaces it because it is entirely necessary for her pain management), and it was nowhere to be found.​ We soon noticed her prescription bottles were gone as well as several small designer accessories. I have never been stolen from by hotel staff, and I am shocked that he chose to steal my moms cancer medication that is clearly labeled with a medicinal label. We knew it was the perfect crime, because we had no recourse. It's our word against his, and he would obviously deny it. However, it has never been lost or misplaced, and the​re was no cleaning cart and no cleaning supplies or linens of any kind present in the room.

The thermostat and temperature control in the room did not work. No matter what we set it at, it stayed at 69 degrees. It was humid and miserable. We again tried to contact the front desk, but our calls were not answered and the lines for the desk stretched to the door. At this point, I attempted to call corporate, where after calling one number 3 times with no response, I tried another, and then finally another, and was finally answered. I opened a case regarding a portion of this feedback. She blatantly told me there was nothing she was going to be able to do besides file it away.

Even without the theft, the hotel was dirty, the food was disgusting, the drinks were horribly made, the hotel front desk was incredibly understaffed, the room was uncomfortable and small and incredibly dirty. We had an absolutely horrible experience and I would absolutely never stay in this hotel, even for the location. Also, make sure to lock up EVERYTHING in the safe if you are going to let housekeeping into your room. Anything designer, any medications, money, anything of any value at all.

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
text: My wife and I are Bonvoy members and we had a wonderful weekend stay at the Lexington. The location was fantastic and the hotel had a really cool look and interesting art throughout . We loved the post-modern Art-Deco, Jazz vibe. The staff at the front desk and the bar were very friendly. Every Starbucks should take lessons from the crew here who were friendly and seemed to really enjoy engaging with the customers. We look forward to staying again. The location was great right near Grand Central Station and walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, the U.N. and Midtown.

title: Not the best stay…
text: Being an ambassador elite member, I expect the quality of my stay to be at the least comfortable but this stay was far from that. When checking in to the hotel, there was no mention of my status or the memorable celebration of my 14th wedding anniversary. The front desk agent said that my ambassador team did not communicate any details for my stay but I know differently because of my contact with ambassador team. No extra pillows, water, or coffee were in my room upon arrival. When I complained about the oversights, I was told that it would be corrected. Of course this was not done. When we returned from dinner and a show, the pillows and coffee were there but no turndown service or water. I went down to the front desk to ask why this was not done and the night manager Rachel totally disrespected me and told me “ if I wasn’t happy with the service. I could get the f*** out of there right now”. I have never been so offended by a hotel employee's attitude. The hotel and its staff should not be in the Marriott program and should be considered for some serious customer service training. The only bright spot was Maria in the Stayton Room bar. What a wonderful and caring server. I would not recommend this property to my friends or family. And Rachel the night manger needs to find other employment.

title: Manuel- rudest receptionist I’ve ever experienced.
text: Upon return late from a Broadway show in the pouring rain I discovered my room key no longer worked. I queued up to politely inform Manuel of this. He didn’t apologise just abruptly said he wanted ID. I told him my name and explained it was in my room. He simply stated that I wouldn’t be allowed back in. I eventually found a credit card which he took, reset the key and handed to me with no apology. His manner and attitude was appalling for someone on reception. Such a shame as a lovely hotel otherwise!

title: Great stay at the Lexington Hotel
text:
We had a great stay with our two boys at the Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection. The hotel is very well located, the staff is very pleasant and caring.
We would like to warmly thank Philippe for his welcome and his kindness.
We recommend this hotel without hesitation.

title: Want to go back , Already
text:
Fantastic stay at a great hotel, within walking distance from everything in New York !!
Friendly staff and yes the pillows were fluffy and comfortable. Breakfast was good , Cocktails at the bar were better , we love that hotel bar feeling !!!

title: Not staying here again - subpar Marriott experience
text:
I have stayed at this hotel for 4 years and this visit convinced me never to come back. The hotel room is missing the few amenities it offers (lotion, tissue box, hangars), I had a broken hair dryer and called the front desk from the room phone 7 times with no answer and then from my own phone 5 times with no answer. 

They charge $3 to hold luggage and while the amount is nominal, every hotel I’ve stayed in around the world, including very low end brands hold luggage for free. 

The usual kind and helpful staff are nowhere to be found. They also give different info every time I check in - sometimes they give you info on breakfast and drinks, sometimes not. Sometimes info on drink tickets or a token for some upgrade amenities, sometimes not. It’s the inconsistency that is not typical of most Marriotts. 

Stay at Residence Inn next door if you want a Marriott property and better service.

title: Warm address to keep
text:
3 night stay in this very well located hotel. Very close to the metro, central train station and close to the main monuments to visit. Central Park 25 minutes walk.
Hotel not very young but very well maintained. Very good sweet and savory breakfast. Very comfortable rooms with very good beds. Hotel a little noisy but the whole city is like that. A big thank you to Philippe for his help, a Frenchman living in New York for a long time
Address to keep.

title: Nice weekend in this cool hotel.
text: The lexington was a  good location  for us as we arrived in New York via train in grand central terminal. The Service at the front desk was excellent and hotel was clean. The crunch time fitness center was pretty big and well equipped, and was being used by quite a few other members .

title: Not safe
text:
Another 1/5 experience 
First time I stayed summer 2023 someone entered my room with a key even though lock and door security were latched. Hotel security did not even call back to check after I called to advise of incident. 

This time (I had to stay here as work booked it) I was given a room key when I checked in at midnight that again was to an occupied room. 

No security here
No respect for the female business traveler

title: Celebrating 2024 a few days after the Ball dropped in NYC at The Lexington.
text:
We came here after New Years Eve to
Celebrate a Bday and walk around NYC to see Rockefeller Center, Bryan Park, and Times Square.  We loved the location and easy parking across the street (for a price).  Within walking distance of everything we wanted to see and easy subway access for those attractions further away.  The room was spacious for a NYC room and there were nice upgrades that we appreciated.  There is a Starbucks right in the hotel and plenty of restaurants and bagel places nearby.  Customer service was nice and friendly which is not always the case when we visit the city.  However, we very much enjoyed our stay and would return here for sure.

title: Big disappointment
text:
I booked this hotel because of the convenient location and it is part of the Marriott Autograph collection. However the quality of the rooms is not reflective of the Autograph’s standards. 

First the good:  the location is great for anyone conducting meetings in Midtown. The lobby is comfortable with plenty of seating. In the evening the restaurant turns into a lounge with a good wine list and friendly service. In the morning, it becomes a buffet breakfast with strong coffee. 

The not so good:  The front desk doesn’t seem to answer calls from guest rooms. 1 pick up for 3 calls during my stay. 

The disappointing:  The rooms are tired. The heat didn’t work in my first room, and the floor was cluttered with dirty laundry carts, which didn’t seem reflective of the Elite floor (their words) I was staying on. The bed covers were thin and institutional quality. When I asked for a new duvet,  its had hair and stains. Top it off, the toilets in both rooms were Toto automatics, but in neither room did it flush automatically. The rooms are quiet, though. 

The redeeming considerations are the kind staff member who helped me move rooms, the bellhop staff, and the servers at breakfast and lounge.

title: New York City doctors appointment
text: Nicole at the front desk was the most wonderful hostess . She greeted us and accommodated our request for a handicap room that was convenient to our other guest.  I can’t get over how patient she was with my mother who is elderly and she showed so much empathy as we requested a late check out.

title: Perfect Valentine’s Day Weekend
text:
The Lexington was the perfect home base for our Valentine’s Day weekend get-away to the city.

The location is perfect - it’s a very close walk to Grand Central and the 51st Street station, making it super convenient for traversing the city.

There are so many great options for bars and restaurants in this area, including The Stayton Room, located in the hotel lobby. Not only does Kush (the bartender) make an excellent cocktail, but he makes you feel welcomed as you’re enjoying it!

Nicole made our check-in/check-out process so easy. She is a shining example of service and hospitality, and she made our stay at this hotel one that we will never forget!

In a city with so many lodging options, The Lexington Hotel Autograph Collection is as good of a choice as you could make for any occasion. Highly recommend!

title: Great location and comfortable stay
text:
Fantastic location.  It is an easy walk to all of the things you’d want to experience in Manhattan including a short walk to Grand Central Station. Nicole at the front desk was amazing!  She really took the time to help me make our stay outstanding. 
The housekeeping staff was also very friendly.  We booked a queen room.  The room was not very spacious, but it was very clean and comfortable.

title: Good luck getting them on the phone
text:
Great house keepers and doormen but that is where the positivity ends. 

Small rooms, tiny uncomfortable shower.

 But the reason for this poor review is the fact that I had to call the hotel 11 times to get my folio. First 10 calls went unanswered. Very poor customer service. 

Apparently they aren’t synced with the Marriott app and they don’t email immediately upon check out. Not efficient for a business traveler.

title: GOOD
text:
Very well located hotel
We asked to change rooms on the second day because it was really small for 4 (it was a deluxe) and the bathroom was in its original condition.
The bar is nice but very expensive ($50 for 2 glasses of wine....)
And the luggage storage scam for the day: $3 per bag... average for a 4 star!

title: Could be amazing but some staff members let the place down
text: This hotel could be amazing as the interior, rooms and amenities are nice but some of the staff let the place down.  Most staff were fine but there was a couple of staff members (a barman and a doorman) that were unfriendly and we dreaded dealing with them. We had an issue with a double charge and the night manager who we initially spoke to was downright rude and obnoxious. The day manager sorted it out in a friendly and professional way the following day but the poor customer service on occasion did ruin our stay and I would not stay here again or recommend it purely because of that. Shame because it could be an amazing hotel!

title: The best hotel with the best staff
text: We had the best experience at the Lexington. We live on Long Island and travel into the city often, staying at all different hotels. After our Stay at the Lexington, we’ll never stay anywhere else. Nicole was so amazing when we checked in and got us into our room early which helped us out a ton. She also ended up upgrading our room and throwing in some other perks. Nicole, Brita, Donna and Brandi the bartender were all so amazing and friendly, helping us with whatever we needed. This is the nicest most accommodating hotel staff I’ve ever experienced and we will 1000% be coming back! The beds were comfy, the room was clean and the hotel is central to everything we needed. Starbucks is also connected to the hotel! Cannot say enough good things!

title: Happy with my stay
text: I was not familiar with the Lexington Hotel but utilized an agent through Marriott Bonvoy helpdesk and they thought the hotel would suit my needs. I hesitated but seeing it was in the Autograph collection thought I would give it a try. I am glad I did as the hotel was great. My room was spotless, well lit (I hate it when hotel rooms have dim lighting) and was a decent size (two double beds). The tv was a nice size, beds comfortable and I didn't hear any noise. The hotel is well located close to  Grand Central Terminal, Broadway, and the garment district which was my main purpose for visiting. We were able to walk, ride the subway or bus to get around and that included going to and from LGA. What really made the hotel stand out was the staff. The front desk agent Nicole was so warm, welcoming, and helpful as was(I forgot his name) but he had a French accent. From the housekeeping staff to the employees at the attached Starbucks everyone was just so nice helpful and pleasant! I look forward to another stay at this hotel.

title: Breada
text: I take my daughter to New York every year for her birthday.  We always stay at the Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection.  We love it there.  The people who work there make the stay amazing.  There is a women at the front desk named Breada.  She is the best employee of any hotel that I have ever stayed at.  When we walked in the hotel and came to the front desk, Breada actually remembered us from the year before.  She remembered that we come every year for my daughters birthday!  She is kind, helpful and so very sweet.  Breada is very smart and is always willing to go out of her way to help the customer.  She is exactly what any employer would want to be the first person that the customer meets.  If you every meet her, you will see what I mean.

title: New York Weekend
text: Good location in Midtown East. The room and bathroom was quite small. I am told that's just the way it is in New York.  Booked online through the Bonvoy site to get a discount. When you add on the fees, taxes and $80 day parking, two days is not a great value. That said, we had an enjoyable weekend.

title: Fine hotel. Horrible desk staff
text: The hotel is fine for the price, but the desk staff is the worst I've ever experienced. Their attention to detail (they checked me into a room somebody was in) and their expediency to help is atrocious. Only stay here if you expect it to be transactional. Don't bother chatting with them on the bonvoy app as whoever is responding to that doesn't read it with detail. If it weren't close to work, and if I were not an elite member, I would never stay here.

title: Cheap, clean, good location
text:
The price can’t be beat for the location so I really can’t complain. The rooms are small but very clean, it’s great for short term business travel. 

My only complaint is that the hotel charges $4 per bag to store your bags, never in my life have I seen this at a hotel before, especially an Autograph Collection property.

title: Excellent classic hotel.
text:
We took a night here to have a couple of nyc days. We took in the amnh - arrange ahead for an entrance time and shows- and the J.P. Morgan library - never heard of it before but definitely worth a visit.

I’m platinum so we got a breakfast and late checkout. There’s a $35 destination charge but we got $35 off at the bar, not sure if that’s a platinum benefit or a general thing.

The room is old style and well kept. Small of course but all nyc rooms are. There’s no coffee but there’s free coffee in the lobby.

Hints: we parked at a good place on 47th between second and third. Prepaid on spothero which I’d also recommend if you drive to nyc. Another hint: the bar is really nice.

title: Exceptional guest service because of Nicole at reception!
text: I want to thank Nicole at guest services/reception for her exceptional customer service. Nicole helped me correct an error I made. I really appreciate her efforts and the Marriott team for all they do.

title: Decent stay
text:
I wanted to experience New York during New Year's and decided to stay at The Lexington Hotel Autograph Collection. Check-in was a seamless experience with a pleasant front desk staff and an energetic holiday atmosphere, which was lovely.

The staff, the location of this hotel, and the onsite facilities are what make this hotel experience pleasant, as the rooms are in desperate need of renovation. As soon as we entered the room, we both noticed that the room was a bit stuffy and stale.

title: Muy buena elección para visitar la gran manzana.
text:
Ubicación perfecta para visitar la gran manzana.
Las recepcionistas muy agradables y resolutivas, hablando español casi todos. La totalidad de nuestras peticiones fueron atendidas con máxima amabilidad y eficiencia.
Las camareras del bar también están en la misma línea, así como el portero. 
Parece que ellos son los auténticos propietarios del hotel por su implicación alegre.
Las habitaciones limpias y cómodas. Descanso garantizado.
Como punto a mejorar, la consigna de maletas, pues tienen una tasa de 3 dólares por pieza, cuando creo debería ser un servicio gratuito. El tiempo de depósito suele ser poco hasta la salida.

title: Consistently excellent.
text:
This is an excellent property for the value.
New York City hotels are at a premium and this hotel gives you the best  “bang for your buck.”
Professional service from the front desk staff…Ms.Marci and Ms.Nicole.
Rooms are small but comfortable.
Bathrooms are even smaller…but work just fine for me.
As a Bon Voy member, the upgrade,bar credit, complimentary breakfast, and welcome points make this a great value.
As in all NYC hotels, I highly suggest bringing ear plugs!
Even on the highest floors, sirens blare throughout the night and a good pair of ear plugs will guarantee a good nights sleep.

title: Avoid them!
text:
Very unprofessional. charged 115 dollars on credit card when we left without explanation. We wrote them several emails asking a receipt and the detail, but they refused to give any explanation and kept the money, probably well knowing we were tourists and could not sue them from italy. They also talk super fastly with strong US accent, so you don't understand a word if you are a tourist. We also had rain inside our room and we had to insist to have it changed (and it was quite bothering). I am sorry but a very bad experience.
8

title: Repeat guest - great service and room
text: Stayed 2 nights in Jan - upgraded to a king room with living area and small kitchenette “closet” with sink, fridge, microwave and Keurig. 2 flat screen TVs. Room was warm so I used A/C. Small bathroom but shelves for my stuff. Comfortable bed. Quiet. Great front desk service from Manuel. Lovely bar off the lobby with good service. Large crowd on Wednesday evening. Restaurant too. Water available at the front desk. Comfortable lobby for lounging. Friendly doormen. Awesome location.

title: Location!
text: Very friendly staff who are eager to help. Location is pretty fantastic (Starbucks in lobby, great bagels a block away, grand central is very close). No coffee in the rooms. Rooms are very pretty and very small- but you don’t come to NYC to hang out in the room! Housekeeping staff was very helpful.

title: Awesome NYE experience
text: My family and I stayed here for a couple of nights for New Year's Eve. The hotel is perfectly located and everything is within walking distance. I would definitely return. Special thanks to Kailyn, the front office manager, who is absolutely amazing!

title: Disappointing
text:
The Lexington is an autograph collection property for Bon Voy. I usually love staying in these properties, but this one was a tad underwhelming. The rooms are TINY even by NYC standards. The bathroom maintains the historic footprint and was VERY awkward to use. There’s virtually no way to shower comfortably and I’m 5 ft 3. The AC was broken, there was mold in our shower and trash in the elevator. The bar/ restaurant has no server. You order from the bartender. 

Very disappointing. If I have another experience like this, I’m going back to Hilton.

Bright spot: great location!!

title: Laute Zimmer, gute Lage, Fitnessstudiaangaben des Hotels stimmen nicht mit denen des öffentlichen Gyms im Haus überein
text: Super Lage zwischen 2 Wichtigen Subway Linien, leider sehr laute Zimmer besonders  unseres unterster Stock zur Kreuzung raus,  lüften nicht möglich, kein Abzug im Bad, Fitnessstudio ist öffentlich, deshalb eigene Öffnungszeiten und erst ab 18 ( nicht 16 wie vom Hotel angegeben)

title: New Year’s Eve
text: This hotel is not the most modern but it definitely was very clean ,staff was so friendly especially the doorman . Room was very clean bed was enormous and comfortable. Great location for everything in manhattan. We had a lovely stay well done to the Lexington hotel would definitely recommend

title: Amazing Staff, and hotel!
text: Just want to thank the staff, at this Beautiful, Amazing hotel. The staff went above to accommodate us! Feeling so thankful, Nicole,Allan,Westley,Liz,and Lauren. I will never forget, everything you did to help us. Going back to Florida today, and will 100% come back to this hotel. ❤️

title: Exceptional Customer Service. Thank you Nicole!
text: After an issue with my shower Nicole, who works at the front desk, rectified my issues and provided the best experience I could've possibly had. Not only did she ensure I was placed in a room immediately, she also provided me a fair compensation for the inconvenience that absolutely made my stay one of the best I have ever had. This was my first solo trip and she saved the day! She was friendly, courteous and understanding. She exercised an extreme amount of empathy for me and I truly appreciated having her help me through this issue, especially on a very busy New Years weekend in New York. Aside from the hiccup with my shower, the hotel itself was extremely comfortable and I would absolutely stay again the next time I am in New York. I want to say thank you to Nicole one more time for ushering a very memorable experience.

title: Phillipe is the BEST!
text:
Phillipe is the BEST front desk associate ever! He was so quick and considerate while checking me in. He asked my preference on floor and gave me clear directions and answered all my questions. Even upon seeing me again, he remembered me which made me feel even more special. When I was leaving there was a long line but Phillipe still took care of all the guests well. I’m just highly impressed by his level of professionalism and attentiveness to the guests! 

Thanks for making my first trip to New York so awesome !

title: Rooms are run down, outdated and depressing .
text:
The hotel staff were courteous,pleasant and accommodating. We stayed at the Lexington for 2 nights after the holidays with our two kids. However, the accommodations were far from 4 star. In fact, I have to say the hotel rooms were disappointing, run down and down right gross  - peeling wallpaper, ripped rugs, stained window treatments and chipped paint. We addressed this with the staff since we paid peak prices for our stay and the kindly moved our room. However, the next room had a horrible odor that would not dissipate even when we left the window open for most of the day. It smelled like wet paint or pungent chemical. We stayed clear of our room for most of the day, but it made sleeping difficult and uncomfortable over the 2 nights. We addressed the concerning odor with staff the next morning, but because of room turn over they couldn't assure they'd have a room available due to room turnover. 
The staff was doing their best under the circumstances of the sub par accommodations. The hotel company really needs to address the structural flaws in the rooms.

title: Nice hotel, but beds uncomfortable
text: Nice and clean hotel, very friendly staff. Beautiful lobby. Location is pretty good. Not sure why this hotel gets bad reviews. The rooms are small, the bathroom is small, but come on, it’s NYC, what do you expect? The beds are hard and uncomfortable I will admit that. The $35 fee can be used towards drinks at the bar or laundry, so just be sure to get some drinks before you leave. Parking is costly, but just check some apps and buy your parking a block away before you arrive and save yourself some money. It’s about a 10-15 minute walk to all the main tourist areas, you really can’t beat the location. Far enough away from the craziness, but close enough you don’t need to grab a taxi or take the subway.

title: The Lexington never fails to satisfy
text:
We have been steady customers of the Lexington Hotel for some years. First, we found it to be a consistently comfortable, value-priced place to stay for frequent business travel (for midtown meetings and Financial District meetings, given the hotel's proximity to the 4-5-6 subway that goes express to Wall Street). Over time, it became our go-to for visiting family (close family moved to NYC over the last number of years), visits for theatre weekends, etc.  It served as a host hotel for our child's wedding back in those pre-pandemic days. I really can't overstate what a well-run, quality property the Lexington is.

Since re-opening after the pandemic, the Lexington has, if anything, improved on its former self.  Whereas we recognize many of the staff from pre-2020 (another good sign about a hotel), management and ownership have changed.  I would say for the better. 

As a pre-war building, there are many unique characteristics about the rooms, the overall layout, and the character of the property.  Many different room types for those looking for a choice on their accommodations is quite nice.  The lounge is comfortable, the lobby is busy and the whole decor has an Art-Deco/ Roaring 20's vibe that's unique and memorable.  The unique character is bolstered by a very capable and genuinely caring staff.  I'm not sure whether The Lexington pops up at the top of searches for places to stay in NYC that deliver both good value and a memorable experience, but take the time to seek it out on your next trip.

title: Great location and comfortable hotel!
text: Excellent location and charming hotel in Midtown. title: Lexington Lament: A Thanksgiving Stay That Missed the Mark
text:
Our eagerly anticipated four-night stay at The Lexington during the Thanksgiving holiday turned out to be less than enjoyable, prompting us to reconsider the value of our loyalty to Marriott. Despite the hotel's advantageous location in a quiet area with easy access to Grand Central Station, the parade route, theaters and restaurants, several aspects of our experience left much to be desired.
From the start, the lackluster greeting at check-in established a disappointing tone. Despite my lifetime platinum status, there was no acknowledgment or recognition. Regrettably, we received neither an upgraded room nor the privacy we sought, as the thin walls allowed clear audibility of conversations from the neighboring room, disrupting the intended tranquility.
The room itself felt cramped, the bathroom in particular resembles an Italian bathroom with minimal maneuvering space. The absence of a second bedside nightstand added to the inconvenience, and the discomfort extended to the bed, prompting a request for additional pillows. Unfortunately, the front desk's unresponsiveness led to an arduous 8-hour wait after using the Bonvoy mobile app to request the pillows which promptly arrived at 7:00 AM the next day.
Navigating the hotel's amenities proved equally exasperating. The absence of an ice machine on the 20th floor and the inconvenient closure of the Stanton Room restaurant during happy hour were particularly bothersome. The limited menu, coupled with subpar cocktails and overpriced drinks, left a displeasing taste in our mouths.
The breakfast experience mirrored the overall disappointment. A hurried brunch on Saturday, where we were pressured to finish by 10:45 for a swift cleanup, felt more inconvenient than enjoyable. The wait staff's literal yelling of "last call" and insistence that we vacate the area added to the unpleasantness of our subpar breakfast. The $35 per day "destination fee" should be relabeled “insult fee” which when combined with the other fees and charges for this added to my already inflated bill, especially as it forced us to endure poorly mixed and cheap beverages at Stanton Room.
The staff's apparent overwhelmed state, evident at the front desk and with the bellmen, further contributed to a lack of attentiveness and timely service. Attempts to check out in person were hindered by long lines, prompting an online checkout. Post-checkout, the lack of communication persisted, with over 24 hours passing without receiving a folio. Although quick to secure charges and solicit reviews, the hotel was notably sluggish in providing a detailed bill or updating the app to reflect our stay.
Parking across the street offered a more cost-effective alternative to the hotel's $80/night charge. The only silver lining was the Starbucks coffee shop located just off the lobby, where using the mobile app provided quicker and better service than the elevators.
In summary, our stay at The Lexington fell short of expectations, plagued by unremarkable service, inadequate amenities, and substandard dining experiences. Despite the hotel's potential, the overall experience left us questioning the value and consideration extended to guests, even those with loyalty status.

title: Mixed bag
text:
The pros: I was fortunate enough to get an Executive King, so there was plenty of space in the room. No view, but plenty of light. The bed was comfortable, the room was spotless, and the housekeeping staff working on my floor (14) were wonderful. Whenever they saw me in the hall they asked if I needed anything and were always pleasant.

The cons: 1) The $35 daily fee. I didn't get to spend a single penny of it. For what? It wasn't explained and I didn't want to wait through the check-in line (more on that below) to figure out where I could use it besides the bar. The bar/restaurant either wasn't open during the hours I could get there or was packed to the gills. This charge felt like a slimy ripoff. Just charge me more for the room...or don't. For this reason alone, I don't think I'd stay here again and I stay in a LOT of Marriott properties. 2) I asked for an early check in. Couldn't get it. I know that sometimes happens, so that's all right, but it took me two more attempts to check in later in the day. The line was at least 20-30 people deep each time. Having to spend so much time on check-in (and then waiting to have my bags stored, then waiting to pick them up again) meant I had to shuffle plans. 3) The heating/cooling in the room doesn't change, despite changing the thermostat/turning it on or off. The fan is on all the time and is quite loud. It also knocked loudly at random intervals overnight.

Overall: the hotel itself is fine. It's clean and in a great location. The questionable $35 daily fee and long check in lines mean I'll likely look elsewhere for a room next time I'm in NYC.

title: Exceptional Service
text: I was pleasantly surprised at how exceptional this hotel was.  I had reserved 3 rooms all with king sized beds.  When we checked into the hotel, they only had 2 kings available and 1 queen.  Nicole at the front desk offered to remove the resort fee from our rooms and provide free breakfast because the one king was not available.  She was super sweet and very professional.   What a great first impression we had.  While the rooms were on the smaller side, they were very clean and this is most important to us. The atmosphere at the bar was very nice and the staff were wonderful.  The breakfast buffet had a lot of options and food was good.  The hotel was a bit pricy but it is in NYC so we had expected this.  We would absolutely stay here again.

title: NYC Dream trip

title: Lemons to Lemonade
text: Wonderful service! Friendly greeting upon exiting our car and then prompt service in the lobby for check-in. Originally seemed to be a snafu with our room reservation but it was very quickly fixed. A team of friendly associates Nicole, Philippe, and Plachette brought out their magic wands and fairy-godmothered us into an upgraded suite!!!! 🥰🥰

title: Ok overall, not good for accessibility
text:
Pros: reasonably comfy bed, nice doormen, good lobby, very powerful shower, not too noisy, friendly staff, conveniently located

Cons: overpriced for hotel of its class (they get you with the charming lobby but the rooms are somewhat threadbare, and while the housekeeping crew are wonderful, there are areas of the rooms that clearly havent been dusted/vacuumed in years - when you do your standard hotel room bedbug check, you’ll see the gap between the mattress and headboard/wall with years of dust…yuck). Also there isn’t a fan in the bathroom. Not a big deal but it’s a tiny bathroom and it gets pretty wet pretty fast even with a short shower. 

They charge a couple bucks per bag if you need to store with the bell desk - which is fine - but the front desk doesn’t tell anybody that - I heard from other guests in addition to myself - and it’s cash only. Again, which is fine, but there is a cash machine by the front desk. When you go to see if your room is ready and they tell you no but go check your bags w the bell captain, why not just explain the cost/cash only/refer you to ATM? Instead you go wait in line w the bell captain, then find out you need cash, then go back to front desk for cash, then go wait in line again to check bags. 

Most problematic, though, was their accessibility service. I called the hotel direct to request an accessible room after originally booking online. I was told it was all set (and even got a confirmation email.) Was not put in an accessible room.  When I called guest services (I had done messages w the Bonvoy app, plus voicemail message, with no response for at least 15 hours, and then had to call the guest services line about a dozen times before someone picked up). They said there was no record of a request for accessible room (and tried to gaslight me into thinking I had called the wrong number - I had not.) Asked if they could at least give me a shower seat. They first said they didn’t have such a thing. Then said they could move me to an accessible room but none of the rooms with two beds were accessible (I’m w spouse and child so need two beds). I said if they had any accessible rooms with wheel in showers they almost certainly had shower seats and could I please just have one. Finally after being on hold for a lengthy amount of time they agreed to bring me one (the thing I had originally requested and was told they didn’t have.). All is well, I suppose, that ends well, but in 2023 it really shouldn’t be that hard for a major hotel to provide basic accessibility accommodations.

title: Pleasant Stay

title: New York Weekend!
text:
The Lexington Hotel is a great location to explore Midtown and Central Park on foot and close to subway stations to visit the rest of Manhattan. There are lots of restaurants near by, and don’t miss Ess a Bagel for Breakfast and Sofia Wine Bar for dinner.

There is no coffee machine or water in the room, but coffee is available in the morning and water all day at reception. However, not the most eco friendly. 

The bar is really nice and priced for the area, and it was great using the resort credit for a drink in the evening. 

Check In was very quick and our room was ready on arrival and cleaned daily.

Only giving 4/5 as the room was not as modern or updated as previous Autograph Collection and no coffee machine in the room!

title: OK but could do much better
text: Let me preface this by saying that I stay at The Lexington a couple of times a year.  It is near my office (I used to stay even closer but most of the hotels on Lex in midtown closed during COVID and never reopened).  When I started staying, there were coffee makers in the room - no more).  Breakfast is continental - there used to be eggs and bacon - no more.  If you want to eat -only bar food for dinner (which is pre-prepped so no edits to menu).  Destination fee of $35 which gives you a daily $35 food credit.  It is not aggregated - you miss a day, you miss a credit.  I find the beds a bit too soft and the bathrooms tiny.  Also could not believe that the desk chair was replaced with an old ballroom stacking chair.  Finally, even though Titanium member, you can not get an upgrade.  All in all, the price is fair but the hotel is missing its potential.

title: Awesome place and location in NYC
