title: Great location - nice lobby - good old school bar
text: Stayed one night for business. Great location. Friendly front desk agent. Nice lobby atmosphere. Starbucks connected to lobby. Given a standard small queen room - bed, nightstand, desk, desk chair, dresser. Very small bathroom. Small closet. Quiet. Decent bed. No coffee maker. No fridge. Old banquet room chair for desk chair. Old desk. Definitely not an updated room. Ask for an updated room.

title: Don't Fall for Car Scam
text: Love the Lexington and have stayed multiple times during the US Open. It's convenient to Grand Central and within walking distance of some great places. Took a cab to Gramercy Tavern on Friday night and a driver of a Suburban offered to take me for $40. I declined and paid $15 for a cab. On Sunday, went to a show about 8 blocks away. The doorman said I have a car service that's the same price as an Uber. It turned out to be the same guy and there were no cabs, so I took it. When we arrived, I handed him my card and said "how much" and he said $40. I said "no way" and he said yes we talked about it and he ran my card before I could negotiate. The car is a black Escalade and the last 4 digits of the plate are 656C. I complained to the front desk and the employee was indifferent so I asked to speak to a manager. He or she never came after 5 minutes so I left. The worst part about all of it was the doorman recommended this guy - I'm sure he was getting a kickback!

title: Nice but room for improvement
text:
We spent 7 nights here in a standard king room. The check in receptionist was polite and when we asked about a late check out as we did not need to leave for the airport until around 1.00pm this was given to us at no extra charge. The room was dated but OK with an in-room safe, iron, hair dryer, alarm clock with a phone charging point and dressing gowns. There was no in-room hot drink facilities but if this is an issue for you I believe you can request a coffee maker. The bathroom is very small with a small sized bath and overhead shower but functional. The TV has the Netflix app if you have an account to sign in. The air-con worked well in our room.

The lobby area is nice and jazzy so are the lifts, you can get free coffee/tea from reception first thing in the morning and bottled water all day. 

Breakfast is served in the bar area and we only had this 2 morning as we found this to be a very basic quality and choice and well below the usual Marriott standard for breakfast. There is a Starbucks counter next to the lobby area and side entrance to the hotel where you can get cakes, muffins, breakfast wraps etc. We also went to the luncheonette cafe nearby a couple of morning for pancakes/waffles topped with strawberries/blueberries.

We went to the bar area on our first evening for a soft drink, there was no table service and had to ask at the bar for 2 cokes which were around $9 each including a service charge which I think is a bit cheeky and expensive as I was given unopened cans. We did have some food in the bar another evening but it has a very limited menu mainly salads/pizza.

Location is great and within walking distant to the Rockefeller centre, Grand Central, Central Park. Times Square etc. Also lots of restaurants around, we liked Toscana 49 and The Smith the best for our evening meal.

This hotel is cashless and we added a few items to our room but were never asked to show our room card to check we had given the correct room number and you cannot view the room account via the TV as other Marriott hotels we have been to and to my surprise no invoice was placed under the room door early in the morning on check out day. When we went to reception to check out we were told by a different receptionist to the one who checked us in that your good to go, I said we should have a few room charges to which the receptionist replied yes you have but I had to ask for these to be confirmed and printed off so we could check everything was correct before leaving the hotel and country. I have been to many hotels over the last 30 years and have never come across a hotel before that does not automaticity upon check out confirm any extra charges with the guest are correct.

title: Superb customer service
text: I entered the Lexington Hotel late on Sunday night after needing to quickly leave my previous dwelling. I came to the lobby horribly emotional and distraught - barely able to formulate sentences. Philipe and Jenny at the front desk were so compassionate and showed me the utmost care going above and beyond their professional duties to take care of me and get me checked into a room for the evening. I have stayed at the Lexington a handful of times before and always have a good experience so it was the first place I went to find a room. I am so incredibly grateful to the staff for taking away some of the stress from my nightmare of an evening. The next day Nicole at the front desk provided the most seamless checkout experience ensuring that the hotel had done everything possible to accommodate me. I will surely be recommending the Lexington to anyone who needs a place to stay in NYC.

title: Suite Life
text: This hotel is visually beautiful. The bar area was so nice and the drinks were top tier. Nicole looked out for us and just went above and beyond to make our stay amazing. The suite was gorgeous and spacious. Definitely a home away from home!!!

title: Let's hear it for the ladies!!
text: My friends and I visited this location to celebrate a birthday.  When we arrived we were assisted/checked in by Nicole at the front desk.  From the greeting, Nicole was so welcoming, professional, friendly and efficient!  She was able to get us checked in, made incredible suggestions and even informed us about the resort credits that CERTAINLY came in handy to grab a cocktail after a long day of traveling.  The rooms were nice sized, clean and had great views.  That evening, the female bartender was super nice.  We got in really late and spoke with Celeste and Kaylin on the overnight crew who were very friendly, helpful and had a great sense of humor. The next day, Nicole and Nurat expeditiously and satisfactorily resolved an issue we had.  I can't thank them enough for making sure that we were comfortable, accommodated and happy with the rest of our stay.  The hotel has a super swanky lounge downstairs that opens at 5 and we visited everyday of our stay. In case you'd like to have a little bubbly before the lounge opens, they have a Moet vending machine.  Talk about luxury.  The bell staff was also very friendly, accommodating and made you feel safe.  The hotel was perfectly situated and with a few steps out of the front doors,  you could find premium shopping, convenience stores, restaurants, entertainment and public transportation. I will certainly be staying again on my next visit.  Thank you again Nicole for everything!

title: Superbe Hôtel
text:
Nous avons séjourné 3 nuits dans ce magnifique hôtel, superbement décoré. Emplacement idéal, à 5 minutes à pieds de Times Square, de la gare centrale....Chambre
 spacieuse, literie très confortable ce qui est appréciable après  une bonne journée de visite.
Un petit bémol pour la salle de bain qui mériterait d être modernisé,néanmoins séjour fort agréable dans cet hôtel.

title: Horrible Experience and Service
text: Horrible experience.  First off, an annoyance:  I've never been to a hotel, which is considered more upscale, that charges a fee to hold your bags at the bell desk until room is ready.  Gentleman in front of me was in from Europe, had no American dollars, and was turned away from the bell stand who wouldn't take his bag to hold.  Totally unacceptable.  Then we checked into our room which was very small, but I expected that from what I read.  However, I have had recent knee surgery and already have experienced a fall.  I was concerned because upon entering the room and going into the bathroom, I tripped on the unusually high marble saddle that was the tallest I've seen.  Since I often have the need to get up during the night, I was afraid I would fall.  I spoke to the front desk, and asked me to speak with Assistant Manager Kelvin.  He was totally condescending and smarmy, and basically did nothing.  There were no accessible rooms available.  So I asked that because I was afraid of falling in the room, if I found another hotel, would he reimburse me the points I used.  His immediate reply was "absolutely not'.  The reason being that I checked in at 12:30 PM and now it was 5:30 PM. I explained we arrived at 11 am, room wasn't ready, but we didn't actually take the keys for the room until 5:30.  He obviously didn't believe me, but finally reluctantly said he would 'take my word for it.'  I nicely asked if he'd be good enough to call the Residence Inn down the street to see if they had availablity for the night and he flatly refused.  So I walked over to the Residence Inn, and they were full, but the gentleman at the front desk of the hotel - a hotel I wasn't even staying at, and was kind enough to call the Courtyard where rooms were available.  The Lexington was a horrible experience with a terrible assistant manager, and lacking even the facade of trying to offer service.  The hotel is a complete disgrace.

title: Nicole made us feeling very welcome. Thank you
text: Great art deco building, great location. Nicole at the reception is wonderful and very helpful. She helped us with our early check in. By the way the elevators are a work of art. They are the pure expression  of art deco. The lobby and bar are very welcoming.

title: Stay somewhere else
text:
We stayed here because it was in the same neighbourhood as where we usually stay, but it happened to be less expensive this time. 

The lobby is beautiful as is the bar. The staff are really just ok. The housekeeping staff are more friendly than the front desk or the manager. I was turned off because I ordered a package to be delivered and paid express shipping for it to arrive the same day as us. When we arrived (3 p.m.) they said they would look into it and bring it up to the room if it had been delivered. Later on I checked my tracking and saw that it had in fact been delivered before our arrival. Nothing had been brought up to the room so I checked with the front desk again and they said the package room was closed for the day so they couldn’t get it for me. Somehow the manager of the hotel doesn’t have access to this room after 5 p.m.? I ended up getting it the next day after I went downstairs first thing and asked again. Then waited for the only person with access to the package room for about 15 minutes. It just could have been handled so much better. 

We had a later flight the day we left and so we had to store our bags. They charge for this and it’s not a large amount but they only accept cash and who carries that anymore? 

The room is nice, but the bathroom is so so tiny. They put us on a high floor which was nice. 

We would not stay again.

title: Don't book a room with a third party
text: I booked a room via a third party system. The price I paid the website didn't include the $35 in resort fees. Oddly enough, they told me I could spend these $35 dollars in hotel amenities. I had breakfast the next morning which was totally substandard and later got a $41 extra charge on my credit card. Beyond this underhanded fleecing, the hotel is pretty ordinary.

title: Très mitigé !
text:
* Du bon :
- hôtel bien situé, proche de la Gare Centrale (8'), de Times Square (17').
- très belle décoration
- chambre de dimensions correctes pour NY
- bonne literie
- lits faits et draps + produits de toilette renouvelés journellement
- café et bouteilles d'eau à disposition à la réception
* Du moins bons :
- pas de frigo ni de cafetière dans la chambre
- petit déjeuner correct sans plus mais très (trop) cher = 37 USDollars
- insonorisation pas optimale : bruits de la rue et des chambres voisines (15e étage)
* De l'inadmissible : chambre bloquée et "non faite" sans préavis ni demande préalable ni explications pour non paiement des petits déjeuners en cours de séjours !!! Plainte a été déposée !
Ce manque de correction et de respect (y compris du contrat) m'empêche de recommander cet hôtel. Il y a mieux !

title: Great Ambience
text:
Close to our office on Lexington Ave & a great lobby area as it had a great vibe being the Christmas season in Manhattan. Typical crowds for a weekend in early December but the staff we're great to check you in in a timely manner with as busy as it was. 

I really like these Hilton Autograph Collection hotels within the Hilton portfolio but as typical as rooms go in NYC they are small rooms & this hotel missed on the bedding as the mattress felt like my feet were six inches above my head so we ended up leaving a night early to go to Queens to stay at a newer hotel & have some down time in a much quieter neighborhood after enjoying two nights in Manhattan.

title: Hospitality makes all the difference
text:
We drove almost 6 hours, some through blinding rain and Friday night traffic.   When we walked in and Nicole greeted us with a smile that filled the lobby we instantly shed our stress and knew it would be a great stay. 

We were only there for one night, to see The Eagles at MSG, so the cute art deco room was just fine.  I see other reviews saying it is dated.  Well, sort of.  But that's the point of a retro roaring 20s hotel isn't it?  I grew up watching commercials for the Lex and was so amused to stay there.  

It would be too small to stay a week.  I'll give you that.  While the water pressure provided a great shower, I had to dress in the room as the bathroom was too small.  

Pablo was super friendly at breakfast the next day, and valet parking was great.  $70, but hey, at least I didn't have to deal with a thing.

The location is spectacular and so is the staff.  Next concert, we know where we'll stay.

title: It was a rough night but Nicole made it great!
text:
My flight got canceled out of LaGuardia and it was a heck of a time finding a room. I found The Lexington Hotel and hopped in an Uber. I was exhausted when I arrived and just wanted to get to my room. 

The nice person working at the desk, Nicole, was so attentive and kind. She made sure I was all set and made me feel human again.

I will be staying here again, service like that will make me a long time customer!

title: Très bon hôtel avec du personnel exceptionnel
text: Nous avons passé un excellent séjour dans cet hôtel très bien situé dans Manhattan. Les chambres sont spacieuses et le personnel est très prévenant et agréable. Merci particulièrement à Philippe dont la grande gentillesse, les conseils précieux et les attentions ont rendu le séjour inoubliable. Il a été le véritable atout de notre séjour au Lexington.

title: Wonderful staff!
text: What a welcoming and wonderful staff at the Lexington Autograph Collection Hotel!  Nicole at the front desk greeted us with a big warm smile and cheerful hello. She recognized my partner's birthday and went out of her way to make her (our) stay really special. Nicole was so engaging, friendly, and helpful. What a positive and refreshing attitude she displays! Also, Derek the doorman was engaging and fantastic. He helped with luggage, parking, recommendations, directions, etc. Overall, our experience at this hotel was tremendous. As always, the people make the difference.

title: Exceptional Service Makes for an Great Stay
text: I gave the Lexington Hotel an outstanding rating, primarily due to its exceptional service. Upon check-in, Nicole offered impeccable front desk assistance, intuitively grasping my requirements and allocating a room that perfectly suited my needs. Derrick, the doorman at the front door, goes above and beyond to establish a personal connection with guests. His knowledge of the local area is invaluable; just ask him about the best pizza spots and he’ll steer you in the right direction. While the room itself may not be luxurious, the top-notch service more than compensates for it. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

title: Compliments to Front Desk Associate
text: Can’t say enough great things about my recent stay at this hotel. Amazing service the entire staff went out of their way delivering world class service. Special recognition to Nicole at front desk guest check in. She was pleasant and despite the long line of guest waiting to check in she was cool, calm and collected as she served each guest with a greeting and smile. This is my 5th stay at this hotel and will continue to be my choice for future trips to NYC.

title: Midtown Moments of Hospitality Excellence
text: The hotel exudes a sophisticated boutique atmosphere inspired by the Jazz Age. Upon my arrival, I was assisted by the doorman and taken to check in for Bonvoy members. Check-in went smoothly, and I was upgraded to a slightly larger room on the 25th floor. My room was tidy, looked cared for, and had a lovely bed and a small but clean bathroom. Unfortunately, I had to shower in the bathtub, which I don't like, but sadly, it happens often. The hotel has a Starbucks entrance so that you can get great coffee there in the morning; too bad the room didn't have a coffee machine, so you had to go downstairs first. In the morning, a small but OK breakfast buffet is served. If you want something different, there are plenty of restaurants in the area where you can have breakfast a la carte. The bar is very cozy with a friendly staff. Everyone in the hotel is more than helpful, making this a nice hotel. Great base if you need to be in midtown.

title: Great NYC midtown hotel!
text:
We just stayed at The Lexington overnight for a concert. The room was large by NYC standards. The bathroom was small which was not a problem for us but if is for you, you could ask for a room with a larger bathroom.
This hotel is very centrally located, we took a walk to Central Park the first day , had lunch along the way at one of many restaurants.
The next day we had a nice hotel breakfast and walked to Hudson yards to see the attraction The Edge. We enjoyed the view but next time we plan on going at night to see the nighttime skyline.
I have stayed at many NYC hotels and for the price , I think this is an excellent choice.

title: The absolute BEST Staff
text: This was my very first time traveling to New York City! The Lexington Hotel is in the perfect location, we walked everywhere with ease. It is centrally located with beautiful accommodations. While all of that is great what I came to Trip Advisor for is to rave about the most incredible staff I have ever experienced in my many years of traveling. I am from Memphis, Tn and while New York is quite different from the South, the employees at this hotel made me feel at home! I can't remember the lady's name that checked us in but she had the cutest Tom Ford glasses that I complimented her on and we discussed different types of water and how they all taste different. If she reads this I hope she remembers the conversation and knows that I am speaking about her. She was amazing, such a warm welcome to such a big city. The other employees at the front desk at night we just as amazing, Manuel and Phillippe! Kush is such an added gem to your property, I know most bartenders are very personable but he was extraordinarily amazing! We sat at the bar about 10 minutes before it closed and in that short amount of time I felt like I had a new best friend! I had really low expectations when traveling to NY when it came to the southern hospitality I'm use to however, the staff here WOW'd me like no other and I was blown away at how in a city I have never traveled to, I felt at home! Thank you to the Front Desk clerk with the cute TF glasses :), Manuel, Phillippe, and Kush for an unforgettable First Trip to New York!

title: Pas beaucoup de plaisirs…
text: Hôtel très bien situé, proche de La gare centrale et de Times Square. L’impression en arrivant était très positive. Mais on quitte l’hôtel sans trop de regrets: personnel correct, sans plus, chambre petite ne pouvant pas être aérée, salle de bains minuscule et désuète, aucun équipement dans la chambre: pas de bouteille d’eau, pas de bouilloire, pas de thé... Pour un quatre étoiles? En fait, pas beaucoup de plaisirs. Et cerise sur le gâteau : devoir payer 3 dollars par bagage gardé à l’accueil lors du check out!

title: Good. Basic. Small.
text: Good basic hotel in NYC. Stay here for the location if you need to be in midtown. Easy to walk to 5th Ave, Rock Center, Grand Central, etc. Basic king room had more space than many other NYC hotels. Bathroom was VERY small. Ceiling in shower was too low for my husband to shower, he’s 6’5” tall. The shower was very narrow also. Small counter space too. AC was good, not great. Our view showed roofs of other buildings. The room had a great full length mirror and lighting was just okay - not good enough for make up application. Starbucks store had access from the lobby. Bar has Happy Hour specials and served a simple buffet breakfast. Complimentary water for Bonvoy Members.

title: a great 7 night stay
text:
A wonderful stay at this hotel. The hotel is beautiful both outside and inside. We would like to thank Philippe who was very attentive, kind and professional during this stay. A thank you to all the staff who are all brilliant.
I highly recommend this hotel, you will have a pleasant stay, safe and close to several iconic New York landmarks!

Un merveilleux séjour dans cet hôtel. L'hôtel est magnifique autant à l'extérieur qu'à l'intérieur. Nous tenons à remercier Philippe qui nous a été d'une grande écoute, gentillesse et professionnalisme pendant ce séjour. Un merci à tout le personnel qui sont tous génial.
Je recommande fortement cet hôtel, vous passerez un séjour agréable, en sécurité et à proximité de plusieurs monuments emblématiques de New York.

title: Beautiful stay - amazing hotel, location and customer service!
text: I had an incredible time at the Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection. The staff were incredibly warm and helpful, the location was amazing, and the accommodations were so comfortable and well thought out/designed. I will remember this stay for a long time - thank you Lexington Hotel for making my New York trip so comfortable and memorable!

title: Dissatisfied Stay
text:
The worst hotel we have ever stayed. Rude, incompetent, poorly trained manager at the desk Kaylen. Front desk clerks kind and professional, limited hotel services, no amenities to speak of besides an $35 credit  no mini bar (but still they leave the fridge in the room, switched off??) dingy, broken up rooms filled with chipped furniture and stained carpets.
Note to management- don’t bother replying to this with your poorly written, copied and pasted hotel response. Spend your time reading up on Customer Service 101 instead.

title: Disappointed Stay
text:
Avoid this property. Not worth the price. Rooms are cramped. Plumbing issues. Staff not as polite as at other properties I've been to. 
The front desk manager Katlin has no customer service very unpleasant

title: One Night Stay at Hotel
text: I am very favorably impressed by the hotel and its services.  The room was a little small, but my and his wife, who stay there when they are traveling thru New York, fold me tp expect smaller rooms when they recommended the hotel to me, so I was not surprised.  The room was certainly beg enough for my needs.  It was quiet, and the bed was very comfortable.  The only thing missing was a rack to put my luggage on, but the desk clerk apologized and tolm me if I ever ran ito this again all I had to do was call the desk.  I definitely plan to stay at this hotel again.

title: A 3.2 star hotel with a friendly desk staff.
text: One of the smallest rooms I’ve ever seen and no amenities. I’m a Bonvoy titanium elite member and this hotel offered fewer amenities than a regular Courtyard Marriott. The room 917 was a tiny box. No in room coffee. No refrigerator. One tiny bar of soap. As an elite you get free breakfast and Motel 6 puts out a much more impressive spread. I paid the same number of points as the Ritz Carlton in Orlando and I just don’t see any reason to stay here besides the nice location.

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel in a great part of town.  I was there for work but enjoyed my stay and can't wait to come back.  Nice size rooms (for NYC).  A champagne vending machine (can never go wrong there), great breakfast as well.

title: Amazing customer service
text: Lovely welcome to New York, Kailyn and the rest of the staff have taken great care of us. The hotel has lots of atmosphere. No wait at reception which always makes a stay better. But the staff make this hotel stand out. Thank you.

title: Accueil et service parfaits
text: Nous avons séjourné 5 nuits dans cet hôtel et nous sommes ravis ! L’emplacement est parfait à côté de Grand Central. L’accueil a été extra et nous remercions particulièrement Philippe à la réception pour sa gentillesse et son professionnalisme - en plus il parle français 😉 ainsi que Jenny à la réception également & Randy un de leurs managers, ils se sont parfaitement bien occupés de nous 🙏🏼😊 On recommande ! Sylvie & Xavier

title: OK Location
text: We have stayed here for business industry meetings a few times.  The rooms are small but it’s NYC.  We were charged $35 a day which the front desk didn’t tell us about.  The only reason we learned about this was from Trip Advisor!!!!  You can spend this fee at the bar or dry-cleaning etc. We had a glass of wine and rum and coke and were charged $50 so it’s really a racket to get you to spend more money.  The door man was very friendly.

title: Very good experience
text: Everything was really good. The location is just perfect and the hotel facilities and services very good. It was our second time in the same hotel , we will repeat again if necessary . Try he staff very kind and professional.

title: My Go To Stay in NYC
text: I am a HUGE fan of the Lexington.  I have been staying here for years for business.  It is a small boutique hotel with a lovely staff and they always make me feel welcome and safe.  The hotel has some cool history behind it and is in a great location.  It is my go to place any time I come into NYC. Starbucks is attached making it easy to grab coffee and breakfast first thing in the morning or the hotel restaurant on the first floor is great too.  There are some nice spots on the second floor that are quiet if you need to get some work done or for interview purposes.

title: I wouldn’t ask for your autograph
text: Stayed at the Lexington on a recent trip. It’s an Autograph property so I was expecting something a little above average.  I was disappointed. Lobby and Bar area are decent but the rest of the place is in severe need of a makeover.  Only one or at times 2 elevators were working leading to long lines at times and when you got to your room it felt tired and old.  I’m top status in the rewards program and they didn’t even put me on the preferred floor.  We have a corporate rate with the hotel and when making a reservation they associate couldn’t find the appropriate code - or didn’t really try.  The only good news was the bar and the F/B manager who was around both nights and very pleasant. Drinks are very expensive and of course there’s the inevitable resort fee added to your stay. I needed an email of my bill and it took three phone calls and an email before it was finally sent. For me that pretty much summed things up. For me it’s a one and done.  I won’t be giving them my autograph again.

title: Horrible
text: Staff was dismissive, and unprofessional. Guest services never answers the phone. Hot water was turned off without notice so I went down to the front desk and asked if Guest Services was open (because I called and let the phone ring for 25 minutes and no one answered). I was told " we're the ones who answer the phone's and we're busy right now". I then spoke with a manager who offered an apology and explained a pipe broke so they shut the water off. BUT the front desk staff that were "busy" continued to check guest in but never made them aware of the fact that they did not have running water. I went back to my room and waited 45 minutes, and still no water... I finally checked out and during the process a  young man was delivering food and asked one of the staff a question (there was a language barrier, but absolutely no excuse).The staff responded with and I quote "I'm no the door man what the f*ck.". I was appalled... not only is the behavior and language reprehensible but my 4 yr old heard this. Where is the professionalism? I paid good money to stay at this hotel and in part due to it being a Marriott brand. This was the absolute worse stay I've ever had at a hotel! Later that afternoon someone with a Florida area code called and identified herself as Cami/Kami. She wanted to know how was my stay at The Lexington. I told her about my experience and she began making excuse verses offering an apology or resolve, and when I told her the lack of customer service seems to be systemic, she said, "well call guest services and hung up on me.

title: Excellent communication at The Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection
text: We called to check about parking and had a few additional questions. The PBX Operator is an exceptional resource.  Derrick was friendly and very professional while talking with us. He gave us the distance to the Paley Center, Rockefeller Center and recommendations where to go for great NYC pizza!  Thank you, Derrick!

title: Bad service
text: The day of check-in there was only one person to receive more than 15 people in line, the manager passed by and it didn't seem that she cared, the person at the counter did the best she could, but the indifference of the manager and the lack of staff I do not help

title: Dirty sock in bed
text: Unsatisfactory experience for a room costing 350 a night. Imagine my surprise when I found a dirty sock in my bed when I laid down to sleep at night. The room also had red mold in the grout lines, a view of a terrace covered in rusting equipment, coated with pigeon poop and a group of pigeons. The alarm clock was not shut off between guest stays, so I had a rude awakening at 6 AM. The front desk offered me a refund which I accepted, and then proceeded not to follow through on after being emailed, so I had to contact Marriott and my bank. I would recommend taking your business elsewhere.

title: Good location, good value, nice guys
text: Pleasant stay, clean, nice staff, good location, convenient room, nice bar, good value, the breakfast must be changed from continental breakfast to a more variety of food including the possibility to order an omelette...

title: Great experience at the Lexington
text: The staff goes above and beyond to make sure you are happy with your stay.  Very personalized attention, I liked that there were never any lines at the elevators, the outdoor space with the suites was the best I have ever seen in NYC and I liked the location, walkable to everything but not in the craziness of times square.  I would definitely stay again!

title: Cannot get a receipt/bill/folio after many weeks and endless requests
text: I will not stay here again when there are much better options within blocks.  I've been trying to get a bill/receipt from my stay.  It's been almost a month and multiple phone calls, emails, texts to Marriott and to the hotel have led to nothing.  I expense my hotels for work and this is the most ridiculous thing.  I also prepaid and was charged more than the prepaid advertised amount.

title: It’s a Jazzy Place
text:
The hotel room was NY small but  clean, and the hotel allowed us early check in.  The lobby is magnificent and comfortable, with a Starbucks attached. The $35 daily destination fee (a claimed credit) was a gambit to force you to eat the continental breakfast  in the hotel bar, at a coincidental cost of $32. It was, however, a good continental breakfast……

Elevators were fast and efficient; maid service was excellent.  We had a very quiet room, no street noise. 

One strong plus - the hotel provided an unlimited supply of bottled water at the front desk. 

One strong negative - no cash on the premises, so bring plenty of small bills for tips.  If you ask anyone in the hotel for change, they look at you with amusement and say no.

But on balance, because of its great location, we’d stay there again.

title: Good with a comment
text: This centrally located hotel, 5 minutes from subway,. 10 minutes from Grand Central looks better on the pictures than it is. it is an old hotel, though we enjoyed it as it has pretty decent sized rooms for NY standards with all amenities. Beds were superb, good shower, lower floor get noisy even when you are on floor 11. Good bar area too. What I do not liek is that they add 70$ to your room rate per day that you basically have to spend on drinks and partially on dry cleaning (but not in the weekend) or renting a bike (which did not work) or it is gone.

title: Enjoyable Accommodations
text: Very helpful staff. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included, although very modest options. No dinner service but close to several restaurants. Nice location; very close to shopping on 5th Avenue.

title: Basic rooms
text:
Disappointed with the rooms here. I was reminded of the Scottish saying, "Fur coat and nae knickers", with this hotel. Yes the public areas look posh - foyer, very expensive bar to one side, mezzanine seating area, even a vending machine selling small bottles of champagne! However once you go up to the rooms the standard falls sharply. The double rooms are very basic and tiny (just enough room to walk round the bed and no more). For UK travellers to give you an idea of the level, the rooms are more basic than a Premier Inn, more on a level with a Travelodge but not as modern. 
The rooms are in desperate need of a full refurb. They have tried to patch it up e.g. bits of wallpaper and sealant round the bath, but very old and tired. No extras at all e.g. no fridge or tea/coffee making facilities. You can get ice but this is only available on a few floors (not ours) so good luck finding it.
The hotel seemed popular with people on business and flight crew. Although if on business be warned you can't really work from the room - there is a desk squeezed into the corner but there isn't enough room to sit comfortably, there is no ceiling light and outside light is blocked by other buildings so the room is very dark and dreary. It is also too noisy to work after 9am. Although I put a 'do not disturb' sign on the door the housekeeping staff were very noisy, shouting to each other along the corridor and having personal chats outside my door.
Not sure you could call the breakfast a buffet, there is hardly anything there and it's just laid out on the bar. It is fine if you just want a coffee and bagel but no hot food (they also had some cold meat, cubes of cheese and melon). A door near the lifts opens directly into a Starbucks so you'd be as well getting breakfast there. There is access to a gym in the basement. This is a private gym but guests can sign in. 
When we arrived we did order a sharing platter at the bar but it was very small (and expensive) so we had to go out for food. The cocktails were disappointing too.
The best thing about this hotel is the location. It felt like a safe enough area and easy to walk to most places.
In conclusion, I would say this hotel is fine for a single person, someone on a business trip maybe. However it is too expensive for what you get (you might get a cheaper deal at a weekend as they are quieter without all the business people). In this price range you can find much better hotels in NYC.

title: Lexington Hotel - Autograph Collection?
text: Nice property and tastefully furnished but not sure why Autograph? No special amenities, in fact, no coffee makers, no water, nothing outstanding to make it an Autograph property. Or perhaps I do not understand what Autograph refers to.

title: Not as luxurious as they want you to think
text:
Will update after my full stay but right off the bat these are things that make me question why this is a 4 star hotel:

- no robes in the rooms
- no refrigerator in the room
- no room service
- the bath towels are very small and very scratchy

Additionally, the shower is so tiny and didn’t drain well so the water accumulated up to my ankles. Overall this doesn’t feel as luxurious or high end a hotel as the website leads you to believe.

title: A Very cool vibe at this hotel
text: Go for the king size rooms. The double rooms with one bed are on the small side but the kings are lovely. Staff very kind and helpful. My only suggestion is in addition to the hot oatmeal for breakfast at the small buffet, add some kind of egg dish . fritata etc. Fresh fruist and breads and bagels and muffins are nice but for $30 you can add some more hot items.

title: Don't recommend
text: So disappointed. Front of the house staff were unhelpful.  Complained to us  about being understaffed as we checked in. We checked in ti a dirty room, front desk staff told me there was no other room. Luckily all of the housekeeping staff was helpful and friendly and cleaned our room. I watched interactions with managers desk and guests,  when a guest would ask for something, they were sent to another desk (fridge, directions).  Breakfast host was short tempered with guests. We went down to desk after checkout for lost item, we were told "I dont know how long it will take".  Go to the Residence Inn next door, they all go above and beyond to help.

title: Definitely not Autograph level
text: Not at all what I expected from a Marriott Autograph Collection.  The rooms are very very small, and the bathrooms are even smaller. You cannot extend your arms out without hitting a wall. The ceilings are also low throughout - it is a very old building. I am shocked that this is considered an Autograph and it is overpriced as well! The housekeeping staff was wonderful and did a great job.  Also no coffeemaker in the room and no fridge either - and ice on only a few floors so you had to walk to fin ice and then try to chill water or sodas in an ice container.  Pointless.  Outside of hotel is also not well light and not convenient for walking in NYC.

title: Staff needs more supervision
text:
Lovely art deco inspired boutique hotel with all necessary amenities. Unfortunately my husband tripped and fell on sidewalk and bell boys refused to help, they were more interested in their conversation.
Continental breakfast was perfect.

title: Don’t waste your money
text: Rooms are decent , AC  effectiveness moderate. Additionally the lobby bar/restaurant (if you want to call it that) 1) limited food selections; breakfast is like staying at courtyard or Fairfield inn 2) restaurant kitchen- either they can’t keep staff or management thinks it’s a good idea to close early. No food or issues, excuse if The kitchen is closed 3) lunch - restaurant is closed 4) spend the money and stay across the street at Intercontinental

title: Convenient location in mid-town Manhattan
text: Very pleasant hotel within walking distance of many of the main attractions of New York. I have stayed there three times, twice for business some years ago, and again this year for a holiday and have always had a great time there.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: This was our first time at The Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection and it was Wonderful.  Fast efficient check in, informative staff. For the price it included $35 food/beverage daily credit, free daily entrance to Crunch Fitness, 2 Citi bikes.  Food/beverage could be breakfast or at the bar...We have never had this service before.  Fantastic

title: A nice hotel with two big issues
text: Nice enough hotel. Friendly staff, Nice lobby, good rooms, Crunch Gym on the lower lever. Two big negatives - the WORST breakfast Buffett I have ever had - I have more than I thousand nights in Marriott alone, so they have accomplished the impossible. Migrants at the Southern Border get better food. Second, nice bar - a glass of house wine, two tequila and sodas served in a juice glass - $91.00. I know that the crime rate in New York is high, I didn’t expect to be robbed at the bar.

title: Another Great Stay!
text: The Lexington continues to be our "go to hotel" in NYC. The combination of a great location, excellent customer service, and nice amenities results is a first-class experience. We look forward to our next stay when we are back to the city.

title: Will not stay here again
text:
After moving rooms, I ended up worse than when I started.  The rooms are dated, smell musty, the towels were damp and there are zero amenities.  Walls are paper thin. You can hear everything around you. 

Bonvoy status does not matter here. Will never come back.

title: Inaccurate billing
text: Location is alright. Hotel is super old and need an update. There is funky smell (like mold and humidity) once entering the lobby. Room is old. Lobby bar is nice. But they change a 18% tip by default on the bill. Fortunately the service was fine. Everything is acceptable but price is way too high (almost 300 per night) for this standards. Worse thing is, they charge me the wrong amount on the bill. Would definitely not going back next time!

title: The most amazing staff!
text: Though the bathrooms were dated and needs major renovation, the staff more than compensated for this.  Everyone from the front desk (specially Jenny), to the housekeeping staff, their very welcoming attitudes were simply amazing.  The nice housekeeping ladies who serviced my room were constantly asking for and attending to my needs; every time I left the room, they were there to greet me!!!!  I’d definitely consider staying at The Lexington again in the near future.  To the housekeeping staff…THANK YOU!!!

title: Summer Trip
text: Excellent hotel, ideal for mid town access and tourist spots. Rooms cleaned daily and fresh towels put in bathroom. Beds are huge and very comfortable. I would use this hotel if I was coming to Manhattan again

title: Best Hotel in Manhattan
text: I’ve stayed here twice and both times it’s been pleasant they helped me when i came in on an early flight knew i needed rest and placed me on the quietest floor possible had the best door men possible knew exactly where everything was

title: I'm back where I belong!
text: Pre-pandemic The Lexington was my hotel of choice in NYC. Close enough to shows, museums, Central Park, shopping....whatever I wanted to do seemed to be within walking distance. But, they closed for a bit longer than some, and I started staying at the Marquis...closer to shows, but nothing else. Now, I'm back at The Lexington and feeling home again. The rooms, and whole hotel, are charming...not the largest rooms (bathrooms especially small) in the city, but they have everything that I need. Refrigerators available on request and delivered promptly. Amazingly welcoming and accomodating staff. Terrific bar staff...with an AWESOME chocolate martini by Lauren. Breakfast is more that basic continental, but not by much, but it's everything that I need. I am home again....back where I belong!

title: Our Stay at the Lexington
text: Room was very clean! Having a room with separate bathrooms was a real pleasant surprise. Hotel Bar made a refreshing aperol spritz with a good sized humus with pita  appetizer. Morning breakfast hit the balance of filling without stuffing.

title: The Lexington - like family
text: When travelling to New York City, my go-to hotel is the Lexington. I am warmly welcomed by the staff who are genuine and make me feel like I'm at my home away from home. Super comfy beds and quiet rooms allow me to get the rest I need to face the day. Love this place.

title: Old property in need of maintenance
text: Lovely property but in need of maintenance. My aircon sounded like a huge generator even after the maintenance man reluctantly fixed it. My colleague’s room flooded in the middle of the night after a pipe burst in their room.

title: Consistently solid…The Lexington
text:
Nicole at the front desk gets 5 stars.
Friendly. Helpful. Did a great job of multitasking while another employee was occupied. (There was someone that needed assistance and Nicole helped both of us.)
 The bar is fun. Good cocktails.
The staff at the bell stand/desk are generally friendly and helpful.

I like the hotel because it is familiar.
Several colleagues have joined me in staying here for years now.

The weekend breakfast for Elite members could use a bit of touch up.

title: Superb
text:
This is a great property, conveniently located, and home to warm and resourceful staff. Nicole was above and beyond accommodating us.
The higher you go, the better the views can be. 
The Moet vending machine is a must-try.

title: Great Stay!
text: I booked the Lexington, having stayed there before, and it was just as great as before.  Upon arrival at 12PM, they had a room ready for me and everyone was as nice as could be.  They provided me information about all charges that would happen, so there was no surprise at checkout.  Very appreciative of that!  Not only was the front desk focused on my room but also advised about using Crunch gym.  For anyone that is traveling and used to a gym and not a hotel gym (no offense to hotel gyms, but they are just different), it was great to have this option.  I used Crunch one day and I felt like I got a great workout like I do at home as it wasn't filled with hotel guests that have never seen a real gym before.  This one perk will make me choose The Lexington over and over again.  Not to mention how nice every one was to me and how easy check-in/out was.

title: A Short Stay in NYC
text: Staying at the Lexington Hotel made a short trip to NYC less taxing because of the lovely people who work there. They made my visit that much more pleasant by seeing to my every need. I forgot to pack a toothbrush, they sent one up. We needed another robe for my roommate and one appeared at the door. They took the extra step to  seeing that my very short stay in NYC was above average. All thanks to the excellent and responsive staff tat the Lexington Hotel.

title: Old school level of service
text: Do you miss the days of having your bed made and towels refreshed without having to request the service? Stay at the Lexington and you will be met with service that is beyond compare. The Lexington is a beautiful property with a kind and helpful staff. Each day our room was tidied automatically and every request met with a smile and speedy response. If you aren't used to staying in urban areas, the room will feel small. Our room was well appointed and very comfortable. Even though the hotel was fully booked and our room was next to the elevator bays, we never heard them or any other guest noise. Well done, Lexington staff! Thank you for a lovely stay!

title: Better than advertised
text: I was a bit worried after reading less than glowing reviews, but my one night stay was actually very satisfactory.  The room was fairly spacious, it was clean, quiet and comfortable.  Everything worked, and the staff that I interacted with with very professional.  This being said, I was annoyed by the surprise $35 resort fee at checkout, and the lobby bar closed at 11 pm.

title: Very average place - not really 4 star
text: Rooms are very dated - hotel looks like it needs an update.  There were painters painting over blemishes on the crown molding the entire time I was there, so I think they are seeing the wear and tear. Gym is nice because it is a Crunch fitness. Restaurant is really cool decor but very average food.

title: Worst Marriott I’ve ever stayed in. Avoid.
Phillips is great!
text: Phillips at the desk was phenomenal!!!! He provided kind, professional and friendly customer service. He is a true gem and an asset to the company. He was warm, welcoming and made my stay that much better. Definitely will return!!

title: Needs updating
text:
Small room. Asked for step in shower, apparently no such thing. Changed room 3 times after checkin, but gave up. The accessible rooms have a tub with a lower side, and shower. The larger rooms inexplicably have a queen or double bed, not the king we booked. Our small room had a king, and a non functional safe, that staff could not fix. There is a $35 allowance for bar or breakfast, but when we checked in the desk person said it is not included in our reservation. The next day, someone else assured me it is, and it was. 
On positive side, we asked for fridge and coffee maker, and got those. 
This was by far the worst experience I have had at a Marriott property, which are typically very good and and consistent.

title: Our new go to for NYC girls trip!
text:
We walked in and saw the champagne vending machine.  Our stay started with Donna at the front desk who was engaging, positive and was very helpful.  
For a NYC hotel room, the bathroom was larger than expected and amazing water pressure. Beds were so comfortable after a long day and sometimes night. We had a great experience for our girls trip to NYC and will be booking here again for the next.

title: Not the Same Lexington!
text: We stay at the Lexington twice a year or more if possible, this visit was extremely disappointing.  The fees that are added for "amenities"have not been reduced, but the "amenities" certainly have. The breakfast was horrible, no more eggs, bacon, potatoes, etc, only cold pastry, limited fruit, mushy oatmeal and other non appetizing cold option but not too many more ! No one was around to replenish the milk options , I literally had to go deep into the kitchen to ask for refill and the tables were left uncleared. Our room was not made up even though we opted for daily housekeeping, glasses were left in the hall way for 2 days, the rugs were not vacuumed, there was broken glass on the rug in our corridor. No more water bottles, a machine dispenses cold water in plastic cups to take back to your room.  Laundry not available at all on weekends...Not a good experience!

title: Thank you Marriott creative customer service
text:
My adult kids flew in to NYC and met me at the Lexington Hotel as a birthday celebration. They planned favorite activities the following day and they topped it off with tickets in Central Park for Indigo Girls. I loved the, in the 80’s my kids were so excited to be old enough to give me this treat. And we were so excited to be together. The concert would be over at about 9:30 or 10 pm. 

I’m a platinum member, the staff at check in was so polite and helpful. The staff at the restaurant was wonderful and so professional. 

When we were checking out ( late checkout for Platinum members is 4. How wonderful and convenient is that?) we went to the bell hop to store our bags for a few hours while we went to Central Park for the concert. Well….the bell hop shift after 6 person was not showing up so they would have no one there to retrieve our luggage after the concert. 

My kids were devastated. How could we not go to the concert? That was the big present for their mom. There was no where we could leave our bags.

I went to the front desk, spoke to Nicole and Arlene. They remembered me from check in. I explained the trip purpose and how much my kids did for my birthday. We needed somewhere to store the bags.  They were puzzled, yet said they would come up with a plan and came right back. They allowed us to store our bags in one of our rooms!  I am so grateful to these two experts in hospitality. 

This and so many other reasons, is why I feel wonderful and safe and valued using Marriott. Arlene and Nicole saved the day.

After the concert, we went right to the room, retrieved our bags, and quickly continued on our journey, celebrating the amazing family trip we just started. 
 
CT Marriott user.

title: Rude Staff and Overpriced
text:
We encountered the rudest nighttime front desk staff ever at this hotel. MANUEL was not only unhelpful but downright hostile. He seemed to get pleasure in telling us that we'd "lost" the $35 daily credit. 

The credit is ridiculous because there is hardly anywhere to spend it. No room service. No restaurant or food options. $32 continental breakfast in the bar area is outrageous for croissants and a hard boiled egg. 

Other issues: No coffee maker in the room. No robes (despite advertising on the website). No actual glassware in the room (paper cups only, like a Holiday In. Almost no hotel amenities or services that you would expect at this price point.

This hotel is full of airline staff who are in for a quick turnaround. At $400 USD a night, there are a thousand better hotels to stay at in NYC.

The only good thing about this hotel is the decor and the very friendly housekeeping lady we met.

title: Great location and big rooms!
text: Excellent customer service by Ms. Jenny Capellan and all staff members . She and rest of the staff went above and beyond to make our visit comfortable. Though it was raining they provided umbrellas and complimentary coffee and hot drinks , Than you!

title: Réceptionniste hors pair
text: Nous avons séjourné une semaine dans cet établissement et sommes ravis de notre choix. Idéalement disposé, prestations irréprochables. Sans parler de Philippe de Châteauroux qui nous a été d une grande aide. Encore un grand merci à lui pour son professionnalisme. Philippe.

title: Cockroach in your room is a "norm" here.....
text: This is definitely not an Autograph Collection standard hotel. The rooms and furnishings are outdated, water is NOT available in the rooms- you have to go downstairs to a "water station" if you want a small plastic cup of water (they should just tell you to go buy your own water at the local CVS when you check in), and worst of all, we told front desk that we have a massive cockroach crawling in our room and they just said "Welcome to NYC"... Yeh, never again will we stay here....ever.

title: Avoid this hotel
text: What on earth is going on here? No coffee, no room service, no fridge, tiny bathroom, no water ….. this is not autograph collection standard and should be removed. This is a very very basic NYC hotel for the same price as the intercontinental or the Hilton Times Square. Both are Amazing compared to this level of basic. Staff are nice enough (but since the bar is open for 5 hours a day the only staff you’re going to meet are at reception).

title: Great staff
text: Nicole at the checkin was so nice and helpful! She started off our trip on the right foot, the room itself is small but clean. We are happy to be here! The hotel is located in a great spot with lots of food options around and public transit. Would recommend!

title: Memorial Day Weekend
text: This hotel is centrally located and in a good location.  It’s a nice hotel.  Nicole helped us at the front and was very accommodating.  I had questions about the mandatory “resort” fee and she was very helpful.

title: Youss et Anne Marie
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, propre et joliment décoré.  Le personnel est aux petits soins.  Philippe, un français  tourangeau, à la réception est exceptionnel.  Le bar au top mais un peu trop cher, sinon un régal .
Je n'oublie pas les femmes de ménage,  en particulier Laverna et sa collègue du 21 ème étage qui rendent le séjour encore plus agréable par leur gentillesse,  leur professionnalisme et qui donnent de bons conseils lorsqu'on les sollicite. 
Franchement, nous reviendrons.

title: Excellent front desk agent-Nicole H.
text:
The stay at the Lexington was overall excellent.  We did have a persistent plumbing issue that was ultimately resolved by the most professional front desk agent I have encountered in a long while. Her name is Nicole H. and I cannot speak more highly of her.  Her confident professionalism, empathetic spirit, and the willingness to elevate our experience at The Lexington-resolving an unpleasant plumbing situation into a faded memory.  Immediately placed my husband and I into a different room—with an even better view—- and salvaged our NYC vacation.  Koudos to her!!

I would be remiss if I did not mention just the pleasantries that I received from all of the housekeeping staff on both of the floors on which I stayed. They were all kind, cheerful, and greeted me with a smile and a genuine hello each time we crossed paths.  Typically, that must be a reflection OK good housekeeping manager, who set an outstanding example.

title: Southern hospitality in a northern luxurious kind of way
text: Decided to book a trip from North Carolina to New York for the upcoming AIDS run being held in Central Park. Upon arrival I was taken Aback by the level of hospitality met with opulent conversation. The elite Guest service representative Nicole,met me with charm, compassion and anticipated my needs. The best part was the level of her concierge service personal Champaign that came along with a rob and slippers. It’s these added perks that bring together the luxury and opulent coordination of feeling personable . The check in experience was really congenial Phillip added a fresh taste of energy that I needed to really get me relaxed. His attention to detail explaining the amenities and hours of the bar was beyond appreciated. I’ve stayed here in the past and recall being introduced to the Marilyn Monroe drink. The hotel is in my opinion a secret gem especially for content creators who aspire to bask In old Hollywood charm. Oh and yes the iconic Miss Monroe did grace these hallways . I was further met with Jenny who is quiet but passionate regarding hospitality with these three people the expectations where all met accordingly and humbly. It’s nice to be welcomed the way that I was and if came from the heart. I have well over 20k followers via TikTok and look forward to reviewing this location see me at orlandojacobs676. But hands down the close proximity to Central Park Saks fifth avenue and my all time favorite Tiffany and co is an added treat. Nicole thanks for the recommendation regarding high tea. Your definitely an lux Ambassodor in my opinion

title: Location is the only good thing here
text: A very disappointing stay, staff here don’t seem to care gathering from the reviews and our own experience. The staff antagonise or ignore guests, check in is a pure transaction done in a robotic way. Most of people appeared to stay for a night with many air crew checking in / out all the time. The level of cleanliness in our room had a lot to be desired, belongings from previous guest were left behind, used toiletries, hairs and fluff everywhere. Strong air freshener is used in common areas to disguise the smell of old carpets. The extra charges for things left a sour taste. For the price and brand you expect much better quality, location is the only good thing here.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
We stayed for 5 nights , beautiful hotel very welcoming receptionists. 
Lovely Jazz music 🎷 playing and portraits of Marilyn Monroe

Room was very clean and bed super comfortable.
Breakfast was very good , plentiful. 
Starbucks on side entrance. 
Main entrance very grand.
Close to Grand Central Station. 
Fabulous hotel away from the central bustle of the city.

title: Won't return
text:
Pros: 
* Good midtown location, two blocks from Grand Central subway station.
* Elegant hotel. 
* Good rooms, except for one problem. 
* Quick efficient check-in.

Cons (in ascending order):
* None of the receptionists smile (unlike house cleaning staff). 
* No wherewithal for making in-room hot drinks. 
* No mini-fridge. Found out only by coincidence that one can be requested. 
* Breakfast: no version of warm eggs (only cold boiled); no vegetables; no hot chocolate; no variation in what's offered, during 6 days. 
* Windows not noise proofed. I asked ahead for a quiet room. Was assigned one facing away from street traffic, but there was loud engine/ventilator permanent noise at the 18th floor, to which the window made no change. 
* When calling Guest Services, you get a "we are busy, please leave a message". NEVER happened to me at a hotel. The don't call back.

title: Would stay again and again!
text: It was my first time staying here and I had a wonderful experience! Shoutout to Manual who made checkin super breezy and Nicole at checkout who was incredibly kind and helpful. This hotel is full of life and personality. Stay here if you want a jazzy experience!!! A fun fact: Marilyn Monroe resided here for a year while she was married to Joe DiMaggio!

title: worth the stay!
text: Had a great stay, room was cleaned and air conditioned! We were credited for breakfast and drinks, got passes to use the Crunch Fitness Gym & There’s also a Starbucks & Bar located inside the Hotel, which was very convenient. Nicole at the front desk was very helpful from when we first entered the building up until we left and made sure we had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. Will be back again!

title: Would not stay again
text: I did not enjoy this hotel. I will say the location was good for the business I needed to do. However the room was small and so dark! I expect small in New York but this was seriously small. No fridge or coffee maker. Hardly any shelf space in the bathroom. The shower drain was not working properly - standing water while I showered. The phone on the room didn’t work: not that I needed it but would be nice to function, especially since the front desk said they tried to call me and couldn’t get through. Would have expected them to fix it. No food couriers allowed on the building at all.

title: Grateful for you kindness.
text: From the entry in to the hotel you know you are in for a treat, but it's the amazing service that sealed the deal for me. I was concerned bc I needed some special services for my family. I was greeted by Nicole who graciously took care of me and my family needs. I appreciated that. Thank you to the management, Arlene and the rest of the staff at Lexington hotel, NYC.

title: Great Hotel & Amazing Staff
text: I had an amazing experience with the front desk upon arrival. I worked with Nicole and Arlene to get a room and they were able to accommodate my family & I, who are visiting for the weekend. The cleaning staff greeted us as well as we got to our room. The hotel itself is beautiful & modern. We are frequent travelers but I must say the staff (Nicole, Arlene & the housekeeper) have made the experience one of the best visits to NYC. My fiancé also loved the Moët vending machine in the lobby lol. Nice touch.

title: Nicole and Jarinel front desk rock!
text:
Today on 5/13 , I was feeling homesick as mothers day weekend. Niocle and Jarinel at the front desk were so very kind to me and talked to me like they have known me for ever!
I used to live in nyc and have  never been treated nicer than these 2 women in a marriott.... The best day ever... thank you both!!!

title: Great Customer Service
text: This Hotel is Great.  The customer service here is Fabulous.  Jenny C from the front desk assisted me with a room switch.  She was very professional and catered to all my needs. Thanks Jenny G.  I would defiantly stay here again.

title: If you are a business traveler, please do yourself a favor and do NOT stay here.
text: As a loyal Marriott Bonvoy member, never have I had such a poor experience. First, they provided me an occupied hotel room upon checking in which was a scarring experience to say the least. My room was extremely dirty and not up to par for a $600+ one night stay. Additionally, after requesting an hour late check-out the next morning (and that being granted), the housekeeping interrupted me and attempted to barge into my room 3 times while I was on business calls. Finally, I have reached out to the hotel several times and have had to engage Marriott corporate twice just to receive my receipt which they are having trouble locating. Business travelers, beware!!

title: I love the vibe here - Service could be better, but I'd definitely come back
text:
I had the unusual experience of staying next door during the week at the Residence Inn for business. At the end of the week, I checked out and walked next door to start my weekend fun with my wife. We checked into the Lexington. What a stark difference between the two.

The Lexington is full of history and vibe. They have a wall full of key moments that happened here. The decor gives off this fun Blues and Art Deco feel. Musical notes make up a mural wall. The mid-lobby area has an open ceiling to the second floor where there is a ringed seating area with crushed velvet seats. The bar is fun and adds to the whole experience.

Service fell short for me, but not enough to give the place five stars. Major shout out to the cleaning team. The rooms were spotless and my most favorite of all is they practiced the 5x5 bubble. Anytime you got near them, they stopped, smiled, and said hello and how was your stay. I love that! Cleaning is so hard. Stopping the tough work to put on a smile is no small task. Thank you! The front desk, bellman and concierge could all take a lesson from the clean team.

The rooms are New York tiny. The bathroom is especially small. Two people cannot fit in there at once.

Please get rid of the $5.00 storage charge per bag. Your competitor next door does it for free.

title: Excellent option in mid town Manhattan
text:
This is an excellent option. The staff of the hotel is really friendly and the room is good size and very clean. Very comfortable bed, pillow and towells. The location is excellent, easy access to the subway line that goes to JFK airport. The only thing I missed was a mini-fridge in the room.
I'll be eternally grateful for the early check in late check out

title: Great hotel with friendly staff
text:
Beautiful hotel with really friendly staff. Nicole checked me in and was extremely helpful and professional. She set the tone for the whole stay - which ended up being a great one! 

The room was clean, the bar had great service, and the hotel itself was centrally located.

title: Good location, recommend
text: Great central location so good as a tourist and near subway station and eateries/bars. Friendly staff. If you aren’t a seasoned traveler as we are you’ll be shocked at how small the rooms are but this is typical of cities like New York, London and Paris. Comfortable bed, reasonably quiet for location. Historic hotel so appreciated the references to the history throughout the hotel. Nice touch having free little chocolates at front desk. Only complaint would be they charge to store luggage ($3 US) a bag which I’ve never experienced before especially at a Marriott. Was really annoying as also they’d only take cash so we had to go especially to an ATM to get.

title: Good place to stay in mid-town
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights during a recent visit to NY and had no problems at all.

Our check-in was quick and efficient and our room was ready for us when we arrived. The room itself was pretty compact (but still comfortable) but had all of the amenities that you would need or expect. It was clean, comfortable, cosy and clean. The bathroom was very small and could do with some TLC....but still fully functional.

The hotel is in a good location, 3 blocks walk to the nearest subway station. Its walking distance to the Top of the Rock and the Empire State assuming you don't mind a bit of a walk....but it is NY. We found plenty of good restaurants to eat close-by for breakfast & dinner so we didn't eat in the hotel.

It's not the best hotel that we ever stayed in...but not the worst either and we had no issues throughout our stay. I was surprised to be charged $3 per case when we left them with the bellboy....but maybe that's standard in NY? Though I've never seen that before. 

Would definitely stay here again

title: Fraudulent Charge, No Response
text:
I encourage everyone to stay far away from this hotel.  I wasn't impressed to begin with during my stay.  The location isn't wonderful, the staff wasn't particularly hospitable or responsive.  The room had several issues (a lamp that wouldn't work, a broken phone, a TV in which only three channels came in with a clear picture), and there was only one water station down at the front desk.  Definitely not worth the price tag.  However, the real trouble started once I checked out.

Upon checking in, we were told breakfast was included in the $35/night destination fee.  Cool beans.  After checking out, I was charged over $70 more than I should have been.  I couldn't pull my hotel bill from the website or app, so I contacted the Lexington accounting department.  They sent me my bill, which included a bar charge.  We were only in the bar for breakfast, which, as I said, was included in the destination fee.  I emailed the department back, letting them know the charge was erroneous, and they did not respond. I emailed several more times. No response.  I'm going to end up having to fight this via my credit card company.  Not up to Marriott standards--heck, not even up to Super 8 standards. Ultimately, it's a mediocre hotel that does not value customer satisfaction and actively works against you once you're gone.

title: Stay Away! Not Marriott standards
text: Not the typical Marriott service you expect! Not one person smile or greeted you! Staff don’t recognize Marriott elite members! $3 cost to hold each bag at the bell stand! I wouldn’t say typical NY attitude because I’m from NY & stayed at other Marriott properties in NY and received better service! Marriott elite members stay away! Rooms are tiny! Staff is rude!

title: Great experience!
text:
Personal experience - great! We got fresh newly remodeled room with an excellent view #503. 
Staff was courteous and attentive. 
The only not very important thing was strange TV channels. I didn’t care I was vacationing. 
The hotel is super close to the beach, cvs, latin cafe and plenty other walkable places.

title: MAXX Factor Quartet loves Nicole and The Lexington Hotel!
text: Girlfriend trip! What an amazing stay...a special thank you to Nicole H! Talk about excellent customer service! She made our stay so wonderful. The entire hotel staff was excellent and our room was perfect! We will be back!

title: Wonderful stay!
text: I had the most amazing stay at this hotel!!  It is such an oasis from the hectic noise and activity of midtown. The room was well sized, super classy, and offered a lovely view of the surrounding area. I loved that there was a moet split vending machine in the lobby! Everyone was extremely helpful and kind and the bar has some of the best drinks I’ve had in Manhattan. The whole experience was wonderful!

title: Dream team A+
text: Nicole, Arlene and Kelvin are the dream team.  Customer service at its finest.  They ensured I had an amazing room, easily extended my stay without having to change rooms and did it with a smile.  They are welcoming and made me feel at home!  I’ve stayed at a lot of hotels in NY - will only come back to NY Lexington!!!

title: Great!!!!
text: Amazing!!  From the minute we checked in the staff was friendly, accommodating and extremely attentive. Nicole Hudson made sure every detail of our stay was covered.  The hotel was very comfortable, clean and we will definitely be staying again!

title: Nice hotel, great customer service by Nicole at the front desk!
text: I arrived in NYC on business after making a reservation at the Residence Inn on 48th. Upon arrival, I found out my room had been given away and the hotel was sold out. Thankfully, Nicole at the Lexington Hotel (Autograph Marriott) right next door helped me book a reservation with them, and even checked me in immediately even though it was early in the afternoon. Night and day experience when comparing both hotels. As for the hotel itself, no complaints. Rooms are a decent size for NYC, and the hotel appears pretty up to date. That said, main reason for the 5 stars is the last minute flexibility, and customer service at the front desk.

title: Nicole Hudson is THE best
text: When arriving and checking into our rooms they were not connecting, not even on the same floor.  Nicole Hudson immediately took charge and made our day!!  Thank you, Nicole, for EVERYTHING you did for us!!!  We’re going to remember this trip for some time!

title: Corner unit bathroom size? You must be joking.
text: NYC's most expensive bathroom per square inch. Literally impossible to brush your teeth without dropping something into the toilet. I've stayed at enough Marriott properties in NYC to know not to expect anything extra, but as a top tier status member I could have at least been notified at check in about the doll house sized bathrooms in corner units when I checked in. title: Another Great Stay!
text:
It had been a while since I stayed here, but I booked this hotel because past stays were always great. When I arrived to check-in there was a short line, but lucky for me I'm a lifetime Marriott Titanium Elite member, so I went straight to the Elite desk, where I was thrilled to see a familiar face, Nora!

I'd not seen her in at least two years, but moments into our conversation she remembered me--which was nice. I told her I was in Manhattan to visit friends and family, and to celebrate two birthdays--mine, and my mother's. Nora wished me a happy birthday, and informed me she'd upgraded me to a larger room. To sweeten the deal, she gave me a few vouchers so we could enjoy a few birthday cocktails in the hotel bar.  I thanked her and headed up to the room--which turned out to be a one-bedroom suite!

A bit later there was a knock at the door, which turned out to be a hotel team member delivering a nicely-chilled bottle of Prosecco and some delicious chocolates and fruit. Wow!

There are countless Marriott properties in Manhattan, but this one is special. Nora makes it special. Thanks Nora, for making my stay awesome!

title: Séjour à New York

Mobile order to start the day and our coffee was waiting for us.  Same experience I had when I visited in October.  They seem to not be impacted by worker shortage.

title: it was alright

title: New York, New York!
text: Such a great hotel and location. Staff was great especially Nicole H! She made my mom feel so special on her 60th birthday! The rooms are hit or miss for size, some are spacious others aren’t.  Always very clean and beautiful though!

title: Great Staff, Location, and Space
text: The Lexington Hotel makes me feel like Eloise at The Plaza. The staff is welcoming and SO helpful. Lisset knows my name, she knows the room I like, and goes that extra mile to make NYC feel a little less hectic. Jenny is always on the lookout for me and handles anything I need with a smile. Virgina, Nicole, Donna are also always on the case no matter what it is. The rooms are larger because the building is an older historic property. Newer hotels may be "cooler" or "chicer" but a hotel in a great location with bigger rooms and quick access to Grand Central and all other midtown sites makes travel to NYC easier. I always choose the Lexington and will return again and again.

title: Rooms need to be gutted, too expensive for quality
text: This was easily top 3 most uncomfortable hotel stays I've had in my life, and I travel a lot for business and pleasure. The staff was wonderful, but the condition of the hotel room specifically was atrocious for the price. I paid $2,300 and had a leaking toilet and leaking shower that left the tiled bathroom floor sopping wet after every shower. Several towels and the shower curtain were dirty, but I guess it didn't matter because I needed those towels to sop up the floor after every shower. I know this is the fault of the laundry service and certainly not hotel housekeeping (they were excellent). The wallpaper was peeling and it looks like they painted the ceiling and re-grouted around the bathroom, but paint dripped on everything...all over the floor, wallpaper, even the toilet. The grout was crumbling all over the floor. Since there was so much standing water and really old carpet, the room smelled like dirty socks or the inside of a hockey bag after every shower (mostly the carpet area at the front entrance closest to the bathroom). The back of the room near the bed and radiator smelled like urine. The carpet needs to be ripped out, it was truly disgusting. The toilet had an auto flusher installed at one point (why on earth would you add this to a hotel toilet) but it had since been disabled, so you had to override it to flush each time. I don't know if all rooms are in this condition, but I do not recommend staying here for the price. Positive feedback - comfy bed and pillows, big bathroom, lots of clothes hangers, and a large desk. Location is fantastic. This hotel has potential to be wonderful, but they need to gut these rooms and do a proper renovation.

title: Find another place to stay
text: This visit was beyond disappointing.  Great location but terrible service we had no towels at check-in and we called down several times to inquire with no answer.  The room heater was noisy and did not work right.  The breakfast buffet was terrible, food was way over cooked and lastly the remodel they did falls way short.  Just a tremendous disappointment.

title: How I spent my Sunday Evening.
text: I booked this room for a charity auction winner for a weekend in NYC.  I prepaid via my Marriott account and Bonvoy Credit Card.  For some reason when the guest arrived Marriott had not run my card for the pre-paid amount.  The hotel told the auction winner they would need to pay for the room.  I immediately contacted the Lexington.  There was no explanation for why the room was not pre-paid through my Marriott account.  The first gentleman I dealt with was rude and told me it was my fault.  I asked how I could get the room paid for.  I was told I would need to fill out a credit card authorization form.  I asked how long that process would take.  He stated" It depends on how long it takes you to get it back to us."  I sent it back in five minutes.  It took over four hours and six phone calls to get this taken care of.  I was told three times that the manager on duty (Wesley) would get back to me.  That never happened.  I had to keep calling to get it done.  It's an embarrassment to me since this was suppose to be a pre-paid hotel room for the charity auction winner and should have been a non-event.  Instead, Marriott's system failed.

text:

title: Great hotel & location, Amazing Staff!
text:
We recently stayed at the Lexington for the first time for a weekend getway, and it was great.  Rooms are spacious and clean and the location is amazing, but the staff is what send this into the stratosphere, and here's why.  

After checking out on a busy Sunday, we got to the garage two blocks away and I discovered that I lost my phone.  I raced back to the bell desk, where we had just picked up our bags, hoping I had left it there, though sadly I hadn't, which meant it fell out of my pocket it in a cab.  Ralph L., the Bellman, stayed completely calm, took my number, and started calling my phone,  He also took my wife's #, and we went to sit in the lobby and solve other lost-phone related problems.   

Twenty or so minutes later, Ralph came by with his phone and the cabby on the line - he had found my phone!  When the equally amazing cabbie returned it, I checked my phone and saw that Ralph had called 22 times, until the cabbie finally figured it out and picked up.  Weekend was saved thanks to this amazing employee who went way above and beyond, that's what you'll get at the Lexington.

title: Le must pour un séjour réussi ! 🍎
