Le personnel de l’établissement est exceptionnel en particulier Philippe qui nous a vraiment réservé un accueil chaleureux et des conseils personnalisés, un grand merci à lui ! title: Always a few bad apples….
text:
I do not expect luxury, I do not hope for luxury. I do hope for kind and respectful,
interactions between people in the service industry and myself. Most of people work very hard to provide a positive experience; some don’t work as hard (whatever that’s their business and problem.)
But unfortunately, there are always a few bad apples in the barrel. To the young man working in the hotel store On 2-17 in the evening, young man, your comments and attitude towards me about a female razor for my wife were extremely personal and impolite. I was shocked you would speak to anyone like that!!! when I retorted with my wife cares, she has sensitive skin and you gave me a “whatever “….holy cow…young man , have some class and act accordingly. Your attitude is not appropriate for this kind of work. Use this as a learning experience!
To the young woman, with the wonderfully curly and dark hair at the front desk on 2-18 at 6 AM, Miss, I apologize that you took my disappointment that the gym was closed so Personally, it was no way directed at you. However, I found your comment that was made under your breath in English of “go for a run”, extremely rude and offensive. I also found your comments made in Spanish to be tasteless and tacky. Shame, shame on you for using that language at the front desk with the possibility of someone being near; shame on you!!! If our roles were reversed, I know your attitude towards me would have been far worse than mine. Use this as a learning experience!
If I were you two, I would admit nothing, deny everything, and make counter accusations. You have jobs, reputations, and I assume personal responsibilities that are important and vital for you to meet.
I have found at this hotel that the hardest working people are the most kind. The housekeeping staff ( and assuming the
engineering/maintenance. ) does a very impressive job at keeping this hotel and the rooms beautiful , clean, well stocked, and hopefully up to most guests standards; they certainly meet mine.
You will not find this email associated with any reservation as the reservation was made under my friends name.

title: FANTASTIC GEM - "THE LEXINGTON HOTEL"  in NYC
text:
We recently stayed at the Lexington Hotel, Autograph Hotel (Marriot/Bonvoy) for a long NYC getaway. The Hotel was fantastic and we highly recommend it for both a weekend visit and for weekday Business trips.
   Great location in Midtown, only a couple of blocks from the best shopping in the world on 5th and Madison Avenues. Broadway Theatre is only nice walk across town or a short Cab ride away.
   The Room was extremely comfortable, clean, quiet and well-appointed. The water pressure in the shower was A+. The mattress and bedding were also extremely comfortable...slept like a baby!
   There are so many great Restaurants within walking distance. One night we ate at Smith and Wollensky- it is right around the corner and was superb. The extensive Breakfast/Brunch Buffet in the Hotel Lobby Restaurant/Bar- "The Stayton Room" was delicious and reasonably priced with everything you could possibly want- including eggs, bagels, breakfast meats, Danish, Muffins, Oatmeal and fresh fruit, etc., etc. etc. And the coffee was the best! There is also a Starbucks right of the large Lobby.
   All the personnel were very helpful and friendly including the Front Desk, doormen and housekeeping. They all made us feel welcome and truly cared to make our stay as pleasant and memorable as possible. 
   Several of the Staff members told us the relatively new Hotel Manager- Brian Fahey has a lot to do with how well the Hotel is now run because he pays attention to every detail....it definitely shows!!
   I have stayed at many fine Hotels in NYC over the years and the Lexington Hotel stands out as one of the best- comfortable, clean, reasonably priced, and quiet with a very WELCOMING STAFF in a great Midtown location.....close to everything and anything you might want to do.
   We have already booked our next stay at the Lexington Hotel....can't wait to return!!

title: Warm and Welcoming
text: Our stay at the Lexington Autograph was absolutely wonderful because of the kindness and attentiveness we received from Maalik Lewis.  Maalik was an absolute gem.  He was so accommodating and friendly.  He certainly made these southern girls feel welcomed and made our stay in NYC that much more enjoyable.

title: Girls trip!
text: Our girls trip to NYC from North Carolina could not have been any better because of the wonderful service provided to us by Maalik at the Lexington. He went above and beyond to make sure we had an amazing time!

title: Maalik with the hotel bar/ guest services is the best!!!
text: Maalik with the bar and guest services was absolutely phenomenal! So welcoming and friendly. He really made our trip and stay at the Lexington a fun and personal experience. It felt like the hometown bar away from home in a big city. Thankful for his hospitality and kindness.

title: Disappointed at the last hurdle!
text:
My partner and I travelled to NY to celebrate New Years and checked in for a week at the Lexington, initially we did find the check in slightly confusing and ‘scam like’ we were already aware of the destination fee they charge. But on questioning the guy at check in, it was very poorly explained and he then said its actually not necessary and we wouldn’t have to pay it, but on check out a different lady told us we would have to pay it and it is not an optional. We fought back and wasted a good 20 minutes of our last day in the city and explained we were told we were already told we wouldn’t have to pay it. She eventually ‘spoke with her manager’ and took the payment off. It really felt like we were being taken for idiots and you were trying to make as much money out of us. Every interaction we had with the guys at the check in desk we were left incredibly confused and irritated. It kind of felt like we as the customers were a ‘hassle’ and they had better things to do.

Furthermore, at checkout we wanted to leave our bags until the evening. As we went and spoke to the ‘bag guy’, we were surprised to here it would cost 3 dollars per bag, now if you had as much luggage as us that’s an extra 15 dollars on LEAVING A SUITCASE in a hotel we just spent a considerable amount with. I have never experienced this in all the years I have travelled and would never expect to be scammed in the states. I use the word scam as the VERY unprofessional guy who took our bags told us we could only pay in cash! We had to spend an extra 5 dollars getting cash out, utterly ridiculous. The issue is not the money, its the unprofessionalism and the fact you are treated like an idiot as soon as you check out. It left us with a very sour taste in our mouth and that was enough to say I will never recommend this hotel to anyone, or quite frankly visit again.

It seemed a real shame to have ended what was a great stay in this way, we actually thoroughly enjoyed the hotel room and thought it was a great size for a NY hotel and the location was utterly brilliant. I feel frustrated our great trip had to end this way but if I can offer my advice, go somewhere else! The room was pretty clean but I wouldn’t use the word ‘thoroughly’, the carpet by the door was torn and the wallpaper in the hallway was peeling but I will add this was rectified.  A tip for travellers checking in to the Lexington, don’t go to the hotel bar there a cheaper drinks to be had on rooftop bars with views of the NY skyline. It really wasn’t worth the 30 bucks plus tip we payed for two beers!

title: NICE TO BE BACK
text:
We were frequent guests at The Lexington until Covid upturned everyone's lives. We are so happy that it reopened, especially since several New York City hotels closed permanently. I've already touched on all the advantages and wonderful experiences we had here in prior reviews, e.g. friendly staff, large guestrooms, location, etc. but I would like to single out PHILIPPE at the Front Desk who, once again, was super friendly and was instrumental in getting us into one of our preferred guestrooms.
We live in Connecticut and have been coming to The Lexington since 2015. HAPPILY NEVER DISAPPOINTED!!!

Charles and Jessica
12/31/22

title: Welcome to NYC
text:
Hotel consigliato dalla nostra agenzia di viaggi di fiducia per la posizione strategica: in pochi minuti si è sulla 5th Avenue e a Times Square.
Siamo arrivati la sera di Natale nel gelo Newyorkese e nonostante la tarda ora siamo stati accolti molto gentilmente sia dal taximan che alla reception (peccato solo che il bar chiudesse alle 23, speravamo di prendere qualcosa visto che nei dintorni era tutto chiuso essendo Natale, ma non ci è andata bene).
La hall dell'hotel è curatissima ed è possibile accedere ad uno starbucks direttamente dall'hotel.
La camera era all'altezza degli standard e delle nostre aspettative, forse un po' povero il kit di cortesia (che, in realtà, prevedeva il nulla: con nostro stupore non era presente nemmeno il bagno schiuma  ma solo delle saponette, per fortuna invece era presente l'asciuga capelli visto che per errore ne avevamo portato uno non compatibile con la 110v).
Un po' alto a mio parere il deposito cauzionale di quasi 1000$ per una prenotazione prepagata, della quale poi vengono trattenute solo le resort fee.
Molto comodo il distributore di acqua potabile nella hall.
Forse sarebbe comodo avere, oltre al distributore di champagne, anche un distributore di bevande in bottiglia/lattina che permetta almeno di tamponare alla chiusura del bar.
Anche se non soddisfatti al 100%, la posizione vince sul resto: consigliato!

title: Barely  a "3",  the hotel wasn't bad, it wasn't good
text: We have stayed at a lot of Marriott properties and this one was not up to par.  We know rooms are small in NYC however for $600 per night this was one of the smallest rooms we stayed in.   You could not fit two people in the bathroom unless one was in the shower.   The hotel did have a nice lobby bar and was close to all the things we were going to see.  I should also mention the mattress was sooooo soft; it had no firmness.    If I had my my reservation earlier I would have stayed at the Marriott Marquis which has much larger rooms (so does the Park Lane, Palace, etc.)

title: Stand out service.  We are going back.  Already reserved
text: 5 stars:  Kelvin Rodriguez  and Randy Cabral were incredible standouts at the Lexington hotel in New York. These are the two individuals that have us going back again this month.  Management makes such a big difference and these two people are absolute stars. We enjoyed the hotel very much. We love the atmosphere, as well as the amazing bar downstairs. It has a wonderful history and has been newly redone. They really captured the terrific environment to make it Such a pleasure place for us to stay. We would highly recommend it and that is why we are returning.  Pat from RI"

title: Disappointed with service at checkout. Please send me my folio already.
text:
I stayed at the Lexington for a few days on business shortly after Thanksgiving.  I would have said that I had a nice experience except for the fact that I cannot for the life of me get them to give me a copy of my folio.  I asked for it to be emailed to me when I checked out at the front desk.  I then called the hotel a few days later to request it be emailed to me. A few days later I submitted the form online at marriot.com to request my bill.  I got a response saying it would be emailed to me within 3-5 business days....which is kind of a long time but whatever...I just needed my bill.  Now that it has been longer than 5 business days and still no copy of my bill, I have emailed and called the hotel yet again to no avail.  As of writing this review I am still waiting on a copy of my folio.  

I am leaving this poor review solely for 2 reasons: 
1. A warning to others who may need to expense their stay at the Lexington and 
2. A last ditch hope that maybe the hotel will notice my negative review and pretty please just email a copy of my folio.  Thank you.

title: Business hotel in New York city
text:
The rooms are clean, not very spacious but functional. The staff at the reception desk is not really welcoming but polite. The breakfast is good and the staff there is really lovely and helpful. 
The gym is great, which is definitely a plus. The valet service is correct.
The hotel is very well located, close to the business and shopping areas.

title: Not Bad But Needs Improvement
text: Nice but old hotel with small bathrooms and small guest rooms.  Conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan.  Understaffed and overwhelmed by the tourist crowds these days.  Operator didn’t answer calls from our room half the time.  Breakfast was mediocre and uninspiring.  Management tried hard to make things better when we had complaints.  It’s still apparently hurting from pandemic issues (such as  short staffed). We requested a microwave and refrigerator which was left on our floor as there was no where to put it. Unattractive but at least useful.

title: Excellent upscale hotel that delivers superior client service.Hospitality at it's finest.
text:
This hotel continues to upgrade it's amenities. front desk is extremely professional and friendly. as a regular repeat life time platinum elite  member the welcome I receive is awesome. for a NYC hotel it is Beyound exceptional.  excellent management  , bell staff, doorman, housekeeping. decent to good breakfast buffet with variety 
highly recommend this hotel. Thank you to all who delivers such great personalized service

title: Midterm Gem
text: I stayed over the Thanksgiving holiday from Nov. 23 to the 25th. I have stayed here multiple times over the past three years or so and it is always a very enjoyable stay. This is a historic hotel and is centrally located in Midtown at 48th and Lex. I highly recommend it especially if you are not familiar with other parts of the city. My one criticism would be that even if you are Marriott rewards member you don't really get any benefits staying here. (Not the hotel's fault or the staff it's purely a Marriott issue it seems.)

title: 5 Stars for The Lexington Hotel
text: I cannot speak higher of The Lexington Hotel and it’s staff, I planned a proposal at the hotel last night and it could not have gone better. The gentleman at the door as I arrived, I did not get his name, he was so helpful and attentive, I was able to unload quite a few decorations, check in and get into my room easily. The staff was so kind to upgrade me to the most beautiful suite it was amazing! Simon checked me in and he was fantastic, very helpful and accommodating, excellent service. I want to thank you all so much for making this a wonderful experience for my now fiancé and I.

title: JUST DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! Unsafe, Dire need of renovation!
text:
BONVOY MARRIOTT TITANIUM MEMBERS, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!
Lacks security as anyone can walk into the hotel through the couple of entrances and go right to the unguarded elevators. It doesn’t feel safe in this hotel. 
After numerous stays at this hotel I’m convinced YOU, nor I should ever stay here again!
Joe DiMaggio divorced Marilyn Monroe after living at this hotel and I understand why now. Tiny unsafe rooms, ZERO amenities! No restaurant! Indifferent staff sleepwalking through the day. We first stayed here after our son moved to the area just before the pandemic. Everything here is rundown and in dire need of renovation. All the furniture is chipped, damaged in some way, Bathrooms with mold in the shower and chipped and worn sinks, tubs/showers and even chipped and dented toilet seats! JUST GROSS!
We reserved a special room for our stay and of course again they gave it away. So we come up for Thanksgiving and everything in the area is booked and my 8’x10’ room feels like a prison cell. What was to be happy week seeing family and friends has turned to a disappointment. Management couldn’t care less as they clearly have contracts with airlines evidenced by the 20 or so airline personal checking in as we waited an hour in the lobby to find accommodations for us which are just not up to par!
It’s time for the hotel to take a hard look and sell to some organization willing to come in here and do the much needed work! THE RESIDENCE INN DOWN THE STREET IS RENOVATED AND HAS A WELL TRAINED STAFF AND YOU HAVE A KITCHENETTE! 
Here you will get grief!

title: Quick trip to NY
text:
The cons: Tiny room, no amenities at all in the room, tiny bathroom, shower didn’t work properly leaving most of the water flowing from the tub faucet to directly and painfully hit your feet while you showered. Thin, inexpensive towels, wimpy pillows that completely flattened out when sleeping. The worst was having to bend over the toilet to press and hold the flush button since the hotel had disengaged the auto-flush function in all their bathrooms. Really awkward!

The pros: clean hotel, friendly staff, free cocktail cards handed out in the long check-in line to compensate for the long wait. Took advantage of that after checking in and the drinks were great!  Comfortable bed, pretty quiet room considering it was NYC, housekeeping refreshed all the towels after only one day, location was convenient, breakfast was included and for a buffet style breakfast the offerings were pretty decent. Great coffee!

title: Awful - especially given the price and destination fee
text: I stay in a lot of Marriott properties. I would have preferred a Courtyard or Fairfield Inn to this. I have no problem with the room size - that's New York. But let's see. 1) It appeared that there was no hot water in the shower. When I turned it off, I realized that if you turn the shower past off you get hot water. But you can't mix it with cold. 2) the toilet. The hotel disabled the auto flush. Ok, but I had to press the flush button multiple times each time I used the toilet. 3) No coffee maker in the room. Yeah, I know that's the usual in places like the Ritz Carlton, but what the heck? Also, not obvious that there was coffee in the lobby. 4) It took 20 minutes to connect to the WiFi. 5) A destination fee? Seriously? It's not like there's a pool and a beach. And it took me 20 minutes to connect to the WiFi.

title: One of a Kind!
text: This is NYC best hidden secret for hotels. The staff is amazing! Phillippe, Juan, Jose, Louis, Louie and Kevin are all gems and offer world class customer service. Phillippe will always greet you with a smile. The service doesn't stop in the lobby. Make sure you stop by the bar and have one of the wonderful drinks. All around the best hotel!

title: Autograph Collection??  Room was worse than Courtyard properties in NYC.
text:
Staff was very friendly and a high energy lobby - however ... 
1.Smallest room I have ever stayed in while in NYC.    
2. Had to bend over the toilet and hold the flush button - kind of gross to lean over a toilet b/c they disconnected the auto-flush b/c the bathroom was so small. 
3. Towels were old and scratchy and they only had 2 when we first arrived in the room (no hand towels)
4. Odd noise in the hallway at random times - was coming from the fire alarm box but sounded like high pressure water running creating a high pitched whine.

title: Dont stay here ever. Zero star hotel. Shame on Marriott.
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights not a worth; when you enter there is a bell desk but they won’t bother to assist you with the bags me and my wife dragged our 4 bags by ourselves:

On arrival to room no water bottles just few disposal glasses in the room zero amenities.

I request  shampoos, dental kit and bathroom sleepers and soap via bonvoy app chat received a reply thats someone is on the way guess what no one came ever next morning I myself found a housekeeping lady on floor and ask her for the stuff not expected in marriott hotel. 

Got cleaning once in three nights and when i return to room all the garbage was left in room and housekeeping never took it they just made the bed and thats it, seriously Didn’t expected that from Marriott paying 350$+ for night not worth it at all. 

Would not recommend to anyone and won’t stay in marriott again.

title: Perfect spot for a NYC birthday trip
text: From start to finish everyone we encountered at the Lexington was fantastic and we couldn’t have had a better experience. We had two rooms which we asked to have on the same floor before arriving, not only the same floor but they put us right next door, great start. Celebrating a 40th birthday we splurged on the Hemingway Suite which was the best room we’ve ever stayed in!! Two balconies, in NYC!!!  We wanted to have space for all 5 of us to gather and relax together and it more than delivered that. The second room was an executive king which also had a balcony and plenty of space for 5 to relax for a drink together. Our whole group which ranged in age from 11 to 69 loved the rooms, the property, location and staff. Such a cool lobby space and great vibe at the Lexington, we can’t wait to go back.

title: Fantastic Experience
text:
From start to finish we had an excellent experience at the Lexington Hotel. We arrived at 2:30m  on the Thursday of New York Marathon weekend which meant the hotel was very busy. We were thrilled to learn that our room was not only ready but that we had been upgraded to a room on an "EliteMember" floor even though we had booked through Hotwire! The room was spacious, stylish, and had two bathrooms (because it was clearly two singles that had been merged into one) - fantastic!

The staff were all friendly, the hotel had a cool vibe with entertainment in the lobby and a very nice bar area - drinks were no more expensive than what I would expect in an NYC hotel and the charcuterie board and Margherita pizza were very tasty!

Conveniently, there was a Starbucks attached to the hotel  - and I will also say that this store had some of the cheeriest and most pleasant baristas I have ever encountered!

Although there as some street noise, earplugs were provided and it is NYC after all !! The location is fantastic as well as we were able to walk to 5th Avenue to shop and also walked to MOMA and Central Park very easily.

I would not hesitate to return to this gem of a hotel!

title: Top of the line Customer service!
text: I stayed there last Saturday & was greeted by Nichol at the front desk. She is a natural. Not only was she welcoming; she went above & beyond our expectations.  Giving us recommendations on where we should visit, shop & eat. Her spirit was nurturing & caring. I worked in Hospitality for 20 years & have traveled all over & she was by far the most friendliest & attentive Guest Service Representative ever. What a great asset to your establishment.  We definitely will be back next year.

title: One night in the Hawaiian Room
text: I have stayed here a few times as it is close to my office in New York, has always been fine, rooms and amenities are good for New York and price is relatively good for the area.  This last trip was really excellent though, only stayed one night but they gave me a status upgrade to a suite that I didn't know they had - the Hawaiian Room.  Really nice suite with a full outdoor patio on the 23rd floor, great views, nice space, and the room decor is really great.  Nicole at the desk and Khaleel managing were great, really appreciated the high touch.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Was a convenient location in midtown to explore NYC, rooms were a decent size for a city hotel, and Nicole at the front desk was very helpful. We went to Monkey Bar right next door one night which had great food and drinks.

title: Good location but small, dirty room!
text:
I spoke at a conference nearby and the property had no rooms with points so I stayed here one night using points. The room is tiny with no fridge although it did have a full bath with tub.

The biggest issue is that I have asthma and the fan in the bathroom, which pumps air into the room, was caked in dust. I cleaned it as best I could. This is unacceptable.

The other issue is that they charge $30 as autograph collection property. This can be used for buffet breakfast or a drink at the bar but it’s really just a gimmick to get guests to pay more money for breakfast which used to be free!

On the plus side, the hotel was lively and the business center is easy to use and open 24/7.

title: Not this one
text: There is mildew on the shower curtain. The linen is cheap (probably the fewest weaves to get by without failing standards too badly). The WiFi is slow and admits only one device. The room has inadequate lights. You have to collect your water front the lobby. Yup thee is no water in the room. Don’t let the hotel impose the daily destination fee if you don‘t need those extras. With this kind of price I expect better than this.

title: Unnecessary fee for bag check
text: Honestly the room was great for NYC. What brings the rating down for me is that they charge you $3 per bag to keep your bag before your room is ready and at checkout again $3 per bag to hold them for the day while you are out and about. And the line for them to take your bag is long so all in all an unpleasant ending to an otherwise good stay!

title: A bar with some rooms
text: Having stayed at many "Autograph Collection" hotels, I am not sure how this one qualifies. Looking for any standard amenities of an average American hotel? At  The Lexington: water in the room - nope; coffee maker in the room - nope; fridge - nope; body wash - nope; lunch available at the hotel - nope; dinner available at the hotel - nope. And it's in need of a little repair too.

title: Great stay and service!
text: Checked in early with Nicole Hudson. She was fantastic - very knowledgeable, friendly, and extremely professional. My room was on a high floor, bed was comfy, and breakfast was great. Guests currently have complimentary access to the Cruch Fitness Gym attached to the hotel which is amazing. One thing I’d like to point out - the finer details in the room could use some work, like where the carpet meets the baseboards and ceiling meets the walls.

title: Dream Stay at the Lex
text:
From the moment we checked in, the staff at the Lex went above and beyond to make it a dream stay. Specifically, Nicole Hudson pulled out all the stops. She treated our family like they were her family. No request was too small and was always completed in a few minutes with a smile. 

I can easily say this was the best hotel stay we’ve had in years and solely because of her, we’ll be booking here again come next family vacation. 

Also, shout out to Breeta and Omega. When Nicole wasn’t taking care of us, they were and again, you couldn’t ask for better staff. Nothing but great client service with a smile and most of all, they care. 

Hey Marriott, if you them, you lose us. It’s employees like Nicole and her teammates who treat travellers as their own that make your chain the best in the business. Take care of them like they take care of us and we’ll never stay anywhere else. 

Overall the location and amenities at the Lex are great. The room was a little tight, but everything was in working order, so no complaints there either. This place is a 10/10.

title: Cheerful Staff/ Sunny Room
text:
Bright room with a view.  The room seemed larger than prior nights stay at a hotel 2x price.  It was likely the layout and being a corner room (extra window).
I did use ear plugs to sleep (typical for me).  Asked for a later checkout and they were very accommodating.  I did get a nap in before departing.  Breakfast in the hotel was good.  A variety to fit different palates. Gym was affiliated with membership gym so lots more equipment choices than a typical hotel.   Every staff member was helpful and cheerful.   Lynette started my stay with a fast and friendly check-in.

title: Excellent hotel with a personal touch!
text: The hotel was excellent and extremely centrally located. Simon F. at the front desk was an absolute god send and was able to accommodate our requirements despite the hotel being sold out. Would definitely recommend staying here!

title: Amazing service from Maalik
text: The Lexington Hotel has been the most accommodating hotel I have stayed at in NYC. The Stayton’s manager, Maalik, made our experience that much better. Customized service all around, but we felt especially taken care of by Maalik. Highly recommend for anyone visiting the city.

title: Very good location in updated older hotel
text: Very good location in updated older hotel.  Very busy lobby with large and multiple airline crews checking into hotel.  One agent checking in long lines of guests.  Free breakfast is a plus. Small king size room for the price, even in NYC. Location is the best asset here.

title: Wouldn't recommend...
text: A great location & the hotel is nice enough but extortionately priced & very poor value for money. Be warned, breakfast is an extortionate $30pp + 18% compulsory gratuity + tax for just a buffet!!! At $400 odd dollars a night, for the room not to even have so much as a kettle was really frustrating. Housekeeping (though lovely & apologetic), didn't clean my room for the first 4 days despite multiple requests. My disabled brother was also given a completely inaccessible room to begin with that left him unable to use the bathroom & at great risk of falling & injuring himself. The staff were friendly but not particularly helpful at resolving any of the above issues with any efficiency, if at all. We knew multiple people staying there at the same time, most of all had similar issues if not worse. One rather accurately described the hotel as 'entirely incompetent'. Being able to leave bags for $3 an item after check out was helpful but I certainly wouldn't stay again.

title: Best costumer service
text: Kudos to Nicole at the front desk for excellent customer. She made our stay really really special. We met up with our friends for a fun weekend which turned out to be a blast. We had our own patio and we ended up staying in our room the rest of the night. Perfect weather!

title: No complaints, convenient location
text: Overall pretty good.  Rooms a little small (even for Manhattan), but clean, convenient  location, and the staff was friendly.  Not really anything to complain about and overall a good stay.  This part of mid-town is not a favorite, but it is a short walk or subway ride from most anything.

title: Marcie- Thank you
text: Marcie- Front Office- amazing service- all my questions here at new york was given to me was wonderful- smiles is the best when you approach at front desk. Fist class please do the necessary Pass my messages- i will be back soon here for next adventure and amazing experiences here New york

title: Great Hotel, Great location
text: Our check in process went smoothly and quickly.  All staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was a nice size, quiet and very clean.  The only thing preventing this from being a five star review is the breakfast selection was sub par, not clean and very messy.

title: Decent hotel but not that great
text:
While the hotel is fairly central to where I needed to be - I’ve asked to never be booked here for work. A few reasons:
- the rooms are fairly small
- there is construction of buildings on the other side which creates a buzzing noise, I barely slept 
- breakfast is something like $30 and is very weak, and they get around it by saying there is a site credit that discounts the breakfast; you are better off going to the Starbucks in the hallway, which is what most people did after I had committed to sit down
The only highlight is that they do have a nice lobby bar that is tasteful done and there is a Crunch gym downstairs that is excellent for getting a morning work out in.
Overall, you are probably better off staying at the Intercontinental across the street.

title: Terrible
text:
No space to put a suitcase: 
No space,hooks or hangers for hanging clothes
Nearly $40 daily charge on top of the room booking but the restaurant does not open till 4pm when all the tourist would be out yet your forced to spend $40 per day.

title: Historic hotel with a retro vibe
text: I enjoyed my stay at the classic Lexington Hotel, where the historic lobby has a great energy and bar scene. Rooms are on the small side, but clean, quiet and decorated with a nod to the hotel's history. Pluses: location, jazz-age lobby and bar, plenty of elevators and service. The hotel was packed when I was there and every member of staff was professional and courteous at all times. Cons:  prices add up, as there are charges to store bags and daily service fee (offset by a breakfast/bar credit IF you use it, if not the daily charge remains) Also, no water or coffee makers in the rooms, and ice machines are not on every floor. If you like historic hotels with excellent service, I recommend the Lexington.

title: Chaos at Check In
text:
We were spending a nice weekend in NYC, great dinners and a show.
I checked in early using the Marriott app.  When we arrived at the hotel our suite was not ready.  I was told the previous guest had a late check out.  Then why bother having me check in on the app-they knew I was coming.  
Apparently we were not the only one-the lobby had a very long line waiting to check in and was full of guests waiting for their rooms.  Not relaxing on welcoming.  Our suite was finally ready at 5:05PM.
Once we got to the suite, we liked it.

Another annoyance was the $35/day "resort" fee.  Another way to raise revenue I guess.

On the positive side, the location is great, we liked the art deco vibe and the restaurant next door, Seafire Grill is not to be missed.

title: Great Hotel!
text:
Hotel is located in the perfect place in the City. Lot's of places to eat around. Close to public transportation. 
The staff is professional and courteous.
Good vibes in the lounge and bar area. Keep up the good work

title: Terrible hotel
text: The worst hotel I have stayed in. The rooms are so small and very badly designed. No place to put your suitcases nor adequate wardrobe space which is cluttered with ironing board safe etc. There’s no place to move in the bathroom which is so tight you cannot properly dry yourself. There is a hairdryer but no  socket! No tea making facilities nor water in the room. You have to pay $40 each day of your stay which is such a con. You can then redeem it in their very expensive so called restaurant and bar which is not even open all day. I wanted to grab a quick sandwich around 11.30 but was closed. The breakfast is terrible. You can also redeem the $40 for laundry but the rules for use at weekend are such that you it’s impossible to use without surcharges being paid. I would never stay here again.

title: Low-quality hotel.  Read the other negative reviews before booking this hotel.
text:
It's a low quality hotel.  I wish that I listened to the negative reviews on Tripadvisor before booking this hotel.

1)  Rooms are very small and outdated.  You have to contort your body to use the toliet and shower.

2)  A/C does not work properly.

3)  To flush the toilet, you have to press this tiny silver button (which is very hard to reach) and hold it down for about 4 seconds.  It's a terrible experience each time using the toilet.    [The engineer who recommended this toilet type should be demoted.]

This hotel destroys the good image of Marriott Bonvoy. 

I will never ever stay at this hotel.  Never!

title: Excellent check in process
text: Nicole was incredible and helped get me in a room quickly with a smile.  She also helped explain all of the hotel benefits.  Really appreciate good service.  The hotel is also very nice and clean and the door man was also super friendly

title: Great hotel, very noisy room
text: The hotel is beautiful and the lobby very welcoming Nice design. However, when it comes to rooms,  on 14th floor - room 1436, week of Sept 5, facing the back are located above huge ventilators. This makes you feel like you were sleeping into an engine room. As they are running nearly all the time. Forget quietness. Secondly, the Bonvoy app asked me to rate my stay when I first log in. I added comments about the room issue, on the first night of my stay, yet no one contacted me during the stay or in the following few days - which was the second disappointment for this stay, especially being a gold elite member and loyal client for >20years.

title: Very rude staff
text: 2 members of the staff were very rude to my wife.  The first, she asked “may I ask you a question”, and the gentleman replied “absolutely not”. The 2nd instance was when we called after 10pm about an incessant banging in our room. They sent someone up who could not identify the noise, then when she called to request a room change, and the guy was rude.  Super poor experience for almost $500 a night. After the first rude guy, we were promised 20,000 bonvoy points that never appeared in our account.  Good times…

title: Very disappointed and underwhelmed
text:
We booked Lexington for a family vacation in NYC over the Labor Day weekend.  I am a Titanium Elite who’s stayed in many Marriott properties worldwide, and I was looking forward to this experience.  However, for a five star (Category 6) hotel, this fell so short in many ways:

Front desk service: When checking in, we were denied an upgrade and  given a 5/F room with a view of the air conditioning unit.  The first staffer claimed there was nothing available. The room had no view, no fridge.  We tried calling guest services five times but no one answered. When we went downstairs and spoke to another staff member at the front desk, we were immediately upgraded to nicer 25/F. The first staff member didn’t even make an effort.  So disappointing. We’ve been loyal members for over 20 years

Destination charge: $35/day, not waived for elites. This is not unique to Lexington, and it’s sadly prevalent across NYC hotels.  Regardless, it’s a shady practice just so they can advertise a lower base rate, and save on taxes.  You get a $35 F&B credit but that will get you not even two glasses of wine at the bar.

Room: The room was small but adequate.  We know this is the norm in NYC so we were prepared. However, toiletries were not restocked daily, nor was the room cleaned by housekeeping.  As guest services was completely unreachable by phone (on this and many other occasions), We had to go down and ask for toiletries and cleaning! Also no bottled water - period.  Only manual water dispensers in the lobby.  It was embarrassing for the hotel

Breakfast: Very limited spread, overcooked bacon and eggs. Weren’t quite sure if it was fresh. 

Staff at the restaurant were abrupt and inhospitable.  Yes, it’s a New York thing but there still needs to be some basic level of customer service.  When breakfast ended at 10:30, we were rudely kicked out of the cafe and forced to take our half eaten meal upstairs. Never experienced this before in a Marriott property worldwide.  We’re usually politely asked to move to the lobby or another area of the restaurant.  I understand that the restaurant needs to be cleaned, etc but there is a way to communicate this better, especially at a luxury hotel.

The worst part: for two days, the breakfast offered expired food.  If we had not been vigilant, we would have fed our kid yogurt  that was 7 days past its sell by date (we have photos).  Unbelievable for a hotel of this stature.

Overall: we were hoping for a good experience, given the histor

title: A nice hotel
text:
This is a nice hotel in an excellent location. A few blocks from train stops. Rooms are very small, but were in NY I guess.

The complimentary breakfast in the mornings was a nice touch. The bar is cool in the evening too but I'm surprised how early they close.

title: Nothing good to say
text:
Start with the guest rooms:  no coffee maker.  no window shade for the bathroom window and an opaque bathroom door combine to make sure your room is nice and bright while you are trying to sleep in,  no bathroom counter.  Tiny room.  Bathtub only - no walk in shower.  To get the toilet to flush fully you have to hold down a button for like ten seconds.  Just awful all the way around.

Then to add insult to injury , the restaurant is closed for lunch and dinner , breakfast is buffet only , the bar doesn’t open until 430 pm, and there is no room service, yet I am being charged a daily $35 fee that gives me a $35 food and beverage credit.  Well what the heck am I supposed to use the credit on?  Just avoid this place and pick somewhere else.

title: OBNOXIOUS, UNPROFESSIONAL AND SUB PAR
text:
Let's start off super strong: Instead of the Autograph Collection, it should be the Trainwreck Collection.

This was one of the most frustrating stays I've ever had at a Marriott. Onsite market was not connected to the hotel. I couldn't even get a bottle of water as a Titanium Elite for my elderly 75 year old mother. I specifically asked for connecting rooms since I was traveling with my elderly mother. I called the day before - they said it was confirmed. Upon check in - they confirmed they were connecting. When I got upstairs they were not connecting - they were across from each other. I have no choice but to conclude that the people who work here do not know what 'connecting' means. The experience was annoying and sloppy. Quite a few have nailed it, the customer service and the attention to detail is non-existent.

The breakfast was the most sub par thing I have ever had with limited options - I have had better at TownePlace Suites. This was the first time, since being titanium, I did not feel valued. I put way too much time into calling and requesting connecting rooms, addition of elite nights and points to be done. At one point I was told I did not get points or elite nights which is completely against Marriott's own Terms and Conditions. It took well over a month for my elite night and points to be added which forced me to completely change plans for another trip I had planned.

Like the Le Meridien, I would never under any circumstances spend another dollar here or at an autograph collection period. It is amusing how people at check in remind me I booked it with points like I have no money when the fact and reality is to get points I have to spend money. I also cannot be Titanium Elite without spending money. No need to remind me how I booked the stay, I did it myself. Every time I try to find a hotel with a slightly more reasonable rate I end up with the most sub par experience. I'll just spend the money to avoid this sort of nonsense

title: Staff is outstanding
text: The front desk staff was outstanding with efficiency and friendliness. The only names I recall are Marcy, Kendrick and Philippe even though they were all great. Housekeeping was good even though I didn’t get service every day at my choice. Did a fine job and were very pleasant and friendly when I saw them. As far as the room I had a corner king and as far as New York hotels go the room was good size. The mattress was in good condition. The downside is the bathroom is very small with no counter space. That was the only drawback.  You might want to bring earplugs if you were on the side facing Lexington Avenue . As far as luxury and amenities this is not a five star hotel but it’s certainly a solid place to stay and when I’m in Manhattan my usual choice.

title: Love Lexington Hotel
text: Absolutely best hotel stay! Hotel Lexington has become my home away from home as I’m spending a lot of time in NYC. The staff is the reason for my great stays. From Lisset and Arlene who managed my pre-stay and helped me with room selection to Virginia, Khaleel, and Jenny who assisted me with requests. Everyone goes out of their way. Nora in housekeeping came and cleaned my room at 10:30pm after an oversight! The people make the hotel and the people who work at Hotel Lexington are the absolute best!

title: Bang Average - you are paying for the location and nothing else.......well maybe the gym
text:
Small room and small bathroom.
Charged me $3 to look after my bag for a few hours.
Staff were very helpful and polite.
Traffic noise could be heard from the street - so try and get a room as high as possible.

The Crunch gym has the lower ground floor and can be used by residents - the gym is very good

title: Nice hotel cheapened by nickel and diming fees
text:
I stayed at the Lexington Hotel in August 2022. As a frequent traveler (including to NYC) and a Marriott Ambassador member, I was tremendously disappointed in how this hotel nickles and dimes its guests to the point of exhaustion.

Start with the basics: The hotel is in an excellent location. Its tiny rooms are standard in NYC, and I don't fault the hotel for that. I hate the scammy $35 "Destination Fee" which serves only one purpose: to obscure the price of the hotel and make it difficult to compare against other hotels. This is sadly commonplace in NYC, but its so scammy that it needs to be called out. Don't fall for the marketing lingo that "it covers (horribly overpriced) drinks and breakfast" - you're far better suited by eating elsewhere in Manhattan.

The worst thing about the hotel is that they tried to charge me to store my bags. I’ve stayed at countless hotels around the U.S. and internationally, and nobody hast *ever* charged me for this. It’s a small amount, but it’s cash only (it’s 2022) and it’s a moral outrage that a relatively upscale hotel like this one would nickel and dime guests like this. I avoided this fee by asking for a late-check out and kept the bags in my room instead of paying the fee, but it still left a horrible taste in my mouth.

I know that Covid has been tremendously difficult for hotel owners. But the extend to which this supposedly luxurious hotel cheapened the experience made me certain to go elsewhere during my trip to NYC next month. You would be best to look elsewhere as well.

title: This is what our bath water looked like
text:
We stayed here in august of 2022. I drew a bath and this is what the water looked like. 
Also we had a security threat at our room and staff couldn’t help us because they don’t have cameras in hallways

title: BUYER BEWARE - EXTORTIONARY BUSINESS PRACTICES
text:
Read all the way to the bottom to learn about this hotel's $38 Quesadilla and its prostitution problem....

I am a Marriott Bonvoy, Titanium Elite member.  I have stayed at Marriott properties in dozens of locations on four continents.  This hotel wins the award for the most ridiculous business practice I have ever witnessed.  

Let's get the positives out of the way - this is an historic hotel in a good location.  It's in decent shape; the rooms are not totally upgraded, but fine. The staff is courteous.  

Now for the negatives.  This hotel charges a nonvoluntary $35 "destination fee" on top of the room rate and taxes.  Here is how the website describes it when you make a reservation. 
 
"Daily destination fee of USD 35 plus tax will be added to the room rate and includes a daily food and beverage credit of USD 35, Crunch Fitness passes, Citi Bike passes and more."

Fine print on the website also says guests will receive an additional $35 valet credit - although this is not made clear in the reservation (or anywhere else).

When I checked in, no one ever offered or explained how to obtain Citi Bike passes or the Crunch Fitness Passes.  Nor did they provide any other information regarding the $35 fee, or how to redeem the $35 laundry or room credits.

Despite offering a food and beverage credit, there is no restaurant.  The Stayton Room is a bar/lounge that offers an extremely minimal "bar fare" menu at exorbitant (even for NYC) prices.  I ordered one diet coke (can) and a Chicken Quesadilla.  The price: $38!  I have included photos of both my "order" and my bill to illustrate how ridiculous these prices are.  

Further, I stayed for two nights in the hotel on business.  On the first night, I was unable to redeem the laundry or food and beverage credit, because I had evening plans in the city.  When I redeemed the laundry credit the next day - one shirt and one pair of pants - it cost $26!  If I had done that on my first day at the hotel, that would have cost a premium price of $39, because they were not in before 9:00 a.m.  

Finally, while eating my... let's call it a snack... in the Stayton Room, I overheard a prostitute (who was clearly a regular) successfully proposition a hotel guest.  They discussed payments methods, services, and arranged to meet in his hotel room.  Yuck. 

Skip this place!

title: Another delightful stay at The Lexington, Autograph - service at its finest!
text: I’m a happy Marriott Rewards member, and an important part of that is the excellent and helpful service I get when checking in to their always-welcoming properties.  The Lexington Autograph is a favorite hotel on the east side of midtown, sporting a comfortable, artsy, and fun vibe in a great location.  I stayed for an overnight on August 6, looking to check in early.  “Lisset” noted that my room wasn’t ready yet, however, an upgraded room certainly was and so I checked in early and in a more comfortable space than had been planned.  Lisset, and other proactive, service-oriented staff members, make customer loyalty an easy decision.  Thank you, Lisset, and to the Marriott people!

title: Depressing
text:
Thought the room was depressing, the Barclay across the street is much better for the same price. 

Decor is very basic even on an elite floor. 

Breakfast very poor, think courtyard but worse. 

Would not recommend

title: Beware / Be Aware
text: Please know that the hotel has no security cameras in the elevator or hallways. This has been confirmed by the NYPD. I will not go into the details of the incident, but all guests should know that the hotel will take a he-said/she-said approach.

title: Great location, annoying “amenity fee”  but great rooms.
text:
The location is fantastic, a few blocks from 5th Avenue, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre and Grand Central. 

I used a Marriott suite night award and was upgraded to a lovely terrace suite for the weekend. The weather was abysmal so we couldn’t use the large outside space but it was a fantastic outdoor area. 

The bed was really comfy and amenities were great. The room was very clean and had everything i needed. 

The annoying thing about this property was the $35 “amenity fee” that they charge per room, per night. I really resent these additional fees, especially at a city hotel. The benefits from this amenity fee are also pointless when you’re a bonvoy member with status. Hotels need to stop these fees - they are just not ok and don’t add any value. 

The other issue here was the food and beverage options. The bar was only open in the evenings with 3 options for food on the menu and there was no room service. Seems very odd to offer such a light f&b operation in a large upscale NY hotel. 

We did valet parking which was seamless and good value. Breakfast was fantastic, lots of choice, great service and tasty food. 

I’d love to stay here again but they need to figure out the annoying “amenity fees”

title: Elizabeth is an Amazing Manager
text: I had the distinct joy to work with Elizabeth about a minor question. She was incredible. Knowledgeable and efficient. Elizabeth really made my experience with the Lexington one of the best. The rest of the staff were incredible was well.

title: 40th Birthday Trip to NYC
text: My wife & I visited NYC for her 40th birthday and stayed at The Lexington. The hotel was very clean and staff was friendly. The most outstanding person we met at the hotel was Omega Beard, Food & Beverage Director. He went above and beyond to make our stay extra special.  He was exceptional! It is within walking distance to lots of things including Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and St. Patrick’s Cathedral. Great hotel and I highly recommend!!

title: Two nights, two different rooms two very different standards.
text:
I stayed twice in the last week, different rooms each time. the first room was excellent, encouraging me to book a second night two days later. 
The first (1408) was spacious and very comfortable, the second time the room was tiny cramped and left a lot to be desired. Had that room been my first experience I think I would have had second thoughts about returning.
Evening food is available at the bar, but it was noisy and the menu is disappointing.
Breakfast is also served in the bar area, it wasn't very enticing  but thankfully there is a Starbucks (access to from the lobby) so was able to start the morning with a great coffee!

title: Rude Staff  & Loud
text:
The staff couldn't have been more unfriendly and act as though they were too busy to do their job. Front desk prior to stay and during stay were rude and unhelpful. I had originally booked the hotel only to find out two day prior that I needed to cancel my trip due to a team member having covid. The hotel staff was so rude on the call and even asked the  question of why I didn't cancel sooner. I unfortunately gave them a second chance booking a second time (another 1k+ for 3 nights) only to find that my experience was just as poor. 

Upon check-in, the front desk staff, Jenny, checked me in. She was not very polite asking me twice to put my credit card in the reader without telling me what she was charging and why. She just firmly told me to insert it and that she needed it. Mind you I prepaid so this was totally unacceptable. I then asked a third time and was told it was for incidentals however another 1k+ was charged to my card. I was then also charged the full amount AGAIN and was told by the manager that the system didn't know I had prepaid. Watch your credit card!

In terms of the stay, there is NO Coffee in the room or on the floor. You must take the elevator down to the common area to get this and it is not marked what is decaf or not. 

The bar offers breakfast and coffee for your $35 voucher each day. If you plan to go to Starbucks within the hotel connected, know they are pretty busy (because the hotel coffee is so rare). We actually stopped to pick up a carafe and we were told they had too many orders and didn't have time for ours.

Cleaning was minimal. I did see the cart once and asked for a shower cap and was told to go to the front desk. The cleaning crew did bare minimum and half way replaced towels. 

To shut the door of the room, I had to slam the door shut.  I totally understand why people around had to do the same.  Walls are paper thin - could hear tv constantly next door and plumbing all around. 

Overall - location was the only thing this hotel had going for it. Plenty others to choose from. I highly recommend it. I have no idea how this is categorized at 4 star and is under Marriot name.

title: Exceptionally loud (not street noise)
text: I travel for business every week and this has been my most disappointing stay in the last two years.  Started out with a lackluster front desk service where the person checking me in literally disappeared for 10 minutes in the middle of checking me in.  That should have been a sign to turnaround.  The room is clean and no frills, but this has got to be one of the noisiest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in (and I am not talking about street noise), from thin walls to a persistent “drip” sound with no water it has been a very frustrating experience.  Top it off with the toilet not fully flushing, I stated calling other nearby hotels around midnight to see if they had availability.

title: Don't stay anywhere else
text: I decided to come to NY to celebrate my 50th  Birthday. This has been the best hotel experience I have ever had in New York. I had so many problems when I showed up. New Credit card, no place to park and starving. The Manager Wesley Laidlaw took it all personal. He literally walked me through the several payment options, made sure my car was taken care of, and gave me several options to eat. I would have had no idea he was the manager. If he is running this place, I would be the entire staff is awesome (which they really are). The place looks amazing and the food and drinks are the BOMB!!!! (FYI... A Starbucks is also attached to the hotel. I will be coming back. My little small tip to you is .........  STAY HERE!!!!!!!!

title: NYC AT ITS BEST
text:
So where do I start? Okay so a lot of flight attendants stay in this hotel fyi lol but its the fancy ones. Extremely classy and jazzy hotel, the flight attendants added to that, gave it a whole "CATCH ME IF YOU CAN" feat. Leonardo DiCaprio vibe era. 
Lasette checked me in. Mind you this was my 30th Birthday this past weekend. She surprised me and gave me the unexpected. I am a Convoy Member, however she put me from a normal King to best room / hidden gem in the entire hotel. I enjoyed a BEAUTIFUL 2-Balcony private room with lavish space. Her customer service, not to mention fabulous Fashion was nothing shy of what is expected and she took the bar up a notch.
My special house keeper was Miss Nora and when I say she was a VIBE! She was the picture perfect woman for a New Yorker Italian , idk I think she was Italian? Lol maybe it was the accent, but she made me right at home. Couldn't have asked for anything more from the staff.
 The bar here is soo cool, retro, and full of chic life. The L'espresso was so good and hit the spot (they're version of an expresso martini). I enjoyed that as my last cocktail before I flew back home to Atlanta, Georgia. 
The Lexington is a Must stay when visiting New York City.

title: Okay
text:
I booked an executive room. I guess the executive means two bathrooms. I wish this room had a separate living room area instead of two bathrooms, but it didn't. Of course, I could have booked a suite. 
After checked-in, I went to the desk to speak with the manager and asked about the possibility of being upgraded to a suite. The front office manager said that the suite wasn't available that day but to come back the next afternoon to double check with him about the upgrade. 
Our stay was supposed to be for 11 days (business travel/my spouse's medical visit). On our first night, upon arrival at the room, I called the desk to inform them that the safe wasn't working and requested a clock. 
The following day, I went to the desk to inform them that we had never received the clock and that no one had come to the room to fix the safe. I saw the agent write a note about my request. We went out of the hotel for my spouse's medical visit. Later in the afternoon, when we returned to the hotel room, we noticed that the clock was never delivered even though the room was already cleaned and made-up. So, I went down to the desk to check on the status of the suite upgrade and to let them know that the clock was never delivered to our room and that we needed someone to fix the safe. 
The front desk agent told me, "The manager comes at 3 PM," and he is the only one who grants upgrades. (Important to mention that we weren't looking for a free upgrade since we knew that we had booked an executive room; we were willing to pay for the suite upgrade).
It is terrible that a front office agent is not empowered to make decisions about room upgrades and that everything must go to the front office manager. We 
waited until 3 PM to again be declined an upgrade, and the message was that the suites were unavailable. 
I decided to go to the hotel website and was able to book a suite which I never clicked to finalize the reservation because I thought it was deceiving the answers I was getting at the front desk. It all seemed inconvenient for them to move us to another room. We were very frustrated about it, and now it was closed to 7 PM (our second night at the hotel), no clock, and no one had come up to fix the safe. So, I went down to the desk and told them we were checking out the following day. You would think that when the front office agent looked at the screen and saw that we were shortening our stay, the agent would have been empathetic and asked why we were leaving the hotel earlier than the reservation. Again, lack of concern and caring.

title: Where Art Deco Meets Service: Kudos to the Lexington Hotel for truly delivering an authentic and exceptional experience!
text:
I recently had an opportunity to stay at the Lexington Hotel and am pleased to share that my experience was outstanding!

As a hospitality design & construction professional, I’m keenly aware of details that contribute to exceptional guest experiences, from attention to location, architecture, and interiors, to the sleep and dining experience, and most importantly the service.  Kudos to the Lexington Hotel and it’s operations team for truly delivering on the above with its unique appointed charm and superior service.

Sincerely,

Colleague and satisfied customer

title: Found Cockroach And Underwear
text: Okay I guess we will start with the cockroach. I was walking to my bed when I glanced to the floor only to see a dead cockroach in plain sight. How do cleaners not see this?! If your going to work as a cleaner at least put effort into you job so people can have the best experience possible. Now the worst part; dirty underwear. It was time for bed after a long day in the city. We haven’t gotten into our beds yet, and are ready to relax. As we look at our beds they are neatly made and look clean. So my mom pulls back her covers, ready to sleep. And she looks in the bed to see bright pink shine underwear. We all gasp and call the desk to get a new room. They are out of rooms, so they clean our room and give us 2 free drinks. 1 hour later we head back to our room only to see the bright pink underwear folded and on our chair, as if taunting us. We again call to the front desk and some guy comes and picks up the underwear with a piece of paper and leaves the chair. He had to pick the underwear up with a piece of paper, so he could clean the chair too! We ended up putting the chair in the hall and clearly inspecting our beds before we went to sleep. I’ve never had such a horrid hotel visit, and I hope never to experience that again.

title: Found dirty undergarments in between well made bedsheets
text:
After a long day walking around the city, the girls and I came back and started getting ready for bed. There was no outward sign that made us question the cleanliness of the room. The beds were made well; so much so that the only way to get in was to rip the sheets way back. That’s when I found the underwear. 
This was shocking and not expected especially at this level of hotel. I kept the girls from posting this on social media and called the front desk. The manager on duty had limited options as he had no available rooms for us to move. All he could do was offer for someone to change the linens. Honestly just changing the linens at this point still made me question the cleanliness of the room. The girls and I changed back into our day clothes so we could go wait downstairs. An hour later, we were able to go back to our room. We were greeted with the underwear once again when we got back to the room. 
It was appalling to find the underwear on the chair. I called down to the manager again. Someone was sent up to grab it. The guy that came in used a piece of paper to grab the underwear and departed. Seriously if he needed a piece of paper to pick it up, why didn’t it occur to him to CLEAN THE CHAIR!  Another call to the manager. At this point, I’m tired and so disgusted with the hotel that we chose to just put the chair in the hallway and go to bed. I’ve never had such a nasty experience as this.
I am posting this review now because I am not satisfied with how this was handled. We have been loyal to the Marriott chain for years and we were only credited points for our inconvenience. For $499 plus lodging tax and fees, I expected more than a few drink coupons while we waited for the sheets to be changed. It seemed reasonable to be credited enough points to stay at that hotel again but the manager wouldn’t do so.

title: Great front desk experience
text: Five stars to the amazing and wonderful greeting at the front desk. Nina was a delight and such a pleasure to speak to. Is checking into a hotel supposed to be fun? Cause she was FULL of excitement. Thanks for starting my weekend in NYC off perfectly Nina!

title: A Great Location
text:
We stayed at the Lexington when we went to NY for a shopping and theatre weekend. The lobby and bar have a great vibe.

The staff isveris very professional and friendly.

The rooms are very reasonably priced given the great location but they are very small.  The hotel was built in1929 but extensively renovated in 2013 but you cant adjust the room size.  Keep that in mind if you book.

title: Friendly staff but needs some polish
text:
Nice, friendly hotel in Midtown East, but the management needs to pay attention to some of the details.

We liked the staff and the hotel was located in a convenient part of the town for our activities, But I expected more polish in the fit and finish of the construction. Examples in our 10th-floor room:
- One of the tiebacks for the curtain had fallen off the wall exposing an inch-long screw, which could have been dangerous with a small child
- The bathtub had paint, cement, or grout spatters all over it
- Part of the tiled wall had smeared paint or cement
- The corner of the ceiling above the shower had paper stuffed in it to plug a hole

These details don't seem to fit a hotel that's in the "Autograph Collection" where I believe hotels are upscale.

The included breakfast buffet was small and average, The Stayton Room (their bar in the lobby) was hopping while we were there and the drinks were fine.

title: Will not be staying here again
text:
Is it COVID or has service fallen generally? Should of stayed across the street at Intercontinental. 

I arrive at the front desk to check in and ask why mobile checkin not working and the guy at front desk, “it doesn’t work for this hotel!” - then why send me an email asking me to check in?!?! That’s dumb. 

Second I kindly asked if an upgrade would be available, as asking nice gets your further than barking, but in this case he proceeds to tell me that he can either place me facing a brick wall out the window or facing the street, but will hear the road noise!  Great options!?!?!!

It’s NYC, I know rooms are small, but my room was tiny!! If I place my small suitcase on the floor, I can’t even make my way around the room. 

Lastly, i checked in around 6pm and saw trash near the elevator bank and left the next morning around 8 and the trash was still there. 

If you want a blah hotel and nothing else is available, then stay here, but noting great about this place, other than location, but it’s nyc and there are hotels everywhere.

title: Made a great trip even better
text:
This has been an amazing place from the very beginning.  Everyone is so eager to help - housekeeping, front desk, doormen. The rooms are more than adequate in size, especially for New York. Great location for walking to most anywhere. Broadway, Time Square, great restaurants, sightseeing, shopping. 

Our flight home was delayed a day and Lisset and Jose were especially helpful in providing us the opportunity to keep our room for an extra day. We plan on staying here whenever we visit New York again and we recommend it to anyone visiting Manhattan.

title: So so.  Wouldn’t recommend for business travel.
text: It did not feel like a Marriott.  The hotel is convenient to GCT and is clearly popular with tourists, but there is no place to have a business lunch or dinner in the hotel.  Also, the furniture and fixtures are well warn.  I paid a significant amount to stay there and they charged me $6 to store my bags while I went to a quick business meeting after I checked out.  Also, my room wasn’t ready when I arrived and they told me they’d call my cell to let me know when it was ready.  I finally went back to the desk over two hours later and they told me it had been ready for a while. I never got a call and would’ve been nice to be able to take business calls in a quiet room versus a loud lobby.  I should’ve known that would happen based on the number of people I heard complaining to staff about various things, including no one answering phones at the front desk, rate changes, accidental cancellations and damage to a car parked in the garage.  Wound stay there again.

title: Amazing front desk agent
text: My name is Stefan foster and I just wanted to highlight an amazing agent at this property. I believe her name was nicole, very pretty front desk agent. She was amazing, attentive and helpful. I was in New York for a funeral from the 10th to the 14th and she was awesome. I booked two rooms and she assisted with both, and working for hotels myself for the past 10 years, she is definitely an asset to your property.

title: Decent Hotel
text:
Stayed here for one night only

Hotel is conveniently  located.

Well trained staff, had some issues with my booking, was promptly resolved by the Frontline Manager.

The only drawback I saw was the Room Size, may be I am used to staying in big rooms)

title: Save your money, or at least get value for your money by going elsewhere - yes I’m bitter
text:
I know Covid has decimated the world and destroyed the tourism/hospitality sector world wide.  Staffing issues and the ‘restart’ will likely impact the world for at least another 12+ months

However  - this accommodation venue markets itself as a 5* boutique destination with many unique and ‘special’ benefits.  We had the Conservatory ‘suite’.  A ‘spacious, unique ‘one off’ bedroom and seperate ‘sitting room’ overlooking the NYC skyline.  

No concierge, no room service, paper cups, an ancient coffee pod machine that as a tea drinker I can say with 100% certitude needed descaling and cleaning, holes in the few towels we were allowed and surly uncooperative front desk staff who were clearly overwhelmed and discouraged.

Our highly anticipated, 2+ years delayed (Australia had the borders closed for a long time!) ‘retirement with a bang’ explore NYC before heading on to Europe started with a whimper.   The bathroom IS marble and so small that 2 people simply can’t use it.  

Would I recommend the Marriott Lexington to someone who expects the Marriott quality with extra shine - never!!  Go across the road to 48Lex - at least they have a restaurant and staff who imply they care 

Probably the most disappointing accommodation we’d ever had…until we got to the Marriott Renaissance in Amsterdam

title: Breda At Front Desk - Superstar
text:
When you check into a hotel your first point of contact is often the Front Desk. They can set the tone for your whole stay. When we arrived many guests were waiting in line and only one person was attending front desk duties. That is not fair to the staff. 

But, Breda at the front desk took it all in stride and even though she was faced with tough guests and overwhelming circumstances, she handled it like a superstar. She was attentive, communicative, listened and heard our requests and gave superior service and attention. She is as welcome, accommodating, efficient and everything you would want in front desk personally. She gave us a great room and we think she shooed be recognized as associate of the week or month for her top notch service. 

Nice rooms, a bit small but typical of NYC. Very clean and overall a great stay.

title: Very special place
text: We have stayed here several times, even during the pandemic when occupancy was down to 20%, the staff gives my family the same level of white glove service. I made 2 friends that I’d like to give a shot out to, Elizabeth and Breda. Elizabeth has been in charge of the phone service for 25+ years, and treats every guest with warmth and compassion. She often underestimates the value she brings to the overall hotel service, but once you get to know her, you’ll see she’s a phenomenal individual. Breda was one of the first people I met when I walked into the Lexington last year, she’s not only incredibly professional at her job, she also has a great sense of humor. I look forward to seeing all my friends at the Lexington, who collectively make this hotel a truly special place. NK

title: Easy check in and check out with Nicole
text: Nicole was very helpful with the whole check in process. She made it a fast and easy process for me to get to my room. Even when I came down to do check out she was very helpful and made the process easy. Loved staying here!

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC!
text: My new favorite hotel in New York City! I don’t know why I never discovered this hotel before, since I have stayed close by many times, but this is where I’ll be staying from now on. I loved the location, with a short walk to Rockefeller Plaza & 5th Ave. On Lexington, it’s convenient for Uber pick-ups as well, since they don’t have to wind their way through a crowded side street.  There’s a Starbucks inside the hotel and a restaurant that serves breakfast by day, swanky cocktail bar by night.  fantastic cocktails and bar menu.  Love the hotel decor. It’s a charming historic property, with updated art deco decor. Very well done!  My room was comfortable, clean, and spacious with windows on two sides of the corner unit. The bed was sooooo comfortable!   The only thing i wished they had was a coffee maker in the room for that very first cup of coffee in the AM. I’ll be back!

title: Awful
text:
I kept trying to call the front desk and got no response.  When I went down there, the manager tried to claim I couldn’t have called because he was there the whole time, until I showed him my phone with the five outgoing calls to his number. 

Everyone makes mistakes, but to blame it on the customer has to be one of those cardinal sins in B-school.

title: Good location. Small room.
text: We got the standard size room and maybe it’s standard for NYC, but it was small. Bathroom was small. Bed was comfortable. When the bathroom above was used, it was noisy in our room. Room temperature control was good. Staff was friendly.  Breakfast buffet was good if you don’t mind spending $35 for breakfast. We used the coupons they gave us and when they ran out we went to Mr. Smood two blocks away. Could use modern upgrade to rooms.

title: Great NYC base
text: Great experience. Excellent location. The hospitality was more than you could eXpect; Comfortable room, cozy beds wonderful breakfast.The price was right, and the hotel staff were attentive. Just the place you want as a base in NYC. We will hopefully return.

title: A quiet gem
text:
Ok- I usually don't right about hotels in New York because they are cold and impersonal. However I want to share my thoughts on this venue. I'll simply list then pros-

Check-in- no lines a breeze-and thank you for an amazing suite upgrade for being Titanium. The hotel was sold out and they still were able to upgrade

Housekeeping- while other hotels use cover as an excuse to dave money on staff, this hotel actually cleaned my room when I left.Great job and thanks for being honest

Location- perfect- blocks away from Saks, Rockefeller center, can walk to central park and best of all its quiet at night so you can actually sleep unlike the noise of Times Square

History- You can almost feel Joe DiMaggio and Marilyn Monroe (this is where they lived) in the lobby. 

Hotel- beautiful lobby and elevators, no lines to get on. Hotel was sold out and I was always only person in elevator

Food/Bar- I read they don't give elite breakfast here but they gave to me. Was delicious. Also, don't fret at the hotel's $35 destination fee. Between having my laundry done and a few drinks int he bar your taken care of

A special thanks To Marci, Shena and Breda at the front desk. Thanks for making my stay wonderful

All in all if you want a nice quiet stay away fro screaming tourists and kids and honking cars all night  in a gorgeous setting with a professional staff, stay here.

title: Great experience
text:
Shena, the receptionist who checked us in went out of her way to make us comfortable and gave us a lovely room. Such a pleasure for our first contact at the hotel to be so helpful and obliging.
The hotel location is good, very central, close to shops, public transport and restaurants

title: Location is great, Staff great, Value and room avg
text:
Got this hotel from 3rd party booking and seeing as Autograph Collection, thought I would get a good place to stay overall.   

Positives for here: 

location almost can't be beat, you are within walking to most major places, times square, Rockefeller center, grand central station.   If you got walking shoes and willing further then you can get to Intrepid air and space and even central park.  

Staff were very friendly and helpful, no issues with any.  Check in was good and everything explained to me.  

Lobby was easy to get in and out of, they have a bar/lounge there, I used it for breakfast (one of the resort fee things you can use for).   Breakfast was enough to get going, eggs sausage toast coffee etc

and Negatives why I place it avg rating:

Room and bed -  small room, appeared to be redone, but wallpaper of water damage area?  and the bathroom ceiling had some sort of tarp material over it, not sure what hiding.   Bed was very hard, too firm.   Base boards around bed were dusty.    But it was cleaned daily and staff were good there.  TV was ok, and had a AC to run as room got hot, did the trick.   Toilet had an autoflush feature turned off, so you had to push a metal button to get it to work.  

Resort fee -- seems to be with many hotel in NYC area, but their fee came to $35 USD and taxes to $40 USD.   You get the amenities, like a gym access, wifi, breakfast or drink at the bar, or citibike use.   I used for breakfast daily.   But breakfast was not worth $40 USD.   Anyway, it is what it is.

Overall with the positives and negatives, I'd give it an avg based on my stay.   But not worthy of the Autograph level that I have seen in other hotels with this designation.

title: Mediocre Stay
text: Stayed for one overnight Saturday to Sunday in mid May. The room was probably last updated 15 years ago. It was decently cleaned. The bathroom amenities weren’t anything to write home about and there were small noticeable signs that it’s close to time for an update. The front desk staff said the hotel was booked to capacity.

title: Good Choice; Would Stay Again
text: At nearly 100 years old, you feel enveloped in history at the Lexington. Despite its age, it was clean, had a jazzy-themed vibe, and felt safe. The lobby was nearly always bustling. Staff --front desk, valets, housekeeping-- was very friendly and helpful (never saw anyone at the concierge desk, however).

title: Great Stay
text:
Recently stayed here for a stayed in NYC. Great staff members, very helpful, very welcoming.

The only disadvantage to this, they are forcing you to pay a $35USD taxes that pays for other stuff that you will more than likely never use. But for some people, you may..
Rooms were spacious, comfortable.

title: First time in NYC
text: My husband and I decided to stay at Lexington, we got in at a good rate! This was our first time staying in Manhattan. It is a perfect location to subways & bus. Plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance as well. The hotel itself is clean for the most part.
