The walls are pretty thin since I can hear whenever someone leaves or comes to their room every time.  We did not eat breakfast since it costs just as much as some shops with less options. We only used our 35 resort credit once for a nightcap at the Stayton during our 4-night stay. Again pricey, when i can get the same or better at a rooftop bar. So I feel like that 35 resort fee should be optional. Loved having a starbucks nearby! We would stay here again, Marriot did make the experience enjoyable

title: Very Comfortable, Welcoming Hotel, Great Location
text: We spent 6 days in NYC this May.  The Lexington Hotel is a great choice -- the setting is very welcoming, comfortable, and very convenient.  If you use the subways, both Grand Central or the 4,5,6 line are within a 5 minute walk. Also 5th avenue and Central Park 10 min walk.   Most important, the staff made us feel welcome and that they were glad we stayed.  Especially:  Elizabeth L, Arlene G and Lisset -- really helped with our accomodations, and our entire stay.  As well, housekeeping was excellent, really good.  If you are a Marriott loyalty program member with any "elite" status, the staff really treats you as a highly valued guest -- total no-brainer for any visit to New York City,

title: Can’t beat location and price!
text:
You can’t beat this location and price. Walking distance to most places, with the subway and Grand Central conveniently close by. Stayed here 4 years ago and as great as I remembered 
We checked in with Philippe and he was wonderful! So welcoming and helpful 

Keep in mind that this hotel is 100+ years old, in mid town. Rooms/bathrooms are small. Air circulation / thermostat is great though 
There is a full gym in the basement (Crunch) which is excellent to use, better than a regular hotel gym
An abundance of restaurants & coffee shops close by, with a wide variety of cuisines and price ranges 

The staff for room service / front desk / valet are all extremely friendly. They have umbrellas available to borrow for rainy days 

The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the Destination Fee. It is $35/day, however it is more of a credit that you can apply at the Stayton room on the main floor. This initially sounds great, however their breakfast brunch is $30 (very basic, no omelette or crepe station, your typical continental breakfast) or drinks ranging from $15-$25 each which is very high, even for a hotel lounge. If you stay a few days and get a few of these cards, you cannot combine them for one seating either

All in all… I would stay here.. AGAIN!!

title: Spring Time in NYC
text:
Another AMAZING stay at The Lexington Autograph Collection.  This was our family’s second trip to this particular property in the last 6 months.  We decided to head back once the weather warmed up to explore Central Park among other parts of the city with our 4yo daughter.  

The location of this hotel is outstating!  Close enough to all the culture without being overwhelmed by mid-town chaos. Walking distance to many thing and access to subway hub 15 blocks away.  A nice mix of business types and non-business types.  Definitely a safe feeling for our family at this location and zero riff raff hanging around.  I think the door men do a good job of keep it moving out front.  

The real shining star here is the staff in our opinion.  Friendly, outgoing, and accommodating.  We were there 3 days and must have interacted with one of the GM's, Randy probably a half dozen times while coming and going.  It was nice to see hotel brass accessible to the guests and engaging with them.  The staff was quick to answer every question we had and addressed every need.  If they couldn’t grant a request, they offered an alternative solution for us.  Our room was clean and smelled FRESH!  You know that fresh room smell – total game changer.  

Lastly – this place offers an AWESOME breakfast each morning.  VERY fresh fruit, eggs, potatoes, a protein, milks, juices, and an oatmeal bar.  A fantastic way to start your day in NYC and save some cash! At breakfast each day we were greeted by Stephanie and Omega at the hostess stand and they made us feel very comfortable and welcomed.   

Do yourself a favor and book a stay her for business or pleasure any time of year.  Whether traveling with your family or a colleague,  you absolutely cannot go wrong with The Lexington!

title: Love the Lex
text:
I have been a fan of the Lex for a number of years.  I was really bummed when it closed down for Covid, and rejoiced to see it open again.  

I like the style and history of the property, the cleanliness, the location and the excellent customer service.  The other thing that I appreciate is that the Lex treats frequent Marriott Elite guests well, recognizing that for folks who travel frequently, little touches matter and the perks that come with that status are earned, and mean a lot to the guest.  Well done Lexington!

title: Super disappointed
text: The location is great, and the room was pretty quiet. However, we were shocked by the amenities fee. They charge $35 a day and then say you can use vouchers for the bar, breakfast, or dry cleaning. Breakfast costs one voucher PER PERSON. It’s a very generic eggs, sausage, fruit, bread buffet. Even for NYC, that’s not $35! We asked to opt out of this and were told we could not, although I just read of other guests who were allowed to. There was not a mini fridge nor water in the room, so I’m not sure what kind of amenities we were paying for. We also went to the bar one night and ordered 2 glasses of Malbec, gave a voucher, and were still charged $20. So $55 for 2 glasses of Malbec?? Additionally, we have been to hotels all over the world and this is the first time we have ever been charged by the hotel to just store our luggage until our room was ready. How is this even a thing?? Very disappointed. We will not be staying again.

title: Checkin at the Lexington Hotel
text:
We checked in yesterday for a 9 nights period.
Lisset at the front desk gave us an excellent service accommodating us in a very nice room for a long stay.
Her attitude was excellent in all respects!!!

title: Anniversary Stay
text: What a great hotel to celebrate an anniversary (26 years ago we spent our honeymoon n NYC).  The accommodations were nice and spacious.  We had a nice view of the city from our corner room.  There is a nice restaurant in the hotel and a few others which are walking distance from the hotel such as the Lexington Brass and  Joe's Dumplings NYC.  There is a nice  coffee shop across the street Ole & Steen.  Shout outs to the staff are a must for great service, help, and recommendations.  Thanks to Lisset, Nicole, Marcie and Breda.  And of course the doormen Juan (and only) and Derrick who had me download the Curb app for taxis.  Curb is cheaper than Lyft and Uber. The app was convenient.  Final props to the manager Kelvin Rodriquez for giving me suggestions on  how I could teach my online class in the evenings and so much more.  We will be back again. We were treated like family.  Thanks again to everyone at the Lexington Hotel.

title: We loved our stay! So will you.
text:
Don’t let the few bad reviews cast any doubt. I’m glad I didn’t because I really enjoyed my extended weekend at the Lexington. The vibe of this hotel is awesome, especially for “post” pandemic travel. It’s gorgeous too. It’s not your typical hotel decor/lobby. 

In fact, I was pleasantly surprised to see how many people were there and active in the lobby. The restaurant bar was reasonably full and it was nice to see hotel/travel coming back to life. 

The person I dealt with at the front desk was awesome. Really warm welcoming and friendly. I believe her name was Marci. (I hope I got that right). We stayed in a room on the 24th floor and really enjoyed it. It was a reasonable size considering we are in the heart of New York City. Speaking of which, the location is such a gem. It’s far enough from Times Square yet close enough to the action. No matter which direction you take  you’ll find something to do. Everything’s walkable and accessible. 

We had the same room staff every day and she was awesome. Always smiling when we saw her in the hallway and made sure we had everything we needed as far as towels and face cloths. Our room always looked great when we came back.

My stand out memory was in the dining area. We went down for brunch, which by the way is a really good brunch. And we were greeted by Omega the Food & Beverage Director. He spent time talking to us to find out how we were enjoying the experience, whether we liked the food and the service, and made sure that we were enjoying our stay. He even made arrangements with us to connect with one of his managers Malik in the evening to extend the hospitality even further. And the bar staff definitely knows how to mix a good drink.

At the end of the day for me it’s the little things that make an experience at the hotel awesome. From the hotel desk to our room attendant to the hospitality in the restaurant/bar to the front door guys (who are so warm and fun) there is not a doubt in my mind that we’ll be back.

title: We like this hotel
text:
The Lexington Hotel has been our “go to” hotel in New York since before the pandemic.  We eagerly awaited it’s reopening.

The hotel is one of the Marriott Autograph Hotels, meaning it is a unique property.  It has several connections with history and celebrities, as the Marilyn Monroe pictures attest.

It has a good midtown location at Lexington Avenue and East 48th Street.  The rooms are clean and quiet. It’s an old building, so the walls are thick.

We like it a lot, but there are negatives.  The rooms are on the smell side.  The bar is closed on weekends, at least at the time we visited.  There was no breakfast buffet at the time we visited either.  I am assuming these kinks have been ironed out.

The pricing is pretty attractive for Manhattan.

title: Fantastic staff and location.
text: I am a noise sensitive traveler and understood that a quiet room in New York City would be challenging. I can tell you that both Arlene and Randy went way out of their way to provide me with several options at the Lexington hotel.  Their efforts made all the difference as I had a wonderful stay and slept very well. I would definitely return!

title: No Longer the Classy  Historic Hotel It Once Was Before  Marriott BonVoy
text: Once home to Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggio, you'd think the design team at Marriott would respect the bones of The Lexington and preserve the classy atmosphere.  Elements of authentic architectural details  are still present, but the interior decor of the public spaces and rooms are hideously decorated with cartoony wall murals, ugly furniture and nightmarish wall paper . Location very convenient, staff pleasant and good breakfast.   We were not told about the "destination fees" which add 12% to the bill.

title: Gute Lage und freundliches Personal
text:
Das Hotel befindet sich wirklich an einer guten Lage. Man erreicht zu Fuss viele Sehenswürdigkeiten. 
Das Zimmer ist sauber und wir hatten genügend Platz. Das Badezimmer ist eher klein, aber für unsere Bedürfnisse hat es vollkommen ausgereicht. 
Es ist schon etwas hellhörig... aber den Schlaf hat es uns nicht geraubt.

Das Hotel hat einen tollen Stil... "alte" Klasse mit modernem Design gemixt... macht es sehr charmant.

title: The fact that this is an Autograph Collection hotel is a joke!!!
text:
I was so excited to stay at this hotel.  It looked great and in a fun part of town.  I had a Very, very disappointing stay.  I checked in, and the staff member could not have been any less attentive.  She didn't smile; she told me nothing about the hotel (is there a bar, a fitness centre, or what is near).

I had a small room, no mini bar in the room, and no coffee maker. 

On their Hotel Services screen in the room, they say you can have complimentary coffee, tea and water 24 hours a day, ask at the front desk.  When you ask, they say, "Oh no, Only between 06:00 and 11:30 ", so they are false Advertising their services.  The fitness centre is also not open 24 hours as advertised in the rooms.  Just a nasty place all around.  Even 2* South African hotels are usually way better equipped.

I will most definitely never stay here again, and for the price, you would expect a lot more.  I would instead move back to the Hilton Millennium, where they always treat you well and provide excellent service.

title: Best birthday “staycation”
text: Decided to surprise my husband with a weekend in the city, there were so many hotels to choose from but decided to go with the Lexington hotel, what a great decision that was!!! From the moment we checked in till we sadly checked out everything and everyone was amazing! We had the pleasure of being helped by Kelvin Rodriguez and Arlene. Then while having some drinks at the hotel bar (amazing gimlet & old fashion BTW) we chatted it up with Malik, who was awesome!  The room was so cool, each one has a theme, ours was Hemingway! If we’re ever looking to stay in the city again we will definitely be back!! Don’t think twice about this hotel!

title: The best staff ever !
text:
I am a frequent guest at the Lexington Hotel, NYC. There are many things I like about the Lexington Hotel. These include:  the vibe, live jazz , retro look and feel, breakfast buffet, gym.....but most of all , the staff ! Many hotels have great amenities. The differentiation is the staff. Lissette, guest services, Cici, breakfast host, Kevin and Louie at the door,  Albon, Brandy and Kush , lounge.... all make my stay enjoyable! Great job always by the Lexington team !

Chuck Martin

title: Great Older Hotel
text:
Fine older hotel. Clean,super well-run, but bathrooms and windows need updating. The bar is excellent but pricey.

Lots of elevators - no waiting.

Very pleasant lobby.

Convenient to everything - best location you could hope for in Midtown.

I would gladly stay here again but might bring my own plunger...

title: March 2022 Business Trip
text: Randy and Breda were very accommodating when I had a last minute change to my reservation during a recent business trip. Both were quick to step in and support and make this a great experience while staying at the Lexington. Thanks again Randy and Breda!

title: Good enough for a solo trip
text:
Welcome to New York! I got an upgraded room but it was super small. Not sure how regular rooms look as this was a better category. While in the bathroom it was difficult to turn around it was that small. Rooms are noisy. There is no lounge but they gave me vouchers for the bar. I didn’t have breakfast. 
There is a Starbucks attached which works well. You get breakfast with a higher Bonvoy status. Hotel was pretty busy. Staff was nice they let me check in early. In General staff was nicer than expected from New York. For the right price it is a good choice also in terms of location.

title: Old and NOT an Autograph Collection. Somebody must have paid Marriott to get the designation. How sad
text:
Tired, worn hotel. Bathrooms run down. Calk all around moldy bath tub seams.

I would not expect anything special from this hotel.

It must be easy to get a designation from Marriott Management.

New York is still a very expensive city to visit.

title: Dudley KY NYC 2022
text:
I appreciate the room upgrade. I appreciate the resort fee waiver. However I do not think a few should be charged for bike rentals, exercise equipment and internet? I found it baffling to want to charge for internet and it’s actually free according to two employees? But thank you for waiving it.

My biggest issue with the hotel is no one except the front desk made any attempt to check on us or speak to us. I had to pay $6.00 for my bags to be held while waiting on check in. There was no mention of my birthday which was the reason for the trip.

Also there needs to be a mini fridge in each room.

The location is decent for shows and that area. However a good walk to any decent attractions. One thing that can’t be controlled but should be is grabbing a cab. It seems like the cabs always grab people at the Intercontinental Hotel before this one. 
Lastly I know NYC is noisy. However until the last day, no one mentioned the headphones we could of used. I just happened to run into them while placing at them for storage.

title: Lexington hotel stay
text: Thank you to the Lexington hotel for making my stay easy and organized. And a special thank you to one of the managers, Wesley, for taking the time to help me with all my questions and concerns. He went above and beyond.

title: Very good location, enjoyed our stay but bed not overly comfortable.
text: We were able to walk to Times Square, Broadway theatre, Madison Square Gardens, Radio City Music   Hall and more, yet avoid the chaos that surrounds a hotel located right near Times Square.  My only real complaint is that the bed was quite hard.   If that’s what you prefer, you will love it… but if you prefer something softer, you may feel like you are sleeping on a wood board.    Good service at the bar downstairs, but it closes around midnight - maybe even earlier on weekdays.   So if you go out to a concert or other activity that runs later, don’t expect the hotel bar to be open when you get back. Rooms were reasonably sized for New York.   The view was limited to just the street below and the building across the street… but that’s what you often get in New York.   Overall a good stay, but the bed issue was enough for me to look elsewhere for my next trip to NYC.

title: Great hotel in an ideal location
text: We stayed here for 3 nights whilst we were in New York & it was just perfect. The hotel was built in 1929 but has recently been updated & as far as possible modernized. The lobby area & lifts have been decorated in 1930s art deco style which reflected the decade when the hotel was built. The rooms which are on the small size - no room as far as I could see was twin bedded - reflecting the age of the building & they don't have a mini bar but other than that my room had all mod cons. Check in was very quick & the hotel offers free bottles of water to all its quests. Our rooms were on the 8th floor & had excellent wifi, separate bathroom with a shower over the bath, flat screen TV, hair dryer & toiletries. Again the bathroom was not that large but for me was more than adequate. In the lobby there was a bar area to the left which also served breakfast . The bar didn't open until late afternoon. The hotel is perfectly located with many of New York's attractions within easy walking distance. The staff throughout were excellent, very friendly & helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there & if I ever get back to New York I would stay there again.

title: Lisset: Phenomenal Ambient Customer Service!
text: Pretty remarkable - the line to check was moving a little slowly and I joked maybe a little too loudly to a friend I was meeting up with - by the time I got to the counter, Lisset was there to explain the delay and without asking quickly took simple steps to create a truly warm customer experience at check-in. It’s the little things done well that make all the difference. Also the Lobby looks amazing now!

title: Anniversary Trip to NYC
text:
Fantastic property!! Service was excellent, Juan at the front door was very outgoing and provided exceptional recommendations. Our room was clean and comfy. We did stop at the bar a few times for cocktails, service was great and drinks were well built!

Great first trip to NYC, we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Good value with minor exception
text: Pros:  solid location, older property renovated to high standard, great 'jazzy vibe' decorations and public spaces, staff extremely nice and helpful, esp. housekeeping.  room clean, attractive and one of the best bed mattresses I've experienced in quite some time; did not use workout facility so unsure how good it might be.  a well-known coffee shop easily accessible off the lobby.  Con: the bath.  simply too small in dimensions, but being an older building.... the fixtures and all were nice/updated and very good shower, just not a lot of room.  Overall:  I would stay there again; my husband wasn't so sure simply due to the bath.

title: Value on Lexington Ave.
text: The Lexington Hotel is the perfect for hotel for any trip--Business or Pleasure. The accommodations are comfortable, the location is accessible to everything-- the staff goes above and beyond to accommodate all needs. An added bonus is that if you're seeing a Broadway show, the hotel is in walking distance. To not have to look for a taxi after a show is a special bonus. I would especially like to shout out Lisset, Nicole, Jose, and Calvin. They were able to help with any minor issues as well as make some great suggestions. Safe in my room didn't work and Calvin the manager came to my room immediately and made sure it was fixed. Lisset made sure I was able to have the room I wanted. And though the hotel was extremely busy with Spring Breakers and St. Patrick's Day revelers, the staff took the time to help with everything. In a big city like NYC, it's great to have staff that treat you like family. Have already made reservations for another stay.

title: Actual Hotel OK, Billing and Breakfast Awful. $600+ overcharge.
text:
We checked out this morning. The actual hotel is fine. Rooms are nice, beds are comfy. The billing is a total disaster. 

We booked two rooms on Marriott.com. One room included both breakfast and parking. The other I booked with Marriott's Stay for Breakfast rate. Despite that, and despite only bringing one car, each of our two rooms was charged each night for parking. 

We were also told repeatedly that our rate did not include breakfast despite opening the Bonvoy app and showing the restaurant host and front desk person the reservation page for each room that clearly stated that our rate included breakfast. Breakfast was sparse -- this morning at 9:30 when we went down, there was one mini croissant in the pastry case, the yogurt fridge was totally empty and the coffee on it's last gasps. There were scrambled eggs made from a mix and some bacon. 

The hotel has a mandatory $35 a night per room "amenity" fee. The only thing the $35 can be used for is the lounge in the lobby, which, if you don't drink, is a total waste. There are only 5 items on the menu -- pizza, guac and chips, hummus and 1 pita, a quesadilla, and a charcuterie board. They were always out of the charcuterie board and one of our party can't eat dairy, so,  last night, we used 1 coupon from each room to order 1 hummus and pita order for each room and 1 diet coke. Despite using the coupons, EACH room was charged $74+ for 1 small tub of hummus and 1 pita. Let me be clear -- this is $158 for about $6 worth of hummus and two pita rounds. 

We were then told we should have used the amenity coupons for breakfast which made no sense as we explicitly had breakfast included in our rates. 

The "amenity fee" also includes wifi, which is already free if you are a gold Bonvoy member like I am, so . . . .it's basically a ripoff. 

So, now, between the food (which we should not have been charged for on either room) and double incorrect parking charges, we were overcharged by over $600. When I left, they were still unable to remove one of the incorrect bar charges for $74.oo as the "bar manager" was unavailable and I will now have to follow up by phone, which is always a total pain. I am not looking forward to chasing down the manager and checking my credit card bills to make sure wrong charges did not go through for the next week or so. 

Watch your bills carefully if you choose to stay here. This was a real mess. The location is decent and the rooms are clean, but the front desk really needs work.

title: Great mid town location for a business trip
text: Stayed for business recently.  Room was typical NYC - definitely tight, especially the bathroom but the amenities were good and wifi was strong.  They charge you a resort fee but you can use that as credit for bar food/drink which I did and that was just fine.  Got buffet breakfast there and it was more than adequate.  The fitness center is closed but the hotel will spot you a visit to Crunch Fitness in the basement - that's a better trade as it has everything that you can possibly need.  Staff was very pleasant.  My only gripe, which isn't really the hotel's fault, was that the room/suite next door decided to throw a party until late in the night and then the couple proceeded to have a fight well past midnight - clearly the walls are too thin to handle that, but again, it's NYC, what can you do?  Price was reasonable, so couldn't complain and the food/gym made up for it.

title: Not recommending AT all
text: The first room we had was not in good shape, old, half of one faucet handle missing, radiator making loud sound once in a while at night. We were assured around 11pm that there would be a room available next day and as long as our luggage is all packed the hotel will arrange for moving them to the new room once the room gets available. (Which was great and understandable). The manager asked for a follow up next day from us as the shift would change. Long story short, by 10pm next day our luggage haven’t been moved and I called 5 times and each time was rather told, yes we will move them and last one was well we can’t because you are not here for us to move it (and after explaining that we were all packed and this is what we were told, again yes we will do so). Finally my husband moved them once we got to the hotel. With the contradictory reception I was not sure we will have a new room once we get back to the hotel. The second room is way better but the picture speaks volumes of how 2nd room looks. Go figure the first room.  I won’t comeback and I don’t recommend it. It’s the worst autograph hotels I have ever seen. Took the office to send us towels 1.5 hours as the new room had 2 big towels for 4 people after I called 3 time the second night (after the shift change, it finally happened).

title: Spacious Room, Great Breakfast, Friendly Staff
text:
We had a great experience at the Lexington hotel in Midtown East. With NYC hotels, it can be hit or miss and the Lexington Hotel was certainly a hit. Our room was spacious featuring a couch section, a kitchenette corner, and the bathroom. We were also thankful they re-opened breakfast for in the lobby, which was excellent (and had plenty of healthy options). Free bottled water at the front desk was a convenient touch. Overall, in a city with so many hotel options, Lexington was great and we’d consider staying here again.

The only reasons I’m leaving 4 stars instead of 5 were that 1) they completely ignored any pre-check in chats using the Marriott app (including inability to use Suite Night Awards), and 2) they did not have the Citibikes codes available which constituted part of the required amenity charge.

title: Wonderful stay & exceptional service!!
text:
My fiancé and I were nervous coming to NYC with our toddler. We require space and a quiet environment. We expressed our concerns to the Front Office Manager, Kelvin Rodriguez who went out of his way to ensure these conditions were met. Him and his team exceeded our expectations from the moment we checked in to checking out. We were greeted with curtesy and friendliness. The front desk agent gave our baby a complimentary teddy bear from the hotel. We also enjoyed complimentary bottled water throughout our stay. The room was very clean and room attendant was always friendly. Our room faced the inside of the building so we did not encounter noise and we had a small kitchen where we were able to take care of our baby's meals. We loved staying at this iconic property. The lobby is beautiful and inviting and the staff made our stay pleasant and easy. 

We will be recommending this hotel to our family and friends.

title: Amazing Weekend
text:
I stayed in this hotel with my cousin and friends for a 21st birthday in the Ladyella sweet and it was everything we could have wanted!! The bedrooms were super comfortable, private and spacious both with gorgeous en suites. I loved the balcony views since we were on the 18th floor it was very special. 
The staff and service was brilliant, we were left a great selection of snacks and soft drinks and everyone was so kind. 
I had an incredible and fun weekend here I would recommend this hotel for any occasion:)

title: My daughters 21st birthday
text: I have to say the hotel were just incredible - I flew my niece in as a surprise and they were aware and very accommodating to keep her as the surprise - Wesley was superb and organized all including setting up my Marriott membership and Arlene arrived to the room and surprised my daughter with balloons !!! Amazing experience and can’t wait to stay there Again - very warm and personable hotel staff !!! The room was just amazing and the views stunning -thank you !!!

title: Memoirs Forever <3
text:
Being in the same room as Marilyn Monroe is more than enough words. The elegance, art deco, the luxury and comfort, picturesque suite, all adds to an unforgettable experience. Add the unequivocal service - equals the perfect stay !! A special thank you to Arlene G. who really took good care of us!

 A once in a lifetime experience that one would want to do again or at least, let others, experience the ambiance. Forever Memories <3 
                                                                                                                                  William Jr Yap

title: It was definitely a DISNEY EXPERIENCE!!! We shall be back!! 🥳
text: My family and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel! We celebrated my brother’s birthday and valentine’s day. The experience from the moment we checked in  to the moment we left the hotel was just amazing! It was definitely a “Disney experience”, from the warm welcome at the front desk, to the friendly staff and the cleanliness of the room! I also wanted to give a shoutout to Arlene (Manager) for making sure that we got everything that we needed. She provided us with a 5 star experience. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our family and friends! We cannot wait to come back!!

title: Stunning hotel, fantastic location and SUPERB service
text:
Having stayed at the Lexington Hotel NYC on more than one occasion this is definitely my NY hotel of choice!  With so many hotels to choose from in Manhatten, it may be overwhelming to find the best fit but the Lexington hit everything for me.

The check-in was smooth and we were offered water, a smile, an upgrade and a tastefully decorated lobby.
Our room was amazing and we had the Hemingway Suite which is a real treat for anyone looking for the super extra special touch!  
Our room was spotless, huge and the cleaning service was 5* STARS.  Hilda and her team are what make hoteliers stand out from the crowd. 
The gym (Cruch) has amazing fav

Thank you for a MEMORABLE stay at Lexington Hotel and I will be back again soon from London with friends!

Noah

title: Would recommend - review from a Travel Agent
text:
We stayed at the Lexington from 25 December 2021 - 01 January 2022. First impressions were great, the hotel is really beautiful from the outside and the entrance to the hotel is very grand and luxurious. The doorman was always very friendly and said hello each time we passed. 

This is a really nice area to stay in. The streets are very clean and they are so long that you get a nice city view down each one. The Lexington is only a short walk to the Rockefeller, Grand Central etc. The walk to Times Square was around 20 minutes. We stayed in one of the DoubleTrees near Times Square for a night beforehand and that wasn’t a great experience due to the street being quite rough and full of trash.

We were treated to a free upgrade at check in from a Standard Queen room to a Standard King room. Our room was HUGE… especially for New York standards. It was clean and well decorated. The bathroom looked modern but the shower was a bit outdated. It worked fine (if a little noisy) so this didn’t bother us, plus it was always clean. There was a hairdryer, a safe and an iron and ironing board in the room. These were all nice touches. 

There is a $35 resort fee per night. This fee is standard in NYC but the price varies from hotel to hotel. This fee is supposed to cover access to the Wi-Fi, free bike passes and credit towards breakfast at the hotel and the lobby bar. We didn’t use any of this and my booking confirmation actually said the fee would be $25 per night. I mentioned this at checkout and the fee was discounted by $70 so we were happy with this. 

The hotel lobby is beautiful. My partner and I met in New York in 2016 and we were returning to get married at City Hall. We took most of our photos in and around the hotel. 

Overall, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay again!

title: Pretty basic for an Autograph hotel
text: No executive lounge. No breakfast. Bar wasn’t even open, so couldn’t even use food & bev credit—because of this, management did remove the $35/day resort fee when requested. Room was comfortable and location was handy, but it was more like staying in a nice Courtyard than what I expect from Autograph. Bellman even charged for luggage storage before our departure flight.

title: Fantastic experience at The Lexington!
text:
Our check in date was 12/1/21 which included me, my wife, and our 3.5yo daughter, which is a monumental task in NYC.  The check in staff was very friendly and offered us waters upon our arrival.  There were some challenges with the reservation from my end but the staff worked through them with me and remained patient even though I was probably annoying them…  The wait was not even noticeable for my wife and our daughter because the lobby was clean, fun to look at & explore, plus almost all the patrons had masks on which made our family feel more comfortable.

The staff was so kind and focused on my positive experience. They were able to recognize and quell my aggravation because of the mix up which was my fault. So much so, they offered a small upgrade to a room with two beds.  This was greatly appreciated because it allowed our daughter to have her own bed and mom/dad to share comfortably. We graciously accepted.

The room ended up being amazing! Spacious, clean, very comfortable.  You could tell the staff took pride in cleaning the room thoroughly.  Rooms like this are hard to come by when staying in this part of town on a family budget. We were very happy that we made the commitment to stay at The Lexington, Autograph Collection.  After a long day in NYC it was great to kick back and relax at such a great location.

What happened next is really the foundation of what drove me to write this review. We were undecided on a dinner spot so we thought a call to the concierge would be helpful.  Just our luck the concierge was unavailable – but by the grace of God we got someone even better who by happenstance had stayed late that day.  The stars were aligning for us!

In fact, I now believe this person is the person who the concierges probably call when they need something.  Queen of the castle, the hostess with the mostess, Brooklyn’s finest, The Lexington’s Operations Manager aka Ms. Elizabeth Lopez!  Within the first 2mins of my call about restaurants, I felt like I was talking to an old friend who just got me.  It was wild and totally unexpected.  We probably talked for about 15-20 mins and eventually my wife started laughing and was like who are you talking to? I said, our family’s new favorite person! 

Elizabeth was filled with great suggestions and ideas for our family.  The information and patience Elizabeth provided totally enhance our hotel and NYC.   

About 10mins after the call there was a knock at the door.  Elizabeth sent up a robe for my wife and 2 keepsake teddy bears for our daughter.  I must say 2 teddys was a veteran move, considering she lost the first one that night somewhere in NYC .  But of course Elizabeth already knew that would happen and was ahead of the game, hence two teddys!

Elizabeth, the check in staff, and the auxiliary staff should be commended privately and publicly by your organization for their professionalism and ability to assure that a new customer would become a return customer.

Typically I don’t provide reviews for positive experiences.  Like many other people I only speak up and fire off emails when things don’t go my way. Which I admit - is completely ridiculous and unfair to businesses.  This year and moving forward I am making the effort to give credit when credit is due for exemplary customer service experiences.  Not just blasting someone or some company when I don’t get my way…

title: Great For a Longer Stay
text: We were staying in NYC for 10 days, so we looked for a hotel a little away from the hustle bustle of Times Square and settled on the Lexington in Midtown, which was close to Grand Central. Very Clean Lobby and the reception were extremely helpful and easy to speak to. Phillipe was brilliant, because we were staying for a longer than usual stay he upgraded us to a bigger room free of charge and sent a Kettle, Coffee Machine and Mini Fridge Straight to our room, and generally along with the other staff was friendly and helpful across our whole stay. The Stayton Room is a cool place to chill, I don't drink but the great bartender made a lovely non alcoholic Mojito. The hotel room itself was fine, nothing to shout about, NYC hotel room aren't ever going to be huge, but everything worked and there was no issues. The Room Service Staff were great, we had a particularly lovely lady across our stay, the only thing I would say is that hotel rooms may need a thorough vacuum once in a while, under the radiators we saw quite a bit of dust that looked like it had built up over time. One of the most important aspects of a hotel room Shower Pressure - A rating!

title: Excellent location and friendly service
text: This hotel is on 48th Street just around the corner from Lexington Avenue. It is a great base since it is just a few blocks from transportation all over the city at Grand Central and within walking distance of Central Park and many other venues of interest. The doorman was super helpful on arrival as were the check in staff. My room was modern in its decor, comfortable but was a challenge to optimize the heating. Initially it was too hot but after turning down the thermostat, I was not able to heat it again adequately for the 48 hours that I was there. There is an excellent wireless system. No breakfast included. Mask use required in public areas. There is an excellent but pricey bar/restaurant on the ground floor. There was no coffee or tea in the room but there is an excellent Danish coffee shop a half block away on Lexington Avenue. Given the convenience, decent accommodations, and friendly service, I would stay there again.

title: Won't be staying again
text:
Stayed in this hotel December and I most certainly won't be back! The room was only okay, no breakfast included and there was an air conditioning unit outside our room that was always running all day and night.
However the main reason I won't be staying again is that the hotel charged my credit card for someone else's stay! I paid for the hotel prior to my stay and was asked upon arrival for my card details as a security deposit which was fine. However the card details were actually put against another person's room while they were there. I was charged over $650 total for this mistake and I had 3 different members of staff tell me that there was nothing charged to my card. Only when I got my bank involved did they realise their mistake. Extremely unhelpful and slow throughout the entire process.
All in all,  there's a lot nicer hotels who I'm sure wouldn't make the same mistake in New York!

title: Great hotel,great stay
text: Stayed for Christmas, first night we were a bit cold and that was as bad as it got, asked  and recieved a couple of blankets within 15 mins. Room was lovely, spacious, and very clean. The was room was cleaned and beds made daily. Breakfast  was very nice, reception  staff very polite and helpful, I would say one of the best hotels we have stayed in.

title: Winter Break
text: The Lexington Hotel is in a great location. Most midtown Manhattan sites are a short walk away. It is tucked away on a quiet street so if you don’t like noise, this is a perfect spot for you. The rooms were small but manageable for 2 people. The worst part of the room was the pillows on the bed. They definitely need to invest in better pillows, they went flat as soon as you put your head on them. It definitely made sleeping a bit difficult/uncomfortable. Overall, it was a nice stay, it was very nice that the $35 resort fee could be used for drinks at the lobby bar. If you are looking for a nice place to stay in a good location the Lexington hotel is a good choice

title: Ok hotel - as long a
text:
The Lexington Hotel is in a good location. It is close to Grand Central Terminal as well as the shopping on Fifth Avenue and other mid-town attractions. It is also on a quiet street away from some of the noise and crowds, which is nice. The rooms are very small (even smaller than hotel rooms I have stayed in throughout Europe) but this is not an issue if you're planning to spend most of your time exploring the city.  However, I would say the room is almost uncomfortably cramped if you plan to spend more time than just sleeping. A king-sized room is just big enough to fit the bed and two nightstands with a very narrow walk-way between the dresser and bed. There is a desk and chair but no other seating options. Due to COVID we opted to do more dinner/take out and had to basically eat on the bed as there was no where else to eat. The hotel charges a $35 destination fee which does provide a $35 food and beverage credit in the bar for drinks or breakfast. It can also be used towards laundry or a fitness pass. Unfortunately, I would say that breakfast is incredibly overpriced, and is a very basic American style buffet that is $29 or so for adults. The food is served on the bar and certain items i.e., oatmeal was at an uncomfortable height for anyone that is petite. Several tables in the restaurant/bar are also not large enough to comfortably accommodate plates and drinks. We decided after day 1 that the breakfast was not worth the price (as the destination fee would not cover it all for 2 people).  We did try to have drinks in the bar another night but when asked they only had two non-alcoholic options (lemonade and fruit punch) and no hot beverages. So, this was not really an option if you're with someone who is not drinking or able to drink. The hotel offers no water, coffee, or tea in the lobby for guests (nor does the bar have it) so if you want those items you have to buy it from the Starbucks next door. There is also no coffee or tea offered in the hotel rooms. I found the hotel lacking amenities I normally see in Marriott properties (including ones in NYC).

The hotel will require you to prepay $100 a night for incidentals. I have never in 8+ years (several of those as platnium elite) of frequently staying at Marriott properties encountered a prepaid incidental fee. Upon check out I expected this to be immediately refunded but it was not showing up as a credit to my credit card.  When I called the hotel, I was told it takes 3-5 business days for this to be refunded back to me, which seems excessive. When I asked for the person to put this in writing she refused, nor would she articulate to me why she couldn't since she told me the 3-5 business days was the hotel's policy/standard practice.  By this point there should be no question as to the state we left the room in and quite frankly no reason the fee was not refunded to my card by close of business today. Instead, it seems as though I'm loaning the hotel $400 over the course of 9 days. I found the customer service-person that I spoke to about this point to be dismissive.

While this was our second time staying at this hotel - I would say the main reason I would choose it is the price as it sometimes is cheaper than other Marriott properties.

title: Christmas In The Big 🍎
text: We have just spent a great 5 nights here in NYC from across the pond. Firstly this hotel wasn’t our choice as part of  a BA package but we’re certainly glad it was! It’s very busy and within easy reach of all what The Big Apple offers for tourists. The reception staff are very helpful and friendly and will help you with any queries you during your stay. Our room was a double and was kept very clean and tidy during our stay so thanks to housekeeping, if you require a kettle /coffee/ tea just ask and one will be provided. Overall we had a fab time and enjoyed our stay here and if we visit NYC again would book this hotel.( final note….if storing luggage you will be charged $3 per item which should be included in the rate we think?)

title: Do not stay here if you have a car
text: I travel 30-60 days per year and routinely stay in Marriott hotels, but I would not advise staying here if you have to have a car valet parked. Probably the worst travel experience I have had in the past 5 years. I was harassed by the bellhop who made me sit in the car and wait 45 min for someone to come and valet park it. Then when it was time to leave, I called 90 min in advance to get the car delivered and when I showed up 90 min later, they had not even told the valet to move the car. Everything inside the hotel was fine, manager and hotel staff were polite, but this experience was simply terrible.

title: Great service.
text: Busy weekend in NYC and there were only King beds available. When checking into the hotel, Philippe noted that there was three in the family and offered a rollaway however asked us if we would prefer a double-double room. We explained that we knew that two beds was not available.  Philippe searched the system and found us two beds. It is this kind of service that changes the dynamic of a family trip. It allowed us to get the valuable sleep so we could truly enjoy the city from morning to evening. Thank you Philippe.

title: We're Gonna Need a Higher Rating!
text:
This is one of those times where I sincerely wish this site allowed me to give a hotel MORE than five stars. The Lexington Hotel deserves a constellation's-worth.

To give you some idea of what a sterling impression this hotel made on us, we have not only already booked a return visit, we opted for one of their Specialty Suites!

Why? Many reasons. The hotel itself is perfectly located. Rooms and all public areas are 100% spotlessly clean, with the high degree of preventative sanitation so important to travellers, especially now. It's also just plain *beautiful*, especially the holiday decor in place during our visit.

Yes, there is a Destination Fee, but at the Hotel Lexington, you actually receive *real* value for the cost. Your $35 per day is redeemable for $35 in food/drink daily. This, in addition to other amenities included in the fee. WELL worth it!
Drinks at The Stanton Room bar are generous. The breakfast buffet is lavish, with plenty of hot and cold choices. 

Our room was cozy, comfortable,  and well-stocked with amenities. The bed was a dream!

Above all, the Hotel Lexington gave us some of the finest Customer Service we have ever encountered. It began at check-in, where we were privileged to have Virginia take care of us. She is a treasure, no other way to say it. She knows that professional skill and efficiency can still go hand-in-hand with warmth, caring, and a true *welcome.* 
Every other employee with whom we interacted at the Hotel Lexington was also wonderful, but Virginia's kindness, help, and attention really are among the top reasons we're coming back, and to a suite. She's the best.
We're looking forward to it!

title: It is perfect place to spend the days in New York
text:
The location is perfect, especial for Broadway plays.
The room is clean, it is small, but I guess is good size.
The lobby of the hotel has a lot of chairs and tables, some people bring pizza and eat on the tables.
I recommend the hotel for business travels and couples.
The service in the room is limited, No coffee machine, no small refrigerator.

title: Hôtel classique bien placé
text: Hôtel new yorkais classique, idéalement placé à Midtown East. Parfait pour arpenter NYC de long en large et profiter de la ville. La chambre (située au 21ème étage) était de belle taille et la salle de bain équipée d'une baignoire. La literie était très confortable. Le jour de mon arrivée, n'ayant pu disposer de ma chambre qu'en fin d'après-midi, j'ai laissé ma valise mais cela m'a coûté 3$. Un peu dommage ! Mon séjour a été agréable grâce, également, à Philippe, à la réception, qui a répondu à toutes mes questions et réglé, avec un efficacité, un petit souci d'intendance (ma chambre n'avait pas été nettoyée et le problème a été résolu sans délai). Merci à lui pour son accueil et son professionnalisme. Le petit déjeuner (inclus) était correct mais rien d'extraordinaire . Ne souhaitant pas m'installer dans le restaurant, je remontais dans ma chambre pour le consommer ; cela étant, pratique pour débuter la journée. J'ai, aussi, profité du "guest service Laundry" et j'en ai été très satisfaite. Le jour de mon départ, j'ai disposé de ma chambre jusqu'à 4 pm ; bien agréable. J'ai passé une belle semaine dans cet établissement. Un regret : l'absence de plateau de courtoisie (et de bouilloire/cafetière) dans la chambre (mais bouteilles d'eau à discrétion).

title: No complaints
text: While this is not a 5 star resort, we found the Lexington to be more than adequate for our needs. All the staff were very pleasant and personable. Having stayed in other New York hotels the room was a nice surprise, it was large other than a small bathroom but not a problem . The location was great. Was not disappointed .

title: Very disappointed
text:
Really bad hotel. 
I was given this hotel after booking the Hilton metropolitan. I never chose this. I thought the hotel was in a good location.  
No breakfast. 
No concierge
No view
Bad WiFi
Staff don't care
Everything in the hotel is either broken or needs replacing. This hotel is very tired and needs refurbishment. Showers don't work properly. Bar shuts at 8pm. No restaurant. I only get caught once in life and this hotel won't get a second chance. No safe. I brought $10,000 dollars which I was worried about upon arrival. 
Everything in New York is at least 30% more than anywhere else in the world. Don't buy designer brands or any presents. Nowhere in New York is open in the morning before 11am. FACT.. People say time square is open all hours, ITS NOT AND THEY ARE LYING. Trying to find food before 11am is almost impossible. No kettle at all. Dont cater for vegans at all which is the same as the whole of New York.  Breakfast is open 6am till 9am in the hotel but not good for vegans.

title: Even for New York Standards, this place is rough.
text:
The rooms are incredibly small, the price is high, the lobby is chaotic and too small for the number of rooms.  There is a destination charge that gets you nothing.  This hotel really had no redeeming factors other than being in a good location.

Location:   The location is great.  I give it that.  

Platinum Recognition:   Zero.  They didn't even offer breakfast at check-in.  I would have had to ask for it.  No talk of any benefits or upgrade.

Condition:  Average at best. 

Service:   I only interacted with one person, a check-in agent, and it was fine...maybe rushed.  Definitely was not told about anything, just given a key and rushed on.

Rooms:   Micro sized rooms with absolutely no view.  You aren't staying in NYC for the rooms though.

Breakfast:   N/A, but I believe it was in the restaurant as a platinum.  The restaurant did look packed at breakfast.

Final Notes:   With all of the options in the area, I would never stay here again, even as a Marriott loyalist.

title: I really wanted to love it again
text: I really wanted to feel the magic again and my expectations were absolutely rock-bottom but unfortunately no go. The check in line was almost to the entrance door. It took five complaints to get them to fix my room’s temperature to be below 82°. Was told to open a window. After being extremely uncomfortable and FIVE asks and five times being told they’d fix it, yeah I’m pretty irritated and they act like it’s your unreasonable issue. Housekeeping was really poor, noticeable stain on the bedspread, I had exactly one towel of any type, slow draining tub and they didn’t make up my room at all one day. The hotel itself does seem extra clean, you can tell they cleaned in the corners, cleaned the carpet etc. After reviewing my folio I noticed the $35 day destination charge which I didn’t mind when the hotel had a bar but it’s still closed. Not an impressive welcome back at all.

title: Mis-Advertised and Over Priced
text:
We were very excited to come stay at an Autograph Collection hotel for the first time. We booked the Conservatory Suite, which is supposed to be a specialty suite. Wow the room was nice and the decor was great, but it stops there.

There is a $35 per night destination charge which is supposed to include all types of "goodies" including a food credit for breakfast, rental bikes and more, however nobody told us about how to take advantage of these at check-in. We had to ask about it later and was comped the fee because they didn't tell us.

The bathroom is super small and the toilet is wedged between the sink and wall. The bed, supposed to be a queen, is a full size with a king size headboard. See the attached pics where I layed out note pad papers which are 5" in length. The bed measured 55x75, by no means a queen. After first day of housekeeping visit they took all our washcloths and left no replacements. 

Starting at 6am in the morning you start hearing and "banging and bumping" type noise non-stop until at least 11pm or later. This noise and banging was so loud at least every 5-10 minutes it would rattle the pictures on the walls and you could feel it in the floor. When we called about it the first night an engineer was sent up to investigate and was not only amazed by the noise but also baffled and needed to see if he could find out what it was. Later we were informed the noise was service elevator. WHY would you put a Luxury and Premium Suite next to something like that? Looking at previous reviews today and found someone else mentioned the same noise in 2018. Apparently they are not concerned with having this resolved.

title: Natale a New York
text: Posizione ideale per concedersi qualche giorno a spasso per New York. A due passi da Central Station, Cattedrale di S. Patrick e Time Square. Buono il servizio e le camere sono comode, pulite e accoglienti. Ottima esperienza . Sicuramente da ripetere.

title: Lovely property, great location, pint-sized room
text:
I go to NYC once a month to work in the corporate office and usually stay in Midtown near Penn Station, but decided to try The Lexington because it was close to where the office holiday party was being held.  Check in was smooth, but I was shocked by the size of the room. Yes, I know NYC hotel rooms are small unless you’re willing to fork over big bucks, but this room (2225) was really small.  I had to close the bathroom door to sit on the toilet.  I am not a small person, but not not morbidly obese, and I barely had enough room on the toilet because it was between the sink and a wall.  The  bathtub was extremely deep and I was terrier to get and out of it. The room does not have a fridge.

A breakfast buffet is included, and it was very good: eggs, bacon, sausage, breakfast potatoes, oatmeal, cold cereal, fresh fruit, etc.

title: Totally overpriced Hotel
text: There is absolutely nothing good that I could mention with this hotel. The rooms are small, the bathroom tiny, no real shower but a very old bathtub with a plastic curtain, not renovated for the last 10 years. The windows do not close/open properly and therefore it is very noisy in the night. The air-condition doesn't work properly, the beds are too short for someone taller than 6.3ft, the bed linen are thin and it is freezing cold at night. If you book a room for two people, only one breakfast is for free. If you want to leave luggage at the front desk, you pay 3$ per piece. The breakfast is absolutely standard with not much choice and at a level of a Best Western Hotel. And all of this at an astronomical price for a standard room. One of the worst experience I had in my life at that price level!

title: Dirty feel
text: Room was dirty and we felt gross staying there.  The carpet in the room was coming up, stains on the lampshades and bed sheets, dust all over the windows.  The window also has a very bad draft as if the window wouldn’t close all the way and the room was so cold.  We barely slept due do those issues.  The positives were the desk staff and bell staff were very nice and the location was great.  Cleanliness is the most important thing so that is why this review is so low and we will not be back.

title: Smokers and unhealthy air
text: Unfortunately The Lexington violates the New York State Clean Air Act and does not uphold their own Smoke Free policy. They allowed the room across from us to continue smoking despite MANY requests to the front desk desk and security. My son suffered a serious asthma attack and ended up in ER and I still have not had reply from the General manager despite several emails. ZERO stars for breaking the law.

title: Super Thanksgiving Break
text: Visiting family in NY.  Wanted a convenient, comfortable place to stay and The Lexington was fantastic.  We love the Marriott Hotel Autograph Collection.  The integrity and style of the hotels always infuse the environment where they are located.

title: Wonderful retreat in the city.
text: We found the hotel to be excellent.  The hotel was an easy walk to view the Thanksgiving parade, and the sights at Rockefeller Center and on Fifth Ave.  The hotel is located near lots of restaurants and shops.  The service staff was helpful answering our questions and requests quickly.

title: Great to be back!
text: We love The Lex! It's been part of our Thanksgiving tradition for years. It was so good to be back in 2021. Great service. The location is perfect for walking to the Macy's parade, skating and shopping at Rockefeller Center, and visiting with family. We love having an afternoon cup of coffee on the mezzanine and taking an annual holiday photo in front of the tree. The Marilyn Monroe vibe is fabulous making this a unique hotel in NYC.

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is in a great location for walking to theatre, Central Park, 5th Ave, subway.  Excellent breakfast (only buffet) . Cost $30.  Some good restaurants nearby.  The destination fee wasn't included in the confirmation e-mail.  Marriott should include any extra fees.  The fee could be used for breakfast but only for 1 person in a room.

title: Good location, disappointing stay overall
text:
Good location in midtown, but had to move my room due to a very loud pipe "dripping/tapping" throughout the night. Second night, had to have mngt enter room next to me at 2am to turn off their overly loud TV. Same guests woke me up at 8am to very loud "physical activities" on a Saturday morning. Also very disappointing toiletry items - very cheap quality and all different brands (soap, shampoo, body wash). Plus my first room's tub had peeling porcelain and some peeling wallpaper.

When I mentioned to front desk I wasn't aware it was a Bonvoy property, he almost seemed embarrassed by the association, "We are NOT a Marriott, we're just affiliated with the loyalty program. And you can't get any points since you booked via a third party." Had I KNOWN it was a Bonvoy, I would have booked through them directly.

Overall, I wouldn't spend the money for this stay unless you really want the location. Although there are plenty of other nearby hotels likely offering more premium experiences.

title: Amazing hotel
text: I came in early to the city and just hoped I could drop my bags, however Lisset absolutely gave me the white glove treatment and I could not be happier. She helped me get checked in incredibly quickly, made me feel welcome, and put me in the most beautiful room. I hope The Lexington / Marriott know how lucky they are to have such an incredible talent like Lisette working for them! I travel constantly for work and know how rare it is to have someone really connect to help make a stay better, but she absolutely did that for me and I will be back because of her.

title: Amazing Stay!
text: We have a great weekend getaway. What a fantastic place to stay, the staff was very polite and the rooms were very nice and clean. They were able to let us pick from different room options in order to avoid construction noise. This was very thoughtful. We will be hopefully coming back.

title: Someone walked  into my room
text: Unbelievable experience experience where an employee walked into my room with no knock at 11 pm.  Can't get anyone to answer the internal phone. Finally called outside number and then a "manager showed up. Took no accountability and offered no remedy. Horrible experience.

title: Loved the workers and location, quality not so much
text:
Every encounter we had with an employee was so pleasant and very helpful. We first got helped by Lisset at the front desk who was so nice and friendly welcoming us to the city. She was able to accommodate our asks and was so pleasant. 

Every time we phoned for extra blankets or towels (because they often weren't replenished or just didn't come with enough) the employees would have it to our door within 10 minutes! Amazing. 

The location is great and has a starbucks in the bottom. Literally cannot ask for a better location. However, for the price I would hope for a bit higher quality. We had issues with our shower drain and then eventually had to be moved rooms because our security latch for the door was broken. While they accommodated us, I wish the quality was just overall higher. Overall a good stay. I might stay here again with a deal. 

Oh, also no mini fridge?? and the room was TINY. Come on now.

title: Weekend trip
text: Nice hotel located in a great area short walk to central park, short walk to times square.  Room was clean and good sized.  Staff was friendly and very helpful with any questions we had.  Would definitely stay at the Lexington again.

title: Still Coming Back Up to Speed
text: I have stayed at this hotel many times during my visits to Manhattan. It is in a great midtown location. It is a short walk to 5th Avenue, Central Park, the Broadway shows, and many great restaurants. There are several subway stops within a short walk to allow you to easily explore the city. It is a beautiful hotel with a great lobby. I've always found the staff to be attentive and courteous. The rooms, while small, are generally comfortable and beautiful. On this trip, there were a few issues that, while not big, took some time to work out. We did not have any washcloths or a bath mat in the room. It took several requests to get that taken care of. I had to go down to the lobby at 11 pm to make a third request. They ignored the request on the Marriott app. We also did not have a coffee maker in the room. I requested it on the 11 pm lobby trip only to have them bring coffee pods instead of the coffee maker. They corrected that eventually. I am a titanium member on Marriott Bonvoy. They upgraded my room, but this was the smallest room I've ever had here. That was ok because we spent very little time there. The Lexington also charges a destination fee. They didn't tell me anything about what that fee got me upon check in. That is something the hotel should do. I believe a lot of these issues will correct themselves as the hotel gets up to full speed from the COVID shutdown. We will give this hotel a shot again, but may look at other options.

title: Another Great Stay At The Lexington
text: The Lexington is my "go to" hotel in NYC. Great location, comfortable rooms and excellent service. The property was busy and it's clear the hotel has bounced back nicely from the COVID-19 pandemic. The only lingering issue is the lobby bar has not yet reopened. I was very fortunate to receive an upgrade to a suite, which was perfect as we were visiting the city to celebrate our daughter's engagement. Again, this is a wonderful hotel that will not disappoint.

title: Good location
text: This hotel is well located however, I do not think it is comparable to other Autograph collection hotels I’ve stayed in.  The rooms are in need of additional amenities . At the time of my stay, the restaurant was not open after breakfast which is not ideal.

title: Overnight in Manhattan
text: One night stay in NYC for business.  The Lexington is close to where I needed to go and is a a location that is convenient to many amenities in Midtown East.  Property was clean and fresh looking and staff was helpful despite key system being down when I checked in.

title: Don’t Bother, a 2 star hotel posing as 4 star. Our room is nothing like the ones on the website
text: We checked in around 4.30 and had to wait at reception for 30 minutes before a room in our category was ready. My husband is a Marriott gold elite member but we were using the regular check in desk. The room we were given us NOTHING LIKE THE ONES IN THE WEBSITE PICTURE.  It is now 6PM and we still have no bath towels at all. They are apparently all out. I won’t be staying here again and I will be ditching Marriott as a hotel of choice. This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel. It looks like a 2 star.

title: Would never book again
text: Very disappointed in this property. Wi-Fi is horrible. Beds, pillows and linens are bad. Lobby is busy and dirty feeling. Restaurant still closed except 630-930am for a less than mediocre breakfast. Housekeeping is inattentive or maybe just doesn’t have towels and shampoo but everyday something was out or missing. I know it’s NYC but if you get a room on the side with construction happening, good luck sleeping. Spend your time and money elsewhere.

title: Amazing employees
text: I've been long haul cabin crew for nearly 28 years. It takes a lot to impress me. Having been furloughed for a while I got used to home comforts. Staying in this hotel was a wonderful welcome back to o travelling. The warm welcome and exquisite service, which the team who work here make look so easy and working in hospitality is not. I have to mention Calvin and Arlene. Both really had the extra something something that just blew me away. If I ever open a hotel I will round to head hunt them both!

title: Great hotel, centrally located.
text: Very nice hotel and centrally located. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Lobby is welcoming and spacious. Breakfast buffet has a nice choice of hot and cold items, fresh fruit and pastries. All self-served so bring a mask while serving yourself.  Surrounded by wonderful restaurants and shopping. Would stay here again.

title: Superb hospitality
text: The Hotel has high standard and the rooms and beds are comfortable. Though the staff always meet me with a smile and take car eod what ever request I have had. Adding the cosy lobby and bar it means <3

title: Personalized and Quaint and very clean
text: This boutique hotel surpassed all expectations.  Beautifully decorated, surprisingly spacious rooms for what was expected in NYC, and friendly staff.  Personalizes birthday card and surprise made the experience memorable.  Great location for shopping and touring.  Very, very clean.  The fitness room was open and ample and having a starbucks in the lobby was a bonus too.  We will be back!

title: Excelente hotel en NY
text: Quedamos gratamente sorprendidos del hotel The Lexington Autograph Collection, la ubicación es inmejorable, las instalaciones increíbles, las habitaciones perfectas y todos son muy amables... lo recomiendo absolutamente

title: Favorite Midtown East Hotel!
text:
The Lexington is our go-to hotel whenever we stay in Midtown and we are definitely going back. 
The service was primo from the moment we drove up until we checked out. Our room was spacious, spotless and comfortable. Delicious, extensive buffet breakfast was included. 
As they were closed during part of the pandemic, we’re thrilled they’ve opened again, better than ever. Highly recommend-

title: Fantastic Upgrades for Loyal Frequent-Stay Clients
text: The Lexington is my go-to property pretty much three nights  a week every week for business travel in NYC. Conveniently located at 48th and Lex, it is a historic boutique hotel that helps me feel as if i have a home away from home. Friendly staff who personally greet me, small but clean rooms, and upgrades when available.  On my past trip, i booked/paid for a Studio King yet MUCH to my surprise, was upgraded to the Ella Fitzgerald Suite, the largest accomodation in the hotel and exquisitely appointed. Living room/dining room, kitchen, foyer, seperate bedroom, extremely large bathroom with two showers and an outdoor rooftop patio w/ furnishings and greenery.  I had not even asked for an upgrade or applied any of my credits.  I highly recommend this hotel for business travelers, couples and solo travelers.

title: Best hotel and great location!
text: My wife and I stayed for the weekend, amazing location and incredible service. The staff was friendly and check in was a breeze.  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  Overall, great experience !

title: Nice quiet hotel for business trip
text:
The Lexington Autograph Collection is located within one block of my corporate office.  The rooms are clean, nicely appointed, but a bit small.  Good for NYC!  I am in hopes that the Stayton will reopen for evenings soon.  But with good restaurants nearby, it’s okay for now.  
The staff is excellent and all staff members who I encountered were pleasant and professional.

title: NYC
text: We were fortunate enough to have a friend recommend this hotel for our short stay in the City. We were WOWED with our room accommodations and ended up on the 27th floor with a corner view that had a balcony on two sides.  The hotel was conveniently located to everywhere we wanted to go.  I'm glad we changed our room reservations from another hotel to the Lexington!  The staff was very accommodating and friendly.

title: NA
text: I’ve been traveling to NYC for work for many years, due to covid my first trip back in 12+ months was October.  Having spent so many nights here at The Lexington, it was great to see familiar faces at check in, they remembered me even with a mask on. If your looking for a place where the people that serve you, just act like good people, check it out. There are a lot of places to stay in the city, I stay here b/c of people.

title: Lexington Weekend
text:
Nice place with tiny rooms and even tinier bathrooms.  They charge you $35.00/day for things you will never get to use ...but maybe once.  There was no coffeemaker ... 
But the lobby was beautiful and everyone was very nice ... The mattresses need replacement as they are very soft. ...TV was great and security very good.

title: Lexington - Marvelous Midtown
text: I stay here frequently for work and the location is prime - walkable to Park Avenue, Grand Central Station, 2nd/3rd Ave restaurants, etc.  The property is well maintained and the staff is friendly and attentive; it has a cool vibe too!  Rooms are small but well-appointed.  New since my last (pre-pandemic) visit: free use of the Crunch Gym on the lower level - what a great facility.

title: Disappointed
text: For a luxury Collection supposedly, this is a big let down. As a Marriott Ambassador level member, this was the first time a property did not meet the description on the Bonvoy app. Rooms badly in need of renovation. Green water from bathroom taps, old beds that were thin and hard.  Paintwork chipped from corners of walls, bathroom so small you literally have to lean sideways sitting on the toilet or you are jammed against the vanity sink. Breakfast resembled a Residence in and not a Luxury Collection property.

title: Excellent Stay
text: On my first trip to NYC I stayed at The Lexington. It was lovely, the staff were service-oriented, the housekeeping staff kept my space very tidy and clean. The location was perfect for my purposes and very convenient.

title: Comfort and convenience in Midtown
text: Spacious and well-appointed rooms in an updated vintage setting.  My room had two full bathrooms and two closets - brilliant!  Close enough to everything in Midtown and a short walk to Grand Central.  Front desk staff was so friendly - thank you!

title: Great Hotel, Horrible Beds
text: My husband and I recently stayed two nights at The Lexington on our trip to NYC. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was great.  The bellmen and doorman were very helpful, holding our luggage when our room wasn't ready yet and then again when we checked out, hailing a cab for us when we needed.  The room was lovely with blinds that kept it nice and dark in the morning.  The bed, however, was like sleeping on a slab of concrete.  I have never slept on such a hard bed!  If a comfortable bed is important to you, it's just something to be aware of.

title: Business and pleasure
text: This was a business and pleasure trip. Very friendly attentive service. Very clean and well designed hotel. Lots of perks and extras, and we’ll equipped for business or pleasure. Great location. Shhhhh.

title: Normanesque & Norma Jean
text: Cool images of Marilyn Monroe & Joe DiMaggio flank you to the left and right as you enter the hotel lobby which leads you to an eclectic yet inviting lounging area. We found the staff to be extremely courteous, engaging and happy to see us. Randy, the Front Office Manager was extremely helpful in answering any questions we had about the area in mid-town Manhattan. The room was beautifully furnished and the beds gave us a much-needed respite from our long drive from Virginia. The self-serve breakfast was spot-on with multiple hot & cold options. Highly recommend this hotel. Excellent location near Central Park, Grand Central & the subways.

title: Great staff, great location, great suite!
text: We really loved this hotel.  The lobby is so pretty and location is convenient to a ton of great spots in the city.  We appreciated the discounted parking in the garage, although it was several blocks away.  The staff members who greeted us were the nicest ladies ever!  Lisset talked to my 7 year old, gave her a coloring book and a teddy bear with the hotel logo on the bear's shirt.  My daughter loved it so much that she dragged it around the city with her.  She also gave us a room upgrade to the beautiful Arthur Godfrey suite.  We have never stayed in such a fabulous room in all of NYC and we have been many times.  It had a huge bedroom, two full baths, a bar, large table and living room.  We loved the radio/broadcasting theme and the fantastic views of the city from the 22nd floor. The bed was SO comfortable. We were also given free breakfast for being titanium Marriott members and it had a lot of good variety.  Lisset even comped the added on room fees since the bar was not open when we were there.  We will definitely be back!

title: The Lexington NYC
text: Although some of the rooms did not live up to the Hotel's on-line photographs the service at this hotel certainly made up for it.  Every single person was kind, helpful and extremely pleasant. When we expressed our disappointment in the first room given to us the Manager Arlene worked with us to find a solution and we ended up with a very lovely room. We had a nice experience with the hotel- great sheets, comfortable bed and perfect location.

title: Great time in NY
text: Went to NY for a couple of shows on Broadway.  This was a great location to walk to time square, restaurants and shows! Breakfast off the lobby in the morning was over the top with lots of variety of food to start you morning off to a good start to enjoy NY for the day.

title: Very nice hotel
text: The Lexington was the perfect place for our long weekend stay. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location is great, we walked to most everywhere we went.  The rooms have been nicely updated.  Highly recommend and would stay there again!

title: The Lex Let Me Down
text: I'd previously stayed at the Lexington and had a good experience as an affordable and conveniently located Marriott property. This time was really disappointing. After in getting in late from the West Coast on a Thursday night, I was woken up by some of the loudest construction noise I ever heard at what would be 4:30 am West Coast time. I looked out the window and saw there was an active construction site across the street. You could easily shout to the workers if the windows opened. It may as well have been in my room. I went down to the front desk and they dismissed me saying "Well, we don't usually get complaints on weekends anyway." Nothing was done to accommodate me or change my rooms. Of course, there was construction work on Saturday morning as well, which mercifully didn't start quite as early. I tried to reach out to hotel's management through the complaint link in the wifi, but of course nothing. This is what Titanium status gets you, folks! A room across from the maid closet and construction noise at 7:30 am. Also, brave of them to bring back the breakfast buffet, but maybe this is one place where you actually enforce mask compliance? Gross. I'm sure now someone will reach out with an empty promise to "make it right the next time." Sorry, there will be no next time.

title: Just as fine as ever
text: I have been using Lexington fr 3 decades, following it from the dark brown classic interior to the frsh modern look of 2021. Of course I miss the dining experiences being open everyday, but thatwill be back, I am sure.

title: Excellent One-Night Business Stay
text: From the moment of arrival for my first pandemic business trip in over 18 months, the stay at the Lexington could not have been better. Easy check in, extremely clean facilities, and courteous and professional staff, this will absolutely be my go-to and preferred hotel for all stays in the NY Metro region. Will be returning soon!

title: Charged me an additional $750!!
text: My overall stay was okay, but I was extremely shocked when the hotel billed me an additional $750 to my credit card on file after I checked out! I called the hotel to get more information on the matter but no one answered. So i then had to call my bank and dispute the charge where they opened an investigation and eventually reimbursed my the wrongful charge. Hotel never even bothered to get back to me. extremely unprofessional and a hassle to say the least.

title: Uncommunicative and frustrating
text: I booked two rooms for a work trip. They never sent me a confirmation email. I only had reservation numbers from my receipt. When I emailed for confirmation, they gave me two different 'confirmation numbers.' I then asked for a confirmation packet/email/trip details...you know, they things that are usually sent when you book a hotel. They never sent it to me. So I had basically no information. I had registered both rooms under the same name, though I believe I had to enter the secodn guests information as well.
