Nonetheless, when the second guest came to check in later on, after the first one had already checked in, they tried to turn her away because the reservation was not under her name. She had to argue with them to get into the room that was booked SPECIFICALLY FOR HER. And to top it off, the rooms themselves were not at all worth all the mess. Very, very mediocre. Do not recommend.

title: Why treat any traveler this way?
text: Hotel was far from full but my room opened to an active construction site that started work at 7 am with a birds eye view of the walls of three other wings of hotel.  Absolutely ridiculous for hotel staff to send guests to these rooms when the hotel was clearly not full.  I will not be coming back here!  Complained on the way out and front desk staff mumbled something about it is out of their control...yeah...right!

title: Great Hotel with Fantastic Staff
text: I usually visit New York City several times a year, and although this was my first stay at The Lexington, it will definitely not be the last!  The property was clean, convenient, and the staff was excellent.  Specifically, Lisset and Deny were always friendly, helpful and consistently made sure I had everything I needed while I was in the city.  Because of the consistency of great service and the friendly professionalism of the staff, The Lexington will be my go-to hotel in NYC going forward.  Thank you all for a wonderful experience!

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff! (Thank you Amein!)
text: I had a great experience staying at The Lexington Hotel, the customer service was outstanding (THANK YOU Amein was so friendly and helped us find food at 2 AM). Everything we needed was within walking distance and even found overnight parking right across from the hotel. I will stay here again and highly recommend it. Thank you again!

title: Amazing, but the WIFI?!
text: If this were not a work trip, I wouldn’t mind as much, but I had to leave the hotel for better wifi convection. Other than that, the hotel is amazing. Service and the staff were the best part. Would highly recommend.

title: Nice area
text: This hotel has a nice location but the accommodation was only average. The furnishings felt inexpensive and not to the level I’m used to in this brand. I enjoy the usual upscale feel from the autograph brand and I didn’t get that feeling here. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable though.

title: Great option in NYC
text: This was our third or fourth stay at the Lexington. It's conveniently located only 6 short blocks from Grand Central Terminal making it very easy for us to get to as we come into the city from CT. The rooms are small but well equipped and the staff is friendly and engaging.

title: Not that great
text: We stayed here pre-pandemic and had a great stay.  This trip in Sept, however was not that great.  The hotel still had the restaurant and bar closed (except for breakfast) which was not communicated in anything that I read before our trip.  Even though the basic services were not available the hotel still charged the daily activity fee…I tend to disagree with that policy.  The front desk was the bright spot really working to get us an upgrade when we arrived, however they were unsuccessful.  The ice machine scavenger hunt on the the first night was fun as we did not have a machine on our floor and the adjacent floor’s machine was out of order…so 20 mins later I was back at the room with ice - yea!  I called the front desk about the ice and the room AC not being cold and was transferred around but never could reach a manager.  The response from the front desk was “we just reopened”.  I would look elsewhere, we are as we have another reservation for a trip in Dec, just need to spend the time to book a new hotel.

title: More like a cheap motel
text: Marriott should be ashamed. Some staff is unmasked. Dozens of unmasked guests in the  packed lobby. No room service. Smallest room I’ve ever stayed in. I entered to blasting AC and a frigid room, yet cannot get the heater to work to warm things up. Bed has the thinnest “blanket” if you can even call it that. I’m reduced to covering myself with towels to keep from shivering. No coffee or other amenities in the room. This is a bad joke and most certainly not a Category 6 hotel. Room is in poor condition. This is what I would expect of a very cheap motel.

title: Excellent!
text: After years of staying at mediocre hotels in NYC, The Lexington Hotel is a breath of fresh air. Excellent service from the moment you step out of your car to the check out. Big Bonus - Starbucks is just off the elevators. Room is above average and good for NYC standards.

title: Great location and Lobby
text: I was very surprised with the room being so small and no dresser, The shower did not work right, the sink got stopped up and clogged every time we used it. The auto toilet was turned off. Also, the hours of tea and coffee downstairs was limited to breakfast times, when there was no coffee pot in room. The bar hours were so limited. Other than those things, I'm just glad we used rewards and not paid for it. the price being so much and all these that were an inconvenience to say the least. You really should fix the water issue though, before booking it again.

title: Excellent  Quality hotel and service.
text:
one of my favorite hotels . glad to see it reopened. excellent staff, front desk Manager Wade  Laidlaw goes out off his way to welcome guests and make you feel appreciated as a life time platinum elite member.The hotel operator is empowered and she made all of my requests happen seamlessly quickly, from coffee maker to refrigerator delivery. 
very good breakfast , friendly staff, from doorman to housekeeping.  highly recommended and will be back soon.

title: Lindo
text: Me aloje acá cuando fui a Nueva York, puede ser un poco ruidoso, pero me lo esperaba. La verdad que me encanto, abajo en la entrada había un Starbucks, lo cual fue bastante conveniente. El desayuno muy rico y variado. La ubicación es muy buena ya que estaba cerca de Broadway y muchos locales. La limpieza muy buena. Overall muy bueno!! Recomendado.

title: Family stay in NYC
text: We stayed for two nights in a beautiful suite with balcony - perfect for our family of five. The hotel staff was lovely to us and especially our children. The location couldn’t be beat and I loved having Starbucks in the lobby. I love the original art throughout the hotel - makes staying at a Marriott feel a little more boutique.

title: Front desk staff helpfull
text:
The rooms are small and the hotel is old.  The lobby is nice and very busy with tennis players from the us open 
Front desk staff were  very helpful especially Lisset.   Gym is very hot and equipment needs maintenance.
They tried hard to keep me happy 🌷

title: Go somewhere else
text: Problems with this hotel: employees were not masked and were not  professional or welcoming in their demeanor. Our room was tiny, even though we are Titanium members of Bonvoy. The room had a musty smell! We were charged a destination fee- we stay at the Westin often and never are charged a destination fee. We will not stay here again.

title: Surprised by the lack of masked employees.
text: I've stayed at the Lexington several times and have always enjoyed staying there. My wife and I checked in 8/19/21 and upon entering the hotel we were surprised at the lack of masks on the staff in the lobby and behind the front desk. I understand that people may be vaccinated and feel that there is little risk to themselves but I cant understand how this is a good business decision.  All of your guests may not be vaccinated or vaccinated but with a compromised immune system or the children yet to be vaccinated. Considering that the pandemic is still raging all around the country I would think it a better decision to mask up in an abundance of caution for the employees and the guests staying there.

title: A favorite hotel, but be aware of the destination fee
text:
The Lexington Hotel recently reopened after 14 months of pandemic related closure.  We are thrilled.  We stayed two nights, from Friday, August 13th to Sunday, August 15th.  It’s probably our favorite NYC hotel.

Although restaurants might have pushed up prices, NYC hotels are still quite reasonably priced because business travelers and foreign tourists have been taken out of the equation.  I think our rate was $151 per night.

The hotel is part of Marriott’s Autograph collection, which are the one of a kind properties.  This is an older building, dating back to the early 20th century.  It’s claim yo fame was having Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggio as residents when they were married.

The hotel is beautiful.  It’s ma) gained very well.  The elevators are fast.  The bedding is excellent.  The staff is friendly.

One issue to be aware of is the $35/night destination amenity fee.  This can normally be used as a credit in the hotel bar, but unfortunately, they are still waiting for the reinstatement of their liquor license, therefore the bar isn’t open.  The fee can be used for other things like laundry service, but how many people send their laundry out at a hotel?

We like the hotel a lot, but you need to be aware of the destination charge and how you can use it.

title: Disappointed as a returning Platinum Guest
text: I have been in the Lexington a couple times as I love Autograph Collection hotels, this time was different. The front desk welcomed me with a past due balance that they didn’t know where to charge in my previous stay (that happened two weeks back) when all my cards and information is in my Bonvoy App and  I stay in a Marriot hotel every weekend. Then they checked me in in a dirty room and as i didn’t want to cause travel I let the front desk know just to get it clean. 4 hours passed without being able to use the room as it was full of female hairs (I’m a male, so it wasn’t mine). When I came down AGAIN the front desk told me that they will send house keeping  right away.. Im writing this review an hour after that happen and the restroom is still dirty. I used to love this hotel. But unfortunately  this is not up for the Marriott standards. The front desk agent was making sure that the whole lobby knew i was in a friends and family rate, still I’m a paying costumer and a platinum member of Marriott. This is unacceptable.

title: Great Experience
text: The staff at the Lexington were top notch in every way.  They all seemed genuinely grateful to have us stay with them and were very accommodating of our requests.  The rooms were clean and updated.  overall this was a great value for us.

title: Include this option in your travel plans
text: Very much a boutique type hotel, we arrived for a long weekend and were promptly checked in to our upgraded junior suite. Wesley and his team provided the upgrade in advance of my stay; I reached out the week prior requesting an upgrade which I tend to do all the time as a Lifetime Titanium Elite member.  That's because these boutique type hotels have rooms that tend to be smaller; after all they are in buildings that are older. The suite provided had 2 rooms; a small living room and a larger bedroom. Bathroom however was particularly tiny but manageable.  Again, in these types of properties no 2 rooms are the same so whatever you prefer I am sure the front desk will accomodate. Provided 4 out of 5 ratings given the lack of room service, limited to no restaurants or bar given covid. Housekeeping was timely and detailed. Will consider next visit.

title: Amazing staff, lovely hotel.
text:
We had to find a place to stay during our apartment renovation for 4-6 weeks-a place where we could both work and live life with as little disruption as possible. I searched many different options and even visited several hotels prior to selecting the Lexington. 

We could not be happier with our choice,  after our first day! 

Abbey, one of the sales folks, did all she could to find us a great room even though the hotel was fully booked by the US Open team during the same time we are staying.

 She made herself available via phone and email before our stay, showed me several room options and was genuinely helpful and concerned that we would be comfortable here. 

Allan, the hotel manager,  personally showed me the room they saved prior to checking in to make sure it would work for us temporarily until a larger room opened up. Courtney in housekeeping was amazing-he brought us up a fridge and other things we needed and offered to help in any way he could. A very sweet man!

At every turn, folks have been lovely, helpful and dedicated. They all seem to love this hotel, beautiful and historic, and it shows in the care they take of their guests.  

As lifelong NYers, we know that hotels here are expensive, rooms are tiny and good hotel experiences are hard to come by, but the Lexington will be a wonderful home away from home for us. Can’t wait to experience one of the suites, but in the meantime, we are enjoying the amenities such as a poshy breakfast, daily passes to Crunch and massive common areas to work or just hang out.  

One of the front desk staff even filled me in on the neighborhood pubs and dive bars for us to explore!

This is a perfect place for visitors if you are interested in an elegant, old world atmosphere with all the modern conveniences.

title: best hotel in city
text:
So glad this hotel is part of Marriott family now!  great overall value : location and the staff is extremely helpful.they recognized my status at check and gave me my normal perks and also provided excellent service and accepted the late check out( which is hard to do in the city )

would recommend staying anytime you want to be in Manhattan. Lizza was particularly kind at checkout too.

title: Marilyn Monroe Experience
text: IF you want to feel like a hollywood star then this is the place for you.  Not too pricy, but so luxerious.  I recommend this to anyone I know that is going to be going into the city. This hotel was really clean and the staff are friendly.

title: Great location and very friendly staff
text: Stayed here with my sister and nieces for a weekend getaway. The location was perfect, close to Grand Central and walking distance to other cool things. They just reopened after Covid and renovating. The rooms are very clean and the beds were super comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The tiniest issue - no vending machines, which would have been great for soft drinks or bottled water. We'd definitely stay here again.

title: Staff Was Amazing
text: Was there every step of the way to make my stay easier and more comfortable. The rooms were nice, and I just wish I could have extended my stay by a couple of days. No complaints. Most helpful were the front desk staff.

title: Comfort
text: My only downside was beds are somewhat hard, no coffee machine or refrigerator in room. And resort fee is for drinks or CRUNCH fitness but restaurant/bar is closed.  Resort fee should be waived if all amenities are not operational.  No laundry service either. Due to COVID a lot is understandable.  Location and cleanliness was amazing.

title: Excellent staff
text:
Had great stay here , clean and lovely staff , quiet due to covid restrictions , left a game in the room
And they kindly sent it back to the uk for us. Brilliant position to visit everything and felt safe at all
Times , I was concerned we would be in a bad area but it’s not at all .

title: Lexington Autograph - home away from home!
text: For the past six years, when our travels bring us to NY we are excited to stay at the Lexington.  The staff have made us feel welcome over and over again.  From the moment we walk through the door, until our departure, we feel spoiled and cared for.  We were hoping to return to the Lexington the last week of May, but at this time it sounds like the hotel is closed.   Mr. Wassenhove, we send you our best, our prayers, and hope the Lexington will open again very soon - we miss you - A. Mark Vitti

title: Missing You
text:
With the hotel currently being closed due to COVID-19, I thought management might appreciate a nice review, albeit a historical one.

My wife and I stayed here in August 2015 and fell in love with NYC. After getting off a long flight and navigating our way from Newark, we arrived at the hotel to be greeted with the best service we have ever received in a hotel. Throughout our week long stay, all the staff were so helpful and considerate. We couldn't have asked for more.

Wishing the team at The Lexington all the very best and we hope to come and see you all again later this year when you'll hopefully be open again.

title: Great hotel near theaters
text: We visited in early March and were happy with our stay. The hotel lobby was nicely decorated and the receptionist Lydia was very friendly and welcoming. Our Jr. Suite was a good size for being NYC. It was 1 bedroom with a pull out couch in the living room. The purpose of our trip was celebrating my daughter's birthday by watching a couple of musicals. The Lexington was well located to the theaters. The only downside we ran into was the restaurant. One evening we tried to get a late snack/light dinner at nearly 11pm and weren't able to. We were told the kitchen was closed. I then remarked it was okay and would order room service and was told there wasn't any room service. Of course we weren't happy about that because we were hungry. We managed to find something at a market across the street. If a hotel as a restaurant connected to it then room service should be offered. The hotel did offer complimentary water bottles, coffee, and tea in the lobby. Overall it was a good hotel and experience. I would stay here again. I would just keep extra snacks in the room. =)

title: 60th Birthday Present
text: Hotel was in good central location, walking distance to most attractions (weather permitting). Staff were courteous,friendly and accommodating. Room & Bathroom were clean and adequate but not the largest.  All in all good value for money.

title: Excellent
text: The stay was pleasant as usual the staff were great smart and helpful they were knowledgeable and polite christin at front desk was amazing along with Jose he was always a big help  the door staff and the f&b staff were courteous and kind

title: Really nice hotel in NYC.  Usually reasonably priced
text: I stay regularly at the Lexington as I frequently attend religious services at the Kabbalah Centre across the street.  The hotel has a cool vibe.  The lobby has a lively bar with live music and perfume is pumped in the air.  I love the Marilyn Monroe/Joe DeMaggio theme that runs throughout the hotel.  The staff are helpful and friendly.  I almost always get a good price.  Easy walk from Grand Central Station.

title: Nice art-deco themed hotel. Nice as expected Marriott quality
text: Here is an Autograph property with the same feeling of quality that we come to expect from Marriott. Love the common/public areas, restaurant is good, and a Starbucks is attached to the lobby! And perfectly located at Lexington & 48th Street makes it close to Times Sq and all of mid-town.

title: Terrific Midtown Hotel
text:
I've stayed at the Lexington on my last two visits to NYC and couldn't be more pleased.  First and foremost, the location is fabulous; walking distance to Grand Central and many subway station, it seems I can get anywhere I need to go within 30 minutes from this hotel.
The staff is very friendly and professional.  Check-in and check-out have gone very smoothly for both of my stays.  The doormen and bellmen are helpful and cheerful, the housekeeping staff greets you when you encounter them in the hallways, and the staff in the restaurant area do a great job, even when they're obviously busy!!
Speaking of the restaurant area, I think the concept at the Lexington is perfect.  There are so many amazing restaurant options in NYC, I don't expect my hotel to provide a fine dining option.  What the Lexington does offer is a great place to get a very solid breakfast if you prefer the convenience of dining in your hotel and in the evening, the same space doubles as a perfect cocktail lounge.  The nights I've been there, the bar area appears very popular and it's a very casual and inviting atmosphere.  
I really feel very comfortable in this hotel.  It's large enough to be able to offer some nice amenities (particularly food and beverage) but not so large that it seems impersonal or overly corporate.  It's my new favorite NYC hotel.

title: Family Trip
text: My wife and I and our two kids stayed at this hotel while visiting  New York all the staff were very welcoming and great with the children we were very look after by all the staff and would definitely recommend this great hotel in a very good spot to access all the sites of New York

title: Still the best
text:
I’ve reviewed this property on here before and have felt the need to do so again. 

The hotel is still the best in NY. Great location, rooms, bar and people. The staff here are a cut above anywhere else-especially Irina Borukhov.  Every single time I stay, she ensures that everything goes perfectly, this personal touch is rare in today’s society!

title: Great location
text: I really like this hotel. Great location, good atmosphere, comfortable beds, helpful staff. Complimentary coffee in lobby 24 hrs. Good for travellers abroad when you wake up too early. Would have loved a kettle in the room.

title: Secret Gem
text: I almost don’t want people to find this property. I love the hotel. It is unique and “bubbly” from its self dispensing champagne machine to its awesome staff (Kristin Eisele). Kristin is an amazing host. She welcomes you in like an old friend. One of the many reasons I am loyal to MARRIOTT is the excellent customer service.

title: A 2-Star Hotel At Best
text: I'm a Marriott Bonvoy Lifetime Titanium member, having traveled many decades for business.  My expectations for a hotel room are pretty reasonable...clean room; comfortable bed; good pillows; adequate ventilation; decent bedding; and a good workplace.  I've never stayed at a hotel that offered absolutely none of these, not a single one.  The room was filthy; no blanket on the bed; the heat did not work at all, in spite of outside temps being in the mid-40's at night, and after 3 requests to have it fixed went unanswered; the toilet would not fully flush...I could go on and on.  The only good thing I can say is the staff is friendly, and the lobby is very nice.  If you are planning to spend a good deal of your time at this hotel in the lobby, this is a nice find.  If you want a comfortable room, the Residence Inn just 25 feet away is substantially less expensive, and has infinitely nicer rooms.

title: Nice stay
text:
Nikita was especially nice as was the woman bonvoy concierge  ( sorry I forgot name!) 
Smaller feel hotel. Older style rooms but comfortable. Nice bar for a drink. Good location for walking to shows or midtown East locations. 
Overall an easy place to stay if you want a hotel without bells and whistles ( no robe!), decent amenities at a reasonable price. 
Will return.

title: Great hotel
text: The location is great. Walking distance to Grand Central (and from there pretty much anywhere). Breakfast buffet was OK, enough options and good taste. Service from the staff is absolutely great. Stayed there end Jan20 and prices were very descent. The room was a little small but it is NYC (what can you expect!). Overall great option for a business trip or quick getaway.

title: Favorite New York City hotel
text: I love coming to New York and staying at this property. It has a great mix of modern and old world charm. Irina  and her staff always make me feel welcome.  The location of the hotel is convenient and there’s a parking garage across the street

title: Da migliorare ma nello standard newyorkese
text: Al inizio non sono rimasta particolarmente soddisfatta anzi abbiamo dovuto subito cambiare stanza perché troppo rumorosa e con un problema idraulico importante. Già qui mi ero stranita della disattenzione poi in reception non sempre trovi personale  simpatico e disponibile anzi a volte sono anche scontrosi e con poca pazienza. La camera assegnata era davvero molto piccola e da ristrutturare, igiene da migliorare..diciamo che L unica nota molto positiva è la posizione.

title: Horrible staff in hotel bar and ridiculous prices!!
text:
Popped in to the hotel bar last night. 

Was charged $25 for 2 small bottles of beer. 

Typical America/New York trying to rip as much money from people’s wallets as possible. 

The thing is, I very much expect this in the US and especially New York but what is totally unacceptable is the attitude of the barman who, because service is already charged at 18% on the check has absolutely no motivation whatsoever to provide any level of service at all apart from lifting said bottles of beer and placing them on the bar in front of me. 

His face looked like it actually might crack if he risked a smile or any kind of conversation. Horrible man!! Do not waste your hard earned money here!!!

title: Great location and hospitaliy
text: We stayed at this hotel in December and returned for an over night in February.  The location is perfect for access to anything in the city.  The service and quality of the facility is consistent both times we stayed.

title: Great hotel
text: This hotel is close to everything you need! There is even a Starbucks adjacent to the lobby.  Few minute walk to Grand Central, and within 2 miles of Times Square, Central Park and loads of other places.

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC thanks to Irina Borukhov!!
text: The Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection is my new favorite hotel in NYC thanks to Irina Borukhov! As a Marriott Bonvoy Titanium Elite member, Marriott legacy owner of multiple weeks in Aruba, HW, and CA, and Past President of Marriott’s Aruba Surf Club, I was impressed with the warm and generous hospitality of Irina Borukhov, manager!   Irina treated me like family, and she is simply the best!! I also received excellent service from Phillipe at front desk, Juan, bellman, and Mike in security.  Although this was my first stay at The Lex, it will definitely will not be my last!  Upgraded to Arthur Godfrey suite with 2 baths. Although no room service or Club level, the complimentary coffee, wine, and bottled water were a nice touch.  Great location in the heart of Manhattan, within walking distance to restaurants, shopping, and theater. The lounge in lobby is nice, but small.  I am Greek, and I loved the Greek restaurant, Avra, directly across the street and Starbucks in the lobby.  I look forward to seeing you again in May!

title: Hip vibe. Clean, comfortable, nice location.
text: This hotel has a great vibe when you walk in the door. The bar is hoppin' and serves drinks until the wee hours. the lounge atmosphere of the lobby is very cool. The updated decor is glam 60's and staff are helpful and courteous.

title: The Lexington Hotel. New York.
text:
Great Location. Neat modernised clean rooms, although on the small side which seems standard for New York hotels. Complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby which is a nice touch.
Bathrooms are functional and clean although a little worn and tired. 
Staff are very helpful and friendly.

title: Very well located, comfortable and quiet room
text:
I stayed 2 nights in this lovely hotel. The staff is terrific, the room I booked initially was not available, they immediately offer me an upgrade in the lovely Marylyn Monroe suite !
The room was very quiet and the bed very comfortable. I do recommend this hotel, because you are in the center of’ NYC and you are disturbed by noise

title: Excellent hotel
text: I stayed only for one night, the room was really good and clean.  All the people were very kind and if I needed help, they were there for me. The drinks at the bar were really good. I had a great time, I recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
Stayed at The Lexington Hotel for business on 3 separate trips and will be back again next week. 

The customer service is excellent from Nakia at the front desk at check-in, to Ari Bodner the Sales Manager,and Amanda Keator the Conference Service Manager, to the staff in the restaurant and bar. 

The rooms are very cool and spacious!

title: What an extraordinary secret of a gem
text:
The Lex has been my home away from home for about 4 years now. I go there 9 out of 10 times when in Manhattan. The service is personal and crisp. They actually remember me there. The response to needs is darned near immediate. The housekeeping staff makes it feel like luxury every day. Tip them. They deserve it so much! 

The main thing I love other than a fabulous location in Midtown East is I have only been exposed to the same sort of room a few times. The vintage Art Deco meets mid century meets classy speakeasy feel is expressed through a very cool lobby and the hotel rooms have the coolest variety of layouts. Once I had a large room that had two bathrooms in it. Not a suite. Another was the Arthur Godfrey Suite. If you get a crowbar and pry open your wallet and splurge on this huge suite. Gorgeous. 

The kicker: The Lex doesn’t feel like a Marriott although owned by Marriott. It feels like the biggest value and bargain in boutique hotels you will find in the Big Apple. Go!!

title: Good Room Great Customer Service
text: Stayed at the Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection for 2 nights. The hotel was very close (about 5 min walk) to the Grand Central Terminal. Getting around the city was very easy because of that. The customer service at the hotel was great. The 24 hour coffee, free bottled water as many as we wanted (I have had to pay at other hotels for even 1 bottled water), friendly staff, hotel bar coupons etc. only added to the good experience.

title: Business
text: I’ve stayed here several times for business.  It’s tight, but that’s NYC.  The rooms are decent for the cost.  The bar is fun.  Very cool overall vibe.  A Starbucks attached, so that’s great.  Fantastic location in the city for getting around.  Nicole and Jarinel at the front desk were incredibly helpful. They should get shout-outs.

title: Best Place to Stay
text: Just love feeling at home here!  So welcoming from front desk staff to housekeeping to lounge staff!  The bar has great energy too!  Clean, super convenient location in Midtown and close to Grand Central as well!

title: Great location, comfortable room
text: Perfectly placed for mid-town meetings!  Surprisingly quiet room (I was 11 floors up) for the area.  The breakfast is very expensive, but there are loads of other options, including a Starbucks right in the building.

title: Location
text:
Rockefeller Center, St Patrick’s, Saks all nearby.
Times Square just a short walk.
Great restaurants in every price range in a  5 block area.  
Breakfast deli across the street, Starbucks in the hotel makes breakfast inexpensive and fast.
The rooms are modern, not cramped and the prices are fair.
The staff are all courteous and helpful.
Then there is the free nightcap prior to turning in.
Pelo

title: Meetings at JPM
text:
Prior to my 1st stay in January, I had never visited or stayed at The Lexington.  Well, it was so nice and the Staff was so excellent that I decided to come back with 2 more visits and also had one of my people stay here as well.
I'm mad at myself because I cannot locate the list of names I had that were so friendly, helpful and outstanding.  A few would be Bella - Concierge, Louie and Kevin - Doormen, Lizzette, Donna, Jose', and Gyselle, Irina(Mgr), Rachel in the Bar and Marianne - Bar Server and I know I'm  missing Others and may even have names wrong....sorry!
Again - GREAT JOB TO ALL!
David Horvath
EVP Sales & Marketing - Dr. Praeger's Sensible Foods, Inc.

title: Tired and hugely disappointing
text:
We arrived at 8pm and did not get into our room until after 10:30pm. We were compensated in the form of free breakfast vouchers and a few bar vouchers. The buffet breakfast was so poor that we only used it twice, even though it was free.

Our "deluxe" room was old and tired, the bed uncomfortable and the soundproofing with the neighbouring room non-existent. It was an unpleasant place to be. Given the problems we had getting into the room in the first place we didn't bother complaining as we had been told that alternative rooms on other floors were "exactly the same". All of this was disappointing, really putting a dampener on the experience of the trip. What made it worse was the poor level of housekeeping: every evening I got a drink from the bar and brought it up to the room, at the end of our stay there were 5 glasses still in the room. My electric toothbrush stands up on the shelf above the basin and has a nasty habit of leaving a ring on the shelf which is, luckily, easily wiped away. When we left the hotel there were a whole cluster of rings showing where I had stood my toothbrush every morning and evening.

title: Amazing stay!
text:
My partner and I were at Lexington for 2 nights. We both loved all attention that friendly staff offered us. Nice and cozy rooms, delicious breakfast and very well located hotel. Can’t wait to go back!!
Thank you

title: Good location with a fun lobby
text: Live music in the lobby is a great way to end the day.  I wish the staff had better visibility with the timing of the music and gave me a heads up on when to be there (I missed most of it on a rare day when back early to the hotel).  Rooms are New York cozy, but the music and the "free" drink encourage everyone to spend time in the lobby.  (one drink is included in the "destination fee")

title: Short but not last stay here
text: Great property and great location. Friendly staff and David the Bellman was wonderfully kind and helpful! Good drinks at the bar and the atmosphere was very very vibrant! Will definitely stay here again

title: Beautiful Hotel in an Excellent Location
text:
We stayed here for a week (Mon-Fri) and had a wonderful time.  Room had a nice view from the twelth floor and was a comfortable size.  Shower had nice pressure and plenty of hot water.  Hotel is about 3-4 short blocks to the subway, which is plenty close and convienent to the Upper East Side (The Met) and broadway shows.  Not located in Time Square, but much more peaceful.  Hotel had a nice bar and hotel unexpectedly provided free wine a couple of evenings (Wed-Thur).  Not sure about the other evenings.  Jazz trio was quite enjoyable.  Elevators were quick and plentiful.  Starbucks is attached to the lobby and we enjoyed "Bandit" coffee shop nearby as well.
Definitely recommend and will stay here again!

title: Winter escape
text: Excellent as always, this hotel never disappoints. A last years stay revisited and we were happy to do it. Comfortable, perfect size bedroom. Heating was on point, except on the bathroom in our case we had a glass window right in the side of the toilet.  I still consider this hotel to be very centric and with plenty of places near to eat. We will return

title: Such a hip hotel
text:
This will be my go-to hotel when travelling to NY. Eclectic vibe, hip decor, great rate, perfect location. 
Rooms are small, as expected in NY. Bar food nice, good selection. Love the fancy water station, loved it even more when they swap the water for red wine on Saturday evening 😊

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This is my second time staying at the Lexington Hotel, and I'd happily make this my go-to hotel for NY for the future! The location is perfect, as it's near numerous subway lines, making it easy to get all over New York. It's also close to a lot of key attractions, like Bryant Park, MoMA, etc. The staff are always friendly and courteous, and check-in/out was a breeze. I really appreciate the smaller details like drink vouchers for the on-site bar/restaurant and the bottle of water given upon check-in.

title: Got it all!
text: Location is perfect for uptown, downtown, east & west side. Comfortable rooms, excellent service and a good restaurant/lounge. And then there’s this champagne vending machine in the lobby! (Make sure to take full advantage of the cocktail, breakfast and dry cleaning resort charge)

title: A Perfectly Acceptable Room
text: The Lexington has charming video clips of Marilyn Monroe from "Some Like It Hot" running behind the check-out desks. The bed was comfortable, and the breakfast was delicious, if expensive. The doorman and concierge were helpful. My only complaint was that the cool air rushing from the ceiling was a little too cool, but my husband was able to turn up the heat. Otherwise, it was a very good place to stay, and one is only a short walk from MOMA and a slightly longer walk to Central Park and The Metropolitan Museum of Art. We had a lovely time visiting our friends.

title: Excellent Stay at the Lexington Hotel
text: The Lexington is the nicest Marriott hotel we’ve stayed in in Manhattan. It has a very stylish lobby and tastefully decorated rooms in this boutique hotel. We’ve stayed here several times over the past 8 years and have had great guest service, especially by Irina Borukhov, the manager. As an elite Marriott member, we were treated as VIP’s.

title: Less Than Expected
text:
This refurbished 1929-built hotel with a Marilyn Monroe theme has a warm welcoming cozy lobby and welcoming front desk staff. 
Favorables: 
1/Convenient location: Walking distance from subway stations, landmark attractions, shops, drug stores and restaurants (eg Ashley’s right across Lexington). 
2/Amenities: Hearty complimentary breakfast buffet for Marriott members and early evening wine and hot apple cider in lobby. 
One Annoying Unfavorable: Repeated toilet clogging requiring engineering help (very responsive). The scratched bowl bears scars evidencing prior, recurring issues, probably stemming from need to press side button in place of deactivated auto flush.

title: Great 3 night stay at the Lexington Hotel!
text: My stay at the Lexington on February 18-21 was once again, perfect!.  The front desk staff of Jose, Corey and Lisette are wonderful and friendly and always ensure that accommodations are perfect. Irina and her team always make you feel welcome . . just like family!!!  At the Stayton Room, one of my favorites bars, in NYC, Alban, Valentina and Brittany are fantastic and are so friendly.  I am really looking forward to my next stay at the Lexington next week!!

title: Staff attend Rudeness School for next level bad attitude
text: There’s New York brusqueness and then there’s the next-level rudeness of the staff at the Lexington. You can’t casually be this rude. You have to go to a special Rudeness School to achieve this level of being a jerk to your customers. You have to put in extraordinary effort and go all out to be as rude as humanly possible. You can’t just rest on the easy laurels of indifference.  You have to train like an Olympian in the Rude Olympics. And believe me, the staff here are all gold medalists. Bravo.

title: Save your money
text: Rooms are tiny like a little box 2 people can barely get by each other in it, no microwave, the mattress is so thin, first room we got the window was broke staff acted as if I was bothering them by asking for a different room. The window was completely off track you could stick your hand through the window cold air was just coming in. Staff did not apologize she basically told me that the room I got was a upgrade which is was not it was the exact same room.  Also even if you call an ask ahead of time for early check in you won’t get it. We  were told the day before that we could check in around 12:30 since we had a early flight. We got there at 12 and didn’t not get a room till 3:30 after going to the desk again and asking about a room. After I second day I came back to the room and my key was deactivated staff didn’t give me a $20 beverage voucher that time. Definitely will not be returning.

title: Fantastic Stay!
text: It was great to be back at the Lex! The property is immaculate and the service excellent from check-in to check-out. Attention to detail at every step. Irina at Guest & Member Services is an asset and a champion of hospitality!

title: Excellent one-nighter in the heart of NYC
text:
I recently spent one night in midtown Manhattan over Valentines Day/Presidents Day weekend, and you could imagine there was quite a bit of foot traffic throughout the city and all the hotels.  Despite all of this, check-in was quite simple and made amazing by the attention and courtesy the staff were able to offer.  Particularly a woman by the name of Nicole Hudson was extremely gracious with the willingness to offer amenities that weren't advertised or promoted - amenities I would've completely missed out had she not told me.

Beyond that, the hotel was extremely clean, modern, and offered everything you could expect for a busy hotel in 2020.  I'd definitely return back assuming I could lock in a somewhat decent rate.

title: Beautiful Hotel in NYC With Many Amenities
text: I stayed at the Lexington Hotel during a business meeting in New York City. My colleague had selected it. It was a hugely pleasant surprise! We were greeted with a glass of wine when we checked in and given a voucher to get a free drink in the bar/restaurant. The room was beautiful and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I definintely want to stay there again in the future.

title: Recent Stay at Lexington Hotel
text:
Wonderful location.  Great History.   Beautifully restored.  Lobby is always full of activity.  Very good breakfast for Platinum members.  Very good bathroom amenities.  Popular for return customers.
Would highly recommend.

title: Quite Nice, If you are not picky!
text:
I stayed at the Lexington New York in February, 2020. It took me about 1 hour on Lyft from Newark Airport to the hotel, which I thought is pretty normal. 
The hotel does shows its age but with some urban charm. It was inexpensive, considering the based rate was 159 for that day. With a 25-dollar destination charge and various taxes, it came up a little over 200 for the night. The hotel did provide me a $20 drink voucher and a voucher for the breakfast the next morning. The breakfast was in the "lounge" which was a bar in the evening on the first floor.
The gym on the third floor was nice and clean with adequate equipment. As a platinum member, I was upgraded to a corner room with a king size bed. The room is kind of typical NYC size, not big, clean with simple modern decor, the bathroom is also on the smaller end but functioning well except for the toilet which I found it too close to the wall and toilet paper holder was too close to body while sitting on it. Besides that I was quite happy with my stay. The staff members were friendly and helpful as I once locked myself out and they gave me another card key in no time.
The breakfast was nice for me to get the day started, it is a typical American style breakfast but nicely presented.

title: Location is the only good thing about this hotel
text:
Apart from a great location this hotel has nothing to offer.

We arrived at half 8 in the evening to be told our room was still being cleaned. 2 hours later we were still being told it was being cleaned. Only when the manager arrived did we get a room. By then we’d encountered rude service and been offered a one bed room where we could add a roller bed for our daughter. This was not a solution as the room was too small.

The fact my daughter was feeling ill by 10:30 (3:30 UK time) after a 7.5
Hour flight counted for nothing. We were told people had waited longer and it was due to late checkout of others.

The room itself was cramped, the bathroom tap leaked, the walls were so thin that the couple having sex next door kept us awake one night.

The cleaner was rubbish - after 6 days we had a collection of glasses as these are never cleared, face cloths were not replaced and the bathroom was not cleaned.

For late check in we were offered breakfast, which we took on 2’days. It was okay, but the limited range meant we chose to spend the money and eat elsewhere to get things like pancakes, waffles and French toast.

We did negotiate a reduced rate for the first and second nights and the hotel waived drinks we had. But only when we asked, not after they’d seen us spend 2.5 hours waiting for our room.

Yes, they tried and we got some compensation, but it was a dreadful start to our holiday, the staff were rude and made it clear they had no understanding of the impact it was having on a child, and with lots of other hotels on offer I really would advise anyone to choose another

title: Accomodating
text: The front desk clerk (upon check in) was superb, unfortunately, I don't remember her name, if the hotel gets this review I am hopping they can figure it out who was she was (checked in on 02/15 room 1111), she always had a smile in her face, she answered all my questions very accurate, although the room was very small, we have a great stay.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: Great room and great service. The hotel itself has great character. You don't feel that you're in a cookie cutter hotel. The staff was great at answering questions and providing recommendations. The location is excellent. Thank you for a great experience.

title: Thank you Lexington, Lydia and Nicole!
text: We had a wonderful stay thanks to Lydia and Nicole!! Their hospitality set the tone for a fantastic weekend trip. My daughter couldn’t stop talking about how nice everyone was and wanted to make sure we came back to say bye before leaving the City. We loved our room and how the hotel was just a little away from Times Square. Thank you Lexington Hotel....we will be back!

title: Great service
text: From pre-check to the way the door man greats you to the bartender Albans who always remembers me.  This is my place in NYC.  It is central to everything.  There is a coffee shop downstairs.  Bar was just remodeled and looks great.  Doorman is knowledgeable about the area.  One tip for maintenance the windows were REALLY dirty.

title: I intend to cancel my next reservation given the poor service I experienced
text:
Let’s see, where do I begin?: I received a nice upgrade when I checked in last week. 2804 was nice but it was cold. I ran the heat and ran some errands only to find that the heat was not working. They sent a maintenance guy up in around 11 PM I learned that the heat was not working. I called downstairs letting the phone ring more than 30 times at which point I had to contact the hotel through my app and my text message. They finally sent someone to give me a new room but never offered to help me move my things or to even apologize. When I went downstairs around midnight, I saw 2 guests who were waiting for someone at the front desk. This makes sense given that no one picked up my call earlier. (incidentally, one of the girls said that he did not have a shower curtain in his room!)  

When the clerk finally showed up and I finally got to speak with him, I told him I wanted the general manager to contact me as the service was unacceptable and that it was unacceptable for calls to ring without any acknowledgment. He told me that he was with other guests. I said based on the fact that we’ve been waiting for someone to show up at the desk I had some doubts as to the validity of that account but moreover I wondered why he couldn’t have picked up the phone to simply say can I place you on hold or I’ll be with you in a second. I still have yet to hear  from the general manager. I heard from another guess that they too had trouble reaching someone at the front desk.

Under the arrangement, they were supposed to provide dry cleaning and yet despite leaving it in my room 2802 with instructions, no one ever did that.

The hotel is in a good location but given the difficulties in trying to get anyone to attend to customer service I would not recommend staying there.

title: Not up to Autograph Standards - Old/Disgusting Room
text: I'm a titanium elite member and primarily stay at Autograph collections. This room was literally crumbling away; window/wall leaking; stained curtains/carpet; disgusting. Staff were not helpful/responsive.

title: Bday Celebration
text:
Everything was wonderful.  I want to recognize Lexington employees who played key roles into the weekend.  
 
-  Amanda executed my vision perfectly and provided flexibility when there was a last minute schedule change.  She ensured Guest Services presented all gift bags to my guests upon their arrival.
 
-  Bella at the Concierge and others in Guest Services recommenced great places in the city.  All had great food or activities.  The service at each location was excellent — Davio’s, Lexington Brass, Seafire Grill, and Club Bonafide, and Uncle Paul’s.
 
-  The bar staff, especially Lauren, was fantastic.  My family and friends loved her.  She is such a sweet spirit and excellent representation of a quality member of the Lexington team.  Food and beverages were delicious.
 
-  Simon in Guest Services immediately addressed and resolved concerns.  I escalated issues on behalf of my guests who initially did not get an acceptable response.  I wanted their hotel experience to be comparable to mine.

title: Great location and value for money
text: My wife and I stayed for a long weekend and to celebrate my birthday. We had a fantastic experience at the hotel from quality of rooms, great breakfast and friendliness of the staff. Having drinks and breakfast tickets was a good touch and the quality was excellent. My only criticism if any was that it was very busy at times especially in the lifts and at breakfast. Hey only a minor issue and guess it’s popular due to the good reviews it gets. Great choice of Hotel.

title: Great Stay
text: This was our second time staying here.  Like the boutique feel.  The location is great.  Very accommodating and polite personnel.  Love the mezzanine  - a great place to relax and meet with friends above the hustle and bustle of the lobby.   They offer excellent free coffee, hot tea, and fruit-flavored water all day even though there is a Starbucks attached to the lobby.  The only downside - We stayed in a room with a king bed and although there was ample in the room the bathroom was quite small and tub/shower was awkward to get in - steep and narrow.

title: Great value and central to business
text: I tend to stay away from the Times Square area so when this popped up on my search at such a great rate, I chose to book.  I am Diamond with Hilton so Marriott is never my first choice but nothing compared rate wise to this.  The staff was personable, the room comfortable and quiet, the shower--excellent.  Was surprised by the f & b credit of $20 per day--nive of them to buy me a glass of cab at the end of a long work day!

title: Stop in at the Lex
text: Perfect location for mid manhattan explorers. Easy walk to Broadway, Times Square, Macy's, St Patricks Cathedral, Radio City and Rockerfeller Centre if you fancy some outdoor skating in February. Hotel is lively and quirky with small compact but adequate rooms.  Free coffee and refreshments in the lobby. Clean well equipped bathroom and friendly efficient staff.

title: Unapologetically abysmal service
text:
The customer service at this hotel was abysmal. There was no communication amongst employees. We had requested a connecting room but were not told that it was not guaranteed. When we arrived the front desk staff unapologetically informed us of this And also informed us that they had no record of the phone call we had placed to ask for the connecting rooms.They then put us into adjacent rooms that did not connect. Unfortunately the phones didn’t work so we were still unable to contact our children in the room next-door. They even offered to send someone up to check on the phones but we had been using them correctly, they were just broken. There was no apology for that either. Then the staff called us to inform us of !we don’t know! because the message was incomprehensible.  When we checked back with front desk They had no record of this phone call either. The next morning they Asked us to pack our bags and move them all to one room and that they would move them to a new connecting room before we got back. When we got back this still wasn’t done. Then we went out again and were told it would happen while we were gone that time, but it still didn’t happen. Finally we moved our bags ourselves at about 9 o’clock that night.  

It’s a shame that the service was so terrible because it actually was a nice hotel facility. We did meet one lovely woman when we first got there but as soon as there was any problem I feel like she never made eye contact with us again.

It seems that the employees there are told to just ignore things and maybe they’ll go away. And thank you Marriott because we will be going away and not returning to this facility or perhaps not to any other Marriott facility as well.

title: Best stay for business in Midtown East NYC
text: My stay was smooth and very fun. Our front desk host, Ameen, was very helpful and courteous. He made our stay very enjoyful. Beds were great and rooms were very spacious. The bar is a great spot to lounge and have a good time.

title: Excellent
text:
Nice hotel, well located. All The employees were nice and helpful. The rooms are clean. The breakfast with limited choices can be improved. 
Very nice lobbying with free wine and Friendly bartender. For my next trip, I will come back for sure.

title: Dirty and Outdated Rooms
text: Everything in the room was outdated and dingy - Decor, furniture, lighting, etc. Bath was dirty and tub slow to drain. Incredibly disappointing and far below expectations for an Autograph Collection level hotel. More like a dated Holiday Inn. Lobby is fine.

title: Nicely located, but pretty old property
text: Our room was very cold, because the heating wasn’t working properly. After several demands to fix this problem we have solely received a few vouchers for the drinks in the hotel bar. At the same time we had to sleep with our clothes on the last night of our stay...

title: Interesting hotel, good deal for good location
text: I was in town to visit my mother, who was quite ill (she passed away the following week) so I was looking for a hotel in a good location for a reasonable rate (I knew I wouldn't be spending much time in the hotel).  Check in was very good; the front desk person offered me a mini fridge since I'd be staying a while.  That was very nice.  Unfortunately they delivered the fridge at almost 11:00 at night when I was in bed.  I thought I had reserved  the standard room but the desk clerk told me I was in a larger room.  However, looking at the photos on the website, I think I was in a standard room.  By normal standards it was small but by NYC standards it was fine.  The bed was fairly comfortable and there was a large desk.  The bathroom was small but usable.  The toilet was an auto flush toilet but they had disabled auto flush and you had to push the button to flush it; unfortunately it was hard to reach the button and I had trouble getting it to flush all the way.  The tub is narrow and has a high side you have to step over to take a shower.  There is limited storage space in the bathroom but it's fine for one person.  The hotel decor is interesting and they've tried to give it a trendy look.  The lobby was crowded every morning with people sitting around and frequently busy in the evening with people having a drink.  My husband joined me for the later half of the stay and had breakfast one morning.  It was your typical buffet breakfast at NYC prices.  You are better off going out to one of the nearby breakfast choices with better food for a fraction of the price.  There is also a Starbucks adjacent to the lobby.  The hotel is within walking distance of Grand Central Station, the subway, and buses, so it's easy to get around.  I had to extend my stay several times and the desk staff was very accommodating about this.  They also had free bottled water at the desk that you could take at any time, as well as coffee and tea in the lobby.  My main complaint is the $25 destination fee they charge daily (you also pay tax on this fee).  The fee gets you bar credits and laundry credits, but because I was there visiting my mother and spending many hours with her, I did not get to use my bar credits or do laundry.  You have no choice (it's like a resort fee).  I did agree to the fee when I made the reservation so I can't complain too much; even with the fee the hotel was a reasonable rate, but I hate when I am charged for something I don't get anything for.  Over 9 nights the fee and tax added up to over $225.  The location of this hotel and reasonable rate make it a good choice if you need to be in this part of town and need access to public transit.   The staff was friendly and accommodating and the room was quiet even if they lobby was busy.

title: Manhattan transfer
text:
Great little boutique hotel!
Ideal central location! With plenty of good eateries, as well as bars!
In easy reach of train and bus station. 
Rooms small and cosy! Bed comfortable! 
Staff delightful, friendly.

title: Excellent location and environment
text: Excellent location and environment. It is near centrally located within walking distance of  Rockefeller center, time square, theaters,  shops and district. The hotel environment is very nice and the staff is very courteous and friendly. Highly recommend.

title: Great Overnight Stay
text: Great service Lexington team - we checked in after midnight and you quickly took our car and checked us in with an upgrade. Breakfast buffet was nicely laid out and maintained - we were in a hurry for a college visit and we able to quickly grab a full breakfast and get out the door.

title: Comfortable
text: This is our Place to Stay in NYC. The Autograph provides a Jazz theme, instead of a standard hotel look. The happy hour is always buzzing and the location is great: close to Fifth and Madison Avenues for shopping and plenty of fine dine restaurants.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I stayed at The Lexington for 2 nights on a business trip.  The location was excellent.  Walking distance to many sites and restaurants.  The staff was very friendly.  I enjoyed the 24 hour coffee and tea in the always bustling lobby.  The room was smallish but clean and the bed was super comfy.  I liked that I could open the window a crack for some fresh air.  I will plan to stay again for upcoming business travel

title: Εξαιρετικό
text:
Εξαιρετικό , καθαρό , με ωραία θέα από τον 25 όροφο που μας έβαλαν μετά από αίτημα μας! Δωρεάν καφές και εμφιαλωμένο νερό στο ξενοδοχείο ήταν στα θετικά πριν ξεκινήσεις την μέρα σου !
