title: Great Location. Super Friendly Staff. Fast Elevators
text: I liked this place more than I expected to. Check-in was fast and was given $40 in drink credits. We were given a small upgrade which was nice. Room was typical for the city. Big bed. Little other space. It was quiet, which I absolutely appreciated. Shower was a little sketch and old and unfortunately a bit dirty, but that didn't phase me much. I loved that every time I needed an elevator there was one there quickly and we were up on 20. Made me so happy. I really only sleep in my room and am out and about in the city for the rest. Did I mention everyone was nice? Because the staff made the place so much better. Everyone. The maid asked if she could get us anything extra for our room. The concierge was always friendly and chatty. Just good people who seem to enjoy their work. Now the bar, that was an experience. it's a lot low-brow. Was great for people watching. The drinks were bad but free. I will definitely be back to the Lexington in the future. That location, elevators, and staff won me over.

title: Expected a better experience
text: I am a travel agent and like to try all that is available.I stayed in Dec this year and found it to be overdone in decor and bar to noisy -rooms ok but not for the price-shall try others but not in New York.

title: Time for a new regular hotel....
text:
I've been staying here for many many years. I have a lot of problems with my recent stay here.  

I emailed the hotel stating I was a multiple visit returning guest.  I didn't get a response, but I assumed, they would note it and upgrade me appropriately.  I arrived and was being checked into a lower floor entry level room.  When the gentleman began to tell me about the hotel I advised, I'm a returning guest and it's my regular hotel on all visits.  He then switched me to a higher floor, however the same entry level room.  I'm not sure what the point was as there was no view or anything else "special" to welcome a returning client.  

The hotel now asks for a $100 dollar per night charge on your credit card.  I'm not sure what this is for.  All other hotels I stay at ask for a card for incidentals but don't charge anything.  Here they actually charge per day.  You'll come home to a hefty charge on your card, that doesn't need to be there.  Yes they remove it in about a week, though I've read about the problems with this.  You shouldn't actually bill it !!!

In addition to this, they've now started to charge a resort fee.  I'm not at a resort.  Hello???  I'm charged $30 per night for wifi, a free drink and laundry.  That's appalling.  Not to mention, the wifi in the room only works if you keep using your phone.  If you stop, the wifi goes off, so good luck getting an airline alert, text or email, if your data is off.  I missed an alert about weather delays for my flight. Thanks!!!   So I'm paying for something in the resort fee that doesn't even work.  Nevermind I don't need laundry for a long weekend.  

The rooms are getting worn out and dated.  I have to say, they are not well kept anymore and there is dust where there shouldn't be.  I was disturbed that at this price point and hotel type I'm finding coats of dust on the rim of furniture, tiles, etc.  

The guests were rather noisy as well.  I'm not sure if some are getting  "deals" that lure in rowdy clientele??  I didn't get a deal or any other perk as a regular.

Might I add, at all other hotels I stay at I don't even have to ask about anything, as they automatically upgrade me and provide other perks such as wine, champagne, vouchers for continued patronage. 

The lobby seem a little bit nuts at all times.  Every time I walked through it there were hoards of people sitting all over the place, some even on the floor, for lack of seating.  I'm not sure what these people were waiting for.  There was also luggage everywhere. 

I felt like I was at a downmarket chain motel.  This is supposed to be an Autograph Collection Hotel!  It needs a good Reno for starters and some loyalty to repeat clientele. It's strange in reading some other reviews first timers seem to be upgraded and gifted, while regulars not at all.  Besides being a regular, I've probably sent about 100 people to the hotel to stay.  

I don't think I will stay here anymore.  If they were to explain that this was a one off disaster of sorts and offer me a free week to demonstrate the kind of hotel they're supposed to be, I may consider it.  However, at this time, I'm looking for a new regular hotel.

title: A Home away from home
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel many times and every time they make me feel even more comfortable 
the only thing that comes to mind is, awesome  
this past week was my birthday my son wanted to do something special for me 
well besides the wonderful upgrade to a suite, Oscar sent a nice bottle of champagne to my room 
it made my birthday and time spending with my family very memorable & extremely enjoyable.
I really enjoy staying at this hotel for the status recognition, great service & always accommodating

title: Our go to hotel when in NYC
text: Always a comfortable stay here. Lovely rooms, great service and very accessible to many places, attractions . Close to Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave and shopping.  The rates are very reasonable for a NY property too! There’s also a nice fitness center😊

title: We'll be back for sure
text:
Stayed for two nights, on a sunny but cold February weekend, while in town to visit our adult kids. 
We checked in around 5pm and enjoyed a complimentary glass of red or white wine. Apparently this happens nightly. Also live jazz...a lively happy hour with a nice bar in the lobby.
The room was small, but the bathroom surprisingly spacious. Clean and comfortable.
(We opted for a smaller room and a large bed, rather than a larger room with a smaller bed! Wonder why they don't put a king bed in one of the larger rooms?)
Mattress and pillows very comfortable. Great view. Friendly staff. Cool vibe.
Our only complaint was that we were on the top floor right next to where the elevator mechanics are, so we could clearly hear the elevator working ALLTHE TIME.
(So avoid room 2718!) 

When we mentioned this to the front desk, they were very apologetic, and refunded our hospitality fee for both nights, which was very nice.

We'll definitely be back for another stay, just making sure not to stay in that particular room again!

title: Great Choice Midtown
text: Great spot midtown. Close to some excellent, reasonably priced spots for a drink or dinner. They have a guest happy hour and a breakfast often included in the price - a fun scene with live jazz during happy hour. Very nice to kick back and relax before the NYC evening.

title: Great Customer Service!
text: Nicole at the Lexington made the difference for this stay! She is energetic, friendly, professional, and highly accommodating. Excellent customer service! Thank you for making a difference and making the stay enjoyable.

title: Outstanding experience
text: The best thing is the location - very good value for midtown Manhattan. The rooms are nice with a comfortable space and accommodation. The bar is convenient for a drink before dinner; however, they close a bit early and there is not much activity right outside.

title: Lexington
text:
This was our Fifth stay.
Fabulous. 
Location, service, room, everything!
Best NYC hotel.

Highly recommend!

This hotel is great, everybody is so nice.
We cannot wait to return.

Many friends agree.
Best in NYC

title: Excellent hotel option!
text: This is a clean, fun and affordable hotel option in manhattan.  Truly enjoy the location, staff and facilities.  Recommend checking it out.  Appreciate the water bottles and follow up on your stay.  Truly want you to have a great experience.

title: Stay at an Icon
text: We enjoyed this icon’s location as we moved about the city. Clearly attention has been taken of details in upgrading the asset to take advantage of the history of this property. There was value in the price.

title: Like no other hotel in NYC
text:
Cannot fault our second stay at The Lexington. We loved our very first stay here in 2017 so when my fiance booked me a surprise trip to New York to celebrate our engagement for the New Year, I'm so glad he chose this place to stay again.

When we arrived check in went without a hitch, can't remember the young lady's name that checked us in but she was extremely pleasant and helpful, as were all the staff! We were given our room keys to the 27th (top) floor and on opening our room door I couldn't believe my luck. The wonderful team had upgraded our room to their suite with not one but two balconies!!! The views of the city were amazing! We had a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a lovely little welcome note on the desk. Fantastic surprise!

We stayed for a full week and were also given complementary breakfasts and coupons for daily drinks at the bar for up to $20. 

The hotel is in such a great location, not too close to Times Square so there isn't too much hustle and bustle, but only a 10 minute walk to see all the bright lights. Everything is pretty close by - Rockerfeller, Grand Central Terminal and if not there are plenty of near by subways which can take you all over the big city.

New York is our favourite place in the world, and there is no other hotel we could now stay at after yet another incredible experience staying here. Don't even question staying anywhere else when you come to New York City. The Lexington has all you need - perfect location, top quality staff and cleanliness!

Thank you so much for your kindness during our stay and helping us celebrate our engagement in style!

title: Amazing experience in NYC
text: From the check in, front desk staff, to the location, gym, restaurant, friendliness and food everything was lovely! The place is stylish and features a lot of convenient amenities like free bottles of water, restaurant, a Statbucks and even Moet Chandon vending machine and across the street of a food deli as well as top cuisine restaurants

title: Great choice
text: The housekeeping staff was terrific and the front desk did everything they could to make sure that I had a clean quiet room which was much appreciated. Special thanks to Ampara who checked in and made sure I had what I needed!

title: Top Shelf Irina
text: Always a pleasant experience when I stay at the Lexington. The staff is so friendly and engaging. The only issue I had, which I brought up to Irina, was that one of the exercise bikes in the gym needed to be repaired and/or maintained. I like to workout when I travel for business and therefore having machines that are continuously kept in peak working condition is important to me.

title: Great hotel with amazing history
text:
I have had the pleasure of staying at the Lex since 1979, it has become better and better! 
Location can’t be faulted and the staff are some of the most welcoming in Manhattan!! I can recommend this hotel with no hesitation.

title: Home away from Home!
text: My wife and I had such a great time at The Lexington Hotel.  We choose this hotel for our "staycation" (we live in Westchester County, NY) whenever we can. The front desk is so welcoming and Irena made our stay even more fantastic and special.

title: Nice stay
text: Would stay here again for the location alone...Room we stayed in was typical size for NYC...did not eat breakfast there, can’t comment on the food but the bar staff makes a fabulous Old Fashioned.  Loved the historic aspect & all things Marilyn...A very special Thank You to Denise (housekeeper on the 18th floor)...who made our visit extra memorable!

title: Almost 5 stars but...
text:
This is my first stay at this hotel. The front desk staff was super welcoming. Jose was helpful in funding a room for me to check in early and also arranging for a late checkout. The room is small but not unusually so for NY. The bathroom is tight, though. If 2 people stayed in this room, we would run out of place for our toiletries. 

Overall, I really like this hotel and probably will stay again. BUT, there was a couple having loud sex somewhere near my room, and I repeatedly heard a loud knocking sound like a headboard against a wall. Good for them, but I'd expect more soundproofing in a boutique hotel that tries to cater to business travelers. This type of experience is more Motel 6 level than Marriott Autograph collection. Not the best night's sleep.

title: If Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggio Slept Here, How Bad Can it Be?
text:
When you get to the Front Desk, you are looking at an entire wall of video screens showing movies and other images of Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggio, who apparently stayed there.

The entire place, from the graphics in the elevators to the imprinted lampshades in our room was Jazz and Music-themed. I assume there's a historical connection between jazz and Norma Jean (there is a Norma Jean suite, I'm told, where Marilyn and Joe stayed.) 

We definitely did not stay in the Norma Jean suite.

Instead, we stayed in a small room that was actually categorized as "deluxe" and it was fine by Marriott standards - very clean, very quiet and big enough for two people and our things. The cellophane-wrapped paper drinking cups in the bathroom seemed a little bit down-scale - Marriott Meets Red Roof Inn?

The wifi was strong and free, the TV was top-rate, and we were able to access Netflix through our own account. 

You get hit with a $25 "destination fee" on top of your room rate, which is just additional profit - they give you coupons for drinks at the bar (or a $30 laundry credit) which sort of evens it out, but if you're not a drinker and you're only staying overnight, you probably don't have the ability to use the laundry service. 

In any case, the staff was terrific, there was jazz music piped into the elevators (a bit too loud), and we would definitely stay there again if we could get another reasonable room rate for a Saturday night. With taxes, destination fee and room rate, we spent just under $200.

It would have been really cool if there had been a knock at the door and Marilyn's ghost was standing there... but no, it was just housekeeping.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We stayed in this hotel back in summer and it was a perfect stay. The location is perfect, the rooms are very good sizewise and breakfast was lovely. 

The only to small suggestions I would add is that the staff is a bit uptight, could work on being more friendly, and the wifi was not that good. Again, it's just me being very picky, but in general it was a lovely stay in the big apple

title: girls weekend
text: Had a good Groupon for this hotel. Location is central to many things- theatre district, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Central Park. Surrounded by many good places to eat, you had many choices for any palate.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
I’ve been coming to NY multiple times a year for many years, and I’ve stayed at multiple hotels. I would suggest The Lexington is my top pick for its spacious and extremely comfortable rooms, central location with access to so much, but mostly for its exceedingly superior guest service. Everyone I have encountered has gone beyond their mandate to ensure my comfort resulting in an extremely enjoyable stay. 
The lobby is lively with a happy buzz, comfortable seating to gather, and an enjoyable bar which serves great food as well. 
I will continue to make this my first choice of places to stay without hesitation.

title: Easy and Sophisticated Hotel in Midtown
text: This was a great location close to nice restaurants and attractions in midtown that had an upscale feel for guests. The only downside is that the bathrooms lack counter space for hair styling products or makeup/bathroom essentials.

title: I love the Autograph Collection hotels
text: I spend a lot of time at the Mayflower Hotel in DC, so I am familiar with the Autograph brand.  To me they is always a doze of history with the elegance and comfort.  At the Lexington, a big part is Marylin Monroe and Joe DiMaggio living there when they were married.  Get your head around that.  Staff we dealt with were all highly trained professionals with genuinely positive attitudes- everyone was a pleasure to deal with.  The room wasn’t huge, but probably normal my New York standards.  The mini fridge is a nice touch, and the large, marble bathroom was beyond expectations.  As with most hotels in New York, prices vary dramatically with season, and our visit was timed to be off peak getting us a rock bottom rate.  So this trip was a great value as well.

title: Great business hotel
text: I have stayed at the Lexington numerous times and have never been disappointed. The hotel has a pleasant, upbeat atmosphere. The breakfast is great and so is the bar. Good location in mid-town. Irina B. is the best Elite representative I know and this includes European properties. I always feel welcome and taken care off at this property. Every kind gesture makes travel easier for those of us on the road. Elite status is being recognized at the hotel. I look forward to my next stay. 1930

title: Favorite hotel in NYC!
text: I love this hotel.  The staff and ambience is great and they have a great bar.  It has a real nostalgic feel with all the film clips  and pictures from an era gone by.  I would recommend visitors stay here over the Marriott across the street.

title: Amazing stay
text: My husband and I stayed here over MLK weekend and absolutely loved it. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The lobby and hotel lounge were clean and very comfortable. We loved the decor and felt it was very modern NYC. The bed was comfortable and all accommodations were nice. We felt so fancy our entire stay, yet the prices were very affordable for NYC. The location is perfect- just a few blocks away from Rockefeller Center and easy access to Grand Central. This is our go-to hotel when visiting the city from now on!

title: I'm reluctant to separate
text: Staying three nights at the Lexington Hotel, it feels too fast to be abandoned. Clean and spacious rooms make it comfortable and comfortable to stay longer. Unfortunately other events in other cities also need to get serious attention. Goodbye, I miss the comfort of your room.

title: The unconventional awaits, they said
text: Our reservation confirmation stated in bold characters that  "The unconventional awaits" and indeed, this was true both on the positive and negative side. We arrived at 7:30 pm only to hear our rooms were not ready yet - what? at 7:30pm? So we went for dinner and thankfully by 9pm we got our rooms. Which turned out to be nice (25th floor) and relatively quiet by NY standards despite being on the street side. Actually the plumbing, heating and neighboring room noises were louder than the street noise. Amenities were also unconventional: depending on the day and the room (we had 3) towels, bathrobes, bedspreads and other amenities would appear or disappear. You never quite knew what would be available when you returned to your room. The lobby was packed at all times, and most evenings you could enjoy live jazz and a free glass of wine which was great. Upon checkout the bellman would only store our luggage for $3 a piece, unless I could magically remember my Bonvoy membership number. My room number would not do, nor would my name - and of course all this was delivered with a vintage New York smartass attitude. So yes, the unconventional awaits for sure...

title: Terrific Experience
text: Nice to experience a cool, hip and excellent value in NYC. The attention and customer service took this experience to the next level. Thanks to Lydia and management, they did everything under the sun to make my wife's birthday spectacular. It's the little things and they got everything right, and will earn our NYC business forever. Thank you.

title: Hip Vibe
text: Everything about this hotel is lively - the decor, the lobby scene, the elevators, the staff, & the guests. The rooms and hallways are fun to observe. There are pops of color and whimsical decorations, where you least expect. We hadn’t stayed at the Lexington for a while (instead we stayed at another rather drab Marriott on the East Side!), and, on this return visit, we were the recipients of a lovely package of cheese/crackers, chocolate covered strawberries, assorted fruit, AND a lovely bottle of wine. This, while they were serving glasses of red and white wines at the Reception area! We didn’t have time to indulge in everything offered, but we plan to return! The staff is always helpful, informative and, pleasant!

title: Hôtel classique
text:
Le Lexington est un hôtel classique de New York dans lequel plusieurs célébrités incluant Marilyn Monroe ont séjournés.

L'hôtel est propre et les chambres sont biens décorées. Comme membre Titanium j'ai eu un upgrade dans un studio avec lit King. La chambre était très bien avec 2 salles de bain. J'aurais bien aimé obtenir l'une des suites de l'hôtel, elles semblaient magnifiques. J'ai cependant joué de malchance car elles avaient toutes été réservées pour un mariage.

Le déjeuner de style buffet était très complet et de bonne qualité. Cet hôtel en basse saison est un excellent rapport qualité-prix pour New York.

title: It was fine...
text: Not outstanding (as it has been in the past), but fine.  Lukewarm welcome and my room felt a little tired and small. Bed was comfortable and everything worked. A coffee maker (or kettle) would have been nice. I was a little annoyed about the wide range of 'add-ons' to the bill (City Tax - 5.875%, State Tax - 8.875%, NYS Hotel Tax, NYC Local Tax, Destination Fee, Destination State Tax - 8.875%, Destination City Tax - 5.875%, and the Highgate Charitable Foundation) all of which added about 25% to the daily room charge.  I realise that some of these are probably mandatory, but it leaves a bad taste.

title: Lovely character hotel on the east side
text: I loved the vibe of this hotel. Live jazz, fun decor and artwork, great seating/meeting areas in the lobby, and the hotel bar (Stayton Room) was great as well. Other NYC hotels I've stayed in--for similar prices--have tiny, basic rooms. My room at the Lexington was spacious, had a large desk, armchair, fridge and even a small table. The bathroom was cozy, but it had a tub--a huge win in my books. The hotel is within walking distance of Central Park, the 5th Avenue museums, and midtown. I really enjoyed my stay!

title: Lex NYC
text: One of my favorite hotels in the world. Combines great history, comfortable rooms, great service and location to make for a great nyc hotel. Rooms are comfortable, bar is classy and fun. Service is excellent.

title: Pleasant stay!
text: I just completed a weekend stay at The Lexington and had a terrific experience. From check-in to check-out, the staff were courteous and helpful. My Titanium Elite status was recognized at check-in, leading to a room upgrade as well as a complimentary breakfast buffet each morning and drink vouchers. The hotel is located in an ideal location, within easy walking distance to a variety of bars, cafes, restaurants, and shops, and public transportation options (Grand Central Terminal is a few blocks away). Highly recommended!

title: Convenient Midtown Location but nothing special
text: This hotel focuses on it’s history as the one time home of newlyweds Marilyn Monroe & Joe DiMaggio.  However, becoming more appealing to their clientele should be more important.  The rooms are small as expected, the bed mattress past its useful life and uncomfortable.  The Stayton Lounge is a joke.  Great selection of alcoholic beverages but only a few food items.  Customer Service and knowledge is lacking across the employees.  From the front desk who were rushed and lacked the desire to share amenity information with this Platinum Elite Member, to the incompetent Guest Services who messed up on 2 very simple asks for room supplies and were slow to respond.  Housekeeping did not re-stock my room completely after any of my 4 nights here.  Yes, I was tipping them for a lackluster service.  SMH.  The doormen made snide comments each time I deferred their offer for Taxi because I had a ride share en route.  Lastly, there is a $25 “amenity fee” charged per night, which is a joke.  It is only a plot to get you to spend more by utilizing the Stayton or dry cleaning services that are greatly overpriced.  Free coffee, hot water, and filtered water in the lobby are nice.  Just wish the coffee wasn’t lukewarm 2 mornings at 6:30 AM because it had been sitting since the night.

title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location
text: This is our go to hotel every time we stay in the City and Irina Borukhov, Elite Loyalty Manager always makes sure that we well takin care of. The lobby bar is nice place to sit and have a drink after a long day in the city an unwind.

title: Nice hotel for the money
text: The staff was great and we had a nice experience. We were there for just two night and it was in close proximity to our meetings. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers on a budget. It has a very nostalgic feeling and they offer you free coffee and bottled water and a $20 credit at the bar.

title: Excellent and stylish!
text: the renovation is great and the rooms and common areas are very comfortable and pleasant. the staff is friendly and service is wonderful. Excellent location and value for money. you can breathe the city that never sleeps here.

title: Home Away from Home...in NYC
text: This was our 4th (or 5th) trip to this hotel...and it did never disappoints.  The price is right.  The location is perfect for our itinerary.  Hotel Staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome.  The expanded bar is very comfy...and the cocktails are excellent.  We love the Starbucks on property.  Keurig coffeemakers are available for your room...just request them.  I seriously doubt we'll ever stay any place else.

title: Outstanding customer service; cute room!
text: Shower was fantastic, and the bed was comfortable. We were most impressed with the level of customer service with front desk, manager, bellman and bar personnel. It’s a great location and we would highly recommend.

title: Review of the Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection
text: Excellent property, with a professional staff.  Convenient, to theater district, upscale shopping areas, great restaurants, and late night entertainment.  Rooms are small, but worth the price.  I stay at this property whenever I'm in New York City.

title: A great visit to a historic hotel!
text:
I booked a two night stay back in October, and was worried about our stay when reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. It was a pre-paid stay, so we were committed upon purchase via the Marriott.com website. 

We were arriving on a Friday afternoon and using the valet parking ($65.00 plus taxes). When we arrived, our room was ready and since I am a Platinum member, we were upgraded from a Queen to a King on the 24th. floor. We were also offered 1000 points as a welcome gift.

At the front desk we were told that we received a $20 bar credit plus a free breakfast in the bar area from 7:00-10-00.

The room was New York City size and was clean and in good repair. We looked out the window and saw the Waldorf Astoria under construction. The room was very comfortable with a computerized thermostat to keep the temperature at the requested level. The bathroom, while small, was in excellent condition and had a great exhaust fan.

Breakfast is in the bar. The line was long but it moved efficiently. We had a big wedding party at the hotel the weekend we were there and they took up a lot of space in the hotel.

The bar is very comfortable. It was reconfigured about a year ago and is a nice, comfortable place to have a drink at night. The bar service was excellent! 

The hotel is clean and in excellent shape. It was quiet and the service was very helpful. I just booked again for a weekend in February. The location is great, it has a great staff, and is a great place to stay if you are visiting New York City.

title: two nights on business
text: professional and fast check in experience.  spacious room (for NY).  excellent bar and restaurant staff.  superior breakfast buffet.  reasonably priced (for NY).  great location in city and quick ride to LGA.

title: Great stay in Manhattan
text: Perfect location and fantastic staff.  I was here on business, but would come back on vacation.  Breakfast was included with the room, and it was spot on.  If you are doing anything around Midtown, this is the place to stay!

title: Great location. Has personality.
text: We have stayed here a number of times. Great location for us - we come to NYC from CT and the hotel is a short walk from GC station. Very nice breakfast off the lobby. Lots of energy around the lobby. Friendly staff. Room was quiet and comfortable. Good value for the location and amenities.

title: Weekend in nyc
text: Very nice lobby. Great to have complimentary sparkling water with fresh limes and lemons available, plus coffee and assorted teas. We were excited to find complimentary red and white wine upon returning to the hotel Saturday evening and enjoyed some relaxing time in the lobby seating area. Rooms were average for the city. Never had to wait long for an elevator. Only one problem during our stay: bathroom ceiling started hanging low and   Maintenance responded and found water leak. They worked around our schedule and had it all cleaned up by the time we returned. We would stay here again.

title: Maybe the roach broke the door lock?
text: Platinum Elite member and long time fan of the Lex, it was my 'go to' hotel in NYC for the location, value, amenities and history, if not necessarily for the service which has always been adequate, typical, but nothing special, or the rooms which are frankly pretty dumpy and especially as compared to other Autograph properties. My most recent visit though was next level bad. The flip lock in my room was broken, literally hanging off the doorframe by a thread and useless. Traveling alone, this was unsettling. Also, there was an unwanted visitor in the form of a very large, live roach. Meanwhile a family emergency required me to return home unexpectedly and I checked out one night early, in person at the front desk. The folio arrived and I was charged for all nights. Complained via email to both the hotel and Marriott and received the usual canned apology message back. Called the hotel to personally ask if anything could be done and was told no, that was the cancellation policy and the service issues were irrelevant. He went on to ask me to hold a moment while he checked the notes, and then informed me they had no record of me checking out. Rules are rules, things break, bugs happen but that was just too much. As mentioned I have stayed at the Lex many times and watched others complain for sport practically and receive drink chits - piles of them - upgrades, cheese plates, bottles of wine, prompt and personal calls and follow up from the manager and tens of thousands of Bonvoy points, over the most minor of complaints. Meanwhile a family crisis, an unsecure room and a live roach got me called a liar. Done with that nonsense and also immediately canceled an appointment to tour another Marriott property for a large professional meeting. Never is a long time but certainly in NYC I cannot envision any circumstance under which I’d return to the Lex.

title: Loved this hotel
text: This hotel was beautiful, clean, spacious and had all the amenities I wanted! For NYC, I was surprised that the rooms weren’t tiny considering the very reasonable price. The service is great and very professional. The doormen are very friendly and helpful. The bar in the lobby is a nice atmosphere and the drinks are strong! However, the service in there was atrocious, I had to get up twice from my table to go order my own drink or get water. But as for the hotel itself, I would definitely look no further!

title: Excelente
text: En general la estadia en el hotel fue muy buena, el personal muy amable, limpio el hotel las habitaciones muy comodas, lo unico es el cheq in es muy tarde , es lo unico  que no nos parecio bien , pero en general la pasamos excelente

title: Bad choice
text:
The staff is nice and attentive but this property needs a surface renovation. 

The rooms are heavily worn with dirty carpet, stained and peeling wallpaper. I stayed on the ninth floor which was allegedly the Elite floor. 

Go somewhere else until Marriott renovates.

title: Great hotel
text: I recently stayed at this hotel and it was a pleasure. The staff were very gracious, knowledgeable and patient.  The room was clean and fairly large.  We sat in the bar one night and really enjoyed ourselves.  Plus the location was perfect.

title: Old and shabby
text: Reading all the gushing reviews about this run down hotel is making me wonder if TripAdvisor can be trusted anymore. At $350 for my one night stay, I didn’t expect anything fancy but the rooms were an absolutely dump.  I can’t believe this hotel is even in the Marriott system. I knew something was not right when the front desk associate did not acknowledge my elite status using the usual script. She also was dressed very casually in a loose sweater and had no name tag. She did not offer any of the usual membership amenities or tell me about the beverage credit. Then she assigned me a room. I asked if there was an upgrade and she said the hotel was sold out. The room I was assigned was a postage stamp overlooking an air shaft. It was also just really old and looked like a hostel. It was humid and hot and the ac sounded like a jet plane. I went back to the front desk and waited another 10 minutes in line. When I told the associate my room was a dump, she said she’d give me a better room (apparently they were not that sold out). She assigned me a room on the elite floor which was a reasonable standard size with a tiny bathroom. The ac was fine but the bed cover was nothing more than the thinnest blanket and no extra blankets in the closet. The bathroom was really old (see photos of rust on tiles, bubbling paint and wallpaper) and the auto flush toilet didn’t work so I had to find the button to flush which didn’t work unless I kept it pressed down for 5 seconds. It was late so I didn’t bother calling for more blankets. I just folded my covers in half to make it more warm, like I was sleeping at a shelter. On the positive, the gym was decent (with complimentary apples) and there is a Starbucks in the building for a quick breakfast. Lighting in the room was decent as well as were plug locations. Will not be staying here again as the rooms are really old and shabby. I can’t get over the weirdly good reviews of this place.

title: Avoid this hotel at all costs
text: Out of all my stays in Marriott properties, this was absolutely the worse. Miserable and unmotivated staff - front desk, valet, baggage handlers. Incorrect information about amenities and what was included in room. Smug check in person. Requested late check out and my keys were turned off. Room was on AC and 66 degrees in January with outside temperatures below 40. No bath mat. Zero consideration applied to my loyalty or my Ambassador status. Took multiple attempts to obtain simple requests and services. ALL calls were never answered when calling for assistance. Always had to go to lobby - requests, late check out request, valet, baggage. Crap hotel and crap service. Not to mention resort fee is a joke and pointless. No material value....I still have my useless coupons! I haven't even reviewed my bill yet and guarantee I received inappropriate charges due to this absolute incompetent staff! Good location though and Starbucks attached to lobby is only value.

title: Almost perfect hotel
text: The location is central making it a great base to play tourist.... The staff were friendly and extremely helpful .... the rooms were adequate....My only slight issue with this lovely hotel is that at a certain standard I want glass and pot cups in my room not paper !!!

title: Great customer service by Lydia at Front Desk at Lexington Autograph!
text: Lydia provided exceptional customer service! Lydia managed to get me an amazing room upgrade. She was courteous, professional, and above all listened to the customer! Listening is key!   Keep up the great work Lydia!

title: NYC visit, 1/10/20
text:
Excellent property, great vibe in the lobby bar.  Thanks to Irina for making our stay special as she always does.  Evening Music was an added touch.  Nice bar bites to warm up before dinner.
Highly recommend the property!

title: Fantastic overall stay
text: We visited for my girlfriend's birthday and the service was phenomenal from the moment we walked in the door.  There was a long line for checkin and the hotel was able to grant me access to their lounge so that I could take work calls before checking in.  The lobby and bar were beautiful and featured jazz in the evening.  The service was great throughout our stay and the staff went above and beyond.

title: One night stay in New York
text:
The first impression when we entered the hotel is that the hotel looks run down, far from what the pictures on the webpage show. 
Based on the price of the room, and the pictures from  their website we expected much more than this.
The hallway on our floor smells bad, the room was run down and did not feel clean.
A simple thing like the toilet seat, which would be very easy to replace, is completely worn out and could easily have been changed. 
There is also a smell of humidity in the room.
The room is not clean - simply the carpet is super dirty that you do not want to walk without your shoes. 
I travel a lot and spend on average 100 days in hotels per year. I never wrote a review before but I decided to do so as it is my worst experience over the last year. It is 5:41 am and I can’t wait to check out and leave this place.
I fully recommend you NOT to book . This hotel should not be an autograph hotel.

title: Sehr gute Lage, guter Service
text:
Gute Lage in fussläufiger Entfernung vieler Sehenswürdigkeiten. Hotel ist sehr schön designed. Mitarbeiter sind sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. 
Frühstücksbuffet für amerikanische Verhältnisse sehr umfangreich und in guter Qualität.

title: Beautiful hotel, would stay here again.
text:
The location is fine.  It is on the east side but it is a few blocks from the closest subway station so if you want the subway right outside your door... this is not the right spot.  Otherwise, it is much nicer and calmer on the east side of midtown than the west side and the walk to times square and the theater district is not bad at all.  I love being so close to Central Station.  The building alone is beautiful and worth seeing.

We arrived on a Sunday before Christmas right at check-in and the line was almost out the door. The check in process to waaaaay too long.  The lobby was packed and there were suitcases everywhere.  There was also no one working at the elite check in desk so we had to wait like everyone else despite our Titanium status.  On a plus side, they had a complimentary stand of coffee, hot chocolate, and wine in the lobby to keep you happy while you waited.

They also provided vouchers for drinks at the bar and breakfast in the morning. I was actually surprised that the breakfast included bacon and eggs... not just cereal and fruit (but they had that too).  Oh!  They also have live jazz perform in the lobby area at night.  Super cool.  Goes with the vibe of the hotel perfectly!  Loved that!

The rooms were nice.  I love the architecture of the hotel overall so everything was nicely maintained and cutely decorated.  I am sensitive to perfumes and scents.  There is a perfumey smell to the lobby but nothing in the room which is good.  I appreciate that!  We only had two issues with the room. (1) The radiator heat came on in the middle of the night while we were sleeping and was super loud.  It sounded like a car was breaking down in our room.  But with an older hotel that is just part of the charm.  The other was that there was no heat in the bathroom but there was a window so it was super cold in there.  The tile floor was like walking on ice and showering was rough even with lots of hot water.  The bathroom was also really small.

Otherwise I loved it. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Great location
text: Room was clean - not overly spacious but was fine. Staff was super friendly and acknowledged my marriott Bonvoy status.  Hotel is in a great area - close enough to Times Square but away from the craziness of TS.

title: Good Stay
text:
We are top tier Bonvoy members. We checked in on Saturday Dec 14 around 10:30 AM. There is a separate registration desk for “elite” members which was convenient, but our room wasn’t ready yet (it was by noon). We did receive an upgrade and since we were waiting for other family members to arrive it wasn’t a hardship to sit in the second level mezzanine and take in the holiday decorations and people watch. Complementary water and coffee were available. We took the former and headed directly to the Starbucks which can be entered from the hotel. The lobby is large with plenty of seating in different configurations. The second floor has a more eclectic set up, bathrooms (you need a key card to access) and the occasional homeless person sleeping in the futuristic seating stations. That area could use some attention from Housekeeping regardless of who is using it. 

Our room was huge. The bathroom was enormous and such a waste of space. There was absolutely no storage in the bathroom, not even a shelf under the sink. Although Marriott has pledged to stop using small plastics for bathroom amenities, this hotel has not been updated. We had a combination tub/shower which I detest. There was plenty of room for a separate tub and a great shower.  The shower heads were soothing and hot water was plentiful. The lighting in the bathroom is poor and how about a few more hooks for hanging those towels you would like us to reuse? 

The room was large enough to accommodate a queen size bed, desk, dresser with minimal storage and a couple of chairs. If the configuration had been better thought out, this room could have easily accommodated a king bed and probably a small sofa. We had a fridge and Keurig. Nespresso would have been nice. The bed was comfy! Full size pillows are provided. The black-out shades are controlled electronically and very much necessary in some rooms as the hotel is built in a U shape and surrounded by office buildings. There are no USB ports so bring those wall chargers. There are no bathrobes which is a departure from other Autograph Collection hotels I have stayed in. There are earplugs in the nightstands. 

It had been crazy warm in the Northeast that week and the hotel was hot. Our room thermostat could not be programmed below 71 degrees. Even when the weather turned cold we didn’t need the heat. 

Breakfast was included in our stay, but we had other plans. We did get to the bar one evening.  It was packed, but we found seating. The offerings are sufficient and NY priced. We had drink vouchers, but before you get all happy about this, the vouchers can’t be combined and barely pay for a glass of wine. It is not a sports bar by any means so we were following games on our phones. 

This area of the city is almost completely shut down on the weekends. Even Grand Central Station doesn’t feel crazy.  As we were there during Christmas, it was a nice respite from the craziness near Rock Center, Macy’s and Times Square. It came alive Monday morning with the start of the work week and the noise came with it. On the other hand there are great places for lunch in and near Grand Central which aren’t open on the weekends. The typical chain cafes and fast food establishments are near by on the streets and open on the weekends. 

The service was fine. It wasn’t spectacular. The hotel is in an older building, but the renovations are impressive. The elevators are a decent size which can’t be said of all renovated hotel buildings. I have yet to find a Marriott property in NYC that I love at any price.

title: GOOD VALUE IN A GREAT LOCATION
text: The Lexington is a clean, well-maintained hotel. We enjoyed our 4-night stay there between Christmas and New Year's Eve. Our room was small even by NYC hotel standards, with the bathroom being too small and outdated for my tastes. Still, the service was crisp and the hotelis in a great location.

title: Great Stay and Excellent Service
text: We stay at this hotel often and every time we have enjoyed.  It is an older hotel but well kept up.  The service is excellent with a well trained staff.  I would like to highlight one gentleman in particular, Ardy at the front desk.  He was extremely courteous and helpful.  We also love the bar and the original cocktails that I found out are so good because the head of food and beverage has years of experience in this area. Prices can be very reasonable for New York especially on weekends!

title: Location, location, location
text: ... is basically the main selling point of the Lexington and they do have a point there. Located in central Manhattan is it an easy walk to a league of NYC's iconic sights and the end of the day that is what we were there for. Could've made the rooms and facilities in general somewhat nicer, but it's not terrible in any way. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly enough and so on. Then again nothing extraordinary to it, other than the location.

title: Safe, Clean & Friendly
text: Very happening hotel. Lobby and bar area very active. Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean. Close to great restaurants and events. Chech-in and out were very easy. Starbucks attached to hotel was a plus.

title: Another Great Stay at The Lexington
text: Just spent the weekend at The Lexington to celebrate my wife's birthday and completion of her MBA.  We stay at The Lexington every time we are in NYC.  It is a great art deco property that has a very cool vibe.  Rooms are on the smaller side but nicely appointed.  We had an amazing room with a balcony.  The staff are always very warm and accommodating.  A special mention of our favorite bartender, Alban, who always remembers us and makes us feel so special.  We have already booked another weekend in July.  Kudos to The Lexington Hotel.  We highly recommend it.

title: Excellent stay at the Lexington Hotel, Autograph Collection.
text: The room was very clean and comfortable .   The staff was very attentive to requests for additional towels.   Quiet in the room.   Love the lobby of the hotel . Great place to grab a cocktail and meet friends.

title: NYC home away from home, but better!!
text: The Lexington has that perfect combination of location, service, and comfort...fits me to a T. It's my go to location when traveling to NYC. Close enough to walk to so many places I want to go, but convenient subway access or an easy spot to catch a ride (taxi or rideshare). Walkable to Central Park, shopping, museums, Times Square, Broadway, all the Christmas retail windows, Saks light and music show....and so much more. And, what's even better is that the staff are AWESOME. Superior service...and from time to time I am recognized with special returning patron gifts!! Who doesn't love a little recognition!! Housekeeping is thorough and not intrusive. The updated bar/lounge is nice. Why would I stay anywhere else?!

title: Nice Hotel, Busy Lobby
text: Nice hotel, about $15 Lyft ride from Penn Station.  Brought my niece for weekend trip to celebrate 13th birthday, was good location to walk to Broadway, 30 Rock, 5th Ave etc. Ess-a-bagel only a few blocks away. Lobby always busy, especially at night.. not most family friendly, would come back again with adult crowd.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: From entrance to exit, the hotel staff was excellent. We were welcomed by Azeem, a very friendly young man. He gave our kids teddy bears with the Lexington T-shirt  and an activity book with crayons. We met the hotel manager, who signed the kids' scavenger hunt activity. They were so welcoming and when we needed anything from the hotel, they willingly provided it. Earplugs were available for our comfort and we had 2 bathrooms in our room.  Breakfast was delicious and included a wide variety of food and fruits. Soy and Almond milk was available upon request for our dairy free child and the waiters  were always happy and friendly. Our family had an excellent stay at this lovely hotel.

title: The perfect Hotel
text: Excellent place to stay. Hotel is beautiful and all staff was very courteous and helpful. Within walking distance to almost all the places we wanted to visit in New York. We will definitely be staying here again for our next trip back.

title: Great Place to Stay in NYC
text: Perfect location,friendly staff,great service and good rooms. I’ve used this hotel for four years regularly and have never been disappointed. Wouldn’t think of going elsewhere. Rooms are always clean and comfortable. It is a quite safe and enjoyable place to stay

title: Medium
text: Half staff was is a bad mood.   We expect people more friendly.      They lobby was an awful scene:    a lot of people eating pizza delivered in the sofas, ... a mass.    The localization is really good.     There is a Starbucks Coffeshop right in an exit of the hotel.     The bathroom of the room is provided with a bathtub very dangerous, that slides.    It should have a rubber mat.   The room is not provided with a coffe machine, that would be nice.    The internet is good.   And it’s noise.   The windows of the room are not  anti-noise miter.    The ear plugs aren’t enough to avoid the excessive noise that comes from the window.        After the checkout, It’s possible to use restwooms in the second floor requesting a key (card) in the reception.          There is complimentary beverage in the reception.      And it’s possible to leave the luggage after checkout   paying usd 3,00 per bag or suitcase. .

title: Magical location
text: The Lexington hotel is the best hotel we have been to in New York City. The hotel’s location makes it easy to get around without the use of a car. The hotel is warm and you can rest and have a drink in the lobby, which always has people around. The rooms are really clean and spacious and the TV has so many channels to choose from. We love staying there and would highly recommend it for whoever is interested in a relaxing vacation!

title: A good stay
text:
We have just returned from a 3 night stay with our children (age 5 & 3), upon arrival the hotel staff instantly won them over with Lexington colouring books & a teddy bear each! A very nice touch! 
The hotel itself is in a great location and our room was nice (if a bit small but hey this is New York!). We did hear lots of traffic noise but it’s pretty hard to escape that! The foyer was very nice but always very busy with people everywhere but it was peak time. 
I accidentally left my credit card in the foyer after ordering a drink and a member of staff found it and made sure it was returned to me, I was very grateful! 
We would be happy to return to this hotel, a great base for exploring the city.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: Beautiful property.  Great lobby.  Rooms are nice and clean.  Starbucks attached.  Great location.  Enjoyed my stay very much!  Awesome pricing/rate.  Appreciate the access to bottled water, as well.  Thank you.

title: Super Choice!
text: We stayed two nights in this hotel and it was a super choice. Perfect location, very clean, nice bar with live music in the evening and very friendly staff. Will recommend this hotel and will return during our next stay.

title: Fancy
text: I enjoyed my stay. I do feel the sub is a few block to get to. But it’s not that bad in walking.  Their is a .99cent pizza place literally 7 min away. This hotel gave us $60 in credit to the bar . This was pretty cool. Also always free water and free coffee. A nice jazz band plays in the lobby . Of course I went during Christmas so not sure if it’s year round.

title: Décevant
text:
Tres petite chambre
Pas de reponse au demande au chat sur le Bonvoy chat
Pas de reponse au telephone - Guest service
Laundry bag a apporter a la reception 
Petit dejeuner avec choix assez limité 
Chambre non insonorisée (bruit de la route, du vent et du couloir)
Tres beau lobbying avec vin offert
Barman et barmaid sympathiques

title: Silver member not impressed with service quality...
text: When we arrived the bathroom had not been cleaned with massive amount of hair in the bath left. We were promise Marriott points as compensation that we never received... my wife wanted an additional cover for her bed and had to wait 1.5 hour at night to receive it after having called reception 3 times without any answer.... we had a double queen room booked for 4 (us and our 2 children) but everyday only 2 towels were given to us so we had to call to get more towels everyday, knowing their desk is not responsive at all. Finally on the last day none of the shower gel or shampoo was replaced so we had to call again... I have been silver for 5 years with Marriott and this is one of the poorest customer experience ever. If you add there is no coffee machine and they don’t provide water bottles in room (you have to go physically next to reception to get these) it is not worth the money. If you are a Marriott member just cross the street and go to the Marriott Eastside!!!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Visited over NYE, hotel staff were very friendly? Very knowledgeable and very attentive to our every need. Room was immaculately clean, with great facilities. Breakfast buffet was good although a little pricey. Hotel is in an excellent location, right by 5th Avenue. We will be staying again!

title: Fantastic Second Stay!
text: Always a great time at the Lexington. The hotel is maintained very well. Staff is always courteous. We've stayed at this property twice: first time in a Queen room and the second time in a deluxe King. The Queen room was on the smaller side, but was perfect for two people. Looking forward to a future stay.

title: Amazing stay in The Conservatory Suite
text:
New York City is one of the cities that I travel to most often for work and for pleasure. Therefore, having a go-to hotel in NYC is very important to me.

During my most recent stay at The Lexington Hotel, I was lucky to get an upgrade to one of the hotel’s specialty suites, The Conservatory. The Lexington Hotel updated some of its rooms not long ago to create these new upscale and stylish “specialty suites”.  

The Conservatory was one of the most unique NYC experiences I’ve had while staying at a hotel. As noted earlier, it was my first time staying in one of the specialty suites at The Lexington Hotel and it was one of the most memorable stays I’ve ever had in NYC.

In my opinion, The Lexington Hotel is one of the best hotels in NYC. I’ve stayed at the hotel for the last 10 years while visiting NYC. The most recent stay definitely felt like the “cherry on top” of my stays!

The Lexington Hotel is the perfect hotel for anyone looking for proximity to many famous NYC attractions, comfortable – and at times exciting- accommodations, and an overall historic hotel experience.

Even if you don’t book or get upgraded to one of the specialty suites, The Lexington Hotel should be on top of your list when planning an NYC trip.

-Patrycja from The SaviTravel Journal

title: Second visit just as good as the first
text:
Stayed at the Lexington hotel for the second time and there were no faults whatsoever. 

The rooms are not massive however we spent very little time in them. The rooms are very clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. 

All the hotels staff are very welcoming and friendly. They are quick to deal with requests like ironing boards etc.

The location of the hotel is superb, you are around a 15 minute walk away from the main attractions.

title: Una conferma!
text:
Siamo tornati per il quarto Natale consecutivo ed è stato anche quest'anno un soggiorno ottimo sotto tutti i punti di vista
Ancora un grazie a Mrs.Irina per l'accoglienza il giorno del nostro arrivo e l'ospitalità,anche quest'anno ha fatto in modo che avessimo sia noi che nostri amici una splendida camera e servizi annessi..
Sempre gradito al rientro in hotel nel tardo pomeriggio il concerto jazz!
Torneremo sicuramente!

title: Good hotel
text: Very good reception location perfect  our room was a bit noisy.  No fridge in the room  service and cleanliness  was perfect   Will stay here again definitely  friendly staff effective   Great bar. And entertainment

title: Great Lobby
text:
The hotel is cool and has a happening lobby. 
Rooms are decent for a remodeled old hotel. 
Guest service was good, but we checked in before the 4pm time and they held our bags. They were supposed to call/text that the room was ready. We came back at 6pm and I had to ask about the room.  The room was small but comfortable. Nicely decorated.  The lobby and bar/restaurant was good.

title: Great location, service but rooms need a little work
text: This is my 3rd time staying at this hotel and overall I really enjoyed the visit.  I love the location as it’s easy to get anywhere around Manhattan only a few block from Grand Central.  There is a Starbucks attached to the hotel which is great for a quick coffee in the morning.  The lobby gets packed with guests which is a little stuffy and my room this time was very warm and we could t get the air to turn down below 72 unless we opened the window.  Overall I would recommend the property but next time I am in town I plan to stay at the Eastside Marriott or the Algonquin up the road.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE!
text:
DO NOT STAY HERE!
There is a loud and frequent knocking noise coming from the walls and ceiling. Staying in NYC, you expect city noise and sounds from other guests but not this. I have had 2 sleepless nights and am not excited about having a third. I use a sound machine to block out noise when I sleep but there is no chance of covering the rhythmic banging noise in the walls and ceiling.
In addition, walls are paper thin, furniture was being moved across the floor above me two mornings in a row at 8am, and room doors all around you start slamming at 7am. I have traveled to countless countries and stayed in MANY hotels and this is the worst stay of my life. Find another place - this isn't where you want to be.

title: Cocktails and champagne
text: Short walk from Central Station. Moet vending machine in the reception! Clean, reasonable sized room and comfy bed. Got a great deal online which included free daily drinks vouchers. So we both had had a free cocktail each evening. We enjoyed our stay.

title: Excellent Hotel stay
text: Had a good stay - comfortable and clean. The front desk staff was very polite and made sure if there was anything we needed before we headed to the room.  Also welcomed by the loyalty manager - Irina.The housekeeping staff did a good job with the cleanliness and the bathrooms were also kept in good condition.  Overall great service and would recommend this hotel.

title: Enjoyed our stay. Would stay again.
text: The property and staff were excellent. The doorman Derrick was exceptional. The hot cider was a special touch. Loved the gym. The hotel is very clean and that's appreciated. We loved the central location which was near a great market across the street. Also around the block is a restaurant Toscana 49(49th Street between 3rd Ave and Lexington) which had very reasonable dinner prices for the quality and location.

title: Perfect location
text:
This hotel is perfectly located.
Thin wall between the rooms so that if you are unfortunate to have noisy neighbours you will not sleep well. Ask for a larger room as rooms and bathrooms are quite small. A higher floor and / or backside room is advisable.
It is. Pity that the management allows guests to eat in the lobby. Not ice view, not hygienic and not a pleasant feeling when one enters the lobby of the hotel.
Besides that personnel was friendly and location was perfect

title: 立地良し、清潔感あり
text: 歩いて観光名所、エンパイアステイトビルやクライスラー、ロックフェラーブロードウェイまで行けます。地下鉄を乗るのも数分歩くだけで最寄駅に入れるので困りませんでした。ホテルがいくつか並んでいる場所なので観光客も多いですがタイムズスクエアほどの賑わいはないので落ち着いて休める場所です。０時過ぎでも女性一人で地下鉄に乗り歩いて帰れました。お部屋は決して広くはありませんががニューヨークの観光用で考えれば充分な広さだと思います。ロビーでは毎晩ライブミュージックがあり、チェックイン時にはロビー横のバーで使えるドリンクチケットを日数分もらえます。

title: Great Trip
text: Oscar the manager was fantastic! He made you feel right at home. He was very aware that I travel and use Marriott a lot for business and was very attentive because I was with my family and knew to make it special!

title: Very disappointing!
text: Tiny room, for $412 per night. Bathroom was miniscule, although they did manage to place the toilet paper just out of reach of someone sitting on the toilet. Honking horns quite audible on the 22nd floor. Lobby is a zoo; packed with people and left luggage. If your room is not ready, they charge $3 per bag to keep your luggage!

title: Wonderful Stay At Lexington
text: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights at the Lexington Hotel in New York recently. We had a great stay. The hotel is very conveniently located and close to all of top New York spots. The hotel was very well kept and the beds were very comfortable. Staff was extremely  pleasant to deal with and were very good about helping us book a restaurant and to offer directions.

title: Camere vecchie e sporche
text: L’hotel si trova in ottima posizione sulla Lexington con parecchie attrazioni a pochi  passi. La hall si presenta molto bene e lascia ben sperare per il soggiorno. Purtroppo però una volta saliti al piano della stanza  le buone impressioni sono svanite. Per tutto il piano permaneva infatti un forte odore di prodotti chimici che probabilmente viene usato per coprire altro. La stanza era minuscola ed ancora di più il bagno. Scesi in reception per protestare, ci hanno subito dato una camera ad un piano più alto e che corrispondeva alla categoria da noi prenotata. Purtroppo però la stanza risultava solo un un po’ più grande ma altrettanto vecchia e sporca di quella precedente. Il bagno invece rimaneva piccolissimo e comunque estremamente datato. Inoltre durante la notte si avvertivano parecchi rumori provenienti sia dall’interno (riscaldamento) che dall’esterno. Colazione appena passabile. Personale sempre molto gentile e disponibile.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
Beautiful hotel, quiet and clean.
It is in a very good location of the city.
Everything works perfectly and the staff are polite.Only the soundproofing of the rooms should be better.
I recommend it and of course I would go again.

title: Τα ανακαινισμένα δωμάτια είναι πολύ ωραία.  Τα υπόλοιπα έχουν πρόβλημα.
text:
Η τοποθεσία πολύ καλή και κεντρική. 
Οι χώροι του ξενοδοχείου είναι όμορφοι και παρέχουν δωρεαν γαλλικό καφέ και τσάι. 
Τα δωμάτια είναι ανάλογα την περίπτωση.  Άλλα ανακαινισμένα, άλλα όχι.
Ευχάριστο περιβάλλον.

title: Charming Hotel, excellent location
text: The rooms are cosy and pretty. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location good not be better. It has a Starbucks innrer lobby, which is convenient. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes on walking distance.

title: Ms
text:
Met Wendy, a delightful sales associate at the Decorte department
Very pleased with the way Skincare product Decorte was introduced. No sales pressure, just what the product is designed to do. Decorte eyecream was tested, was very impressed by the result.  Being an Certified Aesthetician  myself, helped to make my final decision.  

Thank you, best regards
Sara

title: Great hotel situated close to Rockefeller Center!
text: Took my wife and two little girls into NYC to celebrate the holiday season.  Spent two nights at the hotel.  Staff are friendly and we're extremely kind to our kids.  The room we stayed was perfect for the four of us.  Beds were comfy, room always kept tidy and the bathroom was good for New York standards. I'll definitely be staying at this hotel again

title: Christmas in the city
text:
Upon arrival of the hotel it was a bit confusing on where valet was located and who was staff outside but once identified the valet staff was very friendly and immediately provided instructions for what to do with my car. The inside of the hotel was stunning with the decorations for the holiday. 
As we had arrived around 2:30 we were unable to check into our room however we were able to leave our bags with the bellhop and go enjoy the city. 
When we returned around 4:30 the room was still not ready but the front desk staff was able to switch things around and get us our room. Unfortunately the drink vouchers and Information pertaining to the destination fee was never explained and therefor never used (one of the reasons for not giving 5 stars). 
The room itself was beautiful and clean and the beds were decently comfortable. The furnace next to the bed however was so incredibly hot to the touch that for reference reheated my nuts 4 nuts up to street cart heat when I had bought them within 10 minutes (the second reason for not giving the 5 stars). I accidentally touched this furnace box in the night when rolling over as well as getting out of bed and it was painful. 
Overall we had an excellent trip, the staff was super friendly and accommodating, plus you can’t beat complimentary wine upon checkin! We will definitely be back for our next family trip!

title: Historically Bad
text: The bedrooms are old; which is to be expected. After all this is a iconic hotel. The issue comes in when it seems the hotel rest on that history to overlook quality. First thing I want to get out the way. The staff is amazing. From the moment you check in to you check out. They all are there to do what they can do make your stay great. The problem is you can’t fix the issues with this place. The wallpaper is literally cracking off. The radiator makes this banding noise like you’re in a horror movie. Since it does it all night you might feel like you’re in one at about 3am. The engineer came to look at it. He said and I quote “It’s an old building. Every room will make the same noise.” He even manually turned off the radiator and brought in a portable heater. To my amusement; later in the night I could hear the same noise from the room below me. These old hotels have the same pipes connected to each other.  The next issue was the bathroom. The cold water didn’t work in the sink. Then we move on to the television. Many of the channels were pixelated and the following didn’t work at all. Channel 73 (MTV), 73 VH1 and 77 which is ironically labeled Hotel Information. In its hay day I am absolutely positive that the Lexington was an incredible hotel. Those hay days are far removed. I highly recommend you stay somewhere else.

title: good experience
text: Excellent location in the city, close to many attraction points, nice and clean room (although small), beautiful lobby area, quick service. My wife and I will definitely stay there again, maybe next year.

title: Great Location for the Price
text: My wife had stayed here in September and, on a return trip for the holidays, the two of us stayed here due to the proximity to many holiday sites. Overall, we were very pleased with service, particularly from Aneem at the Front Desk. The bar is an interesting location for breakfast with very small cocktail tables and low seats, but the food was very good and well prepared. Coffee bar, unfortunately, served cold coffee on one occasion and no coffee on another, though our in-room Keurig did the job. Bar and lobby were adjacent were noisy, but, will forgive as it was the holidays. Strange thing about laundry credit...they want you to use it or they charge you, but, in our case, they did neither. Same thing happened with my wife in September. Not sure what's up with that.

title: The Lexington on Christmas Eve
text: Very nice boutique hotel that is quite modern in midtown.  Good accommodations and service from the staff.  Nice lobby and bar area and access to many restaurants in the area.  I would consider staying there again if the opportunity arises.

title: Great Place
text: The hotel was good in all respects.  Rooms were nice sized and comfortable.  Bathrooms small but fine.  Free coffee in the lobby was great..  Staff and service top notch.  Hotel amenities were good also.  Would stay here again.  Mice place.

title: Convenient and comfortable.
text: Much better value than higher priced venues. Great breakfast buffet; other food choices on-site are limited. All staff very friendly. I stayed here twice and my first room was quite small; they upgraded me on the return trip to a luxurious room on a higher floor

title: Great value
text: Excellent location at 48th and Lexington; 3 blocks from 5th Ave. and 5 blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center.  The hotel is a little dated but very clean and everything worked fine.  The staff was top notch. Room was Queen; very typical NYC room/size.  Great value.

title: Lively lobby, great location!
text:
Midtown is great for finding your way to all attractions and The Lexington is in a great location.  You don't get the noise of Times Square, but you are near transportation, Rockefeller, Central Park, Times Square and Grand Central.  Shopping on 5th, and dozens of restaurants are nearby.
Staff is helpful and responsive.  The lobby is next to their bar and always busy and fun.

title: Holiday Visit
text: Good location.  Easy access to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, shopping and museums.  Clean room, friendly staff.  Restaurants nearby.  Lounge in lobby.  No bar or coffee maker in room. Starbucks coffee next door.

title: Disappointed for an autograph collection !
text: I am a huge Marriott brand customer and love their bedding which is the most comfy and “home like.”  I am a bit surprised that this hotel did not have the same quality of mattress nor the sheets/comforter. The bar was great and over all experience was positive except I had to ask for towels for the two nights in a row which I have never experienced in any other Marriott hotels. It was a minor inconvenience but due to their poor quality of mattress, I prob wouldn’t stay there again.

title: Marriott Bonvoi Flagship inactive.
text: The hotel don’t welcome and honor the Marriott Bonvoi members and qualifications. After been securized that an upgrade was not available for my titanium membership I received an email from the hotel back office offering me several solutions of upgrade available  based upon payments and not in accordance with the Marriott Bonvoi loyalty program.

title: Convenient and contemporary
text: Great hotel. We stayed through Christmas and the service level from the front desk all the way through every employee was impeccable. Everyone was professional and no one seemed to resent working through the holiday. Great jazz in the lobby in the evening, nice bar, fantastic artwork throughout. Starbucks in the hotel is convenient too. Only downside to the room is not having in room coffee or a mini bar but heck the hotel is so conveniently located in Manhattan, it’s not a big deal.

title: Great place to stay in NYC!
text: When traveling on business during the busiest time of the year, my (very high) expectations were exceeded consistently! From the free wine every day for happy hour to the generous beverage vouchers and breakfast buffet every day, to making sure that every part of my stay was fantastic, I was so happy when I stayed here for business for 6 nights. Housekeeping couldn’t be nicer, and each and every person that greets you makes you feel welcome from the valet to the wait staff. Highly recommend!!

title: Christmas NYC
text: We loved our experience at the Lexington. Check in was exceptional and Lydia was superb and professional. Breakfast was excellent and room was spacious, clean and had a nice view.  It also had a coffee maker; most places here do not. Complimentary coffee, water and wine in lobby was a wonderful touch. We will definitely be back.

title: Great location and amenities
text: We loved our stay at the Lexington.  The lobby area was decorated beautifully.  There was always free coffee and water and in the evening they had complimentary white or red wine and hot cider.  They gave us $20 to use at the hotel bar also.  In the lobby they had nightly entertainment and lots of people were there listening.  The lobby was lively and inviting.  The rooms we comfortable but small but in nyc that is expected.  It is also a great location, walking distance to grand central, Rockefeller center and more.  Would stay here again.

title: Great location
text: Location was great for Christmas time, close to grand terminal for metro access. This is very luxurious hotel that provides an excellent service, great environment. I will definitely come back here and I would highly recommend this to anyone!

title: Excellent as always
text:
In NYC, this is always my preferred hotel to stay.  The ambience, the hospitality, location, crowd are really very good.  
 
And then there is Irina who always goes out of the way to help   

Lexington Autograph is always going to be my 1st choice in NYC

title: Warmth and love at Lex N.Y.
text: The entire staff at Lexington New York provides an atmosphere of warmth and love. The holiday was ushered in with nightly music, friendly bar service and excellent breakfast amenities. Front desk and house keeping services were all superior and accommodating.

title: 主な観光地に近く交通も便利
text: ロックフェラーセンターや、５番街に近く、歩いてまわれるところです。グランドセントラルステーションも6ブロックで行けるので、そこからどこにでも行けます。

title: A Christmas experience
text: We, a Family of four, booked this Hotel about 2 month in advance to spend the Christmas holiday in NYC. As an elite member of Marriott with far more than 1.000 nights I always appreciate the excellent service of this chain. However, the Landmark was different. Even we used the App for pre-check-in and informed the Hotel that we will arrive at 1 pm, one room was ready at 3.30 pm, the other at 6:30 pm. No room with 2 beds was available (we changed one room after 2 days), the heating system is not working properly, the windows had been very dirty and  hardly provide any noise protection++ This Hotel urgently needs a complete renovation. The breakfast buffet was ok and included, but if someone has to pay 29 $ +, it is overpriced. The price policy of this hotel is somehow questionable. You pay an upcharge to the regular room rate of about 50 US$ per room/day and receive a 20 US voucher for the bar. Free water and coffee/tea is available throughout the day. The staff at the reception was friendly and helpful, particularly Irina, who is the Elite Loyalty Manager. She helped us as much as possible with any complaint. This hotel has a New York character, for sure. But there are better alternatives in town, even for loyal Marriott members.

title: Classic Hotel - excellent staff
text: Irina and her staff were spectacular once again.  I'm a Marriott guy and stay in NYC frequently - the Lexington is typically my top choice in midtown.  I frequently see familiar faces when I arrive which clearly indicates their commitment to maintaining a top notch team and it clearly shows through to the guests.

title: Holidays in THE City
text:
My wife and I recently traveled to New York City on the weekend before Christmas. NYC is magical during the holidays and we love seeing the Rockeffeler tree, the department store windows and myriad other buildings and stores that have decorated in the holiday spirit. Having Bonvoy Ambassador status, I booked a Marriott property. We usually like to stay in Times Square, but this year we tried something different: The Lexington Hotel, an Autograph Collection property. I booked a standard king room.
   On arrival we immediately saw that the hotel was clearly full. The lobby was bustling and the bar area was clearly packed. After waiting a few minutes we were assited by a very friendly check in clerck. When I requested a late check out on our departure date she informed that the hotel could not support the request and actually asked if we could check out at 1000am! However, when I pushed back, invoking my Ambassador status, she informed me that we had the largest suite in the hotel and they needed us to vacate early to accomodate a wedding party. We agreed.
   It turns out that we had been upgraded to the Lady Ella Suite! This is a huge (by NYC standards) two bedroom suite. Each bedroon has its own ensuite bathroom, and there is also a living/dining room area, plus a kitchenette. But the most amazing part was the huhe balcong that runs the length of the suite! Unfortunately it was too cold to really enjoy the outdoor space, but it was fantastic nonetheless.
   When we checked in we had received two $20 drink vouchers, so we headed to the Stayton Room, the hotel's 1920's inspired bar. The bar was busy but we still received good service and the drink I ordered was very good. 
   We also received breakfast vouchers and so we headed own the next morning to cash them in. This was the only "not so great" part of the visit. Breakfast is served buffet style in the Stayton Room, and it ws a zoo. I don't know if it was just a function of it being the holidays, but it seemed that everone in the hotel had vouchers and was trying to eat breakfast at the same time. The staff did a great job of trying to get folks seated (it's first come, first served) while courteously encouraging those who were done to vacate their seats so they could set others. We were seated at a table for 4, and volunteered to share our table if need be. The staff took us up on the offer and we had the joy of making new friends, a very nice retired couple from Arizona.

title: Great customer service during a busy time of year
text:
We stayed here December 21-23 to see Rockettes and Rockefeller with our kids. Even though it was packed everywhere, including in the hotel, we still felt like we were treated like Platinum members. Our room was upgraded from a standard to a deluxe size (super helpful for a family), we got breakfast vouchers for both mornings for our whole family, 7 drink vouchers for the bar, and a late checkout on our last day which we took advantage of.  Free wine and coffee and tea in the lobby, breakfast was high quality and convenient, and the staff did a great job managing the high volume coming and going. Luggage staff was very friendly as our room was not ready when we got there, but we left our bags with them and went out to enjoy the city. When we came back end of the day we found our room had been upgraded and they sent up extra towels and blankets for our kids.

We would definitely come back here, the professional and friendly staff handled a challenging weekend impressively and we still felt special.

title: This should not be an autograph hotel
text:
We travel quite frequently and as loyal Marriott Bonvoy members we love Autograph hotels for their uniqueness and personal touch. This hotel should not be considered part of the autograph collection. To begin the staff manning reception is aloof and unwelcoming. Then we were put into a 28th floor room. One would think a room in the 28th floor in Manhattan would have a lovely view of the city. Please see included photo of our abysmal window. As travelers we are accustomed to small rooms. This wasn’t just a small room.
