With a tiny window and a huge supporting pillar smack dab in the middle of the room accompanied by loud heating and random metallic noises throughout the night, this was more of a “trapped in the evil step-mother’s attic” kind of room. Additionally, the cheese plate at the bar left much to be desired. We’re in NYC, a good cheese plate shouldn’t be hard to come by. A kind woman at reception took $20 off our room when we complained at checkout, but we still paid $297 for this room. Again, I understand this is Manhattan, but I’ve stayed in far better hotels in the city for less and received a nicer room. Needless to say, we will never stay in this hotel again. 
On a positive note, the mattress was comfortable.

title: Great hotel
text: We are up to NYC a few times a year to see a medical specialist there and have tried different properties. this was our second time at the Lexington and it did not disappoint. We had a great room, it was spacious and we love the vibe in the lobby bar and restaurant. It is a great location with access to Times Square and the doctors office. For New York City, it is also a great value.  My only complaint would be that the blankets on the bed seemed light but I hadn’t bothered to look around to see if there were more in the closet.

title: Good location, bad service
text:
We had an 9 hour flight and were very tired...we arrived at 1pm and waited until 5.30 pm to check in and get a room!!! 
And all this even though my husband is Lifetime Titanium Member and they told us that the room will be ready at 3pm.
Sorry, this was a very bad experience.

title: Nice hotel, excellent location
text:
The hotel is very nice and offers an excellent location.
The noise in the room from the hallway and neighboring rooms is something that will keep you up at night. The hotel staff is very helpful and nice. The only problem was the paper-thin walls and the noise that kept me up at night.

title: Fine for some...
text: Historic hotel with tiny (under 300 sq ft) rooms: no coffeemaker, no fridge (on request only), no glassware (paper cups), not much storage space (tiny closet & a few drawers), no storage in bathroom (one narrow shelf so much on floor.) suites are surely different. With status, coupon for “free cold breakfast” buffet in bar area, but hot & cold intermingled so no distinction. Free bottled water at front desk but only if you ask. Instagram worthy wallpaper, orange headboard. Supposed free wine happy hour but never saw anything but empty glasses. Upkeep & staff fine. Halfway between hip & just old NYC. Champagne splits in vending machine in lobby! Carved out Starbucks (at original entrance) convenient & rarely busy, with no seating.

title: Very Disappointed
text:
I am a Titanium Elite Marriott member who travels the US weekly and have stayed at The Lexington 18-20 times prior of the past 5 years. 

I am not sure what has happened to this hotel but my last stay was terrible!   I had 2 rooms, 1 from 12/17-12/19 and 1 from 12/18-12/19. Here are the issues from my trip:

1). Day one check is the computers were down and I couldn’t get into my room until after 4:00 pm
2). The hotel lobby is a zoo and the breakfast was very hectic, hard to find a seat and not very good. 
3). My wife and daughter were coming in the next day and when I spoke to the front desk at 9:00 am on 12-18 they told me the computers were down, again.  About an hour later I was able to check in but my room now wasn’t ready and was given a code to use When I do check in. We spent the day in the city and came back at 5:00 pm and the room STILL wasn’t ready.  I got all kids of excuses. My room ended up being ready around 5:45!
4). I also asked for an box fan 2 different times (one in the morning and the next time at 10:00 pm) and they failed to bring one until 11:00 pm that evening. 
5). There was no elite check in and the lines were very long if you ever needed someone at the front desk

Overall just a poor, poor experience.  I’ll be looking for a better Marriott property to stay at moving forward.  P

title: New Family Tradition
text: Great family holiday trip - three rooms! Love the convenient location. The restaurant/bar in the lobby is super - grab a drink, relax in a comfy corner. LOVE Starbucks in the lobby. Will definitely make this a family tradition.

title: It's so lovely
text: I truly enjoy this hotel. From the location, to the staff, to the way you're treated, everything they offer, the Starbucks practically in the lobby, to the bellhop ... plus, the price is great, the rooms are a lovely size and honestly, I don't like staying anywhere else.

title: Very Disappointed
text: We checked in on Saturday evening we are elite titanium, no one at elite desk. Sunday we left our room early and upon return 3pm our room had not been cleaned, had to call the front desk. Monday we did not feel well and left our room about 1pm, stopped by the front desk to advise the room was available to clean, desk clerk called housekeeping and relayed the message, returned about 8pm room was not cleaned, again we called the front desk to get the room cleaned ,no bath matt not acceptable!! breakfast was a ZOO no crowd control and RUDE people who occupied seating after they finished eating to read or look at computer/ I pads instead of letting others sit and eat, Bed was very uncomfortable, not Marriott mattresses!! Coffee & Hot Cider by check in was not replenished and creamer was sour. Great location, but will not return to this hotel.  Definitely not up to Marriott Autograph standards,

title: Great Place to spend the Holidays
text: We stayed at this Hotel as part of a vacation package including seeing the Rockettes Christmas show. We took a red-eye from Phoenix and arrived at the hotel at 9am. We requested a previous early check-in and were lucky that our room was available at that time! This hotel opened in 1929, so it is an older hotel but very well maintained. Rooms are very small but clean. Rooms normally don't come equipped with refrigerators or microwaves, but we requested a refrigerator and the hotel had one placed in our room. The hotel staff that was part of the Marriott Vacation Club was very warm and helpful. Wendy, our maid on the 12th floor was very nice, efficient and delightfully friendly. They also provided all of the complimentary water bottles that you could drink.

title: Just terrible and overcrowded
text: This hotels location is not bad but upon arrival the staff in the elite desk were very rude while taking care of what looked to be a personal task versus the job they are paid to do! The rooms are so small and I am not just saying small they are tiny the shower has mold the windows have mold (photos upon request) the lobby is pretty much a Zoo with no where to sit everyone there seems to be hanging around and every piece of seating is taking!! I’m traveling for Xmas with 2 small kids and I can’t get ya seated any time! The breakfast was so stale it had been there for ever again / kids can’t get seated for breakfast it’s seat yourself basically in the bar which doesn’t open till very late and it’s a sit where you can scenario! Ok if you are a single or a couple but not a family! Over all there are much better hotels don’t get lured into their price there are tax add ins too!!

title: love this place
text: The Lexington is always fun, a little querky and always posh.  The lobby bar is great and rooms are well appointed with literary comments.  The hotel staff are very accomodating.  I love the breakfast buffet and the occasional special tasting events held there.  I will be back soon!

title: Awful
text:
Showed up at 7:30 (check-in at 4).  Was told they downgraded me to a queen bed (booked this hotel 6 months prior for the Holiday season).  After telling them that wasn't going to happen with two kids and myself, they finally "found" me the room I paid for (had to wait two hours). Bought a new coat.  Left it in the hotel room closet.  I told the hotel manager and lost & found hours after I left.  It went missing.......................Asked what they were going to do.  I was told they would check camera's and call back.  They never did. Called back and asked what they were going to do.  They told me "nothing". So crappy experience over all. Moral of the story, they overbook and don't leave anything in your room... be careful.
Management-Please don't respond to this since it's only to appease the people reading the review. You didn't care then so why bother now. Too late

title: Could not fault the staff or hotel
text: The hotel staff were welcoming and efficient, our room was clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable, so had great nights sleep, would recommend for comfort and location. They knew it was my birthday during my stay, so treated us to a nice bottle of sparkling wine, very much appreciated!

title: Great Christmas in New York stay!
text: Arrived on Friday afternoon of holiday season.  Hotel was very busy, but I was still treated as if I was the only person checking in.  Irina was extremely gracious and welcoming, as usual. She personally arranged my room reservation and sent some delicious gifts to my room.  So very much appreciated!  The Lexington continues to be my favorite hotel in NYC for many reasons, but mainly due to the continued excellence of Irina Borukhov, the loyalty manager. The entire staff is also exceptional. Thank you to all!

title: Great Hotel! Within walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, & Madison Square Garden
text: Loved the hotel. Very accommodating. Really enjoyed our stay. The staff was great. The location was perfect and close to all attractions we wanted to see. We were within walking distance from almost everything! Beautiful place!

title: First trip to nyc
text: This was our first trip to New York City. We went to celebrate my wife birthday. Upon or arrival we were greeted by very friendly members of staff who checked us in with the efficiency you would expect. Our room was very clean and the coffee machine was a god send after the walking round the city. The bed was really comfortable and spacious. The only minor negative is the noise from the emergency service sirens which seemed to be very loud early in the morning even though we were on the 25 floor. But saying that it is New York and you should expect it. It didn’t spoil our stay.

title: Excellent location and excellent staff
text: The Lexington is a small hotel in the heart of Manhattan.  It is in walking distance of Time Square and Fifth Avenue shopping.  The bar is comfortable and there is a Starbucks on the first level.   I have stayed there many times and have been particularly impressed by the housekeeping and breakfast staff.

title: Great location, great hotel
text: This was our second stay at this hotel.  The rooms are great, very clean, quiet and comfortable.  The only challenge we have had has been with the inability to turn down the radiator heat which means we have to have the AC running on high all the time to not be in the sweltering room.

title: Overall wouldn’t go back
text:
The pros: the location was great. As first-time visitors to NY, it was nice to be in midtown close to everything. Especially with how cold it was while we were there, we appreciated the short walk back. Everyone was friendly: the staff was nice. We had little interaction with them beyond checkin/out, but they made sure we had a map, WiFi, answered any questions we had, etc. 
Cons: the bed was very hard. They also didn’t have any blankets on the bed, just a layering of sheets. So our first night was very cold. When we figured out the room heater, we had to put it up to 75 to be able to get any sleep because we were so cold. Also, I know this is pretty standard, but it bothered me in this case: no matter how many days you are there, they charge you a $25/day fee separate of the room charges/taxes/fees. I knew this beforehand, because most hotels we looked at did the same, but that fee covers laundry services (we were only there two full days...) and a drink credit (we don’t drink). It’s irritating that they artificially lower the per night rate and then make up for it in “fees.” Overall I didn’t feel the amount charged was equal to what we received and wouldn’t go back.

title: Consistently good
text: We have stayed at the Lexington many times. Service is good, the bar and breakfast have been improved. We love the location and stay about 4 times a year. Only drawback is the difficulty of early check in on the weekends.

title: Boutique Hotel
text: Rooms are a little small but interesting.  Location is great with wonderful restaurants nearby.  Breakfast buffet has variety but very crowded and hard to find a seat.  Elevators are very efficient.  The holiday decorations are beautiful.

title: Chistmas in NYC
text: We love NYC at the holidays.  The Lexington doesn't disappoint at this time of year.  Once you step into the lobby and hear the holiday music and see the beautiful Christmas tree it is hard not be in the spirit of the season.  The check in process was a tad off on the day we registered.  The line was very long and it seemed as though there should have been a better system to accommodate all of the guests.  The room was very nice. The room was small and not very quiet but some ear plugs and our organizational efforts made the room work for us.  The breakfast offerings were very good - eggs, pastries, breakfast meats, fruit, cereal and beverages.  My only issue with breakfast is that some people are offered tables while others are left to fend for themselves.  The restaurant is very busy and quite hectic during the breakfast hours.  The buffet closes promptly at 10am.

title: Fantastic all round
text:
New York is always a city that I associate high customer service and great experiences with; this hotel completely adds to this.

My stay was made even better by Irina Borukhov, who at all times took great care in my booking and guest experience.

I will only ever stay at this property when in New York. 

Matt

title: Ok
text: Great location!  Very busy hotel, lobby was always crowded. Bar staff not very attentive. Small rooms and bathroom super tiny!  Amenities scarce!  Not a fan of boutique hotels, would not stay there again.

title: business trip
text:
hotel phone did not work and could not call down to get my car. which was very frustrating
No comforter on bed.  There was a thin banket that was not very warm.
Breakfast was just ok, limited seating, oatmeal

title: Great trip
text: Everything was fantastic.  Met Irina who made sure everything was wonderful as we were in town for our 11th wedding anniversary.  All the staff were friendly, professional, and made us feel welcome.  Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN NYC!
text: The Lexington Hotel is our favorite place to stay in NYC.  The boutique feeling, customer service and rooms are great!  The lounge and breakfast add tihe ambience.  Starbucks attached and easy walking to businesses in midtown.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and have enjoyed the experience each and every time. It is a beautiful hotel. The staff is wonderful and the location is great. It is close to public transportation and easy to get a cab as well.

title: Typical hotel for this part of the city
text: I haven’t been able to find a hotel that I really like in this area of the city. The rooms and bathrooms here are tiny. There is no room service and the lobby bar was so packed on a Monday night that there was no opportunity to sit and order food there. The beds are not all that comfortable. The gym in the morning so super packed and every machine was taken and almost every dumbbell as well.  The beeping on the street lasted until midnight and started up again at 5 AM. I guess this is typical NYC though!

title: Not what I expected
text: Stayed recently and let me begin with what was good. The front desk staff was amazingly kind and helpful with every process and request. The bar was hoping and drinks were good, food average but no complaints. Here is where it all fell apart. The rooms were small, dated and a close look a little soiled. We did not stay on the elite floor but did pay elite prices of $600 a night. I realize it is the Christmas season and it is Manhattan but I would have complained if it was a motel 6 at $79 a night. The bathroom was so tiny you could sit on the toilet and open the front door. Either way even with the fantastic staff, I will not return to this hotel.

title: Thanksgiving 2019
text:
We were greeted by friendly staff and were shown to the awesome Norma Jean suite. It’s like a beautiful trip back in time! It also has an amazing balcony with seating. We then experienced the champagne vending machine in the lobby!! The hotel is close to the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade, so we walked there in the morning and got to check that off our life’s bucket list! 
They also had live music in the evening, and the bar at the Stayton Room had great drinks. 

A great stay. Would recommend to anyone looking to see NYC.

title: Surprise
text:
I have stayed in this neighborhood, but never at the Lexington. I was pleasantly surprised by the sophistication of the place and most particularly happy with the brightness of the room. Brightly painted, two windows, light colors everywhere in the room. There were some design flaws, especially in the positioning of the bathroom door. 
The heat was not great and the blanket was a thin summer blanket. I was very cold and no one responded to my calls.

title: Luxury hotel adds additional costs
text:
Hotel was in a great location and I couldn't fault how clean the hotel was. Lovely reception area with homages to Marlyn Monroe and nice seating areas. 

Arrived after a red eye flight and checked in very efficiently. However, we were given a 40 dollar token of drinks that was given to us. We didn't request this but feeling to tired to question the process took them. We never got around to using them due to a packed weekend in the city. We then found out the vouchers was non-refundable. I wish this had been made clearer and we essentially paid 40 dollars on nothing !! Tried to redeem at the bar only to find it was only open at specific times. I'm sorry but if you force this un-refunable hotel service then at least have it accessible at all hours. I've never heard of restrictions on a bar in a hotel. 

Back to some positives! The room itself was clean and comfortable to stay in. Bathroom was also very nice with complimentary soap etc. 

I will finish on another small critisim! The doorman was very rude to me during my stay. He opened the door for every other guest and even said hello to the other guests but never to me. 

Overall hotel would have gotten more favourable review of me had it not been for the hidden fees that I never got to reep the rewards from. 

Won't stay again based on this but otherwise very good hotel.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: I love teh Autograph Collection hotels from Marriott.  They are unique and different which is enjoyable from the stnadard hotel.  Th eservice level here is excellent, my room was nice and very clean.  The desk chair was not conducive to doing any work at the sesk, however.  One thing that i did not like was that there were no glass glasses in the room, only plastic ones.  For a hotel at this cost, glass glasses seems more than reasonable.  Also, there is no room service and there is no real restaurant in the hotel.   Some bar food at the bar late in the day, but no lunch or real dinner venue.  Breakfast is a normal buffet, nothing special but works. However, where the hotel is, there are plenty of great restaurants within a very easy walk from the hotel. I liked the hotel and would stay there again.

title: Best Hotel deal ever!
text: Yes, we took your special offer to stay in your hotel for around $125 USD p/ night, double, and the front desk was nice enough to provide us with breakfast and drink coupons for each and everyday we were there (four. nights).  We were very pleased with he accommodations, location, staff.  Thank You!

title: Low value for the price
text:
No room service. No coffee maker, not even a bottle of water even I have been a Marriott customer for years. Tiny rooms. No breakfast included, even I paid an average rate of 620 USD + taxes a night. Much better options around, including Marriott and related brands in the same block.
I am not coming back again.

title: Friendly/Helpful Staff - Clean Room
text:
The Lexington might now be one of our regulars. When we walked in, the Lobby was bright and fresh. The team that checked us in was friendly, professional, and efficient.

Our room had a great layout. It wasn't very big (it's NYC), but we had everything we needed, it was easy to get around,  and there was plenty of space for suit cases.

Most importantly: the room AND bathroom were very clean.

title: Beautiful, historic hotel
text: It was an incredible stay at this stunning hotel. We enjoyed the accomodations, the staff were great at helping us, and the view didn't hurt! Definitely recommend this hotel, it was really a fantastic place to stay.

title: Perfectly Positioned with Great Service
text:
The Lexington Hotel NY is a great hotel to get away and enjoy the city.  It is closely positioned to Grand Central and not too far from Penn Station.  You can easily get to Rockefeller Center and Time Square or any other of the great areas to enjoy in NY.

Now that you have decided to stay, you will enjoy the great service that the Lex has to offer.  Ameen was the first to greet me and remembered and checked on me throughout the trip.  Any issue or question I may have had, he resolved immediately with no delay.  The concierge and bell hops are all super helpful and there to serve. 

The rooms are a bit small but hey, it's NY and that is to be expected.

title: Over priced and over run down
text: The Lexington is heavily overrated. It has old rooms , noisy . Am a platinum member and stay in Marriott hotels all over the world . It should maximum have a three point rating . Breakfast is a mess and not equipped for the number of guests .

title: Lexington Hotel - nice
text:
Liked (but not quite loved) the stay - 2 rainy days in New York. The location near Grand Central is great. The staff were very accommodating: from doorman to wait staff, there was excellent service. 
The rooms were small (this is an old establishment) but neat. One has to like coziness, and not expect spaciousness. I wished there had been a coffee maker in the room, as well as a fridge - there is 24-hr Starbucks coffee in the lobby though. A nice touch was the complementary ear plugs for guests not used to NYC street noise. I felt the bed was not as "embracing" as at other Marriotts - not sure why not. 
The restaurant (Stayton Room) was good for breakfast (though the eggs were cold). And it was a vibrant place at 6pm on a Monday night - crowded and noisy, jazz band, lots of people. I don't think they had sitdown food; bar food was very good. And the drinks were good, too. 
It's in the Autograph collection - old hotels intended to recall the ambiance of when men wore jackets and ties and women, hats and gloves when traveling. I like that, but maybe not everyone would.

title: Worst mattress EVER!
text: Worst mattress ever!!!! Chic, cozy (tiny) room with the most uncomfortable bed ever. If a hotel doesn’t have a comfortable bed and nice linens, the rest doesn’t matter. Their coffee urns were empty 50% of the time. We stood in a long line to check in. Gave up on the consierge after waiting in line for her 15 minutes.  The room was very clean, shower was awesome, loved the good smelling shampoo, etc. but after 3 nights on that cinder block mattress we were both in pain. Linens sucked , too. We had to ask for an extra blanket. Noisy. 1,200+ for 3 nights.

title: Good location / sub standard customer service
text: The Lexington is nicely located in mid town and very convenient for work travel.  The bar is lively and although small rooms they are nicely appointed.  However I have stayed at this property on 3 occasions and continually am disappointed by the customer service.

title: Lexington
text: Staff is nice but the hotel reservation desk is way understaffed:  I waited in line twice to check-in.  My second attempt took me well over  30 minutes to check in.  I received an email for early check in the day before my arrival however the APP did not work.  Then my room key didn’t work two days in a row.  Each visit the desk took well over 20 minutes.   The hotel is tired looking I am not going to stay at this hotel again.

title: Perfect service - perfect location - wonderful stay!
text:
Thanks to all of the staff of The Lexington NYC! I always love to stay in your hotel. The staff is very kind and friendly, the location is absolutly perfect and the warm and heartful atmosphere makes every stay unforgettable!
The festive decoration and the wonderful christmas tree is giving the feeling to be at home far away!

title: Best of NEWARK
text: Staff were friendly and hospitality was very good! They were concerned we have good time. Location excellent,walking distance to every where.was very safe and clean. My niece is very picky but she liked it,

title: Fab Hotel
text: Wonderful location and superb lobby with live jazz and complimentary wine... Its New York so the rooms are on the small side... Our stay was made uncomfotable and was let down by a very rude bar waitress... But hey ho.. dont let that put you off this hotel or spoil your visit...

title: Thanksgiving week
text: My grandson and I visited New York the week of Thanksgiving. We were greeted by friendly smiling faces- and we felt so welcome to be at The Lexington. The personnel remembered my name each time we came or went. The coffee was outstanding! I just think whenever we return The Lexington is where we’ll stay!

title: Soggiornare dove ha abitato Marylin Monroe con Joe Di Maggio
text:
Hotel in buona posizione centrale, camere non molto grandi ma pulite, bagno minuscolo. Personale molto gentile.
Sempre a disposizione bancone con caffè, the, acqua. Colazione non compresa nel prezzo della camera piuttosto cara e con non molto spazio a disposizione. Al piano terra accesso diretto ad un piccolo Starbucks senza posti a sedere. Comodo il bancone all'ingresso con le informazioni turistiche (non parlano italiano)

title: NYC Christmas weekend
text: Good hotel in mid town. The rooms and bathrooms are quite small but adequate. The walls are a bit thin as this is an older hotel that has been updated. Location is perfect for midtown adventures, and the service is great.

title: Hotel is convenient ,comfortable and Marriott !!
text: Numerous times I have stayed at this hotel at various times of the year for business and pleasure  and it always proves to be Superior.!! The staff adapts and provides for the customer no matter what and this includes all staff.  The location provides perfect access to events, subway, and  train station. It is a safe area and hotel is secure and very clean.  Thank you Marriott !!

title: Christmas in NYC
text: We always love staying at the Lex, but especially at holiday time, with the  droves of people converging on the city, the Lex is ideally positioned. Being a few blocks away from the tree at Rockefeller Center, there is much less congestion around the Lex, but within striking distance of anywhere we’d want to be.

title: Our fav mid-town stay
text: The Lexington is very well located for all of our walking around NYC that we enjoy. This trip included a walk down to the meat-packing district, a broadway show (highly recommend Tina!) and some fabulous food. A typical NYC visit - lol and the Lexington, with its newly refurbished bar to end our days in - continues to meet our expectations.

title: Great time in NYC  at Lexington
text:
Came to NYC for pleasure for 3 nites before Thanksgiving  -and Holidazzze with husband. 
The Lexington  was fantastic-very clean room and lobby.
All staff from desk, lobby, loung, and housekeeping very welcoming and helpful.
I previously stayed at Lexington on business -so when I saw a Tripavisor special I jumped on it. In truth room this trip was nicer than previous stay. 
Location is excellent for subways or Grand Central or Penn. Easy walk to Central  Park, shopping, several restaurants nearby as well.

title: Big Disappointment
text: The room felt like I was in the hotel version of “Tiny Houses”.  That being said, the service was worse.  No room service, extremely limited choices in the bar and the front desk staff (other than the young lady who checked me in) was rude at best.  I will not stay here again and I am a loyal Marriott customer.  Poorly designed and poorly run especially for an “Autograph” hotel.

title: Great location, nice room, and friendly staff
text: The location is perfect - walkable to Rockefeller Plaza, Bryant Park, Times Square and the Theater District, and also to a metro station a few blocks north and Grand Central to the south.  The rooms are clean and comfy, and all the staff we encountered were polite, helpful, and friendly.  The bar is pricey and the free coffee near the front desk frequently empty.  The rooms are expensive, too, but we found a promotion and got a great rate.

title: Great location, service and amenities fell short
text: I was accompanying my husband on an annual conference in NY.  My husband is a Titanium Marriott member, so he and we obviously travel quite a bit, and all over the world.  We have stayed in NY countless times and don't expect massive sized rooms, but were disappointed in the "upgraded" room we received.  A deluxe king, which was no larger than any other room we have stayed in NY.  The temp in the room was never quite right, and the bedding does not include a proper comforter.  My husband called it a piece of paper, which made me laugh, and I have to agree.  Odd that a hotel in the winter does not offer more substantial bedding.  One morning I came downstairs and realized I had forgotten something in the room.  When I went back up and found my key was not working.  Thankfully I had my ID with me and went to the desk to get a new key.  The desk agent looked at my ID and asked whose name the room was in.  I stated my husband, whose last name matches mine.  She told me that he had not added me to the room.  I told her I was present at check-in and no one asked for my ID, which is understandable and quite commonly asked at many hotels.  She then asked where my husband was and could he come to the desk to confirm that I could have a key.  I told her he was working.  She said she had to get a manager.  The manage arrived, looked at my ID and the same set of questions followed.  I told him he could follow me to the room and see my bag tags and I could identify everything in the room.  He said we don't allow keys if the name is not on the room.  I replied, "look, I am all for catching cheating husbands, but this is ridiculous."  Once again, I reminded him that my name matches my husband's, he is Titanium and we could go up together.  He told me that many people have the same names.  I then suggested that he and I go buy a lottery ticket together as the odds of me knowing the room # and having the same last name as the one on the reservation should ensure a lottery win for us both.  He, finally, acquiesced and gave me a key.  I am all about safety and security, but common sense needs to be taken into account as well.

title: A hidden gem
text: Everything was really great! There was a used napkin under side bed table when we checked in and stayed there until last day before checkout. Other than that everything great! Everything else was clean

title: Exceptional
text:
Great Location! Amazing Staff!
Awesome bar. Would highly recommend and will most definitely be back. A bonus to have Starbucks on the property. Rooms are on the smaller side but no need for any bigger.

title: Pricey for what you get
text: We arrived at 4:30pm and stood in a very long line to check in. There was a comp coffee and wine bar, the coffee urns were all empty. Our room was tiny, which is not unusual. It was very clean for the age of the hotel. For 3 nights $1300 in a postage stamp room with not much service. The location is great, close to a lot of shopping and restaurants. We stood in line to talk with concierge for about 10 minutes and finally gave up. There was a nice 3 piece band playing in the lobby.

title: デザイナーホテル
text:
グランドセントラル駅近くのマリオット系列デザイナーホテルです。
外観は少し古そうですが、内部は非常に新しく快適でした。

title: New York 2019
text:
Lovely hotel, staff lovely and great location 
Only thing that let it down was the bedrooms should have been a lot cleaner. Quite a bit of dust under the units and the bathroom could have been much cleaner

title: Loved the Decor and the Free Drinks!
text:
Chosen for proximity to Grand Central Terminus. The first night we were kept awake by the elevator going past our room...the next day we were moved to a better room on a higher floor that was considerably better.

Enjoyed the free drinks in the bar. Better still, coming back after a night out of the city we had a similar room again and another free drink.

Just loved those elevator doors!

title: Perfect Hotel to see New York
text:
We came to New York for the first time. The location of the hotel was perfect to start all the daily plans. We did not book breakfast but there is a Starbucks in the hotel and many diners and shops in walking distance. The room and the bathroom are small but very clean. We paid exactly what we booked over booking.com and got 2 20$ vouchers for the hotel Bar per night. The only thing i would criticize is that the window couldn't be opened. 
Would definately stay here again!

title: Great NYC Hotel!
text: We stayed at the Lexington the weekend before Thanksgiving.  It was my first visit there but I will definitely return.  The staff were friendly and in abundance, the room was well appointed with 2 bathrooms for a 2 double bedroom (we had 2 adults and 2 children so appreciated the 2 tubs for bath time). Convenient location to Radio City and Rockefeller Center (a 15 min walk).  My new fave in Midtown!

title: Great location!
text: Fun boutique hotel. Great location and comfy rooms and beds. You can walk to Time Square and Rockefeller center. You’ll have fun and get your exercise. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel definitely has personality

title: Late November in New York
text: Excellent hotel, service (particularly in the bar) was excellent and given the time of year the hotel was wonderfully decorated. Location was superb for travel in all directions and the rooms (ours wasn't the largest) were clean, comfortable and changed daily.

title: Brilliant hotel
text: Stayed during the Thanksgiving holidays, and had a brilliant time. Great location and brilliant service, we even had a room upgrade on arrival. Close by to Grand Central, so means it's also very convenient.

title: An enjoyable stay!
text: We often stayed here over 40 years ago when we were British Airways crew! So came back for sentimental  reasons! A complete re vamp and was more about Al Capone in the past now features Marilyn Monroe! Really nice bar and free drink always welcome in a great atmosphere! Hope to come back soon!

title: Worst hotel experience in NYC
text: As a titanium elite customer of the MARRIOTT group... I was most disappointed with this hotel. I strongly recommend staying next door at the Maxwell which has far better management and customer care. Ask for Erin or Peter at reception.

title: 40+ years, lifetime member and now they add a daily destination fee?
text: Wanted to book this hotel for a special NYC weekend trip and was informed that Marriott now adds a daily destination fee to all NY properties.  Instant profit boost for Marriott!  Instant hit to my budget!  At first I was told only the property could grant an exception.  Next, I was told by someone else it was (as I assumed) a corporate policy.  The tone with which I was told that a query to "a team" had been submitted (response due within 5 working days) tells me an exception is not likely. It is sad that after 40 years of loyalty I will have to go elsewhere because I object to being sandbagged like this.  Marriott has a good loyalty program, with nice facilities I have enjoyed all over the world, but this takes the wind out of my sails - boosting the bottom line is obviously much more important than retaining customers that have been loyal for decades.

title: Check In Experience!
text:
When i checked in the font desk (Nicole and Glennis) were so nice and personable!  they took great care of me!!
I rarely write reviews (good or bad) but this was a great experience.  I would definitely recommend giving the Lexington a try for your next trip to NYC!

title: Classic NY
text:
Classic old style hotel.

Lobby and bar great atmosphere. Terrific service at front desk from a USMarine (no such thing as a former marine). Price is high but includes generous complimentary afternoon wine. 

Good location. Walkable to Grand Central.

Small rooms, but bigger than some we’ve seen in NY.

Downsides: cold in room and no way to adjust; thin bed covers in another room; drinks about $18 in bar; lobby crowded at times with a wait for room.

title: Best hotel ever
text: It was amazing.I had a great time. I was near Rockefeller’s center. The place has historical value too! I slept in the bed that marylin memore and jo DiMaggio were in. The place was clean . It was fun there was everything to do.

title: Visiting my College Daughter for Thanksgivings
text: The Lexington is a classically beautiful hotel.  Although it is a little away from the high tourist areas and subway, it is a hidden gem.  Great walks to get there. Comfortable updated room.  Our last night they even brought in a cot for my daughter to stay with us ( so that she could get away from her itty-bitty dorm room) for a night and have a girls night with myself and grandma.  I would stay here again when I next travel to NYC

title: Friendly, great option for family
text: Stayed one night with my husband and twin 9 year olds. The lady at the front desk gave them each a gift bag with a teddy bear and coloring book - they were thrilled and a drink coupon for me! Room was on the small side but comfortable and had everything we needed. Nice soaking tub in the bath.

title: Super central
text:
It is close to any place in Midtown. A bit expensive. The rooms are tiny but cosy but I guess that during the stay they don’t clean the moquette every morning with the vacuum cleaner. I found a receipt from July below the window. 
There is a great TV and the hotel looks generally nice. They gave us some coupons to spend in beverages at the bar and at the concierge and reception they are nice. I suggest it.

title: Terrible
text: Do yourself a favor and do not stay here.  The staff was very nice and professional.  However, the actual building is terrible.  It is very old and run down with the smallest bathrooms known to man. If you are not a petite sized person, you will not fit in the bathroom. The noise in this hotel is incredibly loud.  I read reviews on the noise and thought they must have just been unlucky travelers with bad rooms.  Not the case!! We had one of the best rooms you can have in this hotel on a very high elite member floor.  We had other family members on other elite member high level floors as well and we all were not able to sleep.  When a door closes anywhere in the hotel you will hear it.  Unless you are the heaviest sleeper, do not stay here.  Completely ruined our Thanksgiving trip with the entire family tired and crammed into tiny rooms with no bathroom space.

title: Our Thanksgiving spot
text: This is our second Thanksgiving at the Lexington. We love the hospitality, everyone hanging in the lobby over cocktails and jazz on Thanksgiving eve, and it’s a short walk to the Macy’s parade, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and all the holiday windows.

title: Great hotel
text: Love this hotel.  Great east side location. Attentive staff.  Onsite breakfast and bar. Lexington Brass next door is a great meeting spot.   Convenient parking across the street.   Close to shopping and Grand Central.

title: We Will Be Back
text: We are Marriott/Vacation Club owners.  From the time we checked in, we knew we had picked the right hotel...we were deliberating between the Algonquin, which has its own charm, and The Lexington.  The young man who helped us at the front desk was accommodating, helpful and a pleasure to deal with.  I believe his name was Ameesh. (I sincerely apologize if I did not get the spelling correct.) It was Thanksgiving day, so the hotel had a festive vibe.  The bar was great and we enjoyed a complimentary breakfast.  Location, location, location!

title: Great Service @ The Lexington
text: The staff was Super friendly. The rooms were very clean and Comfortable. The location was great and conveniently located to Times Square. Starbucks attached to property and a great cocktail bar. We would definitely stay there again!

title: Lisset - Fantastic Service
text:
I visited the Lexington to celebrate my birthday as a first time visitor to New York. From the first minute I walked into the hotel to the last second I checked out the service from Lisset was second to none. 

To say nothing was to much trouble is an understatement, All Guest Service Agent should take a leaf out of her book 

Thank you for making my first visit to New York such a pleasurable one

title: The Perfect Location
text: We had a fabulous stay at The Lexington.  Conveniently located to key tourist attractions and the Theater District, but just far enough away where noise was not an issue.  Our room was comfortable and the service was excellent.  Great value and we are coming back again!

title: Very nice hotel
text: We stayed at the Lexington Hotel for Thanksgiving weekend 2019. We had a wonderful stay. The staff was very nice, the hotel was very clean, we loved the lounge area and the lobby and the location is great!

title: Sisters Weekend in NYC
text: My sisters and I traveled to NYC Nov 14-17th to not only visit my son in college, but to have a fun weekend away! The Lexington was clean, the service was exceptional, the staff were helpful and the property was beautiful and well maintained. We always felt safe and enjoyed our time there. We will definitely be back!

title: Hotel Lexington NYC
text: Excellent hotel with helpful and friendly staff.  Midtown location made it easy to access everything and walk to much of it.  Nice room, nice beds and great service.  We went into NYC for Thanksgiving and even walked straight to the parade route on 48th from the hotel and had a decent view even though we waited until 8AM to get our spot.

title: Decent value, far inferior to other Marriott Autograph, lobby perfume unbearable
text:
We stayed for two nights.  We were able to get a double full room, which allowed mom, dad and teenage boy to cram into one room.  This is a big value and tips the rating to Average.  

We won't stay here again because the scent in the lobby is unbearable.  

The Lexington is nowhere near the quality of other Marriott Autograph hotels.  Wallpaper is peeling in the bathroom.  The tub is chipped in numerous places.  The bathroom is tiny.  We were only given one towel in our room originally.  The beds are uncomfortable.  Air conditioning temperature varies all night.  Street noise is very loud.  The value price seems to reflect this but it really shouldn't sell itself as an iconic hotel.  It's just tired.

title: Overpriced, outdated, unclean hotel with poor management
text:
This is a far cry from a luxury hotel in Midtown Manhattan. I travel to New York frequently and this is by far the worst hotel that I have stayed at. The room smelled musty, the carpet was squishy, it was dingy, and not welcoming at all. I am glad I brought my flip flops because it was not a clean room. The shower did not even drain.

I was glad to only be staying one night, but the hotel is still giving me issues because they charged me two nights of parking at $77/night. I didn’t notice the second night parking charge until I checked my credit card statement. I have a receipt from the hotel showing one night stay and one night of parking. When I called the hotel to notify them of this extra charge they said there was nothing they could do. Therefor I called my credit card company to deny the charge. Recently I received notice from my credit card company that the Lexington is disputing this and claiming I had two nights of parking. I am now unable to reach anyone with that “authority” at the hotel as I keep getting put on hold and then being told that the person I need to speak with is not in.

Very disappointed, and be weary of staying here. It’s not worth the price.

title: Fantastic Trendy place
text: this is a great place to stay while in NYC! very trendy and modern style, rooms are comfy and spacious; the staff is friendly and helpful. well situated. For the breakfast they serve fresh food with a lot of choice; can be a little noisy at night; but it's NYC!

title: Great hotel
text: Girls trip to New York. The Lexington was a fabulous find. Close to shopping and great restaurants. Hotel staff very courteous and hotel was clean. Only drawback was late night partying in the lobby but overall great stay.

title: Love, love, love!
text:
There are SO many places to stay in NYC that you just end up picking something. Well, I’m so glad this was the one. This beautiful, quaint hotel is sure to please. Oscar is INCREDIBLE. He was so friendly over the phone, and even more helpful
in person. Lisset was wonderful as well. The bar is nice and smells delicious....I’m dying to know the scent. The location is fantastic. We can walk to Central Park, Times Square, Empire State Bldg, 5th Ave, and so much more. We’re trying the breakfast tomorrow and surely it’s as good as the rest of the hotel. Would definitely stay here again. And mainly because if a Oscar and his crew!!!

title: Our home away from home
text: We stay at the Lexington Hotel about 70 days a year.  The staff are caring, helpful, friendly and do all possible to ensure we always have a pleasant stay.  The Lexington has truly become our home away from home.

title: Unethical hotel - review what you are charged
text:
Completely dishonest hotel that lies to their customers.  Stayed here for a week and I wished I booked another hotel in the area even if it costs more for better service.  

Managers like Corey lack the business skills required to be in his position.  He was disrespectful even when the hotel made errors and did not accept responsibility nor apologize. 

Staff and workers are much more qualified to run this place any day than the manager on site.  Would definitely not recommend and if you plan to stay here, please watch out for what you are getting charged.  They will try to take advantage of customers and overcharge them.

They offered “complimentary laundry for $30 a day” but during our stay, we were overcharged and the staff told us that they misplaced the paperwork for the laundry service. If they misplaced the paperwork for the laundry service, how do they know what to charge customers? They overcharged us and lost the paperwork?? How does a place like this run their business? This hotel needs to get their act together.

title: Favorite Hotel in New York City
text: From the moment you walk in the door, you can tell that The Lexington is not your typical NYC hotel. The sounds of jazz abound and you enter into a different time. A time where elegance and customer service was standard in upscale hotels. Thas standard is alive and well at The Lexington. Irina Borukhov (Elite Loyalty Manager) and her staff go above and beyond to ensure your stay is top notch. The rooms are well appointed, the bar is a great place to relax after a long day (there is live music in the lounge area nightly). The Lexington is my favorite hotel in NYC and I have recommended it to friends and family and  their experience has been as wonderful as mine. Having stayed here dozens of times over the years I can attest to the continuous quality and exemplary service.  Do yourselves a favor a treat  yourself to a stay at The Lexington!

title: The Lexington hotel Manhattan
text:
The Lexington hotel is a great place to stay. When you stay here your in the the heart of manhattan. The staff always made me feel welcome when I entered the hotel.l look forward to going back.
And if your a coffee lover there is a Starbucks you can walk straight into.

title: Nice enough stay.
text: Nice hotel.Comfortable. Most of the staff were super friendly and welcoming. The housekeeping staff? Not so much. Left garbage in our sink and woke us up to rudely ask what time we leaving!Do not disturb sign was on door.

title: The Lexington Hotel is the best!
text: Another trip to New York and another stay in the sensational Lexington hotel, for comfort, class, customer service, bar, atmosphere, superb quiet rooms and value for money the Lexington is the best in Manhattan. I work in tourism and travel around the world a lot and the Lexington is a joy to stay in and I have been looking forward to staying here again for 6 months! If your looking to stay in the brilliant New York. This is my first and highest recommendation!

title: Nice stay!!
text:
On arrival we were welcomed and made comfortable even though we could not get right into our room. Our bags were safely secured leaving us able to begin exploring the city. When we came back bottles of water were available along with a glass of wine.
The stay was comfortable. Only drawback was lack of proper housekeeping. The trash was not always emptied, and wine glasses from the afternoon wine was never picked up until after we left I assume.

title: Great midtown location with helpful employees
text: Second stay at the Lexington.  Location is terrific.  All employees with whom I interacted were friendly and professional.  Music in one of the elevators was annoying. Oh, well.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Weekend getaway stay
text: We had a very comfortable experience! Great views of the city! Only issue we had was hearing every horn outside but that’s to be expected when staying in the city! Food & drinks were delicious! I love the speakeasy vibe from the secured public restrooms to the egg shaped chairs. Everything was plush and very “boutiquish”

title: The best!
text: Our favorite hotel in NYC! We always stay at the Marriott Lexington the location is fantastic, a neighborhood feel with great restaurants and shopping close by, we love broadway shows and it's a short walk to the theaters! The staff is the best! Irina and her staff take great care of you, if you need anything they will get it for you! The bar in the hotel is busy and full of life! Thank you for making the Lexington New York's best!

title: Always a great experience!
text: Irina and the whole team at The Lexington always do everything they can to make our trip a wonderful experience! The rooms are comfortable and stylish. The bar opens at 4pm and it’s full of fun people having a good time. If you need anything, they respond promptly with extra pillows, coffee, etc. We love the location because you are close enough to Times Square to walk and far enough away to enjoy dinner at a neighborhood restaurant.

title: A Cool Throwback Vibe
text: The Lexington Hotel has a fun and cool throwback vibe of old New York.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  The rooms can be on the smaller side but the beds are comfortable.  The fitness center is sufficient with 6 or so treadmills, dumbbell weights, a few leg machines and yoga mats for stretching.  All in all one of my favorite places to stay in NYC.

title: Not Autograph Collection Material
text:
I booked two rooms for a one-night stay in NYC with my fiance and future in-laws. I have been a longtime Marriott Elite member and was also familiar with many of the hotels in NYC but had not stayed at The Lexington. I travel frequently and enjoy the Autograph Collection properties. This stay was disappointing on many different levels.

The check-in process was disorganized and embarrassing. I had completed the check-in process via the app for a 5:30 PM arrival and arrived shortly after that time. However, when I checked-in, not only did the app check-in not seem to matter at all, I was also informed that the rooms were not ready. To be clear, this was not an early check-in request and there shouldn't have been any problems anyways. On top of that, I was shocked that as a Titanium Elite member, this didn't seem to matter one way or another to the hotel staff. They didn't bother to explain or even really see the issue with their failure, as my family and I were supposed to just wait in a crowded and chaotic lobby and hope they eventually had our rooms available. 

To make matters worse, when the front desk employee went to get a manager, the manager still couldn't adequately explain what had happened and why a room wasn't ready. I understand sometimes things can go wrong or mishaps occur, and an explanation and simple effort to fix it would have been more than sufficient. Instead, we got a lot of misleading nonsense that only exacerbated the situation and embarrassed me in front of my future in-laws. The primary reason we had picked that hotel was because I had told them about how well Marriott properties usually take care of their elite members. The hotel manager spoke to us like he was negotiating as a used car salesman, saying he was going to hook us up and take care of things, without mentioning any specifics, and then acted like a he hooked us up big time when he figured out a way to get us into two crappy rooms. I informed him that this was indeed what I had already PAID for and was already entitled to as a paying guest, to say nothing of a valued elite member. I came away from the experience feeling like I was getting scammed somehow by the manager. It was unbecoming and I've never experienced anything like that at a Marriott property in my life.

It is worth commenting on the state of the lobby as well. When we first walked in, it looked like it could be a cool hotel with a unique vibe. However, that was quickly replaced by what was sheer chaos in the lobby. The bar was overflowing to a degree that made the lobby feel like a scene in a crowded Grand Central station at rush hour. A solid 1/3 of the floor space in the lobby was covered by suitcases that were stacked for some reason. Presumably the storage for the bell captain's desk was full, but this looked like a scene at an airport.

The rooms themselves were filthy, with hair and grime in the bathroom and gross stains that were highly visible throughout the room. The hotel was clearly in a state of disrepair and badly in need of being refurbished. It would be an understatement to say that it wasn't consistent with the quality of the dozens of other Autograph Collection properties that I have stayed at in the past. I have stayed at some that are older hotels, but well-maintained. This was far and away the worse one. In fact, after we got to the room and looked around, my fiance commented that we should have just stayed at the Courtyard, as that would have actually been far nicer.

My future in-laws ate breakfast (redeeming the vouchers for elite status) earlier than my fiance and I, but we both had issues that were somewhat comical for any reasonable hotel. When my fiance's parents went to eat, the breakfast buffet was out of most silverware, and there didn't appear to be any effort to remedy the situation, so they were left eating yogurt with a fork.

When we ate breakfast, the restaurant was well beyond any reasonable capacity, and there didn't appear to be any system whatsoever for managing the seating or controlling the number of people in the restaurant. There was also no discernible system for creating something as simple as a line for the buffet, which led to chaos and confusion as guests many dozens of guests wedged their way in from all directions. About half of the offerings were out, and once again, there was no silverware. If a Marriott brand representative had seen the scene, they would have been appalled. We waited a few minutes and then just walked out rather than eat sausage with our bare hands.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: Very nice hotel. I arrived several hours before check in and and they held my bags. The lobby is comfortable and good for working on a laptop between meetings. Customer service was top notch from having complementary water and coffee, to a responsive concierge, and front desk check in was a breeze. The room was nice, but a little cold for me. Modern furnishings and enough space to spread out unlike some other NYC hotels. Very much enjoyed my stay.

title: Accidental Tourist
text:
We were rendezvousing via LA and Orlando and our plans fell through and we needed lodging asap.
On the flight from LA my husband booked us our stay for the weekend. It was perfect. The location was within walking distance of anything we wanted to do. Time Square, broadway, MOMA.  Next time we will plan to stay here.

title: Classic Manhattan Hotel
text: Nice Mew York hotel near Grand Central.  Reception was easy, room was an upgrade and quiet.   Hotel buffet breakfast was as expected.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Would stay again when wanting to stay near Grand Central.

title: Great Location!
text:
We have been here several times.  Always great service from all the staff. Location is awesome - easy to get to any part of the city.  Rooms are nicely decorated, a little small, but not unusual for
The City.

title: Great centrally located hotel
text: Perfect location, small room, on the expensive side but this is Manhattan!The staff were friendly but the rooms could be updated.  The bar was a nice place to chill out in the evening.  Would stay here again.

title: Lexington, NYC
text: Terrific stay at iconic hotel in a great part of NY and customer service  was terrific from check-in to check-out. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the bar scene was very cool. We actually ran into friends of NC - quite the pleasant surprise.

title: New York
text: As always a wonderful experience with the Hotel Team  and facility ,My only concern was that we had to wait until 4:30 pm when we arrived at noon and were told we would have a room by 2:00pm  ,Michael Layman,

title: Great location!
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Lexington. It was our first trip to NYC and we couldn’t have asked for a better location. We walked everywhere! Plus it was close to Grand Central Station to get on the subway to anywhere you needed. The room was small but clean and comfortable. All of the staff were very nice!!

title: Fabulous Hotel
text:
This is my 2nd stay.  I love the location, the value and the entire hotel.  The lobby bar is a great spot.  The corridors are fresh & current and the room was large by NYC standards  The bathroom is clean, bright, small (but thats NYC)
Its a great location and a great value  Will definitely stay again

title: Amazing hospitality
text: Elizabeth and Lisset were amazing and treated my girlfriend and I like royalty upon arrival! They provided extra amenities and really made me feel like my titanium status mattered. Upgraded suite on the 26th floor was nice and Elizabeth made sure it was ready upon arrival. We enjoyed cocktails with our drink tickets and breakfast that was available until 10am the next morning. 5 star service and hotels - will definitely be back to the Lexington

title: Perfect Weekend Everytime
text: Upon arrival I was promptly greeted by Jose who began my check in process.  I had a special weekend planned and Irina came out and welcomed me and was very helpful even setting us up with a bottle of prosecco and a couple champagne glasses.  Although, the room was not quite ready I was allowed to take my baggage up and begin setting up for my girlfriends arrival.  The concierge was able to direct me to a florist and the Amish Market for a few items.  For another review but check out the Amish Market too.  Wally the bellman was a tremendous help the next night with a getting a pizza up to our room.  All in all the entire staff was really amazing for our special weekend and we couldn't have asked for better service.  This is all in addition to the Lexington Hotel just having the coolest vibe to it.  We intend on making the Lexington our New York home whenever we come to the city.  Irina, Jose, Wally, I apologize but don't remember the concierge name, Thank you all so much!

title: Comfortable, with prime location.
text:
Stayed at The Lexington Hotel for a short getaway. Booked first night on points, and second night on standard rate. They were very accommodating when I called in advance to stay in the same room.

Room size was small, but not as small as expected for standard New York City hotels. We had everything we needed, except for maybe some drawer spaces. We made due, and enjoyed our stay. Beds were comfortable, but pillows were way too soft - had to request firmer pillows. 

WiFi was good, no complaints in that department. Service was friendly. Would definitely return whenever in need of a quality yet simple hotel in the City.

title: Almost perfect
text:
Hotel in great location with cool retro vibe. Free coffee and bottled water in lobby 24-7 (love popping down to the lobby for morning coffee). Rooms clean, fairly updated and fairly large by NYC standards. Elevators are quick too.
Cleaning staff super nice & helpful as was restaurant/bar staff. However some of the front desk people need to lose the attitude. Overall a great stay and would highly recommend.

title: Friendly and Convenient
text: Great location near Grand Central and easy access to walk to shopping and sights of NYC. Stay here whenever visiting family or friends. Staff always friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast good. Bar/ lounge fun.

title: I'm ambivalent
text:
The hotel is in a convenient location. It's an easy walk to Grand Central Station or across town to the theater district. It has been updated nicely; it's clean and attractively decorated. The lobby is a busy, noisy gathering place ... nice bar, comfortable seats, brightly lit ... unfortunately they spray it with some sickeningly sweet air refresher:-(
The staff is very nice. The rooms are clean. We almost froze at night because the cold air came in through the closed window which is right next to the bed. I had to ask for an extra blanket. They brought it promptly, and also brought bathrobes when I asked for them. They were a little skimpy on the bathroom supplies; one bar of soap?? No cotton balls, q tips, nail files. The bath towels could have been bigger.But the worst was the paper. Both the tp and the tissues were like newspaper. I think they could do better; provide softer paper goods. (Especially if they're gonna spray that nasty stuff that makes my nose itch.) 
And there's no coffee maker in the room. But there is free coffee in the lobby.
Maybe I'm just spoiled.

title: Excellent location and value for business travel
text: Great central location and across the street from a 24 hour grocery/food store and next to a Duane Reade. The daily laundry credit goes a long way and is dead useful for business travelers packing light for a 3/4 day trip. Friendly staff and great service.

title: Great Hotel, Conveniently Located
text: My wife and I spent the weekend in NYC and chose this hotel both for the location and the price. Very reasonably priced for where it’s located and several places are easily walkable from the hotel. The door, bell and front desk staff are all very nice, and the room was nice and clean and tidy’d up each day. Usually I hate paying resort fees at hotels because it tends to be a ripoff for services that you don’t always use, however as part of your stay, you get a bar credit for every night you stay, laundry credit, and free waters (in addition to the free coffee throughout the day and wine in the lobby during happy hour). We arrived fairly early and our room was not ready, however the bell staff held on to our luggage until our room was ready (around 3pm) which was earlier than the check-in time. This hotel is the very typical New York hotel with small rooms...if you’re looking for a ton of space, this hotel isn’t for you. We chose this hotel for both the location and value, as well as other positive reviews we read online. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again next time I come to NYC.

title: Favorite Place t stay in NYC
text: The location is convenient. The hotel is stylish. The rooms are comfortable. The staff is so accommodating. I can’t think of a negative. We’ve stayed here multiple times. Join the Marriott BonVoy rewards program. Plan your trip with this as your base. You can walk or take the subway everywhere. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Location
text: Always a scrum in reception and hard to get someone’s attention. Really disappointed there is no tea or coffee making facility in the rooms . Nice bright rooms. Nice finish. The hotel is really in a great location

title: Great location and attentive staff
text: We love the theatre in NYC but staying at Times Square can be a hassle.  These near East Side Midtown hotel is a great alternative.  It is not a full service hotel but it does have a bar with food.  The rooms are nice and large by NYC standards.  Ample elevator service which can be an issue at Midtown hotels.  The bar scene is very interesting,  it seemed always busy from 5 PM to Midnight.  I was trying to figure out why then I met the servers Anna and Lauren.  They make everyone feel welcome as does the doorman Kevin

title: Disappointing
text:
Luxury photos online make this property looks beautiful, however once you’re on property you recognize her dated the property is, and how noisy the rooms are. 

Having stated hundreds of properties worldwide, I can honestly say this is one of the worst franchise properties in the Starwood and Marriott in network. If you value peace of mind, restful nights, and overall pleasant experience look elsewhere in the city of Manhattan. If you value peace of mind, restful nights, and an overall pleasant experience look elsewhere in the city of Manhattan

title: Worst Hotel in NYC
text:
Cannot believe how bad this hotel is. Did not get into our room until after 9:30 PM. Room extremely tiny and curtains won’t close so we are trying to block the light from the buildings behind us with our suitcases.
Will not stay here again.

title: A wonderful, quirky hotel in midtown east
text: This hotel has loads of quirky charm, an interesting history and a great midtown location. You know you are staying somewhere a little different when you enter the lobby with it's champagne vending machine (!!)  and the arty-50s-cinema themed decor. Desk staff were efficient, friendly and the free bottle of refreshing water on check in was a nice touch. Rooms are comfortable of a modest size - but it's New York - so that's expected. What was a very pleasant surprise was to find that I was staying so close to legendary cinema history. Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggio lived in a room just down the hall while Marilyn was filming Seven Year Itch. And the lobby bar is very impressive.

title: Très décevant
text: Un hôtel très décevant par rapport aux standards de qualité américain.  Nous avions réservé une chambre avec deux lits et on nous a donné un grand lit dans une chambre très petite. Quand on a demandé à changer, la personne de la réception José a dit d'accord avec un supplément de 50 dollars par nuit alors qu'en allant sur le site de l'hôtel, il n'y avait que 20 dollars de différence. Bonjour l'arnaque.  En plus il était très condescendant avec nous.  À force d'insister, on nous a donné une autre chambre avec un lit plus grand. C'est la première fois que je suis aussi déçue par l'accueil et les services (un jour sur 2 il manquait des serviettes et ménage très approximatif,pas de frigo ni machine à café dans la chambre ) d'un hôtel aux États-Unis.  C'est sur, je n'y remettrai pas les pieds.

title: Very good hotel centrally located in manhattan
text: I liked the fact that there was water and coffee 24 hours free of charge. All staff members were very friendly and were responsive to wishes. Very pleasant atmosphere.  The situation's great. Central station and fifth avenue within walking distance

title: Lex Visit Nov 9-10
text: Incredible hotel - history, staff, amenities, location all exceptional.  Not sure what else I can write but need to use more words in this text-box. And still not enough words which is quite silly.  Short answer here:  A+

title: A great location and a very nice friendly hotel
text:
I have stayed in many hotels in New York ,there are only two I would use again and this is one of them
It s a nice hotel ,very clean ,staff are great and the bar in the evening has all the drink selection you can think of ,there is also a Starbucks within the hotel ,or if you fancy a big breakfast ,the hotel does offer it between 7amd 10 
The rooms are clean but small ,but you will find that in most NY hotels ,
This hotel is in a great location ,2 min from a metro station ,5min from grand central and 10-15min to Bloomingdales ,I can walk to Herals street in 20-25min where Macy’s is or you can get a metro to 34th street which takes 10min 
All staff here are friendly and helpful ,and concierge can help with any quieries you have regarding visiting sites or restaurants recommendation or just getting a taxi 
I do recommend this hotel to anybody visiting NY 
The only negative point is that some of the rooms don’t have a coffee machine or a kettle but then again by the reception area ,they do offer a complementary tea /coffee ,and in the evening sometimes glasses of red and white wines

title: Great room and stay, poor security
text: My wife and I stayed the weekend at the classic NYC hotel The Lexington Hotel. The room was great and the service was wonderful. Our only hangup is that the lack of security and follow up from incidents. My wife checked in Thursday and I arrived Friday evening. Well Friday morning, my wife went down to Starbucks for a morning coffee and in the elevator lobby near the Starbucks entrance was a homeless man SPITTING on people. I don't know who or why this was happening but my wife was one of the people he spit on. She ran back into the main lobby and someone finally chased the man away but when I asked her what the hotel did about it she said he came from Starbucks because it had gotten cold but when confronted to leave he began spitting on people and getting aggressive. The hotel never followed up to see if she OK or anything. I feel there should be some type of controlled access at entrances not monitored by hotel employees and I would've liked the hotel to follow up with my wife.

title: Κάτι απο παλαιό σινεμά
text: Ένα υπέροχο ξενοδοχείο στην καρδιά του Manhattan!!Τα παντα είναι σε απόσταση αναπνοής!Τα δωμάτια ήταν πανέμορφα με κάτι απο παλαιό σινεμά!Και φοβερή θέα!!Ακόμα και ότι μας έδιναν δωρεάν εμφιαλωμένο νερό ήταν πολυ καλή παροχή!!

title: NY Getaway
text: My wife and I travel to New York once or twice a year as a chance to get away from our busy lifestyle. We often select various hotels to see what is out there.  The Lexington will be one of our favorite stays.  The staff was accommodating and friendly; the hotel was very nice and clean and the location accessible to all the spots without being in the midst.   Great Trip!

title: Nice Hotel
text: Was told I could get a discount if I prepaid the hotel in full when booking.  But when I arrived, an extra non-disclosed fee was applied.   Bait and Switch.  Other than that, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel in mid-town.

title: 10 jours à New-York
text: Hotel tres tres propre, super bien situé et pas une chaîne standardisée comme on trouve . Chambre pacieuse et tres confortable avec un lit de tres bonne qualité ! Seul bémol......pas de petit déjeuner mais un starbucks dans l’hôtel pour rattraper ce manque

title: The worst hotel from Bonvoy I have ever stayed!
text: I booked this hotel through my Bonvoy (Marriott) account as I had a 3 days business trip in NY. I have a very high tier, which gives me some amenities such as early check-in and late check-out. The elite counter was not even opened, and when I asked the attendant for a early check-in, she said it was impossible, then I have asked for a forecast, as I needed to plan my schedule. I reached out to the manager, which was rude and did not help me at all. They promised to call me when the room was ready and never did nor offered me a shower on the gym. When I came back on the night to finally check in, the Elite counter was still closed and the room was very poor for the rate I have paid. I will NEVER EVER stay there again.

title: NY Marathon
text: the hotel is very good located, i was feeling very gut there, just the room was a little small, actually we suppose to be two persons, at least i was alone, i really appreciated that we had coffee and bottles of water for free all the time, great.

title: Avoid this property - many (!) better Marriott choices in NYC
text:
This place is a wreck. I’m on my first day of a three day trip and I can’t wait to leave. I STRONGLY suggest you not stay at this poor quality property. There are SO many better choices in the City. 

I’m a Lifetime Marriott Platinum guest (Titanium currently) and stay at Marriott properties around the world. This hotel does not meet the Marriott (Autograph Collection) standards - not even close. The front desk attendant was poor - zero welcome when checking-in, zero briefing on breakfast or amenities, zero smiles, zero service...complete crap. My room is so small my shoulder hits the sink (!) when sitting on the toilet. The room can barely accommodate the small queen bed. The TV in my first room didn’t work. It took two calls to the front desk to get a new room - absolutely not proactive service. To add insult to injury, the bellman dropped my new room keys at my old room with no offer of assistance to move rooms. Please remind me what the $25/day service fee is for...? Oh yeah, it’s a total money-grab with little in return, except for a one-time $20 drink coupon. Total joke!

Avoid this property. It’s a low quality, poor service, old hotel that should be rebranded as a Comfort Inn. I’ll never be back here and everyone in my network and readers of my travel blog will also avoid. Don’t ruin your visit to this amazing city with a stay at this below-standard property.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: It was all good. The hotel is fantastic and the hospitality is great. Unfortunately we only spent one night in this superb hotel. The location is perfect the rooms are clean and the people are very friendly.

title: Excellent option
text: Just returned from a short city break with my daughter in NYC.  We basically chose the Lexington because it offered what appeared to be good value for money, and we weren't dissapointed.  Location is very good for exploring Manhattan, either on foot or using public transport (Grand Central Terminal is a 5 minute walk away). While the bathroom was on the small side, the room itself was spacious enough and comfortably appointed.  The hotel offers complementary tea and coffee in the lobby, which is a nice touch.  The staff were all very helpful.  I would gladly return here on future trips to this fascinating city.

title: Stay at the Lexington Hotel
text:
Only stayed one evening. Very smart hotel, lovely big rooms, gorgeous foyer but, like a lot of USA hotels very poor for meals, breakfasts etc unless you have unlimited funds.
$27 for breakfast! Most of my party went over the road to a café and got something reasonable for a third of that. Most hotels I've been to in Europe have breakfast included. They would not get away with this in Europe.

title: Lovely front desk staff!
text: After a long day of flying in for business, I was very impressed from the moment I walked into the LEXINGTON Hotel. There was a convenient Starbucks and lovely bar/lounge in the lobby. My room was a little smaller than I anticipated, and normally a fine size for 1 perso , but my mother was coming to visit me one night and it would have been tight for 2 people. I went down to the front desk, and before I could request a larger room, Nicole, Lydia and Lisset offered me a slightly larger room. I truly appreciated their hospitality and exceptional service. This is why I love staying at Marriott, they value their customers. Thanks again ladies for making this week even better!

title: A wonderful hotel with outstanding staff
text: I had not been to New York in 20 years and what a wonderful surprise, starting with the Lexington Hotel and staff. Friendly, courteous, and lovely is the only way to describe my entire stay at the Lexington Hotel and New York City.

title: convenient and very clean
text: This was a good choice based on the location of the meetings I had to attend and the fact that I came by train to Penn Station. I did not need a cab and got everywhere on foot. My room was very small, the smallest hotel room I have ever experienced in the US. However it was modern, neat and fresh with pristine linens, and good pillows on the bed altho the bed was quite firm. The bathroom was also tiny and the toilet would not have accommodated a larger person. My main complaint was that I felt cold as the thermostat didn't stay above 68F and a fan continued to blow this rather cool air at me. There is no room service.

title: Below Marriott Standards
text: I am a very loyal Marriott customer and whenever possible stick to them around the world and own two time share weeks.The Lexington was not up to Marriott standards. On the plus side, the breakfast, which was included, was great.The major problem was in the room, a very dirty carpet, including food chunks under the heating unit. We told a housekeeper and the reply was that there was a "floor by floor" thorough cleaning going on. Not a great answer. We also told someone in reception and was told it would be taken care of. Did not happen. Checking out I retold the story and they did agree to remove their extra resort-type fee, as I had used none of the services, some of which (dry cleaning credit) had never been disclosed. After our trip I received an e-mail from a manager hoping to discuss the issues. I responded with two e-mails and two phone calls which were never returned. I mentioned I would be writing a review and wanted him to have the chance to speak with me first, but no response. Most Marriott hotels make me feel valued for my business and loyalty. Not the Lexington.

title: Some what let down
text:
Having booked this trip months ago to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and emailing twice I feel somewhat let down. On arrival our room 2001 was ready at 4pm, our two daughters rooms 2004 and 2005 were not made available until 7pm for 2004 and on leaving for dinner at 730pm 2005 was still being made ready and we were told at 10pm it was just ready. My two daughters are ex Marriot employees and are disgusted. There was no acknowledgement of our celebration. We take note of the New York marathon and how busy it was but the acting manager a young guy I believe his name was Corey was unbelievably rude to begin with. We asked at check in to pay our bill in full, on check out two of my cards were declined and my bill was split in half on two cards.
