I went back to reception twice to query this and was told all was good. On returning home it seems I have been billed twice one charge on 2nov and another on the 6nov. We were happy with the rooms 2001 could do with some dust removal from behind the bed. Location was good but don't know if we will return because of let down at check in
We were traveling from Ireland since 6am that morning and to not have a room available at 4pm is not acceptable.

title: Never again!!!
text:
I am currently lying in my bed listening the the person next door showering literally as if I was in the shower with him. I have never in my life heard a shower from a next door room as loudly. Absolutely unbelievable!! 

I have also been listening to his phone alarm going off repeatedly for the past 2 hours not to mention the constant traffic noise on the streets outside. 

There is basically no sound proofing in this hotel whatsoever, whether from the outside or betweens rooms. 

I stay in hotels every week due to my work and have never ever experienced noise like this. Really, really poor!!!

title: Fantastic hotel, except breakfast and housekeeping
text: As the title says: great location as everything you need, be that for business or pleasure, is litteraly within walking distance. Very nice and spacisou room we had on the 23rd fl which again caters for anything you require for a few nights stay. Check-in, though very busy, was friendly and professional. Room, towards the "back" of the building quietly located so nearly not noise at all. Housekeeping quality faded out throughout our stay: with a small tip on the first day, everything beyond perfect. On the 2nd day, forgot the tip, service meeting standard expectations. On the 3rd day, no tip intentionally, they did not replace coffee and tea pods for the Keurig and no bath mat. Used the Marriott app to ask for those items and it took, including a follow-up call, one hour to get it. Not the nicest experience if you're tired after a full day up and about and just want to go to bed. Breakfast: whilst the selection in terms of quality and quantity is ok, the venue as such is close to unacceptable. Small chairs and small tables. You sit like on a kids chair and the table is merely big enough to put two plates and two cups on it. Very chaotic as well and not enough staff to clean used tables. Whilst raising rates during the NYC marathon was not a problem for the hotel, filling up the buffet indeed was a big problem. Always, something was missing: no cups, no cuttlery, no coffee no scrambled eggs etc. I ran to the lobby to that coffee station as there, there were cups but not coffee so I came back with cups to the buffet breakfast coffee and once I arrived that coffee was also empty. Again, not rocket science especially they knew they were full at that weekend but then again, as a matter of simple decency, if you raise rates, also make sure quality of your product goes along. Very simple expectation management I take. I might return on a "normal" period but for busy times, this hotel is not my choice as they struggle with heavy occupancy.

title: Lexington Hotel NYC
text: Stayed for 2 nights. On check in staff said room was an upgrade but I doubt that. It was basic and looked out over a bit of waste ground. Cleanliness of room was acceptable, bathroom looked shabby. Bed was fine. Reception lobby always busy.Saw a few uncollected plates outside guests  rooms around mid morning and they were still there on our return in the evening👎. Location of hotel was ok, 20 minute walk to Times Square. On leaving we were offered a reduced rate package to return to the hotel within 1 year but declined, when we return to New York I’d prefer to go elsewhere. Have stayed in nicer hotels in NY.

title: Very good stay, nice staff and excellent location!
text: We enjoyed a very good stay with super friendly staff at The Lexington Hotel and benefited from the good location with great restaurants surrounding it! We'll definitely come back next time we visit NYC :)

title: Excellent staff but property needs work...
text: Every member of the staff here was pleasant and helpful, even in the face of throngs of marathon runners (it seemed like hundreds of them were staying at the hotel).  The promised "24/7 coffee" wasn't there when I needed it most (6:30am)...no doubt drained by all those runners.  The mattress in my "queen deluxe" room was much too hard...a foam topper would help.  The bathroom was tiny, but I appreciated the tub and the bath products (a label I'd never heard of call "Pure").  The toilet had a large sign taped all the way across the seat cover (classy) noting that the auto-flush function had been disabled to save water...ironically, the manual flush worked so poorly, I often had to flush three times.  So much for saving water...  The safe in the room didn't work, so I had to walk around the entire weekend carrying all my pricey gear.  While I didn't smell it the first night, on my second night, cigarette smoke was flowing in from the hallway (a towel under the door helped somewhat)...chronic problem in every NYC hotel I've ever stayed in (and that would be many!).  My room was located near the housekeeping closet and the door-slamming was incessant.  I wouldn't stay here again, nor would I recommend it to anyone.

title: A great stay in NYC
text: I have never stayed in this part of the city before, and I really enjoyed the location.  Great restaurants and bars very nearby, without all of the hassle of midtown and Times Square.  The staff at the hotel were great, Lisette checked us in and was delightful and very helpful. Our room attendant Angela was also personable and professional.  We will definitely stay here again!

title: A little disappointed.
text: The rooms were accommodating and comfortable. We were forced to pay for things we didn’t want or need and when we went to breakfast we paid $73.00 for two people. It was a buffet, the sausage, bacon and eggs were cold, the fruit okay and over priced.

title: Great Service and Perfect Location!!!
text:
I loved the hotel, excellent service, great location and staff, very friendly and great work of Amin (the man of the door) and the blond lady concierge, I can't remember her name!
Marilyn Monroe also lived there, I was very exited about that!!!
Thanks to everyone !!!!!!
Loves from Chile.

title: Beware of the charging services
text: I booked 3 rooms at this hotel for our family (6 persons) through the Marriot phone number. I gave my VISA card number to secure the rooms and when I checked in I said I will pay with a different card at check out. After I checked out I realized they had charged me $ 818 at the VISA card. Also, I received an offer for a suite for $110 additional which I requested and never got an e-mail back. When I checked in they said they had rooms but it cost $ 300 additional which I had to pay. I have not received a reasonable explanation or refund for any of this yet, which is a pity because the hotel is nice, well located and they have nice personnel to help you (except at reception).

title: Congrats. Great service!
text: I travel very often to NYC, and have had good and bad experiences with hotels.I stayed at this hotel and the service was excelent. Mr Oscar Argueta and the staff provided an oustanding service. Will come return soon!

title: Très bien situé
text:
Hôtel bien situé. Tout près de Grand Central, de plusieurs stations de  métro.
Eau en bouteille à volonté. Un Star Buck à même l’hôtel. On m’a donné des coupons pour l’apéro au bar de l’hôtel. Un peu bruyant par l’environnement (après tout on est au coeur de Manhattan). J’y reviendrai très certainement.

title: My favourite hotel in NYC
text: This hotel is in the heart of midtown in a great location.  I love that it is a Marriott property but has the look and feel of a boutique hotel. The service is excellent and the entire staff is personable and friendly.  And if you love Marilyn Monroe this is definitely a spit you should stay at.

Love this hotel every time I stay here. I,m Platinum elite and I,m always  treated  well. The elite breakfast is excellent. Jose Miranda, I think this is his last name, is terrific  and always is helpful,efficient,and friendly. He makes me and my wife feel welcome all the time.

title: Lexington hotel stay
text: Great hotel very comfortable. They upgraded our room as it was my daughters 21st birthday and left her some lovely gifts. We would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends. Great location walking distance to Grand Central Station and the Rockefeller Centre.

title: Family trip
text: I thought the Lexington was a very nice small hotel. Service was excellent with a few hiccups. The front desk clerk upon checking said we were not registered and I had checked in online. She finally found the reservation. One of the bartenders was not friendly. All in all I would recommend thus hotel, great access if business or family located on east side.

title: lovely location
text: Lovely location, beautiful hotel, Starbucks in the hotel made mornings easy, nice gym, clean comfortable room, great location too! Only complaint is very strong scent cologne smell in lobby when you come in, made me sneeze lots and gave me a bit of a headache when hanging out where the coaches are.

title: Disappointing
text: Arrival at reception for check in was chaotic. Surprisingly, no welcome or pleasanteries at all, we had no doorman to help with our cases on arrival. Our room was so small for x 2 adults and our teenager (considered an adult). No room for our 3 cases to open! 2 towels in the bathroom and only 4 hangers. One bed was smaller than the other! We eventually, managed to change room, but only the next day after insisting we speak to management. We ended up with a suite which was beyond what we needed, and had to pay for it of course, but we couldn't have done 5 nights in a room that tiny. We learn't over the time that unless you are 'Mariott point holders (platinum, titanium, gold etc) you really don't have much of a service and almost deemed as second class citizens! Hotel reception is frosty and I wouldn't recommend it as a family place to stay, much more a business hotel. Location however is good. On top of the huge expense we had to pay for a better room, we also had to pay additional fees for our luggage to be looked after from check out to when we left. Overall, I'm afraid, very disappointing.

title: Classic
text: We stayed in a beautiful suite.  Very clean and well appointed.  Comfortable queen bed and lots of closet space.  Staff was helpful.  Bar downstairs was very friendly with soft jazz music playing in the evenings.

title: Comfortable stay at iconic NY hotel
text: I enjoyed my stay from the start, when there was some extra effort made to help me check in early. I appreciate that this iconic hotel has held on to its character while nicely updating. My room was well laid out with the most important feature for me at any hotel, a great bed. The view was classic New York, noise levels low and temperature perfect. Small bathroom but not a problem. I'll return.

title: Watch your bags
text:
We have stayed here before, as it is in a good location and, in the context of NYC  prices,  is  pretty  reasonably  priced.   However,  this time was not  great.  We  had a suite;  although the room was pretty  good sized, the bathroom is the same tiny  NY  bathroom,   The towels were tired.   The  attempt at "retro-cool"  decor  just looks  old.   The  tiny tables in the bar/breakfast  area,  while okay for someone having only  drinks are too small to comfortable  hold two  breakfast  plates  and coffee and  juice.  This means  everyone with parties of two or more were  grabbing  the tables for four.  I also  hate the low chairs in the breakfast area  that make you feel like you are eating at the children's  table.  

The worst thing, however, is the the  front  doorman is overworked.  The hotel only had one person outside to load and unload  luggage.  So after waiting for our  luggage to be taken out of the car for a while, the doorman helped us  load it on a cart, and then left it on the sidewalk while he ran off to help someone else.   My husband and I had  walked into the hotel to  check in, but when I saw our bags unattended, I ran out and stand by them  (but, hey, it's not like no one  ever has anything stolen in  NY, right?).    When the bags  finally were brought inside,  we checked in, went to our room and waited for the bags.  And waited.  And waited.  Finally, my husband went  downstairs and got them himself.  I am not blaming the doorman, but who  decided that only one  person should be on  duty between  3-4  pm, when everyone is checking in?  And  why were the other valets inside not  helping?  And not  bringing back  upstairs?  

The hotel  has a lot of extra  fees -   the destination charge and  the parking fees are very  high. 

We  are  lifetime  Marriott platinum members, and current Titanium members, so we try to stay at Marriott hotels  whenever possible.  But  we will pass on this hotel in the future.

title: Would highly recommend!
text:
A stones throw from Times Square! Hotel was clean, welcoming, friendly and accommodating staff and easy access to most of NYC attractions. Approx 25 min cab ride to Lag airport ($40 with 4 passengers). Approx 10 min walk from Times Square and very close access to hop on/off bus stops. Conveniently there are 2 spots to eat within 100 feet of the lobby doors - a 24 hour fine food store at the corner and at the other corner a fantastic deli. Rooms are small but have everything you might need!
Great Hotel!

title: Lexington Mid-town NYC
text: Excellent ammenities, clean room, and great location.  The room I stayed in was near the end of the hall which made the amount of foot trafffic very low so it was nice and quite.  The neighborhood restaurants and shops were very good so that made my shopping very easy to do.

title: One night in NYC
text: Great location, helpful staff, nice bar, and Starbucks is just off the lobby. Our room and bath were tiny, but I think that is just what comes with being in New York. It was spotless. Nice bed with luxury linens.

title: A gem in NYC
text: I've stayed at the Lexington a number of times over the years.  The most recent visit was exceptional.  The property was clean and lively.  The rooms while smallish were a great value and very comfortable.  Would definitely recommend this again.

title: They got the vibe right!
text: In case you missed it, this hotel was where Joe DiMaggio and Marilyn Monroe made their home. Everything about it makes you feel like they just might still be there. The new main floor lounge was done very tastefully and in a style representative of the period.  I have stayed there several times and it just keeps getting better!

title: Nice stay
text: Very nice stay that was in a good location. Check in and out was very easy and I was offered bottled water. Everyone was very nice and the room was clean. I will definitely stay here again when I visit NYC.

title: Great location!
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Lexington Autograph Collection.  Spent 3 nights here on a recent family trip.  Everyone was always asking/willing to help!  The hotel's  location is great!  Close to several area attractions and restaurants, etc.  Room was on the small side but realize this is common in New York City.  Hotel was very nice and would stay here again !

title: Ney York my love!!
text: Everything was excellent. Especially the location!!!! The room was very clean and quiet ! Wonderful lobby! A little bit expensive though. The people at reception were very polite! Generally we had a great time there!

title: Great Stay!
text: This hotel is amazing! It's very chic and well kept. The staff is extremely friendly and the free coffee every morning is a plus. The best perk is that if you don't mind walking, its relatively close to everything. The only minus point is that the rooms are fairly small but I guess that's New York! I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Kitschy cool
text: We stayed here for one night recently. Tiny but fun room, 2cocktail coupons, easy breakfast spot and nice bar. The staff was welcoming and lovely as we arrived at 9:30 at night after a day Sloan Kettering. Location is midtown - convenient to everything

title: Big rooms!
text: For NYC the rooms are nice and big. The lobby looks recently renovated and the bar was great. The hotel is a bit noisy but that is to be expected in NYC. I usually stay further West but would definitely come back to this hotel when in NYC!

title: Great Location, but really noisy
text:
The hotel is well decorated, comfortable beds, but its noisy, thats the only reason i didnt feel truly comfortable. 
Location is  great , few blocks from Grand Central and shops and dinner. Receptionists friendly.

title: Nice hotel but the beds where not up to Marriott Standards
text: Nice eclectic hotel close to everything in downtown NYC but the bed was comfortable.  The staff was friendly but I wish that hotels would either raise there prices or discontinue resort fees.  They tend to make me want to find hotels that don't gouge you with these additional charges.

title: Nice stay at Lexington
text: Although the room was small, we found it extremely comfortable and well appointed.  Service was great, they accommodated an early check in for us.  Location great, near Grand Central with a convenient food hall.  Close to subway stations as well.

title: Great staff, bar, and business center.
text: The Lexington Hotel was a wonderful place to stay and work in New York City. The location can't be beat. The rooms were spacious (by city standards) and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. But what stood out the most was the quality of workspaces on the mezzanine level, and the quality of the drinks and ambiance at the hotel bar.

title: Fees, fees everywhere, and poor service
text:
When I first booked this hotel, the room rate seemed great for the location.  But then I found out about the daily resort fee—for the bar or laundry, which I won’t be using—and that it was mandatory.  After 30 minutes arguing with a manager, she agreed to waive the fee.  And in check in—no record of that agreement.  Discussion with rude front desk staff followed, from which I walked away saying I’ll deal with it at check out.

Text message asking about my stay got me confirmation about the resort fee being waived.

Package arrived—but could not be delivered in the evening.  Next morning, it took 3 calls to the rude front desk staff to get my package delivered—2 hours after my first request, making me late for meetings.

Breakfast in any hotel is a rip-off, but the $30 buffet here comes with a surprise 18% service charge.  And no service.  No one came to my table except to drop
a check, and when I asked if she could bring me water, she told me it was self service at the bar.

HVAC control in the room not great, and noisy even on the 16th floor.  Room decor tired and not well maintained but the mattress and pillows ok.  All told, not as good as some of the HGIs and Courtyards I’ve stayed in at a lower rate.

title: Great Location
text: We recently stayed at the Lexington Hotel for two nights. We were surprised at the number of people congregating in the lobby and bar. The staff was very friendly and we received coupons for drinks for both nights. Check-in and check- out was very rapid.  The east side location was walking distance to restaurants and the theater district. Overnight parking, with in and out valet service, was reasonably priced.

title: Great location, lovely workers!
text: This hotel was great! So cute, friendly staff, perfect sized room for two people! Very clean and presentable. Complimentary wine at check in was a huge plus! That was a great added bonus after traveling all day. We also got drink vouchers, Dry cleaning vouchers and free citi bike passes! Definitely would stay at this hotel again!

title: Great hotel! Great location!
text: Just a few blocks from most places to want to visit on the Upper East Side or Mid town East. Six short blocks from Grand central. Check in can get crowded, but moves quickly and smoothly. Great buffet breakfast! Wonderful lounge and lobby for people watching.

title: Great hotel in Midtown
text: A great find in Midtown. Reasonable rates, high end feel, nice but noisy bar. All around an excellent experience. Would highly recommend. A bit of a hike to the theater district but Uber/Lyft drivers were readily available.

title: Perfect place to stay in NYC
text: I cannot say enough about how wonderful the Lexington Hotel is. The location is perfect for everything you want to do while visiting NYC. The staff is so friendly and they go out of the way to make your stay relaxing and comfortable.

title: A typical busy NY hotel in mid-town
text: The Lexington seems very popular, very busy, with people coming to and fro all the time. In part this is due to the convenient location in mid-town. The rooms are clean and well taken care of, the bathroom a bit small but also kept very clean. For a few days this hotel serves its role, but for the price paid it seemed to me overrated. But this can be probably be said about everything in this overpriced city.

title: A Hotel You Want to Like, But You Cannot
text:
I had not stayed here for 7 years, prior to the renovations.  There is good here, but operationally there is too much bad to make this a good experience.

First, the good.  The hotel, with its art deco emphasis, is pretty.  The rooms are small and you can hear noises from the halls, but are nicely designed as a whole and comfortable if you do not have large baggage.  The bathrooms are tiny but also well designed as a whole and pretty.

The staff at check in, despite being overwhelmed (more to come in the bad), were gracious and kind.  Similarly, the waitresses in the bar, also over worked, were the same.

Elevators, despite being a big hotel with many guests, were rapid at all times of day.

Now, the bad.  The check in and bellman areas are overwhelmed most of the days with throngs of people.  The hotel, at some 750 rooms I think, has too small of a lobby, too small of a check in area, ad too small of a bellman area.  This results in lines everywhere and long wait times.

Now, the awful.  Housekeeping.  I checked into my room late (the room was not ready and the hotel never texted me like they said they would when it became ready).  As a result, I checked into the room at about 4:30 pm, changed clothes, went to a pre-show dinner, and then attended a performance at Carnegie Hall until about 11 p.m.  I came back to the hotel, had a couple glasses of wine in the hotel bar until 12:30 a.m. and then proceeded to my room.  Pulling back the sheets, they were *obviously* slept in (wrinkled where you could see a human rear end had rested in them) and had black fuzz and lint all over them (top and bottom sheets).  I called the desk, asked for the manager, and got a relatively snarky man on the phone who tried to basically claim the housekeepers were union and there is no way they could have not changed the sheets.  He eventually sent a guy up to change the sheets.

I left the next day to go out and later returned to the room to find it had been serviced.  Except the housekeeper took whatever towels I had used (including the bath mat) and didn't replace them.  Ditto the cups to drink out of.

I want to like this hotel as I like the art deco appearance and its location at 48 and Lex.  But, operationally, this hotel doesn't have the staff for its size.  To let people check in to rooms that are not fully cleaned is a fatal flaw for a hotel and a sign that staff are cutting corners to deal with the heavy loads of people.

title: Worst two nights sleep ever
text: The staff was nice and common areas nice. I expected the room to be tiny in New York. But the bed was so worn out it slanted into the middle. There was about a two foot gap between the bed and headboard so it was hard to sit up in bed and our pillows would fall in the gap. But the worst part of all was their AWFUL bedding! It was like the roughest cheapest paper towels you can imagine. They weren’t warm or comfortable and the pillow was so rough against my face I had to put something over it. I have never ever ever felt worse bedding! We’ve stayed over 40 nights in hotels this year and these were the worst two BY FAR! We even cancelled the third night we were supposed to stay. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

title: Lovely place
text: This is a lovely hotel in a wonderful location. Close enough to most of the must see places that you can walk to them. The bar is lovely as is the bar food. Service is a little slow, but the staff are good when you catch their eye.

title: Very disappointing 4* not!!
text: We booked this hotel for a short break,this was my daughters first time to NYC so I wanted it to be special. Before arriving I asked for two robes to be supplied as these are only available upon request, four requests later and after 24 hours they arrived!  I also asked for a coffee machine,which arrived but never worked,I asked to speak to a manager but again this never happened. The rooms are very cold and the heating was only turned on after several rooms complained, apparently we were told the heating is only turned on when guests complain.  I was not impressed with our welcome, the room was very average, the bedding is inadequate, I asked for an extra blanket, which was supplied but then removed the next day. Every day I phoned down to ask for the heating to be turned on.  4* I don’t think so!!!

title: Outstanding Contemporary Hotel
text: This hotel was opening in 1929. The rooms are small, there is not a full service restaurant but the bar makes up for it. The hotel provides a buffet breakfast in the bar area that is reasonably priced. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The overall service is great. The location is one of the best because we were able to walk to many attractions and theaters.

title: Nice location and pleasant place to stay
text: I have stayed here numerous times. It has a great location and the staff does a great job. The rooms are roomy enough for New York City.  Simply a nice place to stay. The elevators work great, which is nice in  a big hotel.

title: Lovely experience.
text: Comfortable but not elegant.  Eclectic and interesting decor.  Small bathroom, but nicely functional.  Linens and mattress nice.  Concierge knowledgeable and helpful.  Toiletries and breakfast good, but not exceptional.

title: Noisy hotel in a great location
text:
Hotel is in a great location, easy to walk to most tourist attractions, next door to another hotel that has a great roof top bar. 

Room was clean, but very small especially the bathroom.
The hotel is very noisy the lobby and reception area especially, we struggled to sleep whilst we stayed there it was very noisy not from New York City but inside the hotel, no sound proofing.

Reception customer service was average on arrival and non existent on check out.

We wanted to leave luggage whilst we went out before flight home, we were asked if we were Marriott Bonvoy members which we both are, if you aren’t you have to pay for luggage storage, which I had never seen before.

I’m not sure why this is in Marriotts Autograph Collection, it’s a basic noisy 3 star hotel at best that has pictures of Marilyn Monroe everywhere with average customer service, I have stayed in better cheaper hotels in New York with equally good location.

title: Location, lobby, great spot
text: I really like this location on Lexington. Convenient to many great restaurants and bars and also public transportation. The lobby and bar remodel is really nice. I loved the new bar but upset that I couldn’t get a bar stool when I arrived. Free wine for an hour during the week

title: The Lexington, A Truely Historic Full Service Hotel
text: I love the history.....the Marilyn Monroe video clips playing behind the front desk, and the fact that Marilyn actually lived there for six months!  The Lex has been tastfully updated but still retains the historic charm.

title: Third time but it won’t be the last...
text: We have enjoyed all of our stays but this was the best so far.  Our Junior Suite was spacious and comfortable.  Two bathrooms were the ticket to the overall enjoyment of the space.  The WiFi was fast and stable and the breakfast hot, fresh and tasty.  The refreshing of the property was well done.

title: Stay 10/16-18
text: I have stayed at the Lexington a number of times over the years, normally for work.  This trip was for pleasure.  I have always recieved great service from all of the staff.  I have never had a bad stay.  I stay in hotels over 100 night aper year.  Also, liked the renovation to the bar.

title: The noisy hotel
text:
We decided somewhat to do a very brief weekend away from London and go to NYC. I chose this hotel primarily for it’s location, which is excellent and enabled us to see a lot and meet up with people in a very short space of time. 

The hotel itself has comfortable furnishings albeit the distinction of being the noisiest hotel I’ve ever stayed in. 

It’s apparent as soon as you walk in to the lobby where there was loud music.  Loud music in lifts too.  One night there was some very loud music coming from a service room next door to ours. Not sure what was going on but I didn’t appreciate it at 3am.  People taking drinks back to their room, alcoholic vending machines in the lobby, the hotel plays heavily on the Marilyn Monroe connection..it’s all a bit much for a Brit who values quiet hotels.  

What I find strange is NYC itself is less noisy than the hotel...

At checkout, staff member checked me out and that was it.  No pleasantries, didn’t ask how my stay was. No thank you for my marriott loyalty, oh well..just a number I guess...the hotel did it’s job and gave me somewhere to sleep in the most part and it was clean. For that it scrapes a three. Next time when I have more time to plan, I’ll go to Ritz Carlton, JW or St Regis.

title: Tired of the "It's Manhattan so..." Excuse for Letting Things Slide
text:
First, the good. The location is excellent if you have business in the MetLife Building. Check-in was fast, well-staffed, and very pleasant. Surprisingly, the elevators were very fast. The room was generally clean and comfortable. And a pretty interesting history, which I like. 

Now the rest:

-Mandatory "destination fee" is almost $30/day with taxes. I don't care how much dry cleaning credit of free drinks the fee includes. That's a ripoff and I can't believe they charge this with a straight face. But, I know, "it's Manhattan" so people shrug their shoulders. 

-My standard room was the size of a shoebox. Bathroom so small it's hard to turn around. If you have a decent amount of luggage, good luck figuring out where to put it (or more than one person in the room). But, I know, "it's Manhattan." 

-No coffee machine (or mini-fridge) in the room? Maybe if Marriott bumps up the "destination fee" in the future it can spring for a Keurig. There is a Starbucks literally attached to the hotel, so I appreciate the hotel wants you spending money at Starbucks. But not everyone wants to go downstairs immediately after waking up. 

-Paper-thin walls. Conversations had a normal speaking levels in adjoining rooms easily heard. 

-I was on a low floor and it was noisy. Not the fault of the hotel, I suppose. But just reserve a room on a high floor. 

Overall it's not a train wreck. But I'll go in a different direction next time I'm in town.

title: New York Holiday
text:
Fabulous hotel, great service 
Really good and fast check in
All staff were very pleasant and helpful 
The Starbucks on the ground floor was perfect 👍 our room was small but perfect for a stay in NY, it was very clean with a nice bathroom and all mod cons as expected

title: Great Hotel with Interesting History
text: We stayed 3 nights at the Lexington and appreciated the location as it is close to Times Square but not too close! There are some great restaurants within walking distance. Our greeting upon arrival was not the usual Marriott standard. The gal asked us to approach and then walked away. We were unclear if we were to stay there or wait for someone else. They gave us 3 coupons for drinks at the bar. One coupon covers one drink and there were two of us. LOL And, also breakfast coupons which was nice. The breakfast is good, not anything special. The hotel is very pretty and the history of Joe Dimaggio and Marilyn Monroe is fascinating. We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again when we return to NYC. The room was clean and the housekeepers did a great job.

title: Hip hotel
text: This hotel is vibrant and energetic. Small rooms but that’s average for NYC. Great location and the staff is friendly. I had a difficult experience with the bell desk and would not even try to use them again. If you’re looking for a calm, relaxing place to return to after a day/night in the city that never sleeps, this is not the place for you. There is a significant amount of sensory stimulation and for me, after a busy day in the city, it was too much.

title: Excellent customer service; perhaps not best choice for business traveler
text:
I was impressed with my recent stay at The Lexington, my first. Their customer service was phenomenal. Everything from promptly delivering a package to my room, even after the official time for access had passed, to the fresh still and sparkling water in the lobby, and the very clean room made my stay pleasant.

Having said all this, I travel regularly for business and do honestly prefer hotels with a bit of a quieter lobby and common spaces, so would perhaps not return, but it's not for lack of good amenities or customer service. The lobby, which I use for work in the afternoons, was very loud, with multiple large airline staff groups departing daily. There was also live music in the afternoons/early evenings, and while they were talented performers, it made the entire space very loud and gave it a lounge/bar-like atmosphere. Again, nothing negative per se, but just not the right fit for my travels this time.

title: Magnifica estancia
text: Estuvimos 4 noches en este magnífico hotel. La situación es inmejorable, rodeado de buenos restaurantes y muy bien comunicado. La habitación que teníamos era amplia y cómoda, con dos baños completos. Fueron de gran ayuda JUAN (un filipino que trabaja en la entrada de hotel) nos recibió cuando llegamos y nos ayudó con todo lo que necesitamos. Otra persona muy amable fue Bella, encargada de recomendar las actividades que se pueden hacer en NY.

title: Great Stay near Times Square
text: This hotel has terrific service and an attentive staff as well as very comfortable rooms. The room was nice and quiet, given it's location near the sometimes noisy Times Square, the amenities you would expect and firmly comfortable beds.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This is one of the nicest hotels I’ve ever stayed in in NYC. Rooms are very spacious and so clean. The staff is awesome- everyone is so nice. We went for my son’s 16th birthday and had the best time. I definitely recommend the Hemingway Suite for a special occasion. It was beautiful.

title: Pictures are Deceiving!
text:
I am surprise people gave such good reviews for this place.  Yes the location is great but other than that,  there is nothing upscale about this place on how they advertise it.   I was so excited to stay here as this is my 3rd time back to New York and I am into trying new boutique and upscale hotels.   Check-in was fine as the girl that checked me in was friendly and she informed me the proper steps.  I wish I could give this place a 1 but since she was friendly, I gave this another point.   We only stayed here for 2 nights and trust me it was plenty enough.   One strange thing about our room is this is the 1st hotel we stayed in that offers no mini fridge/bar?  Second,  they don't offer any complimentary water at all?  If they were trying to be environmentally friendly on getting rid of plastic bottles,  please inform this to us when we check in.   But they couldn't be as I was given 2 bottles of water right at check-in.  They did a shoddy job of renovating as understand it is a historical building and they did major upgrades to lift up the hotel to attract guests.  The towel rack was lopsided,  bathroom had musky smell as no fan to keep the air circulation going.  This could definitely bring up mold later.  There was a clunky noise from 7PM up to 11PM for both nights.  I wasn't sure if it was to do with old pipes but it was definitely loud.  The 1st night when I turn on the shower,  dark yellow water came out.  I had to keep the water running till it became clear.   
We had to check out very early in the morning at 5AM and boy the morning staff needs to get their coffee!   They didn't seem like morning people and looked moody!  My husband and I have traveled to many countries and stayed in different hotels and our worst experiences was in North America.

title: Always perfect
text: I always stay here for work trips - though midtown is not my preference for New York, it is convenient for my office.  The rooms are big, the beds are comfortable and clean - and its quiet!  Its PERFECT for a work trip.  Its really great value, love the bar and laundry vouchers - this is the ideal NY stay for work.

title: Bruyant !!!
text:
Chambre vraiment petite (à peine la place pour ouvrir une valise), 
mal insonorisés, bruyant.
Le comble l'alarme à incendie qui s'allume en plein milieu de la nuit, avec le longue alerte pour nous confirmé que c'est une fausse alerte, vraiment très fort !!!

même avec des bouchons d'oreille on entend le bruit de la rue 

Sinon hôtel sympa avec une histoire

title: Check-In Was Awful
text:
Overall, the Lexington Hotel is a relatively nice upscale hotel. I gave a low star rating because my room wasn’t ready at the published checkin time. In fact it wasn’t ready until after 7pm. We had dinner reservations and theater tickets for that evening, and had been traveling since the wee hours of the morning so it was a major inconvenience that we weren’t able to rest, freshen up, and dress properly before our evening activities. As the hours ticked by, there was also the added stress of wondering if in there even was a room for us at all. I received notification that the room was ready long after dinner and after we had entered the theater. Since I had reserved the room weeks in advance, this is unacceptable. 
The room itself was comfortable and nice, although the bathroom smelled strongly of urine. 
This is an expensive hotel and we certainly didn’t get what we paid for. With so many nice hotels in New York, I won’t be staying here again.

title: An historic gem
text: The Lexington Hotel is a comfortable, historic hotel with a modern flair.  Opened in 1929, the hotel was once the home of Joe DiMaggio and his wife, Marilyn Monroe.  It is within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, Grand Central Terminal and Broadway theaters, but far enough away from the hubbub to permit a restful sleep.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: The Service was that of a 5 star hotel. Everything from checking in, to picking my bags up from the bag storage when leaving for the airport was wonderful! All the staff was very friendly and professional. There was also unlimited complimentary bottled water which was an added bonus.

title: Try to avoid if you can
text:
I’m a Platinum Elite (soon to be Titanium) member of Marriott Bonvoy, so I frequently stay at Marriott properties all around the world.  I have to say the Lexington is by far the worst.  With so many great choices in NYC, I would suggest you try and avoid staying at this property.

We arrived on Wednesday, October 16, 2019, which was a very rainy night.  It took us over 45 minutes in the pouring rain to get a taxi (Ubers were booked and just as tough), so we arrived cold, wet and tired, so happy to be finally checking in.  At first there was no one to help us with our luggage, but finally someone came out and grabbed our bag, and told us it would be delivered to the front desk.  We got in line to check in.  It was 8:30, and there was quite a line.  When we got to the attendant, he demanded, without looking at us, for ID and credit card.  When I gave them to him, I told him that it was a special occasion, and that I had requested an upgrade if one was available (I have several Marriott suite upgrade coupons, and with Platinum status, it is often offered).  I know this is based on availability.  Again, with no eye contact, he chuckled, and said “we are fully booked, that is not happening.”  He then handed us a key, and shouted, “next in line”. We stood there not quite sure what just happened.  Funny though, there was no one else left in line, so not sure what the urgency was.  By far, the worst check in ever.

So now we waited for our bag.  We noticed there were carts with bags being transported, but none had our bag.  We could not fine the porter who took our bag.  We started to panic.  I went out front though the foyer, and there, sitting in a corner, unattended, all by itself, was our bag.  I put the money back in my pocket that I had planned to use as a tip, grabbed my bag, and we went upstairs.

The room was ridiculously small, part of the old design of the way hotels used to be.  The bathroom was even smaller.  There was no minibar.  The towels in the bathroom were stacked on the floor.  Yes, on the floor!  The same floor that gets mopped every day with whatever else ends up on a bathroom floor.  I’m attaching a picture.  Not what one would expect.

Next, I needed to press a shirt for dinner.  We pulled out the iron and ironing board.  The iron leaked.  I’m very familiar with hotel irons, and we tried several tricks, but bottom line, the iron was broken, and now had leaked water all over my shirt.  Ugh, just a bad day.

The next morning we went down for breakfast after waking up to noise from the room next door. The walls are quite thin, and you can hear much of what is happening with your neighbours.  The host at breakfast told us to sit anywhere.  It was 7:15 in the morning.  There were several empty tables, but none were cleaned off.  The host just watched us as we looked for a table that was “not too bad”.  We went and got some napkins to wipe it down (picture attached).  Then I went up to the buffet.  The plate I took was dirty!  Honestly, you can’t make this stuff up.  I took a picture of that (I did not start out taking pictures, but once we realized how bad this was becoming, we wanted pictures to prove it.  I’m sorry I forgot to get a picture of the iron).  So dirty table, dirty plates, what else could go wrong.  The bacon tray was 90% empty, and burnt (yep, picture).  Through all of this, the check in, the luggage, the filthy breakfast experience, not once did any employee seem to care.  Everyone seems “busy” but not taking care of things.  The training in this property was unlike any other Marriott I’ve ever seen.  Even though breakfast was included, we chose not to go on the second day.

Finally, I had the pleasure of spending $600+ a night for this experience.  At $600, I start to expect a certain level of professionalism, cleanliness, and service.  We got none of the above.

I hope they eventually get their act together.  The location is great, and there is an AMAZING restaurant right out the front door on the right called Sea Fire Grill.  I will leave them their own review.  It was outstanding.

I hope my fellow travellers find this review helpful.  Thanks for reading.

title: The Lexington Hote,l a great find...in NYC
text: Great Hotel Nicely re-done, very energetic lobby / Bar area centrally located in NYC. This hotel is a good value in NYC. Great service, easy access in and out with nice clean rooms. One of my favorite stays in NYC.

title: Girls Weekend
text: My mom and I went for a girl's weekend trip and from the time we checked in until the time we left, we felt like we were on cloud 22! Elizabeth Lopez who oversees the front of the hotel, she was so wonderful! She made us feel so welcome and comfortable. Our room was so cozy and the hotel was lovely with a Marilyn Monroe ambiance! Not to mention the hotel had such a natural scent to it, almost like a soothing lavender scent. We will definitely return for sure!!!! Absolutely had the time of our lives....oh and I forgot to add, we had our room upgraded as well :)

title: Great place to stay!
text: Great staff and location.  We were very happy with the lobby, check in, bar, concierge service and room attendants.  Rooms are good size for NYC and very nice.  We liked the updating that has occurred and would stay here again.

title: Great Location and Clean Rooms
text:
We give 4.5 Stars to Lexington Hotel. Our room was ready when we arrived and upgraded to the upper floors in a quiet location. The rooms are clean and well maintained. As others as stated, the rooms are small but very adequate for our 4-night stay. We liked the location as in the late night we could open our windows and hear minimal street noise. As a signature hotel, some of the amenities were ok, lots of paper cups (no glass) and rust stains in the tub and inexpensive tissue.

I would highly recommend this hotel for a great location, clean rooms, WONDERFUL housekeeping staff with reasonable priced rooms in NYC.

title: Comfortable hotel
text:
Comfortable hotel at a nice location. Rooms and bed ok. Quite noisy in the lobby. 

We stored our luggage for a couple of hours an had to pay $3 per item. For a hotel like this, we think this should be included.

title: Not Autograph-worthy
text: From poor service to poor furnishings this was definitely disappointing.  My profile specifies a high floor away from the elevator so it is quiet, neither of which was even acknowledged and they left me in a low floor sharing a wall with the elevator so \i got to listen to the considerable street noise and elevators all day and night.

title: Amazing!  Comfortable!  Memorable!  Stay at the Lexington!
text: One word:  Amazing!  From the moment I made the reservation to when Alexandra J. Malamud reached out to me and upgraded our room to the point when we checked in al... well .... that’s the amazing part!  Our room had an amazing balcony on Floor 23 - a wonderful housekeeping staff and kind personnel from the time we walked in until we left.  Highly recommend.  Thank you for making our trip memorable, enjoyable, comfortable and ....perfect!  Would recommend the Lexington and would stay at the property again time we are in NYC.  There is absolutely nothing that would make me want to stay somewhere else. Thank you for making our vacation wonderful!

title: Business Trip in NYC
text:
You need to ask about loyalty perks.  The staff does not tell you.  I was not able to take advantage of the laundry service or the happy hour perks.   

I like the location of the hotel

I had not taken advantage of the restaurant before it was good. 

I appreciate the Starbuks

title: Nice Place To Stay in Midtown
text: If you’re looking for a nice place to stay in midtown that is away from the hustle & bustle, I recommend this hotel. The rooms are clean, “NY small”, and well kept. You get a $20 voucher for drinks when you check in, to be used in their bar, located on the main level. The lobby is a nice place to sit or wait for friends and family. Coffee and water are available by the check in desk.

title: Dreckige Laken bei Check in
text: Bei Check in war das Bett zwar gemacht aber beim Aufschlagen derTagesdecke dreckig. Es sah aus als ob das Zimmer vom Vorgänger nicht neu bezogen wurde. Auch gab es im Bad nur zwei Handtücher. Ein Hotel in dieser Preislage sollte sich einen besseren Service leisten können. Die Zimmer sind klein wie fast überall in NYC. Wir konnten jedoch sehr deutlich die Toiletten Spülung der Nachbarzimmer und den Fahrstuhl hören. Wer das Geld für NYC investiert sollte ein anderes Hotel wählen.

title: Good hotel and good location!
text:
My wife and I stayed here for five nights and enjoyed our stay.  The hotel is a grand old building that I believe was renovated a few years ago.  We got upgraded for free from a standard queen to a standard king and were lucky with that as the king bed was huge and very comfortable.

The room itself was a reasonable size but the bathroom was pretty small but I appreciate this is the Big Apple where that is pretty standard! 

Also, if it’s not advertised in your booking, please be aware that the hotel charges a $25 per night ‘resort fee’.  This isn’t too bad to be fair as it includes the following complimentary items - WiFi, 24 hour tea and coffee, bottled water, gym, laundry credit and $20 beverage voucher for the bar.  So if you take advantage of all of those then you’ll probably get more then $25 per day in value.  Also be aware that the hotel put a hold on your payment card on check-in of $100 per night so I’d recommend using a credit card with plenty of available credit.

The hotel also has a Starbucks in it at one side which also gives a shortcut to Lexington Avenue.  

The location of the hotel on 48th and Lexington, is also a very convenient location as within a maximum of a 20 minute walk you have Times Square, Broadway, shopping on 5th Avenue, the Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and Grand Central Station (to name but a few!).

We therefore enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider it again on our next trip to NYC!

title: Great stay
text: Lovely hotel. Close to a lot of things going on. Not a lot of room for a large case. Some of the rooms have balconies. Haven’t  seen one yet but was told it was a nice feature. Especially if you want some fresh air.

title: Great hotel
text: Hotel was very welcoming. My baby was given a teddy that he really liked and my wife had a bottle and chocolate strawberries delivered for our anniversary vacation. My wife is pregnant so she was not able to drink but the gesture was nice for the celebration. Overall very pleased with the room and experience.

title: Damp
text: My room smelt of damp, it wasn’t pleasant. Wall paper was bubbling, probably from said damp. I notified the hotel and asked them to get in contact with me but four nights later I’d heard nothing back, they ignored my request.

title: Weekend Getaway!
text: I would highly recommend The Lexington Hotel for your stay in NYC!  It is exceptionally clean and safe.  The entire staff is professional and helpful.  Located in the heart of the city, it is easy to get to wherever you want to go!

title: Great hotel in the perfect location!
text: I booked this hotel because it was in a great location - close to Grand Central - and was within my budget. I definitely think it was worth booking here. The staff was very professional and accommodating - our room wasn't ready when we arrived so they took down our phone number to call when the room was ready as well as removing some room fees and providing us with beverage vouchers for the hotel bar (which was excellent), breakfast vouchers, and upgraded our room.  I think they went above and beyond to provide outstanding service and to compensate for the inconvenience. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in and I slept really well both nights.  The room was a nice size for 2 people and I loved the art deco decor featured in the rooms and throughout the hotel itself. I will definitely stay here the next time I am in NYC!

title: 6 nuits à l’hotel Lexington
text:
Hôtel très agréable avec chambre confortable, il est très bien situé pour des visites à pied et prendre le métro.
Nous avons eu un accueil très chaleureux par Philippe qui nous a donné de précieux conseils pour nous diriger dans la ville . C’est avec plaisir que chaque jour nous allions le rencontrer car il a été toujours soucieux de notre bien être. 
Encore merci à Philippe de Châteauroux : véritable atout pour les Français dans cet hôtel !

title: Location good, rooms old and small
text: The Lex has always attracted multitudes of tourists from far and wide.  It's a bit aged and the rooms are smaller than modern hotel rooms, but fine in mostly old NYC.  We paid a lot ($600) for a standard room while our friends paid $300 for the same room, but we had to book late and directly on The Lex website while our friends booked through a web broker.  There are certainly better hotels in the city for $600/night!

title: GREAT location and experience!
text: We had room 708 with two full beds and TWO bathrooms! It was perfect! Check in was very accommodating and gave us two bottles of water - greatly appreciated. The maid service was very good and friendly. Room was immaculate. Bar was fun and lively at most times of the afternoon and evening. As most hotels, you can hear your neighbor. You can get nearly anywhere in the city easily. Bellmen were right on top of calling cabs in, you can walk to the subway or Grand Central, Central Park, Rockafeller Center, Museum Row and more.

title: What a lovely place to stay!
text:
From the moment we arrived, we were well taken care of by the professional and friendly staff. The location was convenient and fairly quiet at night. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Had dual bathrooms! 
The lobby bar was lively and well run by bartenders including Alban (yay for Baileys!) and our servers Valentina, Lauren, and Brandi.  Breakfast was delicious and healthy and had an excellent variety of choices. 
Irina and her capable management colleagues run a wonderful property. I am looking forward to my next visit.

title: Lexington Hotel, trying hard
text: We often visit NYC and are quite familiar with the neighborhoods of Manhattan.  This was the first time we stayed in the Grand Central Station area and it was a great area as a starting point for our adventures. The room was the smallest we have ever stayed in, in our 40 years of travel together. But we expected that after reading reviews and knowing the age of the hotel and only recent affinity to the Autograph chain. But we take a positive attitude and enjoyed the modest breakfast offerings, the 24/7 water and coffee/tea availability and the R.Toledo artwork throughout. Public transportation very convenient and good stopping place for Uber/Lyft drivers-not necessarily the case in many parts of Manhattan. Upon arrival, Nicole at the front desk set a very positive vibe that continued through our long weekend stay. Her smile everyday made us smile.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: 2 couples celebrating 2 birthdays (50 & 55) and 2 anniversaries (both 22), picked The Lexington for our long weekend.  Wonderful experience, great location, fabulous energy in the lobby!  Would stay again!

title: Unique hotel
text: Outstanding service, location and ambiance. Rooms small but quiet, bed comfortable and modern bathroom. The lobby bar/cafe was inviting but limited menu. The buffet breakfast had a wide selection of hot and cold items. Excellent value all around.

title: Awesome Mid-Town Hotel in NYC
text:
The Marriott Group did it right on this one.

Their update of this classic hotel is spot-on...it's always nice to see a refurbishment of a "grande dame" over a tear-down. 

Everything clicks from the second you walk in til check-out.  Great staff, great rooms and great ambiance means we'll be back!!

title: Great Location and Comfortable
text: My daughter and I spent four nights at the hotel. It is conveniently located near many interesting things. Our room was small but comfortable and clean. Fairly soundproof too. Employees were nice and helpful.

title: A very fun stay
text: Loads of color and design, comfortable linens, tons of extras - a free bottle of wine and a fruit and nut tray!  What a treat! In a perfect location for all of my needs, I don't want to stay anywhere else on my next trip.

title: Lousy, won’t stay here again
text: Regretted choosing this out of the other Marriott options even though I got a deal from Expedia, cheaper than usual rates. On Marriott Bonvoy app, this is a category 6, and seems much more premium than other NYC hotels. However, experience was lousy. Check in was 4pm, which is already very late, and I had to wait till after 8pm to get my room. Was so tired from walking the whole day and room was not even ready by 7:30pm. This is unacceptable given I was a platinum client. Room was basic, dusty as well. Hotel looks dated and seems past its time. Definitely won’t stay here again.

title: Unfriendly with no frills
text:
We stayed for 4 nights and there were a few things about our stay that we found odd.

Firstly, we were asked for credit card details when we checked in. Naturally, we gave over a credit card for them to take down. However, they did not tell us that a hold would be put on the card, and didn’t even tell us the amount. We left and around 45 minutes later received a notification that the hotel was attempting to charge a significant sum to our card. Had we been advised of the hotel policy regarding the amount that would be taken for deposit, we wouldn’t have found this an issue. But every other hotel I have stayed in has advised of their hold/deposit policies at check in. When we went back to the check in desk we asked why we weren’t told at check in, and we were simply told (very grumpily might I add) that it is ‘hotel policy’. So it’s hotel policy to not inform your guests of additional charges you’ll be making to their card that are in addition to the actual rate of the room? Great policy!

Secondly, it is $3 per item to store your luggage in their luggage room. Weird.

Thirdly, we were charged over $150 extra than our booking confirmation (which did say ‘total’ inclusive of tax). This is due to a host of other taxes that you aren’t made aware of when booking.

Fourthly, we were on the top floor (floor 28). You might think that this would have been great, however this is effectively a roof conversion with a single tiny window for the room and no view of the city at all.

In terms of good things, it was good that you could get bottled water at the front desk and there was also a tea and coffee station in the lobby. No drinks making facilities in the room though.

title: Disappointing on multiple levels
text:
I actually should have knownbetter. Lexington Avenue near Grand Central is home to a large number of old and often a shabby hotels. However, I’d had a minor foot injury and thought it would be smart to stay directly across the street from where I was attending a meeting.  My foot turned out to be fine. The hotel wasn’t.

The first disappointment was at check-in. There were only three of us in the Elite line, but the process took so long that the person in front of me turned around and said he’d never book there again. I waited a full twenty minutes but did eventually get my key. The next day, two women in the reception area were trying to rectify some problems with their room’s condition— to no avail. The turned around and stated loudly, “worst hotel EVER.” What’s especially strange is that there is a manager’s desk in the reception area. At no time did the manager try to help with either the speed of check-in or with guests’ issue.

My room wasn’t the worst ever, but it was very small, and the bathroom was shabby. The hotel has been clever in its decor, which is bright and cheery, but it does need to do some maintenance on the fixtures and the carpets. More staff to help in reception and in the bar would go a long way.

title: Fantastic Views
text: The Lexington is the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in. The staff were amazing and went out of their way to make our stay a great one. We went to NY to get married and the Lexington made memories we’ll never forget. Will 100% stay there again.

title: Great location
text: We’ve  really enjoyed our stay here, great housekeeping staff (leave a daily tip on the bed), water and great coffee in the lobby, Starbucks in the building, great pastry place across the street, bar voucher and laundry included in destination fee.  We would stay here again, subway close, comfy bed and clean!

title: The mosts unfriendly hotel we've ever stayed in
text:
Spent four and a half hours sitting in reception waiting for room had to pay for luggage storage so we could go for something to eat, finally got  into room, matress eight inches 
smaller than bed one sheet two cotton covers no duvet, no coffee  making machine or facilities to make a drink, two bath robes one pair of slippers (maybe to share or hop)bathroom so small could touch both walls have stayed in other New York hotels and been very pleased with them would definitely NOT recommend  this hotel

title: Lexington Manhattan - great option
text: Spent 2 nights here. Lobby looks newly remodeled. King room was spacious except for the bathroom which is typical NYC small. Front desk very pleasant and helpful. Upcharge for Manhattan hotel offset by free breakfast and free drink.  Modern hotel in convenient location.

title: A nice hotel expensive drinks
text: Surprised how small romms are , but they arranged a larger room, I get it's an old hotel but really small, The cocktail drink prices are outrageous expensive 16.00 us for a gin tonic please. Staff are nice and efficient the doorman is marvelous.

title: מלון טוב ומרכזי במחיר סביר
text: שהיתי במלון 3 לילות באוגוסט 2019. המיקום טוב ומרכזי בטווח הליכה מטיימס סקוור, סנטרל פארק ועוד.. לקיתי חדר ליחיד במחיר סביר יחסית לרמת המלון והמיקום והחדר היה מרווח עם מיטה זוגית. דבר יפה שקיים במלון הוא שמקבלים שובר לבר על סך 20 דולר עבור כל יום שהיה שתקף לכל ערב משעות אחה"צ, בנוסף יש אפשרות למסירת כביסה ללא תשלום עד סכום מסויים. יש סטארבקס שמחובר ללובי ומעבר לכביש ישנה מסעדה בשרות עצמי הפתוחה 24 שעות. מומלץ!

title: Not the best - watch out for the $25.00US/day destination fee
text: We stayed at this hotel several times over the last few years and it appears to have changed - not for the better. There is now a "destination fee" of $25.00 US a day for "other services. We have no idea what these "other services" are as we had none! This is similar to a "resort fee" for other services that don't exist. Essentially, they are charging you for the free drink voucher and the use of the gym. On our last day, breakfast service was delayed by close to 20min because they were "short staffed". People left as they had meetings to get to and flights to catch - yet they had paid a hefty price in advance for their breakfast. Very disappointed.

title: Was better ...
text:
We use to preferr to stay at the Lexington but things have changed. It's always the little things but they're the things that, if there are too many of them, makes the stay unpleasant:
- "Elite" room was just the same as our other rooms on lower floor 
- No bathrobe in room
- Paper cups in room … no more glasses
- Didn't get the requested wake-up-call ... lucky we're early risers or could have missed our flight
- Late opening of breakfast restaurant. A few people had to leave without food/coffee or they wouldn't have been able to get to their morning meeting.
- No room service
- Mandatory $25/night Destination Fee? ... Really! ... just another tax, $ grab.
BUT the gym is still nice!
We use to have a great morning restaurant in the neighbourhood but, by complete surprise to us this trip, it closed up … a BIG disappointment.
The location is just a little further from our usual shopping and walking destinations so we'll probably stay elsewhere in the future.

title: Not our best experience at the Lexington, buyt the Moet champagne vending machine was a pleasant surprise
text:
We've stayed at the Lexington before.  We stayed two nights at the Lexington Hotel earlier this week.  The results were mixed. 
 
There are positives.  The hotel’s location is excellent.  It’s at Lex and 48th, a few short blocks from either Grand Central Station or the 53rd Street stop on the “E” subway line.  It’s an Autograph Hotel, meaning “one of a kind”.  It’s in great condition.  The décor has a Jazz Age feel.  The price is reasonable compared to other hotels in the area.  There’s a parking garage across the street.  The staff is welcoming. 
 
There are negatives.  The hotel charges a daily $25.00 ‘resort fee.”  One of the ways this is redeemable is with a daily $20.00 drink voucher for the bar.  Curiously, the fee is also subject to state and city hotel taxes.  Monday through Thursday they have a managers reception for members of the Marriott Bonvoy program.  They have a section of the bar segmented for these guests.  So far, so good.  There are complimentary glasses of red and white wine.  No cocktail napkins.  No bar nuts or popcorn.  No munchies like you find in the Executive Lounge at other Marriotts. 
 
Other observations: 
 
We were upgraded to a larger room with a king sized bed.  It didn’t seem large, but it had the basics you expect, including those incredibly comfortable Marriott beds. 
The rooms have no coffee makers, although I did see free coffee available in the lobby in the morning.  (That’s a good thing.)  There are no robes in the rooms.   
 
The breakfast buffet was included, which I assume is a Bonvoy perk.  The buffer is $29.00 otherwise.  It had an extensive selection. 
 
There’s one more unexpected positive:  There’s a Moet and Chandon champagne vending machine in the lobby!  How cool is that!  It’s $25.00 for a quarter bottle (split).  You get a coin from the bar that operates the machine.  The $ 25.00 is net, including tax and gratuity.  For Moet champagne in a midtown Manhattan hotel, that’s a pretty good deal.

title: Amazing Stay!
text: This was my first visit back to The Lexington since the makeover of lobby bar. They have doubled the size of the bar and seating space. It provides a great atmosphere for a drink whether traveling on business or pleasure. The hotel has done a wonderful job with upgrades to lobby and rooms. Service was outstanding. Location is superb. This is my "go to" property when visiting NYC.

title: Mother & Daughter’s trip to New York
text: My friend and our daughters had a great trip to New York. We stayed in the Lexington Hotel and I really recommend it. We were all in one room but it was a lovely big room with comfortable beds and plenty towels. The hotel was spotless and an ideal location for all the main tourist attractions as well as Broadway. The breakfast in the morning was lovely, this was the only meal we took our time over as we were really busy the rest of the day.

title: Dyr frukost, ljudligt hotell
text:
Hotellväggarna av papp, allt hördes, hissar mm.
Frukosten är det varning på! 75 dollar för två! Speciellt bra var det inte heller. Fast vi bodde på 27 våningen var det inte någon utsikt, rakt in i grannfastigheten bara.

title: Average stay unfortunately
text: We spent 4 nights recently at the Lexington.  It is on the East side so more in the business district rather than the more livelier West side.  There were really few restaurants for the evening but we found a great breakfast diner close by.  the hotel itself proved uninspiring I'm afraid,  Staff were friendly enough but not enough to make you feel kind of special.  The bar prices are horrendous - three bottles of beer for $35 !! Outrageous.  There's a Starbucks sort of in-house and apparently a restaurant which we didn't see or visit.  NY was busy of course but the Lexington is fairly close to Times square etc. so not too much of a problem walking anywhere.  We just got the impression this was more a business type of hotel that did not particularly cater for people on vacation.  BA crew stay there so I guess it can't be that bad can it.  The room we had was basically pokey and uninviting with little facilities.  You don't expect huge fridges etc in city rooms though I suppose do you ?  Shame but wouldn't go back again. NY yes, the Lexington unfortunately not.  Strangely unwelcoming.

title: Fabulous stay! Will return
text: Hotel was lovely & clean! Great location 10 min walk to Times Square. Received $80 bar vouchers on check in to spend at the bar and room upgrade free of charge! Will definitely stay again when in New York.

title: Good location with compact rooms
text:
The hotel has a good location for a business trip in the region. Walking distance for many major businesses as well for a great dinner options nearby.

I stayed in a King Room that is compact with a bathroom that is even compacter. Bed is comfortable but decoration of the room and corridors looks a little tired.

I just stayed for two nights and missed a luggage rack.

title: A nice little spot
text: This is a nice little hotel that was recently updated. The rooms are small as it is an older building.  It had great breakfasts and nice appetizers in the late afternoon.  It doesn’t have  a full restaurant on premises but there is a Starbucks attached to the building.  Not far from the theater district.

title: lexington NYC hotel
text: In time of hight season and United Nations Summits in NYC, an award should be given to Irina, managing director at the hotel, in helping clients in their room selection and reservations, supervising  their requests efficiently and ensuring satisfaction with all the services provided at the hotel, at  a time of great rush and pressure. With geat thanks to Irina for her warm welcome, I recommend highly this well=located hotel in central Manhattan.

title: Best location and value
text: We stay at the Lexington for all of our business trips. Great location with friendly and helpful staff. We look forward to each of our stays and are treated like VIPs upon checkin. The breakfast package is worth the upgrade when booking.

title: Good atmosphere
text:
I stayed 3 nights at the Lexington hotel. The lobby is very nice and modern. Live band music in the evening - very good atmosphere. Staff was nothing more than OK and not particular welcoming. However, the hotel is well staffed, always someone to help open a door etc.
The room I had was clean but very small. No mini bar, which was a bit surprising.  
Great to have coffee (and sparkling water!) for free available 24/7 at the check in desk. I wish they had almond milk as a choice. 
Great location.
Staff" lost" my suit after it went to the dry cleaner but was found again.
All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanted to stay in NYC for business and pleasure

title: Very happy here. Good location.
text: Newly remodeled room. Well thought out and very comfortable. Very quiet on the 28th floor. The elevator from 27-28 is quite slow so we just take the stairs between 27 and 28. Much easier and faster. Free coffee in the lobby.

title: Disappointing
text: My wife and I booked a standard room. It was smaller than my daughter’s single in college. I mean it was small even by NYC standards. Complained to front desk and was assured we would be upgraded next day (I’m Platinum Elite Marriott). Philippe the desk guy apparently put the entry in the wrong room. Had to argue next day but got a somewhat larger room that was OK. Lobby always crowded. Guest services never picked up phone. I would rate this a Category 3 property. Won’t be back.

title: As a Titanium Elite Member I expected better
text:
I've stayed here a handful of times, but this was my most disappointing stay. I was "upgraded" into a room that was so tiny and no room in the bathroom for my toiletries. What was worse was that it was located right next to the ice maker which was loud enough when not being used, but so loud through the thin door as a number of people used it during the night. 

I understand part of the room size issue is NYC, but as I said I've stayed in this room a number of times before and the fact that they called this room an upgrade was beyond me. My floor also reeked of cigar smoke which meant someone had to have been smoking on the floor. I understand there's not much the hotel can do about that, but ugh it just added to my frustrated stay. There was no luggage stand in the room or closet and no place for my bag to sit other than on my King bed which is not ideal. 
I used the gym in the morning and all the treadmills were being used except one. That one was broken with no sign on it. 
What was positive? Well the free breakfast was decent, the location is an easy walk to 30 Rock, and they provide free water bottles when you check in.
While I've stayed here a number of times in the past, based on this stay I'm going to venture somewhere else for my next business trip.

title: Παρα πολυ καλο!!!
text: Πολυ καλο ξενοδοχείο σε απίστευτη τοποθεσία! Τα πάντα Ειναι δίπλα σου! Τα δωμάτιο ήταν πολύ ευρύχωρο κ παντα καθαρό! Το ίντερνετ ικανοποιητικό κ ελευθερο σε όλους τους χώρους! Στο λόμπυ ο χώρος είναι πολύ ευχάριστος κ χλιδατος κ το προσωπικό ηταν ευγενέστατο. Στα μείον το γεγονός ότι δ είχε ψυγείο στο δωμάτιο πράγμα που μας δυσκόλεψε το πρωτο βράδυ. Ωστόσο ενημερώσαμε τη ρεσεψιόν το επόμενο πρωί κ αμέσως μας έφεραν ενα στο δωμάτιο. Επίσης να γνωρίζετε οτι η φύλαξη των αποσκευών χρεώνεται....

title: Buen hotel, limpio, le falta voluntad al personal
text:
El hotel esta ubicado en una area central, cerca a todo caminando (estaciones de metro,bus etc) nicole en front desk me hizo la vida mas facil ayudandonos en todo.
Por otro lado hay alguien llamado VIRGINIA, en el front desk, es  una persona grosera y ruda que no deberia estar trabajando atendiendo personas en un hotel de esta categoria.
En el baño debes estar pendiente para que te reemplacen el jabón, el shampoo etc, pues no lo hacen todos los días.
No hay restaurante!!!!!!
Así que despues de las 10 de la noche ten presente que si te da hambre debes salir a buscar comida.
El desayuno siempre es el mismo así que despues del 3 día es aburridor el
Mismo menú.
Las chicas que atienden en el bar son muy amables.
El hotel limpio, las camas comodas. Mi habitacion tenia 2 baños, amplia.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Girls weekend in NYC.  We stayed two nights at the Lexington Hotel.   Great location, clean rooms, excellent service!   Upon check in they offered us a glass of wine to welcome us to NYC.   Lisset Alba was our Guest Service Agent - she went above and beyond to ensure our stay was amazing.   I would definitely stay at this property again.   Thank you!

title: A Great Place to Stay
text: We stayed at this hotel for my husband’s 75th birthday celebration and they really went out of their way to make it special.  We received great help in locating restaurants and making reservations.  Our room was spacious.  There was a happy hour with free wine in the evening.  We had a great time. It was about a 20 minute walk to the shows we attended.

title: Terrible check in
text: Although I would like to give a good or very good review, I simply cannot because of a truly horrible check in process. Check in at the hotel is at 4 pm which already quite late. I came around 3:55 pm and I was told that my room would not be ready until 5 pm or 5:30. On the good side I was given 2 coupons for 2 drinks at the bar. but on the bad side no one called me at 5 pm or 5:30 pm. I was made to feel the most insignificant client possible. I was told that they had lots of platinum and titanium level guests as I reason for the delay. And sure enough a long line of people formed at 4 pm and the line gradually disappeared after 30 or so minutes. But no room for me. Finally at 5:45 pm I called the hotel (because I did not want to lose my seat in the lobby that I had been sitting in for 2 hours). I was told shortly after that my room was ready. However, when I actually checked in I mentioned that I had been given 2 drink coupons for having to wait. His reaction was not to give me the 3 drink coupons, one for each of the 3 nights I was to stay in the hotel. When I explained that the 2 coupons I was previously given were compensation for such a long wait to check in, he relented and gave me the 3 drink coupons that I had paid for as part of my daily rate. Long, long wait and disagreeable front desk. Do not use this hotel unless you are a platinum or titanium holder or a VIP. Terrible!

title: Lexington Autograph Hotel
text: An updated, efficient business or short-stay hotel.  Excellent location for getting around most parts of the city.  Staff are courteous and friendly.  Rooms are clean but VERY small.  Bathrooms are VERY small.  Bar scene is busy.  Breakfast set up is mediocre. For a short stay in NYC it is a good option.

title: Great service
text: It's an iconic hotel in a great location -- probably time for rooms to be renovated but this is more than offset with excellent service and the best guest relations manager in the entire Marriott system -- Irina Borukhov

title: Lovely little place
text:
We spent three nights at this lovely little hotel after a Canada New England cruise. The Uber cost to the hotel from the New Jersey terminal was only $53 and then to Newark airport was $83 both of which were very reasonable, making this a good choice for arrival and departure as well as for the stay.
The room was a delightful surprise as it was spacious for an old hotel in a major North American city and the hotel provided priory service for guests and a $20 a day voucher for the bar which could be used all at once or over time. 
The doormen were very helpful as was the concierge. Staff service was first rate.
If you are able, this is within walking distance to major attractions and Times Square. We walked a block and took the hop-on hop-off Grey Like bus everywhere with Ubers or taxis for the rest of the time. 
We very much enjoyed our stay.

title: Great location and service.
text: We stayed at The Lexington during the UN General Assembly. NYC and the hotel was beyond busy with insane security. As a civilian, I was treated with the same level of service as the ambassadors staying at the hotel. Our room was made available early, was very clean and spacious by city standards. We will return.

title: Disappointed in the service at a premium price point
text:
I am a Marriott Gold Elite member, and prefer to stay at Marriott properties for the benefits. On a recent trip to New York, I was pretty disappointed with my experience.

I reached the hotel around 745 am after a long overnight flight from San Francisco. On checking in with the hotel, I was told that rooms were currently not available but I was 3rd in line for a room being available and I would be informed as soon as 1 one was ready. I kept checking in with the reception every hour with no luck. At the same time, several dozen guests had checked out. I understand that it takes time to prepare the rooms and left the hotel for a bit. Upon coming back at 12:30, I went back again to the reception, to ask if a room was ready. The reception staff told me that none was available, while at the same time I saw a new guest walk up and get a room at the same time. At this point I was furious. Upon expressing my displeasure with what just happened, magically a room just appeared and I was given one within minutes.

Fast forward, the room itself was fairly big by New York standards, so no complaints there (hence the 3 stars). The amenities and the room layout was good too. The house keeping not so much. After the first day, I came back and while my bed was made, the rest of the room was messy - exactly the way I had left it. The floor wasn't vacuumed properly either. Maybe this is a misaligned expectation, but in my experience staying at a premium property should come with better house keeping.

Finally one recommendation to the hotel. There are no water stations in the hotel, and apparently tap water is not the safest in New York. As such, everyone relies on bottles of water.
