This creates a lot of unnecessary plastic waste. Given Marriott's pledge to remove single use plastic in all it's hotels, I would love to see this property install a water station next to the ice machine so people could refill their plastic bottles if they so desired.

Anyway, on the positive side it's a good location. This hotel is fine if you don't have expectation of decent service, but given this counts under the 'Autograph collection, and goes at over $300 a night or 60,000 points per night (I believe this is category 6), I was quite disappointed in my experience.

title: Lexington hotel is a good value for money
text:
The lexington hotel is a good value for money with good location and good sized rooms. and friendly staff
The drawbacks are no executive lounge  and limited bar and other options.for getting together with friends.

title: Great property with very attentive staff.
text: I really enjoyed staying at The Lexington Hotel.  I chose it because it was close to Radio City Music Hall and a short walk over to Broadway where we had booked several theater tickets.  It was clean, had an old school charm but with updated fresh twists.  It was stylish and well thought out.  The room was small, but that is normal for NY.  But the layout and furnishings made it feel larger.  And, it was so QUIET.  I was amazed that the hotel was really busy, but you didn't hear much from the hallways and totally shocked that street noise was almost non-existent.  I definitely will book here again.  The staff was great.  I arrived too early for check-in, but they checked my bag, had comfortable areas to wait and I received a text when my room was ready.  Also had daily check-ins from the staff to see how my stay was going and if they could be of any assistance.  I found this to be a really nice touch (this too was by text message) and other people I met staying here mentioned this too as a pleasant surprise.

title: Great place to stay
text:
Fifty’s sort of theme. M Monroe etc. Nice lobby to watch the comings and goings. Premier members treated very well. Elevators fast and efficient. 
Very well located in midtown - easy to get to Park and other areas of interest. Good location for Christmas tree etc.

title: Not terrible but not worth the price
text: The guests next door woke up at 4 am, turned on the shower and they kept it on for 90 minutes. The noise kept me from sleeping for two hours even though I paid for a hotel so I could get a good night’s sleep. I called the manager the next day and asked to be transferred to another room but they couldn’t do anything because they were fully booked. He only offered ear plugs when I said I was going out to buy them. What kind of hotel can’t even do that for a guest? Also, the $3 fee to leave your suitcase with the bellman is unheard of. This is the first hotel I know of that asks guests to pay for this service. It is just all right. I’ve stayed in much better hotels in NYC, with nicer and bigger rooms, for a similar price.

title: Perfect place to stay
text:
Great hotel, lovely decor. 
Marilyn Monroe stayed there when married to with Joe Demaggio. 
Helpful staff. 
Rooms are clean and beds comfortable. Lovely decor.
Perfect after a long day shopping and site seeing.

title: Nice hotel and great location
text: Hotel was very nice and decorated in a retro-modern style.  The room was pretty small and the bathroom was similar to a cruise ship bathroom.  No counter space to put your things on in the bathroom.  Still enjoyed it and the staff was very helpful and polite.  Lots of people as it was UN week.  It does have a nice breakfast and free coffee and tea all of the time.  Not super close to some things but the hotel team was great to get us a cab!  Would definitely stay there again despite the small bathroom! Love all of the Marilyn Monroe videos and pics!

title: Excellent NY hotel
text: Very cool decor at a great location. Service is excellent, rooms are pretty sizable for NY.  Easy walk to Grand Central, Times Square and Central Park. Good bar and a Starbucks attached to the lobby. Highly recommend this place if you’re in NY.

title: Hidden gem
text: This was our second stay at the Lexington and we will definitely be staying there again. Great location. Great staff who are very attentive to assisting the guests and making the stay as enjoyable as possible. Rooms are clean and modern. Beds are very comfortable and the sheets and towels are soft and cozy.  Great little bar and nice breakfast buffet spread in the morning.  The rooms are very quiet during both of our stays. Is it the Four Seasons? Of course not. But it is a hidden gem in a great location for lots of fun NYC activities.

title: Very nice Hotel
text: We had a lovely stay in NY.  The staff were very nice and the location is excellent. During breakfast the room was a bit cramped but still very good.  We happened to be in NY during the UN Clear Air Assembly and traffic was a challenge.  However, because of our location we were able to walk or take the subway. My only issue is that the hotel does not recycle.  As a compulsive re-cycler I am surprised that they do not.

title: Amazing Break
text: Have just returned from a wonderful break in NYC.  We stayed at this lovely hotel.  A receptionist Virginia was extremely helpful and remembered us every time.  Virginia went out of her way to help.  Not all of the staff were as friendly.  However, there was a United Nations summit at the time and it was extremely busy.  Security was high and there were some high profile people staying there.  Hotel was just down the road from Grand Central Station.  We tended to catch the subway trains, as tour buses were grid locked.  You may see more on a open top bus, but traffic horrendous.

title: 🥂
text:
Awesome hotel, perfect location to spend the weekend. 
And great staff at the bar, thank you Valentina, Anna, Alban and Kush  always treating me good...........
I will be back and this is by far my fave hotel

title: Little gem of a hotel
text: This is a jewel box of a hotel, right in midtown Manhattan, with all the sights and Broadway shows within easy walking distance. The rooms are beautiful, but small, clean and comfortable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Starbucks right in the hotel, and a nice bar as well. We were there during UN week, so our room was extremely expensive but that’s par for the course in NYC. Would book again.

title: Disappointing.
text:
Stayed here for a girls weekend with my bestie.

I stay at Marriott hotels regularly and have Platinum Elite Status. We were unfortunately unable to check in early, (at 1:30pm) and had to wait for a room. We were also unable to attain an upgrade, so they asked if we wanted first available or a high floor, and we asked for a high floor... at 4:30pm, we had to follow up with the staff and were given a room on the 5th floor.

The location of the hotel was great! Easy to walk to many different places, subway just down the corner... it really was pretty convenient. Also! A Starbucks IN the building--amazing! Mobile order though, because it's crazy busy 24/7.

The hotel was clean, and the rooms were well appointed.

The bar was our favorite part--super cool art deco vibe! We sat and had a glass of champagne every night, but they were "out" of most of the menu items when we ordered food.

We had 2 queen beds... I'm 5'4, my friend is 5'5, and both of our feet actually hung off the ends of the beds. (LOL) They were oddly small, and our tall husbands would have been irate.

We hardly slept because of how loud it was in the room. We could hear traffic, people talking, almost everything from the street--alllll night long. I mean, this city never sleeps! ;) When we asked the front desk about it, the woman recommended we close the window.... lol Obviously, the windows were not open. So, if you stay here INSIST on a higher floor if you want to sleep. 

The breakfast was a joke. We would have been pissed if we'd paid for it... it was a pretty basic continental breakfast, and the quality was poor. Since it's not an actual restaurant, you'd think they'd at least bring in some NY-style bagels or something a little more interesting that aligns with the Autograph Collection Brand.

All in all, I don't think I'd stay here again.

title: Great visit, again
text: Stayed here a few times on business and would again for business or pleasure.  Location is fantastic and staff very friendly, helpful, and efficient.  Bar and breakfast very good too.  Really like convenience of Ashley Fine Foods and Lexington Brass on same intersection.

title: Loving the Lex
text: The staff has been fantastic since my night of arrival, super friendly upon check-in and have continued to deliver on everything from band-aids to my room to dry cleaning. They are full-service! The central location has been fantastic for getting around to all of the Climate Week activities happening in NYC!

title: Good service, excellent location
text: Despite the craziness of NY during UN General Assembly week (streets closed, sirens going, etc)  the Lexington provided excellent service. Lobby was festive with live music but registration and valet parking was efficient. Wish there was coffee in rooms, but there is complementary coffee in the lobby.

title: Short weekend trip
text:
I’ve been to New York many times and have stayed at a variety of hotels. I must admit that on this occasion this hotel was quite memorable. The decor and style of the hotel is quite unique. I can’t fault the staff as  as they were very helpful during my stay. Nice bar/laundry service. Clean room. Close to Times Square possibly 15 minutes walk. I was in NY for the US open and the hotel was a good place not too far from the tennis.

The only downfall would be would be the noise from that outside as I was constantly distracted by the honking of cars going into the city. This would be the only negative especially early in the morning.

title: Good service
text: The service is very good... Food IA not bad. And the hotel is conveniently located. Rooms were very clean and well set. I enjoyed the fact that from where I was, I could access so many places with much ease.

title: Wonderful!
text: The Lexington is a gorgeous hotel.  Staff was very welcoming and accommodating.  Bella at concierge was sweet and made great recommendations.  Loved the Marilyn Monroe features as well.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Another great stay
text: I have stayed 3 times in as many months at this property and haven't been disappointed.  It is now my go to when in the area.  I reserved my room and rooms for 5 colleagues from China, and Lisset was very helpful and kind on check in for all of us. The location of the hotel is very close to many regular attractions and far less hassle than being in Times square.  Also, I always have a nice brunch across the street at Lexington Brass and good cocktails in the lounge downstairs of the Lexington hotel.  I'll be back :)

title: Lexington Hotel
text: The best Hotel in NYC.  Great, energetic  lobby and bar area. The staff is the best and treats everyone like family.  Its the ONLY hotel I stay while traveling on business in NYC 70 days/year!  Irina, Alban, Nora, Donna,  Jose and Valentina are the very best!!
